PS : you should make a reservation and ask for a table with a view

We visited on our last night in Dubrovnik, what q perfect way to end our trip. The food was fantastic (highly recommend the ravioli starter and steak mains), the view was unreal ( we had a table which allowed us to watch the sunset over the walls of the old town) and the service was excellent (Ivan was very friendly, personable and attentive). Very romantic setting!

We visited the restaurant twice in three days. The first trip was so good we came again. Great service, great waiter and lovely food on the first visit. The vegetarian burger (beautifully described by the waiter) was the best our son had tasted. The second trip was a let down. A different waiter this time and it made such a difference. No bread to the table, no thank you and goodbye when the bill was paid, constantly chasing the waiter, didn’t apply a discount to the bill and just generally made the lunch less enjoyable. The food was good again but the inconsistency between the two levels of service was striking. 5 stars for the first visit - 3 for the second.

Great view, great food and friendly staff.
Most of the time a short waiting time but we were quickly seated.
Will come back if we have the chance!

Nothing special. We had lunch - pizza, fish soup etc. neither I nor my friends were blown away, the toppings on the pizza were very sparingly applied, not sure if even one whole mushroom was to be assembled from the rare pieces. Fish soup super disappointing - just watery with no substance, similar to what you get in a not very good school’s canteen. The View was gorgeous but food only avarage. Service was ok.

This was the most lack-luster meal of our stay in Dubrovnik. The only noteworthy part of the meal was our Dalmatian gin and tonics. And our amazing view of the city walls. The drinks were delicious and strong. However, my fish sampler was Luke warm and overcooked and my wife’s sea bass dish was also lacking in flavor compared to the other fish meals we have had elsewhere in Dubrovnik. They do have gluten free bread upon request. We would recommend just going for drinks.

Dubravka restaurant serves the best and highest quality breakfast in the city at reasonable prices. Value for money. The staff is friendly. The restaurant is located in Pile. I will definitely be back again!
Aleksander gave us a great service. The food was very good and the location was also very nice. Very nice restaurant!

We had a delicious lunch. Due to a miscommunication we got the wrong dish without noticing. It was when we got the receipt, we noticed that we got an other dish than we ordered. The manager quickly picked this up and solved this in the best possible way. Very friendly and hospitable. Thank you!

2 cocktails (best we had in a whole week travelling croatia), a bottle of white wine and two courses for two people for under 1000 HKR/ €150. Amazing view, wonderful staff. We were served by Ivan, a polite young man who offered us 3 different glasses of wine to taste so we could decide which one we would like to order. The Chef’s Beefsteak in particular was outstanding. When we had trouble to call a Croatian number with our phone, Ivan gave us his phone without hesitation. Meat, fish and veggetarian options. Menu available online. 100% recommend, you have to visit this restaurant when you visit Dubrovnik.
If you are tired of Dalmatian food, this is a good option to eat something more international. Food was nice and service quick. The terrace is lovely to seat at night or enjoy the sunset.
Everything was so amazing. So nice atmosphere. The staff was really kind and nice . The food was really delicious . We recommend grilled squid , ravioli and all desserts .
We had excellent grilled squid and rozata desert. The house wine is better then some brand name botles. We will came back for sure.

Me and my boyfriend highly recommend this restaurant if you want to eat delicious meals with amazing view. Prices are very affordable and staff was really nice and kind to us especially mister Dražen Pavlica. Best restaurant in Dubrovnik!

My all time Dubrovnik favourite. 
5 out of 7 nights we have been dining there.
Love all of their food and the deserts are fantastic

Fantastic place for a snack. Great views of the sea if you get a table near the edge, but no worries - there’s a nice breeze throughout this restaurant. Just besides the walls of the Old Town where you can watch the world go by. Relaxed and informal.
Amazing food, friendly staff and beautiful location with a view of the walls of Dubrovnik. Try the mussels or the seafood linguine.

Superb. The location and the atmosphere are great. Here you will feel like a citizen of the castle. Good dishes and kindly staff. Try the aged-steaks. For a family dinner, near the walls and in front of the sea, it will be an excelent evening. I recommend this place.

Imagine a beautiful restaurant terrace by the Old Town entrance with good food, reasonable pricing and most friendly service. Add to this a woman dining alone on a busy Friday night getting a nice table. Both my dinners and the morning coffee with fresh croissant really made my day. I was offered a complimentary card with a reduction introducing their other exceptional restaurant Gradska Kavana Arsenal in the Old Port, an immediate favourite too.
We eat here for our first meal when we arrived in Dubrovnik, and it’s the best way to get a view of old town. Outdoor seating with a nice ocean breeze.
We had breakfast here and we ordered the Lovrijenac breakfast which was big enough for two people. The view is amazing.
Excellent service, excellent food, correct covid standards and clean. Fully recommended because, in addition, its location guarantees tranquility
An excellent restaurant bar. Good prices, an amazing view of the castle and the seaside. The staff was very polite and professional.
Chef beefsteak was 10/10! Mixed fish plate also amazing. Staff was professional and attentive. Would highly reccomend!

Best food and excellent service,very nice place.
Best baked fish I ever taste,you must try apple pie!

Wnet for a dinner with a family of four. Ordered a mix of pizza (very tasty), lasagna (good), but the realy treat were shells "buzara" - in tomato and white wine sauce. One of the best ever and we kept dipping the bread in the sauce until the plate was clear. Very fruity and light house white to round the meal perfectly. Given its prime location, the price tag very decent.
Wonderful spot to have a light meal and enjoy the view. The staff is friendly and helpful and prices reasonable.

Restaurant is worth only for view. That’s why put 2, not nothing. We had bad lunch. Octopus salad was strange. Fish soup- primitive. Chicken with potato was ordinary. Better drink some wine, enjoy the view, and go eat other place.
My friends and I went here for dinner. The staff was really friendly, the food was amazing and the view spectacular. Would definitely recommend to anyone, anytime.

Really great service. Staff are so friendly. I stopped for a drink, enjoyed the views. Had a mimosa to drink. Very clean. Well kept. Big menu from salads to pizza, breakfast and more. They gave me a voucher so I came back for dinner later. The pizza was really great too. Has a nice romantic ambience. It gets chilly in the evening but they have heaters and a blanket. There is indoor and outdoor seating. It's located just outside the main entrance to the old town.

Nice place for a coffe and homemade cake....
Excellent terrace with view.... Nice and profesional service ..........

This is part of Nautica (which is a find dine restaurant just opposite Dubravka 1836) brand and this is very noticeably in regard with service (which is very professional) and the quality of the food.

Location of the restaurant is astonishing and definitively is a "must" in Dubrovnik (at least for a cake and coffee).

Very delicious, but very small portions! 
Very good and friendly service but portions should be bigger!
My girlfriend has 55kg, and after lunch we went to fast food because she was still hungry.
Natural friendly staff who are well known with the cusine that the servels. Ofcourse, great food. Also, great view and thw ambient.

I rarely repeatedly visit a restaurant when there are so many options, but I could not stay away. We ate breakfast twice, had an afternoon drink and appetizer, plus returned to say goodbye. The service from Mateo was over the top, I haven’t seen attentive service like that in ages. And the view was alluring time after time.

We had reservations made for Nautika Restaurant, but because of covid, they ended up closing for the weekend. This was suppose to be for my wife and I's 10th year anniversary, so we were disappointed that they had relocated us to 1836.

That being said, the staff there couldn't have been more apologetic of the situation, even though it had nothing to do with them. They treated our party of 5 to free champagne, as well as a free appetizer. They then made a reservation for us at Proto, since we had talked about going there. Not only did they make a reservation there, they even comped our entire meal with drinks! I couldn't believe it, abd was not expecting at all. What an outstanding gesture this was, and couldn't have been more thankful. 

Our server Ivan, and the manager "Nik" truly went above and beyond to ensure we had an amazing 10th year wedding anniversary dinner! Both of these guys absolutely made us feel very special, and can't wait to comeback to Dubrovnik and see them again. This touched us tremendously, and are so thankful for having the chance to meet them.

High class restaurant, delicious food, and excellent service.
 Recommended dish: chef's beefstak
 Croatian wine Merlot Negermont 2017

This was my favorite restaurant in Dubrovnik. I think I went back four times. I loved the feta salad, and their White House wine was reasonable priced with generous pours. Staff excellent, friendly, and efficient! And the views!... on a sunny day were wonderful, and on rainy day under a covered terrace was given fuzzy blankets to keep cozy.
Really nice pizza and staff when i visited last year for my holidays. Ate here twice and both times had an amazing view and service from staff. Lively atmosphere outside.
Excellent service, great pizza, and the perfect ambient just at Pila gate. Was sceptic as it’s perfect tourist spot but they are really doing good job.

Great terrace with fabulous view. Ordered omelette and eggs sunny side up. Both breakfasts came with hot beverage of your choice, orange juice, bread and fruit. Fast and friendly service. Would return!

The outdoor terrace is one of the best settings I've ever been fortunate enough to have lunch in. With this in mind, I was expecting that the food would be a little underwhelming and I would've forgiven them for it. However, I was happy to be proved wrong. Great sea bass and salmon dishes with a lovely dry white croatian wine.
Wonderful food, great atmosphere and service and a beautiful view... it was a very pleasant experience

We went there at our arrival in Dubrovnik. For the location and the view we expected IT to be a bit pricy, but wasn't! We've ordered salas, fish soul, pizza and a ribeye steak and all was very tasty and served in a timely manner. The house wine is also good. The service is very good and speaks multiple languages. We also received a 10% coupon and came back the day after (which i rarely do). Must visit if you're in Dubrovnik!

After finding this gem of a spot at the Pile gate of Dubrovnik, my boyfriend and I must have gone back at least four times to this wonderful place. Not only do they have what we consider to be the best mojito in Dubrovnik, but we were met (every time) with the most delightful service and amazing meals too. I highly recommend1836 to anyone searching for the perfect meal with an epic view.
I visited this restaurant few times with my friends. Every time food was great,as well as service. View is spectacular,and I must say-this is one of my favourite restaurants in Dubrovnik old town.

Excellent food, service and views. The steak was cooked perfectly. It’s so hard to find well cooked steak. Trust me, you won’t be disappointed.

The sea bass was fresh and we also tried the pizza. Everything was delicious. The cocktails were also amazing.

It isn’t the cheapest place but you get what you pay for and it definitely doesn’t break the bank!

We had dinner there and it was lovely, food was very tasty and portion were good. They have amazing cheesecake which is a must to try! However we were there next day for lunch and portion of Chicken with bacon was really small but expensive so that was disappointing. But it is definitely lovely place with nice staff and location. Give it a try :)
Excellent food and reasonably priced too; some amazing views just outside the Old Town; friendly and attentive staff
Best breakfasts with the best view and friendly staff :) The dishes are absolutely delicious. I highly recommend!

Came here last year and was impressed. 
On our return . The service and food was to die for. I had lamb fillet and my wife had the pitza. Great price and a relaxing atmospher. Gordon Ramsey would be impressed..well done all staff and management look forward to our return .

As we are Newcastle fans (the restaurant shares its name with the club’s ‘keeper) and given the venue’s reputation, the omens suggested this could be the ideal place for a family birthday meal while in Dubrovnik for a week. The welcoming staff did not drop the ball...a truly ‘Instagrammable’ location - especially at sunset - overlooking the Old Town walls and Adriatic, great food & service. Topped off by a serenade from staff and hand-decorated lit dessert for the birthday girl. Result!
The food wasn’t that good but the views and the location makes up for everything, order something simple and some drinks and enjoy.

The restaurant itself has one of the best locations at the entry of the gate. The service was okay. The food was compared to the other "pearls" in this beautiful city absolutely not worth the price. The two salads (Chicken and Octopus) were plain with not many ingredients, did not taste super fresh and the chicken wasn't tender at all. Still they cost 11 to 13 Euros.

A definite problem are the pigeons who dance around on the wall next to the tables and seem to be used to jump on the guest's plate. It was almost impossible to eat in peace for two minutes in a row.

Outstanding service, view and food. Our server spoke fluent English and was so kind and patient with our questions. Our meals came out quickly and were extremely well prepared. Just outside the old town walls with a beautiful view of the harbor cliff area.
Visited here by chance and I am glad we did as had a couple of nice cocktails and watched the world go by!

I would highly recommend this gem!! 
We went twice to Dubrovka. The terrace is beautifully place overlooking the Walls of Dubrovnik and has amazing sea view. After a very hot day it is the best place to relax and have a meal with a glass of wine. Very romantic and peaceful. 
I have to mention the service: all the waiters are just so nice and so friendly. They just looking after you. We absolutely loved it and went back next day for our last dinner before heading back home. And we had 10% discount for coming back!! 
The food is delicious and it is not too expensive.

The atmosphere of this place is amazing. Near the old town with a wonderful view. The waitress was very nice and helpful. We were a group of 15 people and it wasn't a problem at all. The food was incredibly good. My mussels were the best in my life. I highly recommended this place.

Great place with great food, great view, and kind staff. I've been there a few times while in Dubrovnik, and will gladly come back again. My recommendation is the breakfast. It is abundant and reasonably priced.

It was hard to get a table here but well worth booking in advance if you’re in Dubrovnik. Menu had something to suit everyone and the cocktail list was great. The staff were really clued up on gluten free options and my meal was one of the best I had in Dubrovnik. Would definitely recommend - the views were amazing and it’s in the perfect location!

I would say the two best things about this restaurant were the laid back atmosphere and the view from our table by the wall! Mario was our main server and allowed us to really kick back, relax, drink our wine, enjoy the view and casually order our courses. I'm going to admit that we were extra spoiled by the food at their sister restaurant, Panorama, the night before so it was hard not to compare the two so that's why I gave 4 out of 5. 
They delightfully surprised us by moving the umbrellas away right before sunset. So we stayed cool in the shade, had a beautiful sunset and then watched the walls and fort light up. Thank you!

Right by the entrance to Pile Gate is Dubravka. We had an early dinner here so we were lucky enough to get a table near to the wall. If you want one of the tables for 2 along the wall I would recommend you book in advance as we could see they were all reserved.... 
They don't have a kids menu but our waitress who was lovely recommended a starter as they are fairly big sizes. So my daughter who is 8 had the lasagne - and that portion would have filled me up! I had the fresh tagliatelle which was delicious, and my husband had the aged steak which was beautifully cooked with green beans and hash browns. 
Considering its location I was expecting the price to be fairly high, but I would say it was mid range. Very good quality....
With the bill we were also given a card which gave you a 10% discount at one of their other restaurants down by the port. Which I thought was a great. I would eat here again.

My family and I really enjoyed the dinner at Dubravka 1836. The services was 5 star, the food was excellent and the views from the balcony were magnificent. And, it is quite inexpensive in comparison to other restaurants in town.
Highly recommended!

Great scenery and a wide variety of food and drink. I had the lasagne, which is put down as a starter, but definitely big enough as a main course and was lovely! The cocktail pictured is a 'Caribbean Dream', a really light and refreshing drink that came in handy as it was scorching hot in Dubrovnik. A must do if you are in Old City as it is situated right next to Pile Gate, well priced too.

This place is just in front of the sea, so it has a very beautiful view, I had breakfast there and it was not expensive, good coffee, kind waiters but for who is afraid of insects, I would not reccomend this, of course it's not their fault, but the table next to the sea are full of bee around

We went here a few weeks ago for my 21st birthday and the food was lovely. The view from the restaurant is probably one of, if not, the best in all of Dubrovnik. They brought out a nice cake for us and the staff were all very kind.

My first trip to Dubrovnik bring me to this nice place ,where the stuffs from young to old are very professional.
Well how i always meet in my trip problems with"where i eat?",because my stomach is very sensitive,can say that was best place for me in Dubrovnik ,i eat here every day i spent in this lovely city and also i got 10%discount from my bill .
Even the fish was fresh and good cooked.

Had to wait 20mins for a table, but well worth it.
Beautiful setting just outside the city walls.
Great service, food and wine.
2nd time we’ve been here. Would definitely come back.

Had a lovely breakfast sat overlooking the bay. Everything was fine and acceptable. A little pricey but it is old town Dubrovnik so to be expected. 
A really nice experience and worth the cost

We recomended this restaurant, food is delicious, staff very friendly, prices are reasonable. Terrace is beautiful - you can enjoy the view of the Adriatic and the Old city walls. Great choice for brunch or dinner.

We had the prawns and lamb - the ones which said they were the original recipe, but we were somewhat disappointed, the food was quite average. We also had the house wine - not so good, and the music was quite loud euro pop which we didn't enjoy. 

The service and the setting was lovely. But overall we thought our experience was somewhat average, especially when we expected more after the high reviews.
Good food, at a reaaonable price, good service but absolutely unbelievable setting. Fantastic experience.

We tried the sea bass and the chicken with bacon. Both dishes were lovely and the service was friendly and efficient. The views of the castle and the sea and the location are perfect when visiting Dubrovnik. The toilets were a credit to them and kept beautifully clean. Well worth a visit and very busy so worth booking for a table in the evening.
We sincerely recommend this restaurant. Staff friendly, service level. Food fine and sufficient. Prices acceptable. The view is phenomenal. We enjoyed it and will be back.

Had a great meal here last night. The terrace is lovely with great views of the fort and the city walls. Food was delicious - 2 x sea bass with grilled vegetables and Swiss chard (all delicious), pizza and pasta for teenagers, which they were very happy with. House white wine was also very tasty and very reasonably priced at K120 for a liter! The service from our waitress was outstanding. Very attentive but not at all overbearing. Excellent all round, highly recommend!

Great experience. We just walked in we’re treated super nice. Waiter was very nice and Professionel!! Everything was clean. The food was delicious , portions good and price quality excellent!! On hot days I recommend to sit on the city wall side it’s a little cooler.

Dubravka 1836 offers a great value for money breakfast with amazing sea views located just outside of the old town walls. The staff are friendly and breakfast is about half the price of what you would pay inside the old town, I would definitely recommend coming here even if for a quick drink on the terrace.

We has breakfast here all 3 days we were in Dubrovnik & it was always a super start to the day. Our very nice, friendly & caring waiters Drażan & Jasmin were a part of the pleasant experience. The various breakfasts are great value for money & the chocolate croissants excellent. With the view - a true delight!
This is our second time here in 7 days. Tomight was busier, but both the serivce and food worth the praise. My absolute compliments go to Ivan and Mateo, we will be back again tomorrow!
View is great and atmosphere is vivid. Restaurant has a lot of tables and is more like an average food factory. Cheesecake is amazing!

Visited this place for breakfast a couple of times during my trip to Dubrovnik. 
They offer a fantastic breakfast with fantastic views over the city walls and fort. 

Great place, great location and very reasonably priced.
The view is amazing, the service is 5*, but I didn't like the food so much - not on my taste, however the food is fresh and the deserts are amazing.
We booked a table for dining on the terrasse. The view was great, professional-like staff (they even sang happy birthday when bringing the lighted-canddle dessert :-)

This was my second time in Dubravka, and it did not dissapoint! Although they serve excellent breakfasts, lunches and dinners at afforable prices for Dubrovnik, I went with Rozata cake and machiatto. The traditional dessert in Dubrovnik was quite tasty and light, very refreshing during the hot summer. I'd also recommend apple strudel.
Definitely the place to go in the morning with an excellent view of the bay, Lovrijenac and walls, all of which improve the experience.

Just outside the city gate, this restaurant has an imposing view of the Fort and the City Walls. Reserve your table so you can sit outside and look out towards the sea. Excellent service and some very good dishes to try from. Everybody at the table was very satisfied with their main dishes except myself. Next time I would avoid the King Prawns as it is little Prawn drowned in a lot of tomato sauce.

Very good location(view on kingslanding) directly at the entrance to the old town.
Food was very good. Service even better. We felt well looked after. Will come back.finally a place where you feel welcome and appreciated. Thank you Ivan and Ivan for outstanding service!

Vegan review: 

Limited options on the menu! Had the tomato soup though, and it was delicious - it had rice in it, different but it worked. Perfect location and gorgeous views. Also had fresh orange juice. Quick service. Reasonably priced for the location. Would give more stars for more vegan options!
Really nice restaurant. Excellent food and excellent service. So enjoyed fine food with excellent service. Restaurant uncrowded with Covid-19 crisis. Really recommend 👌

Dubravka 1836 was recommended to us by employees of hotel we stayed in. We went for a lunch today, July 14th 2020 at 13:30 and from from the moment we arrived, we left all awfull reviews at Tripadvisor behind us-we were welcomed with a big smile and set at the table of our choice. We started with a large macchiato (a coffe with warm milk but without a foam) - it was perfectly prepaired, just as we asked.
For a lunch, we ordered 2 x grilled calamari/squid, 1x fench fries, 1x boiled potatos with mangel, 2x seson salads, 0.5L of white wine and 0.75L of sparkling water. The food was delicious, wine and spakling water were perfectly chilled/cold and felt great with our food. Waiters were nice, polite, with huge smiles under their COVID-19 masks and very customer oriented - they were filling our glasses with wine the moment they noticed that they were allmost empty, but they did it wery discretely and unobtrusively. 
I have read all bad reviews for Dubravka 1836 and all I can say are three things:

1. Dubravka 1836 is not a 1, 2 or 3 Michelin star restaurant. If you want to have a fancy and expensive lunch or dinner and be hungry afterwards, Dubravka 1836 is not a restorant for you

2. Communication and mutual understanding is crucial key for avoiding any missunderstanding - speak clearly what do you want and you'll get it. We asked for a large macchiato with warm milk but without any foam and it was perfect.
Anybody can make a mistake-if your order was lost, if your coffe was not as good as you expected, if you ordered noodles and got ordinary pasta or spaggeti, talk to the waiter or restaurant manager at once and you'll be compensated this way or another - don't write awfull reviews next day or next week.

3. If you are an ordinary guest who wants to enjoy in tasty lunch/dinner in heart of Dubrovnik, or you just want to enjoj in coffe and cake at great location by the sea and with trully afordable prices, Dubravka 1836 is a perfect spot for you. Read first two points again, come to Dubravka 1836 and you'll won't be dissapointed, I promisse! :-))

We were only in Dubrovnik for one night and I consider we were lucky to find this restaurant. We were worried they wouldn’t allow us to enter with our dog, but they couldn’t have been more welcoming and repeatedly checked if she still had water, the drinks and food were great prices for such a beautiful location, we were sat looking out into the sea. The waiters and waitresses were all extremely friendly and welcoming. We really enjoyed our evening there.
I only tried breakfast here and can tell that is very good! Prices are affordable. Brakfast with the view 😊
Good services. Nice ambient, visiting again. Prices are medium. The best location in Town for dinner and lunch.

Great food with beautiful view, reasnoable prices.
We had tomato soup, cold fish platter and prawns on Dubrovacki - everything was great.

We decided to get an early lunch here and boy it didn't disappoint. The waiting staff were very welcoming and the food even better. The atmosphere of the place was just so serene and relaxing especially as we had a view looking out onto the sea. We both ordered pasta dishes, myself a creamy tomato salmon and my partner a chicken, both highly recommend. This place is a must go to!ne

Ridiculously good food at ridiculously cheap prices in context of Dubrovnik. Sensational views over looking the walls this is truly the restaurant to visit during your stay in Dubrovnik. The lasagne I had was unbelievable and the selection of desserts than followed were equally brilliant. 10/10-would recommend booking.
Had an amazing time here, the view is fantastic, drinks were prompt and the staff, specifically Nikolina, was very accommodating and fantastic conversation, we will definitely be returning!

I didn't expect something like this,the beauty of Adriatic sea is something that gives food that fresh taste...service is fast and polite,very professional. Coming again with friends next year for sure!

We spotted this restaurant while looking down from the city walls and decided we just had to eat there. The views from the terrace over the water and to the old town walls - it is just outside the walls - were stunning. Our waiter was super helpful as we tried to get a table with one seat on the sun and one out of the sun, and the food was really good too.

The best thing though is the views - sitting outside, enjoying the sunshine, in one of the most beautiful cities on earth. What a fantastic way to enjoy lunch.

We went there for lunch the other day and I have to say I've never eaten lunch with a better view! We went for lunch since it get's dark here around 5:30 and we wanted to enjoy the view. Our server, Anita, was really nice and spoke English well. I had their fish soup and it was very good. I then had their John Dory fish dinner (very good) and my wife had the steak gratin which was cooked perfectly and quite delicious! Both dinners were good size portions and enjoyable. We shared dessert (a chocolate walnut cake that actually was more a walnut cake with chocolate icing). The cake was sweet without being overly sweet (much more European style than American style cake). The view of the sea and the city walls was perfect! Since we are here in mid February the place wasn't totally overrun with tourists and our leisurely lunch was exactly as we had hoped. The only downside is for those that sit outside along the wall in front (as we were since I had reserved a table) you have to put up with the pigeons that sit on the wall and constantly eye your food. People must feed them occasionally since they all seemed very unafraid of people though I did not see anyone feeding them when we were there. Our dinner for two, with a glass of wine and two bottles of water, was about $80. It was well worth it and we will be going back again before we leave Dubrovnik.

There’s no telling whether the best part about eating at this restaurant is the beautiful scenery or the delicious food! Whatever you personally choose there is not a right answer! Recommend all tourists solo, couples, or families to eat here.

We arrived late in the evening and really wanted to sit outside so that we could enjoy the view of the Fortress Lovrijenac. They weren't able to seat us out there at first but shortly after we got our drinks a table right at the edge opened up and they moved us so we were really pleased (the patio is enormous, actually and really beautiful in the dark with all the white lights in the trees, etc.). We knew the vegan options were limited but we tried it out anyway for the view. I had the risotto (just ask them to hold the butter and it's vegan) and it was really really good. My husband had the grilled veggie platter but it was less than enjoyable (I can't remember what all was on it but it had a lot of egg plant and it was so unappetizing that I didn't even take a picture of it - which is strange for me). I can't speak for the menu overall but I'm sure it's fine. Vegan food in Croatia is a bit hit-and-miss so we weren't terribly surprised. The staff were really attentive and nice. And the view is worth it.
We went here twice during our stay in Dubrovnik. The location is fantastic, the food is great and the staff is very friendly. Definitely recommend!
Delightful day enjoying espresso, good food, and a beautiful view. Food was great, served hot, seasoned well, and solid service. Hope to go back someday.
Good restaurant with homemade food. You can enjoy your meal in front of the sea. Near the old Town gate. I recommend it

Super Marjo was really friendly and helpful. He gave us a lot of suggestion of what to drink and eat and also helped us find the best table where we could enjoy the view as well as the coffee and the sun. Service 10/10 thanks to him.
Super Marjo, showed us alot of places to visit, he was really helpful and gave us the best ideas where to travel and go and eat. 10/10 Super Marjo 👍🏻

After our morning wandering Old Town, and King’s Landing, we were famished and decided on 1836 for respite and lunch. 
We were offered a lovely table overlooking the water...the ambiance is lovely as the restaurant is waterfront but adjacent the Old Town Walls. 
Beers, bread, the most wonderful seafood salad I’ve ever tried, and a delicious seafood pizza were our choices off the vast menu. 
Delicious!!
The food was amazing!! We loved it, and it topped off our day in Dubrovnik. 
Do yourself a favour, come here for a beautiful meal, with exceptional views steeped in so much history!!

Dubravka 1836 is a nice restaurant with great views of the Adriatic sea. The menu is exhaustive with a mix of Italian, local cuisine, Meditteranean, seafood, other European cuisines etc. The wine and drinks menu is also good. They also have multiple vegetarian options across pizzas, salads, soups.

I had a Vegetarian Pizza for lunch, which was really good along with the service. The views are really good at the restaurant. However, there isn't anything extraordinary as such. Ideal for a quite dinner from the crowd. SImple and stanard fare, done well.

We stopped here on our way out of town, and sat at a shaded table overlooking the little cove near the Pile Gate. Beautiful! We ordered a hearty breakfast and were very happy with how good the food was. Friendly service, and very reasonable prices as well.

We had breakfast on the terrace of Dubravka. Our waiter was great--helpful and very pleasant. Food was very good. We wish we'd eaten there every morning we were there! 
This restaurant is located right outside the Pile Gate and does get quite crowded. Seating is both inside and outside. Seating outside gives a wonderful view of the city walls and castle. It was recommended by the place we stayed and we would definitely go again.

The ambiance is great. The restaurant is like part of the old city walls, just outside the gate to the city.
The view is great. Especially if you can sit outside against the seaview the experience becomes uncomparable to anything.
The prices are really high, like all other Dubrovnik restaurants, even for any European citizen.
The portions are comparably small.
Location perfect overlooking the castle. Good menu reasonably priced. Delicious food & excellent service. Puddings awesome and on display! Love music's bonus.

I went to have breakfast here. Great view, amazing service and good food! It's also at the most convenient location next to pile gate so if you're nearby and don't know where to go for food, just go here. I'll visit again if I'm Dubrovnik next time =)
We were celebrating my wife's birthday and had a wonderful celebratory meal. The waitstaff was attentive and not overbearing. The food was very good. I would recommend for a nice meal.
Great service, great food and great location. Attentive staff who look after your needs. Well worth a visit.
Very good food and excellent service. A restaurant with nice view. We will come again. super marijo !

We ate breakfast here before going into the old town of Dubrovnik a couple of times and were very impressed. The food was excellent, the waiters friendly and attentive and the views were amazing! Liked it so much that we had dinner here one night as well.

We ate here every night of our 4 day honeymoon and we thoroughly enjoyed each meal!
The staff were friendly and professional.
The views were just breathtaking and the food delicious
We would highly recommend this restaurant.

Great restaurant just outside Pile Gate with good choice of tasty food, great views, nice relaxed ambiance and lovely, friendly staff. It was my wife’s birthday and the waiters overheard this and at the end of our meal, brought a big slab of cake, with candle and a happy birthday song as accompaniment! Well worth a visit.

We had dinner in this restaurant, located in the old town, close to Pile Gate, fantastic view of the Fort Bokar and Lovrijenac. Friendly staffs and great service. Fish soup, Tomato soup, King Prawns, Grilled Squid and Grilled vegetables were excellent. Value for money. Recommended!

This was our favourite place to eat and drink in Dubrovnik and we were regular visitors. The waiters were excellent and would find us the best seats available even if we only wanted a beer and a glass of wine. The restaurant overlooks the walls of the old city and important Game of Thones locations. The Waiters always made sure that we received our Dubrovnik card discount. Highly recommended.

Could not have had a better experience. We went for dinner on October 30th. To start with there’s the view!!! Then there’s the excellent service!!! Our food was thoughtfully prepared; feta salad to start, mouthwatering soft feta cheese with diced cucumbers, tomatoes and more. Dinner was grilled sea bass and a mixed fish grill plate. Both served with grilled seasonal vegetables. We shared the apple pie with ice cream for dessert and then our server surprised us with a lemon sorbet prosecco and vodka after dinner drink. What a night, we’ll tell anyone who travels to Dubrovnik to visit your restaurant! Thanks for a great evening!!!

We had eaten at the sister restaurant in Old Town for breakfast and were so impressed we wanted to try Dubravka.
Our dinner setting was picture perfect, overlooking the walls of the Old Town and the Fort. Staff were friendly and helpful when making choices from the menu and the food was delicious. 
We were so impressed we returned for breakfast on our final day. 
Would definitely recommend.

Felt the need to write a review as the meal was so good. We had a salmon salad and caprese salad for starters, both amazingly fresh. The mains were just next level we had the beef steak & dubrovka pizza which were gorgeous. Steak is best I’ve ever had! Reasonably priced for Dubrovnik. Definitely recommend.

Have on many occasions had dinner in this Restaurant when visiting Dubrovnik.
Booking in advance will save you from waiting on a queue for a table.
I had the Seafood selection, although it was tasty it was sadly not value for money, small portions.
My wife however went for her favourite dish again, the Lamb filet with green beans and hash potatoes and she loved it.
Not the cheapest restaurant, bot not the most expensive either.

This place is excellent after a walk round the old town.Views are good, the staff are friendly and the food is of a good standard.
Take your time and enjoy the sea views and the hustle and bustle of the square.
Stopped for lunch - wonderful aperil spritz and a decent pizza. Good value and friendly service. Right by the old town, the views are wonderful.

Been here three times in a week .Great food and beutifull souroudings. 
Staff pleasent every time. 
On the ball .clearing plates..
Top awards for hygien. 
Two ladies in my group was feeling a bit cold. And the staff offered them a blanket .and turned the heating lamps on them .thank you. 
I tried the steak .lamb spaghetti. 
And the veg soup starter is a must. 
Def will be returning in jan. 
Well done management and all staff.

This place is gorgeous in every way; location, menu, service, value and atmosphere. Please don't pay too much attention to the negative reviews; there's a reason that there are over a thousand excellent ones and only 30ish that are bad. 
I was seated within seconds, my meal arrived within minutes, and any further requirements were constantly monitored by the excellent, professional, polite and attentive staff. 
I was extremely impressed all round, especially with the service.
My food was delicious and exactly what I expected from the menu description.
After my main I was given a delicious, on-the-house sorbet/prosecco creation by the waiter, completely unprompted. What a lovely surprise.. It was fabulous and only confirmed what I had felt about the restaurant as soon as I sat down.
I will DEFINITELY be returning and will recommend. Thank you for looking after me so well.
Very nice restaurant in Pile Square at the entrance to the old town. View of the sea, walls and fortresses. It's nice to sit here, have coffee and eat cake or ice cream.

We clocked this place during the day and assumed that because it was in a very convenient location it would be over priced rubbish. Our 17 year old daughter was keen to go as the menu had things she would eat and not overly fancy. If you can get a table near the wall then really it is a lovely location. Food is more than acceptable and with a wide menu there will always be something for everyone.

This was personally my favourite restaurant that we found in Dubrovnik. Situated just outside the city walls, with an absolutely stunning view, friendly staff and good food. The atmosphere is romantic and they often have great live music - we visited twice, for food and just drinks and had a brilliant experience both times. We also found this to be one of the most reasonable restaurants (Dubrovnik is very pricey!) despite it being one of the best. 

The restaurant is linked to the panorama and the arsenal and so will offer a discount card too. Highly recommend!

After a long day in Dubrovnik, this was a wonderful place to eat and be refreshed!
Caprese salad was great, and so were the fries!!!

I wish we had more time to eat a larger meal, the restaurant was set up as open air and the back has a beautiful view of the water.

Highly recommend a visit to this delightful restaurant set against the dramatic backdrop of the walls and the sea - perfection on a sunny day. Received a very warm welcome and outstanding service from our waiter, Ivan (a Croatian Norwich City fan!). 
Ordered pizza, salad and fries for lunch accompanied by a few cheeky cocktails. Enjoyed everything. We were able to use a 10% discount card we had been given at Panorama restaurant and were advised we could use it again even if we only popped in for drinks - which we did later that evening! Relaxed atmosphere and smiling staff everywhere. Another gem in a long list of great dining experiences Dubrovnik has to offer. Fantastic affiliated ice cream shop just around the corner too!

Following a lovely evening walking around the city walls we opted to eat dinner here as the menu looked good and the restaurant was busy - always a good sign. We hadn’t pre booked a table but were lucky to be shown to a table down the side of the restaurant, opposite the city walls & gate entrance. A lot of other customers were coming in wanting/waiting for a seat on the terrace, and were either turned away as it was full, or asked to join a queue around the front. I have to say that I much preferred where we were seated, the views were spectacular and actually it was less crowded & there weren’t hundreds of tourists watching whilst you ate! The only slight issue was the customers who smoked - because there was a canopy style roof above, smoke drifted around. However, because we were sat right by the edge & the open air, it wasn’t too offensive. 

The service we received was excellent, the food and wine were great, and the views were even better! So glad we chose to dine here.

We stopped for a drink, which turned into an early dinner. We did have to wait for a table, but only for a few minutes. We seemed to choose a quieter time, when queues were shorter. Service was great. I had a very yummy pizza and my companion ordered the seafood tagliatelle, which was excellent as was the local wine. It was nice and cozy too, with warm patio heaters. Definitely worth a visit if you time it right.
We stopped there to eat. The food was delicious but small portion , and expensive. Situated near the old town

Lunch was so good, we came for dinner that evening. This restaurant was recommend by the girl doing the orange bus tours and she was right. Service was excellent, very friendly, food and drink was fantastic. Great choice on the menu. Price was very reasonable. Will definitely visit again if on Dubrovnik.

This eatery right by the entrance to the old city offers fine outdoor dining with an extensive menu from several traditions. The service is efficient without being obtrusive, both the local beers and wines deserve to be sampled . You might have to queue for a table at busy times but the wait will be worthwhile. Interesting starters and desserts complement a wide selection of fish , meat and pasta dishes.

Dubravka 1836 restaurant is beautiful with excellent views! The staff are busy but professional and the food is very good. They also have good coffee! I hear that the ice cream is tasty too! Go if you are near the City walls! My choice for a gourmet pizza!

The food was great and the service was wonderful. We took soup and they were a delight . We had a few kinds of pasta dishes as main courses and each one of them was great. For a dessert we had the cheesecake and an apple pie both were excellent. We enjoined the live music that was played. The waiters were welcoming and got us everything we needed. 
To summarize it was a great experience.

Last year we went to the restaurant and we couldn't fault it. The food,service and views were wonderful. This year we were limited on time so thought that we would partake of the icecream as we did for desert last year(never had orange icecream as good). Sadly they didn't have any orange available,but did have stunning banana and a pistachio that was delicious. Oh my goodness it's a good job that they dont have stores or restaurants near us,we'd become food pests very quickly. . .and huge. Eek!

Positives: Pizza was tasty and affordable. Bread is free. The service was the best we’ve had in Croatia. The atmosphere was very relaxing with the lighting and the view of the sea. 

Negatives: The portion size for the pasta is small. The drinks (water) is expensive.

After loving the City Walls Walk we needed refreshment and chose here - there's quite a few options but we were very pleased with our choice. Our coffee and chocolate and walnut torte were delicious. Perfectly located, our table overlooked the water and parts of the magnificent vertical fortified wall of the Old Town and was also perfect for people-watching. This place gets very busy, but service staff are attentive, efficient and friendly. Our bill was a bit on the expensive side, but we were still on a high from the Walls Walk, so we didn't mind! Highly recommended.

Visited this restaurant a couple of time whilst in Dubrovnik for breakfast lunch and drinks. The location is superb overlooking the bay. The breakfast was lovely with fresh ingredients and good service. Lunch was excellent would recommend the seafood salad, mussels as well as the pizzas all were tasty and well cooked. The service was excellent with friendly efficient staff would definitely recommend this place to friends and family. Just watch out for the pigeons some are quite aggressive honing in on the leftovers however the staff were quick to chase them off 😀

Traveling with 3 other couples in Croatia where we dined here last night. We were all really happy with our meals, very delicious food. The staff were very attentive, friendly and helpful throughout the night. T I thoroughly recommend this restaurant!

Juraj was a superb waiter .. very attentive to a lactose intolerance. Food was wonderful and the setting is gorgeous. Pizza, fish, meat ... all fab. Quite romantic with the musicians playing at 9pm. Highly recommended.
This is a busy large restaurant, but it is very well run. Both the view of the city walls and the food are excellent.

We had 2 dinners here & enjoyed great food - delicious grilled fish & mussels to recommend & pizza for the children! Ask to sit outside with the view of the fort. Also great service from the (rather good looking!) waiting staff. We were given a 10% off card for this and 2 of their sister restaurants after the 1 st meal - so worth noting if you wish to eat in the one at the top of the cable car.

great restaurant with lovely food . Beautiful views however make sure you reserve a table as far left facing the sea as you can as all the best tables get reserved and the ones on the right are great until every one stands there waiting for the sun set and all the birds coming out

We had dinner here during our stay in Dubrovnik. Staff were attentive, and food was excellent. We had seafood, beef and pizza and all was fantastic. Great atmosphere too, with a small two piece jazz band playing, adding to the vibe.
Stopped here for some lunch, fabulous views. Lovely lunch, would highly recommend it. Even if for the views if nothing else.

This restaurant is right at the front of the main gate in peak tourist location. I’d recommend for breakfast as bit less pricey than lunch/dinner where suggest better options. There is 10% discount if you show a promotional card (also available for Bar Panorama and Gradska kavana Arsenal). The food is decent enough without being spectacular- the impressive point is the view from your table. The closer to the front the better!
Food was good and price very reasonable considering that Dubrovnik is the most expensive city of Croatia by far. Pasta worth trying and chicken with bacon good. Very good service

We went there twice, once without a reservation on a Saturday evening and still the staff found us a nice place to sit and eat.
The service is very nice and professional, the views are breathtaking but the best is the food - we had the mussels and the Dalmatian steak.
Seasoning and freshness of highest quality.
Good place in Dubrovnik!

A pleasant restaurant with great view of the city walls and fortress, nice food, and friendly staff. It is located just outside the Pile gate next to the souvenir shop, so it is easy to find. Prices are not so expensive too, considering its location.

두브로브니크 여행 마지막 날 저녁에 방문했고, 음식이나 서비스 모두 좋았습니다. 가격도 관광지 물가를 생각하면 아주 비싸진 않은 듯 했습니다.
Brilliant service, amazing hot and value for money food. We came twice during the day we were here and received a 10% discount.try this place you will not be disappointed.

Came across this place for a late lunch after climbing up to the fortress. They sat me at a lovely table that overlooked the water and the fortress. I ordered a pizza as it was quite a cheap option. It was delicious! So big though, I couldn't finish it - would be good for sharing. The staff are friendly and efficient. Only thing, if you don't like pigeons, don't sit near the wall/view - they are not shy and some people think it's ok to feed them!!

We visited Dubrovnik in September, we were lucky enough to eat at this restaurant twice. The food was delicious. The location is stunning. The service we received was outstanding. A special thanks to Ivan who served us on our first visit and Anita who served us on our second visit for making our evenings so special. Am looking forward to returning to this restaurant again next September!!

We first ate here in 2016 on our first visit to Dubrovnik, and having come back this year, nothing has changed! We love this restaurant! Fast service, great staff, great views, well priced, wonderful food and they offer a discount card for you to use in their other restaurants during your stay. We honestly don’t have a bad word to say about Dubravka, it is brilliant!

Booked in advance so we got a front line table outside with views over the old city walls, staff were very helpful and the food was excellent, dispite being very busy you were not hurried off your table. Would definitely recommend this restaurant as a lot better value than some of the restaurants we looked at within the walls with no views
Great restaurant, fabulous, friendly service. Great food,as good as the fabulous views. Especially loved the blankets at the tables. Lovely touch on chilly evenings.
Service and food faultless in this busy restaurant. Visited several times. Lovely views of city walls and sea

Went to this restaurant earlier this evening for dinner. As it was raining my friend and I we were wearing rain ponchos. Perhaps these gave offence for some reason as when we asked a male member of staff for a table for 2 we were told, in a rather patronising manner, that this was a quiet restaurant but that he would get us a table.

We turned around and promptly left despite the rude waiter's protests as we felt insulted by this unwarranted behaviour towards two respectable Irish ladies and will not return.

Good service, great food. 

Branko was a friendly and accommodating waiter. 

Spacious and comfortable restaurant.

As has been said it's in the tourist maelstrom of bus + coaches stopping + just b4 You enter the Pile Gate. So I went in here in the heat out of desperation for a quick cool beverage stop and came back on subsequent days because we were impressed with the service efficiency, staff welcoming and views were superb across from Lovrijenec Fortress. A great introduction

Just outside of Pile Gate, a fabulous setting by the old town and a terrace overlooking the sea. Service was exceptional, the professionalism of the staff is the best we have seen for a long time. Decent choices on the menu, and quality of the food was excellent, at very competitive prices. Can recommend the house wine. Overall a great experience, Mario was super friendly.
Location/view of this restaurant is amazing - food is very good too. Waiters speak perfect English and explain local foods.
Great service. Super Marijo, with a J, was a fantastic server. We didn’t feel rushed. Food was good. I had a lovely drink called Dalmatian G&T.
Staff are nice, food is okay, comfy comfy seats outside overlooking the ocean and the fort. BUT VERY EXPENSIVE. the taste of food doesn't correspond to the price.

I had breakfast here recently on a trip to Dubrovnik. I was wanting to grab some food before embarking on the City Wall walk. 

I ordered an tomato and cheese omelette, which came with a side of bread and fruit. I also had a cup of coffee. The omelette was really thin, as if they used only 1 egg to make it! Thank heavens for the bread and fruit. Coffee was good.

The view is the main reason for recommending this restaurant. It overlooks the Adriatic Sea and coast. You will see multitudes of cruise-ship tourists coming to take photos at the adjacent overlook point. Just ignore them. There will also be many pigeons flying around. 

It's a great place for people-watching for people from all over Europe and the world. Waiter was attentive and efficient.

Stopped in on our first night. Waiter was attentive and offered good dining options. Smoked meat and cheese platter was delicious. Enjoyed the grilled octopus with potatoes and kale side (the best tasting of many restaurants 👍). Nice view overlooking city wall. Our friend enjoyed her grilled trout but the rice and steamed broccoli was very bland. Only down side of our meal.

Here we had the best dinner of our week in Dubrovnik. Unfortunately it was our last evening there so we couldn't revisit the place. What can I say... we should have gone earlier :D Tuna steak and mixed grill were both delicious and service was good all the time even though restaurant was full. Right beside the Pile gate with a wonderful view and milieu and still prices are quite reasonable. Very recommendable.

I ordered a fish platter for my main... literally a plate of over cooked unseasoned vegetables with unseasoned fish. Could have been a million times nicer if seasoned and cooked in garlic butter, as the fish had potential. It was not cheap and completely depressingly uninspiring. Maybe order a pizza from here instead... as the views are nice and the atmosphere is not bad. 

The cake I ordered for dessert was pretty tasteless. My bill wasn’t cheap, but I wasn’t expecting it to be in a prime location. Service is really average, not friendly. Come here for the convenience of the location and if you get a good table, for the views... but don’t expect good food. Like I sat, this is probably the kind of place where you are better off sticking with pizza.

We were staying in Dubrovnik and before arriving I had looked up places to eat and came across this restaurant and I have to say it did not disappoint, the staff were extremely friendly from the time we arrived, we ate here a few times for breakfast and dinner, cannot fault the staff or food whatsoever and would not hesitate to recommend this restaurant to anyone.
 
The view from the restaurant was stunning and was a massive bonus

Dubravka is located just outside the Dubrovnik castle. The place is aimed at tourists and has a rich (slightly pricey?) menu from pizza to more local specialities. I had a John Dory (white fish) dish with vegetables and rice while my wife and daughter went for a pizza and a tuna dish. The taste and texture of the John Dory was very good. The julienned vegetables were nicely cooked and the sauce well balanced. Relaxed atmosphere and friendly staff.

We were there early so we had the chocolate croissant - excellent and then ordered 4 cheese pizzaIt was very good. The location is convenient to the buses if you are on the tour instead of fighting the crowds to go back inside the walls
Recommend this restaurant highly,lovely food and staff very friendly. The view from the restaurant was beautiful

We had lunch here and the food was excellent. The mussels were some of the best I've ever had. The location is just outside the city walls, perfect after doing all of the sightseeing within the old town. We were recommended to this resteraunt by a friend and am more than willing g to pass that recommendation on to others.

Great local good and reasonably priced.
Attentive and friendly waiters.
Located nesr Pile gate with water views
Good for latger groups,bit need to Book ahead

We ate here two nights of our one week stay. The food was superb. The service was just right the food was the best. The pork medallions were melt in the mouth. And the salmon was equally good.The French fries were crispy and just right. The fried vegetables were gorgeous. The house red went down a treat. The banana spilt and the Irish coffee looked mouth watering. ( I didn’t partake ). The staff were friendly knowledgeable and helpful. Recommended

We found this place after walking through the Old City. It’s just outside the Pile Gate with a patio that faces the stone walls and the Adriatic. Quite a varied menu. We found what we liked and had no regrets. Good service, too. We enjoyed it so much that we went back again another night for dinner.

I wax with a group & we stopped here for lunch before we went out on our own. I had a cold local beer and the seafood salad with nicely cooked octopus, capers, shrimp, scallions, anchovies, black & green olives, & cherry tomatoes. ( can you tell that I liked it?) another person had a lovely shrimp with risotto . It was so hot & crowded that day that we came back before we were to meet to go back and sat for another cold drink. I would go back.
There is a card with a 10% coupon for a return visit there or their sister restaurants.

We came here first for breakfast, and ended up coming back several times for breakfast, lunch and dinner! Service is impeccable, food is delicious and uncomplicated, views of the old town and Fort unsurpassed. No need to go anywhere else if you are staying close by!

We have this restaurant prior notice & a choice of three nights for our dinner; we confirmed on the day & turned up early. We had great table, service & most of all the food was really nice & the service was very friendly & efficient. It’s our best dining experience in this wonderful town - with no shortage of restaurants & eateries. The background music was also very nice & peaceful - would like to hear more of that rather than the modern music in such an old town / Croatian classical / guitar would also be appreciated.

We’ve been to Dubravka 1836 restaurant for dinner during our stay in Dubrovnik. We had mainly seafood which was delicious, not only the right amount but very well presented.

It’s quite busy there so making a reservation prior is highly recommended. Views are amazing and there was a gentleman playing saxophone making the whole experience even better. 

Highly professional staff were looking after us. I would definitely go back :)

Came without a reservation at dinner time and were seated right away. The staff were extremely attentive and efficient. Lovely, tasty dinner and the little extras such as bread while waiting and a special drink at the end really added to the experience. Definitely recommend!

This restaurant is amazing and worth the visit. I have allergies and the staff were happy to help us. I had the seafood plate: salmon, sea bass, prawn, oyster and octopus with veg. They also had Gluten free bread. It was so increadable. My husband had the pizza which he loved. As the evening got colder during our meal, the staff offered blankets and turned on the heaters. We were happy and so relaxed. Felt like a piece of heaven.

There are some reviews saying the food was average and I honestly couldn’t disagree more. We had seafood pasta and scampi with black pasta and they were both amazing, the desserts were also delicious (highly recommend the apple cake). We went back the next day for drinks and the Dalmatian G&T is just so good!
The staff are delightful. The views incredible, we were recommended by a local resident, but unfortunately i thought the food was average.

Great service. Sat down when the sun was out so they had sun shades out, and as the evening progressed they removed them all chasing the shade, but without disturbing everyone- a nice touch. Food was great, staff very friendly

This is a wonderful location right next to the old city walls with an ocean view. You can either dine outside on the great covered patio or inside depending on availability. If you are an early visitor the restaurant serves breakfast from 8-11AM. Menu items include:Risotto, Pasta, pizza, salads, fish dishes and home made cake. The Peria Hotel is close by for reference. Great place to cool off in the afternoons and watch the world go by.

stopped here for lunch and had an enjoyable time. It was busy since this is the meeting point for many tours, but we were still able to sit right away and had a spectacular view. I had the octopus salad and it was great. The octopus was tender and not rubbery at all. Food was decent and price for lunch for two with beers and bottled water was about 40 EUR.

Also an excellent location, ate breakfast and lunch there. Enjoyed the food, especially with the view. Awesome coffee. Just wish the service was a little better. Our waiter wasn’t a real friendly dude

I have been to this restaurant before with others and the staff have been unbelievably friendly. However when you arrived today, on my own, it was clear from the outset that the waiter was not happy. A friend was due to join me but ended up not. 
The main waiter was sullen, grumpy, unprofessional and rude. Others who served me my drinks were smiley and pleasant and lovely. 
At the end of my meal when I was paying and things were being flung at me- the check, the direct debit machine etc., I made it known what I felt at which point my waiter started, let’s be nice and say giving out, to me in Croatian. Trust me, you don’t need to understand to know when someone is cursing you!! Pity because my other experiences were so much more pleasant but this has really left a bad taste in my mouth on my last day
Superb restaurant. Great food with big selection at a good price. Excellent staff, very courteous and helpful. Fantastic views and very comfortable. All in all a very good restaurant all round.
We had a wonderful evening here this week, dinner for two, fantastic food, excellent service & romantic setting. This place is a winner & the owners, management & staff clearly know what people want.

We have only been to this restaurant for breakfast, which was delightful. Nothing amazing about the food, but for a very reasonable set price, you get the choice of about 5 breakfast packages. All consist of juice, hot drink of your choice, lots of bread and toppings, fruit salad and a hot dish. All for the price of coffee and a pastry at a restaurant inside the wall. The view was amazing and the staff friendly and service prompt. Recommend for breakfast.

There was a great range of food on the menu, I had the tuna steak which was a very generous portion. Dessert was an incredible cheesecake, again a good portion size.

Atmosphere is relaxed and friendly, service is fantastic, and the view is amazing.
Gratinated beef fillet and cheesecake - both exceptional. The waiters were attentive and accommodating - excellent all round.

This restaurant is in an amazing location for the view , naturally I thought complete tourist trap , but , our GoT tour guide mentioned it also a place to eat , so we gave it a go . 
The service was spot on , food was served in a timely manner , and we didn’t feel we were being rushed on , you also have an option of just having drinks . 

Other travelling companions had breakfast and they loved it .

I recently visited Dubrovnik and found this place before i was due to start a walking tour, so figured i would try it out. It is in such a convenient location, being right next to Pile gate into the Old Town. 
I ended up going back every day! Not only are the staff super friendly (shout out to Juraj, who was always so cheerful whenever i went in!) but the food was absolutely delicious and there was a beautiful view to enjoy as you ate your meal.
The prices are so reasonable and i was given a 10% off promotion card to use for the entirety of my stay, which could be used across all 3 of their restaurants (the other 2 being located in the Old Town harbour and at the top of the Cable Car), which definitely gave even more incentive to go back! 
They were always quite busy, which i also think is a testament to the quality of their food and service. The portion sizes are very generous and the menu is extensive, so caters for all tastes.

We passed this busy restaurant every time we walked into the city. So we thought we would give it a try and have breakfast there. Plus they keep serving breakfast till 11.30.
We were seated v quickly. I noticed a number of people stored their luggage there during the meal. So that was helpful to find out.
The location is great. You can seat right by the wall of the old town and look out over black bay too. 
We didn't as on this day there were a lot of wasps about.
We were service quickly by a nice young man. He later gave us a discount card for a return visit. 
Which we used the next day. 
Food was very good. 
Clean toilets which were free. So make the most of them as public loo in the old city cost 7 kuno. 
Wheelchair users can use this restaurant easily.

We tried this restaurant twice during our visit to Dubrovnik. Each time the food and service were excellent. We only had starters and desserts, but they were very good. The first visit was at 9 pm and we were surrounded by smokers, which was disappointing. For our second visit we visited at 4 pm and the restaurant was much quieter. Our table was outside but away from others who were smoking, which made it a much more pleasant visit.

Great food in a really nice setting just outside the city walls so not inner city prices. 5 star service and food for 3 star price. Don't be afraid if you don't like seafood there are other options, most tastes catered for.

Just wandered in looking for something light. Their outdoor cafe was nice ( of course the weather greatly helps). Ordered the shrimp salad which had a good number of shrimp with lettuce and a nice dressing. My husband ordered the Dubrovnik pizza which had just about everything on it but it still managed to just be ok. It needed more oomph from something- either the sauce or the seasoning.

We had breakfast a couple of times when we were in Dubrovnik.
Reasonable seclection of breakfast choices - between us we had all options. Good amount of food and all great quality with great service. And what a view!

We stopped here for a little bruch before our first visit into Dubrovnik's Old Town, and were sat right on the wall overlooking the City Walls and the Adriatic Sea. Just a great setting for our first morning in Dubrovnik, and the service and food were a delight!

This restaurant has amazing views and good food. It is a perfect location close to the old city of Dubrovnik just outside the Ploce gate. However, the big drawback is that there is no non-smoking section. Why would such a restaurant subject all its patrons to smoking especially when there are little babies present. Are they totally in the dark that smoking causes cancer. I would suggest they could increase their business by simply adding a nonsmoking section. Please join the campaign to stop smoking in Croatia and restaurants in other European countries.

First day in Dubrovnik, first love.
Just at the door of the Old Town, this is really a nice location, especially if you are lucky enough to sit on the terrace.
Quality food, nice staff e price about 180 kune (abt. 25 euro) per person for a main dish and water.
Conveniently located near old city. Very nice dinner. I had fish and my wife pizza. Good service. Great view. Food was good . But not outstanding. However you can't go wrong here

We were in Dubrovnik in a week and happened to be staying about 5 minutes walk outside Pile Gate so almost passed this restaurant every time we visited the walled city. Well truthfully we didnt always pass - 5 of us ate here 3 times for breakfast, once for lunch and twice for dinner. Thats a clue we were pleased. For breakfast its great value and although about 5 set choices its a good enough selection to please anyone - and the coffee is particularly good. Lunch and dinner is different in that there is a huge selection ranging from good pizzas to excellent fresh fish. Stand out dishes were the tuna steak which was perfectly cooked rare, shrimps and pasta which was superb and a favourite of everyone and the best rated dinner was John Dory which was so fresh. The service is eficient and friendly and they listen to any requests - in particular try and push for a table overlooking the sea which is lovely. It is a busy restaurant but if you dont book its vbig enought to have arapid turnover so fairly short waits.

We ate and drank there over a few days while we were in Dubrovnik, always found the food really good and drinks reasonably priced. It probably has the best views just outside the walls. Service was always attentive and seemed like there was no rush to move you on. A great spot to watch the hustle and bustle of Dubrovnik go by with a cool drink and something to eat.

Went here for lunch one day before exploring the Old Town. The food and views were fantastic. It overlooked apart of the city walls and the see which was really good. The food was cooked lovely too. Also, considering its location its not as expensive as one might think, it was reasonably priced. The food and service was first class. 

However, this is a very popular place to eat so I would reccomend booking well in advance, the dinner service is very busy and hard to get a table. 

But apart from that, a good place to eat and enjoy the views.
Ate here twice - enjoyed the grilled squid and seafood risotto, the crene carmel very good as well. Service prompt and efficient. Views while dining unaralleled! Amazing, recomnended!

We (4) had a late night dinner at the recommendation of our Air BNB host Biba. The atmosphere was great- you can sit outside or in. We had salads and fresh fish. Salmon and sea bass. All delicious. Wait staff very friendly.

A slightly odd thing to be worthy of a review for, but hopefully other parents will appreciate it! This is the first bar/restaurant we have been to in Croatia with baby changing facilities and it has really good ones - see picture. That aside, nice shady spot for a coffee and croissant. Nice views and friendly service. Recommended instead of the cafes in the narrow side streets within the walls.

This restaurant is a must for 🍲 lovers. Varied menu from pizza. Pasta Steak. Prices affordable. A place to unwind and soak up the views chat among friends/families or as a solo traveller. Customers service very good. I have been here a number of times over the past year and always enjoyed the aray of food and wine. In the midst of the hustle and bustle of pile Gate the ambience/ views spectacular-relaxing☺️😊😊
Lovely views from this restaurant just in the sea front staff lovely food is good well worth a visit

A great deal as compared to USA prices . Great pizza ; great wines and wonderful service . 
Views can’t be beat . Large restaurant and children friendly . Go you won’t be disappointed .

Are here on our first night in amazing Dubrovnik. Seated right on the edge overlooking the Adriatic which was wonderful. Had asked for a nice seat so pleased that was delivered. 

Had a very tasty pasta arrabiatta and wife had a lovely veggie pizza which I got about a third of. Pasta was very tasty and spicy. Pizza was packed with veg and nicely cooked. Had two glasses of house wine which was also good and chocolate mousse dessert which was a little sweet but ok. Service attentive and friendly. 

There will be finer places food wise in Dubrovnik I’m sure but this is very reasonably priced for the amazing location, as is the alcohol. Also you get a 10% discount card when you visit. We already had one as had a quick drink there earlier in the day so was about £40 for a main meal each, one side salad, one dessert, two house white wines, a coke and a Baileys. 

A nice place to spend our first evening.

Being part of the group that runs Panorama and the 360, I think makes this restaurant seem a bit more fancier than it really is.

The food was nice although we only had pizza as we were just looking for something filling that wasn’t overly expensive.

We had the Frutti Di Mare pizza, Salami pizza and two pints of the local beer which came to 228Kn plus cover charge.

The view is lovely, but being right next to Pile gate meant it was incredibly touristy!

Good for a quick eat though although could potentially be very expensive as the pizzas were one of the cheapest things!
We had a simple meal of arugula salad and grilled trout washed down by Pocip wine. The food was good quality and the service professional and friendly. The view from the terrace was priceless!
Best place in town to have breakfast, we came here every single day! Amazing view and the staff is great! Highly recommended!
They have a large terrace that offers great views of the Adriatic Sea. The food was delicious and our server, Jasmine, was very friendly.

We went there couple of times once for tea and second time for dinner . The food is delicious and reasonably priced. Really enjoyed the desserts there , especially Dubrovnik crémé caramel with orange syrup !!

Try not to sit to close to the edge of the balcony here as there were many pigeons trying to get a free meal. I found this restaurant pricey and not as high in quality as other European restaurants. I thought the roasted veg was particularly overpriced.

So good we went twice!!! 

Arrived in Dubrovnik a bit tired & shell shocked by the crowds, but Dubravka 1836 was perfect place to recharge before & after hitting the sites for both lunch & dinner.

Staff are very friendly, drinks are very good & food is excellent! 

Next time I’m in Dubrovnik, I will definitely be back 👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻

This is all you can ask of an ordinary reasonably priced restaurant. Nothing here pops out but at the end of the day it’s descent food for descent prices. Staff was very nice and polite from the first second aswell.
We went here on our last night and had the most wonderful evening! Setting was beautiful, food was gorgeous, our waitress Anita was great and value for money was also fab
Great place to have lunch if you want to avoid the busy old town during the day - pizzas were lovely and service was good. Ask for a table near the cliff edge as the sea view is beautiful!
The breakfast was much better than expected for a place were all the cruise tourists are dropped off just outside. The service was close to fantastic. Would come back for dinner.

I thought this would be one of the tourist traps like many of the beautiful situated restaurants in the old town area. I was wrong. The staff was super friendly- the best service I had in Dubrovnik so far. The breakfast was superb. The bread was a bit boring- but at every place I had breakfast in Dubrovnik they serve boring white bread in different executions. But everything else was way over expectations. I definitely recommend it!

Some of the best food in Dubrovnik with friendly and helpful staff! Out of all the restaurants this is the best value for money, they have another 2 sister restaurants which are worth checking out too.

My husband and I stopped to have tea/coffee this morning after we’d been walking in town for couple of hours and what an amazing location, superb. Service is excellent and really fast despite being extremely busy. €8 for 2 Earl Grey tea, not bad considering the location. I had a look at other customers food, they had very nice breakfasts, brunch, ice creams, cocktails.... fully recommended.
Went for breakfast with friends. Excellent service, good breakfast, nice view. Recommended to start the day
This restaurant is right in the entrance to the old town. Food is good and prices are fair for the location. We only went once but would have gone back if had more time in town.

Fantastic location at Pile Gate...Sublime atmosphere, soft lights while heating, service is ok.
We were around the town(me and my wife) and decided to stop here since my wife knew the place such tor a long time.
Octopus salade plus Grilled squid plus grilled vegetables and at the end a super fantastic apple pie...I would come back to get this delicious cake...
No complains, everything was fine and the guy who served us was very nice.
Price considering we got discounted due to my wife citizenship it is ok, otherwise it should be too expensive.

Anyway...thanks for that special night.
Excellent service and food. Nice salmon salad and juice. Very handsome manager Joseph and staff. He deserves 10 stars.

This restaurant was fabulous. We were a group of 6 and had a table outside with amazing views. We all had pizza and salad which was great, and cocktails afterwards were superb. The staff were really helpful and professional. The only downside was the wait for a table - we were told we would have to wait up to half an hour - it was closer to an hour and there was no where to sit or have a drink while we waited, we just had to stand in the entrance. I would definitely go again but would book a table next time.

Great food and service, overlooking the old city. Pretty busy with tourists but that's part of it. Ideal location right outside the city gates. Dubrovnik is a really neat city - don't miss going into the gates to check it out.

This restaurant overlooks part of "The Old Town". I was fortunate to be seated at a table with the best view.
