I ordered wine, and sat admiring the view of the "Old Town".
I si enjoyed not being pushed to order food and wait staff were attentive, not pushy.
I did order food, and it was magnificent. A seafood salad, fresh and flavorful. It was delightful.
Amazing service, view, and food.
Food was excellent from starter to desserts. Seafoods are a must-try. Service was superb! Waiters have happy faces.
Very nice foods in here.. I liked it and loved in view... I recommend everyone definitely ... Greatt

Had dinner here and it was wonderful. Great service and excellent food
The wild boar goulash was wonderful

We were lucky enough to have a table by the sea wall; amazing views for sunset. Restaurant had live music and great atmosphere as every table booked. We just had one course; seafood risotto and mixed grilled fish with vegetables. Highly recommend the seafood risotto.

Our group of 11 people arrived in Dubrovnik on a Thursday afternoon, and the tour guide we'd used in Split had given us a strong recommendation to dine at Dubravka. What a brilliant suggestion! We arrived around 6:30; we were welcomed and seated promptly despite the size of our group, and Ivan was a wonderful host for us, providing information about the menu and helping us choose a couple of bottles of excellent wine to complement the delicious food. The open-air ambiance was perfect, giving us a gorgeous view as well protecting us from the very warm sunshine. All of the seafood (Octopus salad -- yum!!!) and vegetarian dishes were beautifully prepared, and we felt completely satisfied at the end of our meal. The staff members were lovely, and invited us to return soon -- definitely on our list next time we are in Croatia, and we'll spread the word!

We ate here on our last night in Dubrovnik - Saved one of the best until last. We had a seat along the perimeter wall looking out to the sea and the wall of the old town. Fantastic views and a fantastic meal. Make sure you book in advance as it can get booked up. Great value with a litre of house wine being only 140HKN (less than £20, and it was good stuff). We had Charcuterie Board and Tomato Mozzarella for starters. The Mozzarella was the best we had in the City, really light and fluffy. The prosciutto Ham was one of the best too. For mains we had a Seafood Platter for one, this included a scallop, squid, and I think Salmon and Seabass. Other half had tuna. Really enjoy both and the vegetables with the Platter were lovely. Staff were fantastic, really attentive. Would definitely give it a visit.

When you have a place with views like this in the middle of a bunch of tourists the expectation is that it will be overpriced and mediocre quality. 

Dubravka had good views, good food, good service, and was easily one of the best meal values of the trip. Breakfast was set menu only but surprisingly complete with good lattes and the juices squeezed fresh. Service was attentive and helpful. Would gladly go again.

Great place to eat with attentive staff and a good choice of Mediterranean cuisine. 
The piano player in the back ground was awesome. Great tune selection in a jazz vibe. 
Food was very well presented and hit the spot in regards to flavor and portion size.
All round perfect night at Dubravka 1836. The food and drinks were delicious and the service was impeccable - the best we had in Croatia! Would definitely recommend!!

Went there for breakfast. Unfortunately they only have set menus which oblige you to order a mix of dishes out of which I dont eat any. Asked to simply get an omelette and was told I must get everything else (bread, marmalade fruit etc) which I find a complete waste of food and money. 
My other half had the set menu which was ok but no flexibility to customer requests is a big no no.

This restaurant is located right at the entrance to old town, has breathtaking view overlooking the sea and walls of old town. Meals and Bear are just right. Proper service and atmosphere. Value for money is 4/5

The location itself is stunning, probably the place to be for every Game of Thrones fan while enjoying a good breakfast and some good coffee. Attentive ans quick service, and moderately priced considering the location. Can recommend going there but make sure you have reservation to get a first row table facing the sea.

The location, the atmosphere, the view, the prices, the service, the food- all fantastic! Very pleased with my visit here. Cheaper than expected considering it was so close to Pile Gate and the Old Town!

We stopped for iced coffee after a trip to the nearby fort, service was mediocre, waitress was mire interested in chatting to another table rather than listening to our order. The iced coffee was delicious, the restaurant was cool and the views were fabulous.
Great location near the old town with a beautiful view at the walls and castles. Really good service and exellent food. Live music as well.

This is a nice escape from the hustle and bustle of inner Old Town. 

This restaurant is based just outside Pile gate with a romantic view of the Old Town walls and ocean. 

I would recommend booking a table the day before you want to go if you wish to sit on the terrace edge away from the tourist photo area. We didn’t book a table and were seated pretty fast as we were only a table for two. (The waiters are consistently rearranging table to accommodate different size groups, they make real effort here)

Our waiter was Toni and he was lovely and super efficient the entire evening. We never felt rushed and were encouraged to take our take and enjoy the views/food.

Would highly recommend to everyone visiting Dubrovnik. (Specially to getaway from the business of old town) it’s like a breath of fresh air.

We ate here on two occasions and thoroughly enjoyed our meals both times.
Service is very good.We ate inside on both occasions but that was lovely too.
You need to book in advance I would think if you would like to eat outside.

Great breakfast in a nice environment - it's just what you need after arriving by ferry and spending almost an hour on finding a parking spot in Dubrovnik. The restaurant is at the entrance of the old town. There are different breakfast menus to choose from and although it's a huge restaurant, the staff is well organised so we got all the attention we needed. They have a gorgeous, exclusive-looking terrasse, so we would have certainly tried it for a dinner too, should we have stayed in Dubrovnik.

We loved the location and the food. We enjoyed a great time with a table directly overlooking the beach. We had pizza, pasta and salad and all 3 were nice. The only problem was an angry waiter when a pigeon came to eat from our plates and we didn’t try to scare her away. He scolded us saying we should feed her which we were not trying to do anyway. Later he was all friendly and nice. I would still go there again when I’m in Dubrovnik.

On our third day in beautiful Dubrovnik we came to Dubravka to spend an amazing and romantic evening! They gave us a great spot, right in front of City walls, underneath the stars. We were so lucky to have Mario serve us. His knowledge of Croatian wines, history and menu made our night perfect. We started with an incredible octopus salad that we shared. My husband had Tuna steak that was a more than generous portion. I had fresh fish and asparagus. Probably the best fish I have had in my life! Wonderful white wine, Prosseco and Pasko! Thanks Mario, you are the best!

We were visiting Dubrovnik and happened to come across this amazing restaurant. There were only 3 of us and only had to wait for 5 minutes for a table. Very attentive waiters/waitresses, polite and respectful. The food was amazing. Menu was very generous as we had a vegetarian and a pescatarian within our company. We spent a wonderful few hours here, once seated no rush to leave, a pleasant relaxing evening meal. We actually went back a few times, definitely our favourite restaurant. Enjoy

We were dining as a group of 8 with 4 children. The order was served to the whole group at the same time by two waiters carrying 8 plates - this was remarkable. Everyone was satisifed with their order, which is also a rare phenomenon. 
We can definitely recommend their pizza, excellent wild garlic pasta, chicken tagliatelle served with fantastic sauce and spaghetti bolognese. Tap water is served for no charge (many other places either charge or do not offer).

My family and I had dinner in this restaurant last Sunday. The food was very good, the view was beautiful and the service was quick and professional. I would recommend it especially after a long tour in the old town!

Great service and food overlooking beautiful views. Price was okay, better than most restaurants inside the city walls. Pizzas were huge and salads were good portion size, plus bread basket was provided which was a nice touch. Would recommend.
Beautiful setting (book in advance and ask to be on the terrace!). Lovely ambience, attentive and friendly service, great food. Definitely recommend. Was perfect for our last evening in Dubrovnik.

This is the third fine dining restaurant we have been to and it is nothing short of amazing. The food is exquisite and worth the price, so make sure you pick this as one of your places to dine. Fresh seafood served, the prawns were like they were taken straight out of the sea, cooked and served. The dish were had (king prawn Dubrovnik style) had flavour and was beautiful. The staff were very attentive and very delightful. On top of that they are extremely helpful and quick. The restaurant contained quaint music and created a very serene atmosphere. This was only enhanced by the idyllic view. Thank you guys for making our first year anniversary amazing.

We - family of 4 - visited the restaurant in July 2019. We had an excellent experience. The food was great, the service was great and the prices are reasonable. We can recommend to visit whenever you are in Dubrovnik.

I ate here 3 times for breakfast and twice for dinner. Can't complain about the food, view or the prices. It does get crowded in the evenings early as it is just outside of Pile Gate so for groups greater than 4, might want go get there early or a reservation. The Sea Bass was great and the waiter even recommended a local wine to compliment the meal which hit the spot.

We ate here tonight for my daughters birthday . I reserved a table overlooking the walls, fabulous. The food and drinks were excellent , the service top notch, in particular our waitress was great, couldn’t be better. The staff brought out a dessert with a huge sparkler in it and sang happy birthday to my daughter. This is my 3rd visit to this restaurant and I shall return, highly recommend you visit here whilst in Dubrovnik. Thanks for a great time

Located at a premium spot , near the bus station and the main gate to Old Town Dubrovnik . 
The two of us only had a yummy ice cream here. We have just arrived to Dubrovnik and not having the local Kuna, they did agree to accept our credit card , Nice gesture , good friendly service .There's a line - but it goes fast .
Pay attention to the interesting tree in front of the shop .

On a warm July evening this restaurant has one of the best views in town. You can watch the kayaks entering the bay and enjoy the view of swallows sweeping beyond Old Town walls.

I make a booking months prior to our visit and the exact table I requested was reserved for us. The wine recommended by our charming waiter was very good.

My husband ordered the prawns done the traditional way in tomato sauce and it was nothing spectacular. Our meal was just average but maybe we just did not order the best items on the menu.

The setting and service was great and I would recommend visiting this restaurant.

I would also recommend using mosquito repellant if you are dining at dawn/sunset.

We received a 10% discount voucher for our next meal.

We all had a pleasurable lunch here today.
Very friendly staff, smartly dressed and attentive.
Theres a good atmosphere and buzz to the place with stunning views towards the walls and coastline. We had a table in a great position.
The food was good and presented well. I really enjoyed the feta on the salad, very soft and creamy. We all really ordered food that was listed under starters on the menu, but the portions were good and we'd all had enough to eat.
Thanks Mario.

Firstly, I was surprised with the professionalism of the staff. Everyone was extremely kind and we had a great service.
Secondly, all the plates (we were a group of 6) were clean and tasty.
Thirdly, the location is beautiful cause of the Lovrijenac fortress and part of the old city's walls views.
The prices are a bit high but in normal frames. You could eat more expensive inside the walls.
The restaurant does not accept reservations.
P.S.: We learned that the owners are the same with panorama's.
We stopped here for breakfast before visiting the old town. We took breakfast set which included bread with jams etc, omelette, really good fruit salad, hot drink and juice. Good price quality ratio!

Located in a big terrace overlooking the walls, it is setup In a very big terraces, with some tables inside as well. Had dinner so we managed to get a table in the terrace; service is fast and courteous, menu has an assortment of Italian and local dishes. Beef carpaccio and cáptese were very good, pastas and lasagna were what we expected. Reasonably priced, fast service, good food.

We visited this restaurant after visiting the bay below (as it is one of the places where Game of Thrones was filmed). We were given a table near the wall so you could see the bay below. I ordered a feta cheese salad and my husband ordered a grilled chicken fillet with bacon and a choice of a side. The food was beautiful. The service was friendly and professional. We were also given a 10% voucher to use in their restaurant or their sister restaurants (Restaurant & Bar Panorama and Gradska Kavana Arsenal Restaurant - best steak ever!). We went back the next day and the food was just as nice as before. Worth a visit!

The location is beautiful overlooking the sea and city walls. There's a good choice of seating both inside and out, with the inside area being more shady and cooler but also more like a terrace. The area was spotlessly clean and there were many waiters. Service was speedy and polite. I had the local sparkling rose and my partner a beer, but after tasting my fruity wine also opted for a glass. 

We both ordered tuna salad, after trying this previously at the panorama restaurant at the top of the mount by the cable car. It was no comparison at all and had very little tuna; when I mentioned this to the waiter he simply shrugged and smiled. The tuna didnt feel fresh, more flaked like you would find in a tin. It was mostly lettuce leaves all of the same type, with limited cherry tomatoes and a spray of olives. There was also a bread basket with six slices two of which were polenta, on the side and a ceaser sauce which had little taste. This was a stark difference to the tuna salad we had at the panorama and the relationship in the sister restaurant held no unison with regard to the quality of food on offer. The price which was at the higher end however, still did.
We had a 10% discount card provided after our meal at the Panorama but this didn't take the sting from our whole meal experience.
Fabulous selection of food, which was very tasty, very prompt service Lovely location over looking old town and sea.

The only restaurant in Dubrovnik we really enjoyed. We were a little dubious given our experience in Dubrovnik with eating so far & it's location I wasn't sure if it wouldn't have to try hard to be full. However we were delighted. 
Attentive staff, nice house litre of wine reasonably priced. 
We had an octopus salad, mozzarella pizza which was very large and mixed fish platter. All beautifully presented and delicious. 
My son also had a very delicious chocolate moose dessert. 

Very tasty meal, don't be put off by it's location, we would certainly return.

Friendy staff. Fish (traut) was grilled whole but waiter offered to clean it for me (took tail, bones etc out.) My husband took mixed meat. Perfect. I honestly don't remember when I have eaten so good food.

Staff where friendly and professional. Food was amazing. There was a wait for a table I would recommend making a booking if not we just had a short 10 minute wait the staff handle very well adding people to the list and calling you as table becomes available. Well worth the wait for the best food with the best view.

Amazing location and amazing food.
Had Garlic noodles and honestly was the best vegetarian dish I had tried in Croatia. Such amazing flavours. We totally went on the staff's recommendation for their signature cocktails and were quite pleased.
Marijo, who attended us was fun and helpful
Thanks for a lively memory!
Loved this place, I had a lovely dinner with a nice wine overlooking the wall and the sea. Prices were a little bit more expensive but you got what you paid for here!

The food is okey, we had fish. Served only half a potato and a mix of soft and bland vegetables. Great view, but the pidgeons where annoying. The Staff was serviceminded. Big glasses of White wine to a good price.

The pizzas are lovely and the breakfast deals are really good. The view is amazing and the prices are more reasonable than in the old town plus they give you a 10% discount card to use for your future visits which comes in handy
A bit of a wait if you haven’t ordered in advance, but absolutely worth it. Great food (mussels recommended), great view and great service.
Had breakfast here ! Reasonable price and have the nicest view of old town ! Friendly staff and food is ok ..

The restaurant sits rights outside the Pile Gate, with views of the Old City walls. It was recommended by our apartment host. The place is pretty large, with an open terrace and a covered terrace in addition to the inside dining room. We sat on the covered terrace. Nice team service. Excellent fish soup, a lot of other good choices on the large menu.

Very goood restaurant at entrance of old town. Amazing service,beautiful view at sea and buildings. 
Very tasty food.

Went here in the middle of the turist season. Even though a full resturant it was amazing! Great views, service and food. Everyone in my company was very satisfierad, we tasted pasta, carpaccio, octopus and prawns, everything was great!

Fantastic view, beautifull location. And you do pay for location. 

Service can be a bit slow when restaurant busy. But on a location like this you should take your time. 

Serve anything from breakfast to dinner. From pizzas to who knows what. So food is ok - but just ok.

Enjoyed a breakfast at this amazing spot last week! Booked ahead of time because I knew it was popular, but breakfast at 08h30 in the middle of summer was blissfully quiet! The communication and confirmation ahead of time was great, and the food was ok...nothing fancy, and the breakfast menu quite limited, but well priced and the view made up for anything missing on the menu. Would imagine it would be stunning in the evening as well, but a lot busier for sure! Would recommend.
Had an entrecôte. AMAZING. No doubt, the best i’ve ever had. I’m here with seven others and everyone walked very satisfied out of here.

We stopped to enjoy a drink with the view at the end of the day but stayed and had something to eat.....and dessert.

The wine was amazing and the view equally so. We did not want to leave so we stayed and had some small plates for dinner. Then dessert which was a hazelnut chocolate cake. It was also really good.

I would recommend if you are not expecting an amazing dining experience, but rather want to enjoy the ambiance of the Old Town.

We visited here three times and all meals were of a great quality and reasonably priced. The staff were both efficient, professional and friendly. The tables outside have a lovely view of the walls and Pile Gate, it was also nice to watch all the swallows flying around.
It is a nice restaurant with great views and a great service. Very friendly staff and very kind. It is not cheap(dinner for 2 around 450KN) but its worthed
My family and I enjoyed a delicious breakfast while enjoy a great view. It is a convenient location to eat at prior to going on the kayak trip

This was one of our best meals in Dubrovnik. The steak was so soft and tender it just melted in your mouth. My partner had the homemade apple pie, which was not a pie in the traditional’ sense, however was declared one of the best apple pie/pudding/cakes he’d had in ages. 

Service was great, lots of staff and all very attentive and didn’t try to rush you out, even though they were clearly very busy. In addition the view of the city walls made for a wonderful view at sunset.

What a wonderful experience!! We had a reservation at this amazing restaurant. Its best to have a reservation as the queue was quiet long.
It was amazing. View was breathtaking, food delicious. We had fish and vegetables and apple pie.My partner had couple of cocktails which he said were very good. I had red wine, also very good. Staff was very polite, friendly and very attentive and welcoming. It’s a bit pricey there but it’s worth it. You won’t be disappointed! Great place to eat and enjoy the beautiful sea views.

Reserved this restaurant for lunch when meeting up with family. The food and service were excellent and I was particularly impressed that though the restaurant was very busy we were not at all rushed and were able to have a very relaxed meal. There is a lovely view of city walls, fort and the sea in between.

We ate at this restaurant multiple times. And each meal was good. 

Located just outside the Pile gate to the old city the restaurant is open aired. Part of it overlooks the walls of the old town, parts overlook the sea and other parts face the fountain which is great for people watching 

Service is fast and friendly. We had the breakfast on one visit - a good selection. On another we had lunch. We tried the seafood and vegetarian risotto - both very good with good flavouring and taste. We also tried some tuna steak and vegetarian lasagne - again both good dishes. 

Fairly pricey but I guess you are paying for the location and proximity to the old town. Nevertheless better than some places in the old town where we paid close to 7£ for a bottle of coke. 

Would definitely come back

Looked really busy and was not expecting much. Disappointed than no sea view tables available but the view we had of the old town was nice. Looked like a factory restaurant with more covers than I have seen for sometime but we had personal and excellent service. My prawns had a fabulous sauce. They were over cooked though. Everything else was excellent and would go back.

We came here for some cocktails upon arriving in Dubrovnik. The views, the staff and the blankets were all fantastic. It was cosy and beautiful, relaxed but professional making it a really lovely start to our evening. At the end, they accepted our Dubrovnik card discount and handed us a discount card for 3 restaurants including their own. Located just outside the walls, the prices were cheaper and the views were better so we decided to head back a second time for dinner the next day. The pizzas and pastas were lovely and as usual the staff were very friendly too. The background piano music with a gentle buzz of people added to a great dining experience.

餐點普通，不會到好吃或難吃，但是靠海的位置可以有很好的view。用餐環境很方便，就在君臨城門旁，不過如果要特地去吃倒是真的不必要。
The view is really good. The meals are normal. It locates just at the corner of the gate of Kingslanding.

We walked the city walls. It is quite an ordeal in the hot sun and when we finished we were glad to sit down in Restaurant Dubravka to be given a bit of tlc! And we were. They were on the cusp of finishing their breakfast service but made little of including us. It was a great breakfast with an omelette, lots of interesting breads and preserves, fruit salad, orange juice and much needed coffee.
Our waitress was a lovely kind woman who discretely cleaned up and replaced a glass of orange juice we spilled and made as little fuss about it as it was possible to make.
Elegant restaurant with a homely and friendly feel. Oh yes and waiters who smiled and seemed happy in their work. A joy of a place.

Went a few times for breakfast during our stay, really enjoyed it. More reasonable than some other places inside city walls. The view from restaurant is amazing and staff are all very friendly. Drinks and dinner are also very good.

This isn’t the usual kind of place that I would normally select to eat, being in the midst of a very touristy square. We enjoyed a very good lunch here shaded under the umbrellas, water and wall views and a good outlook onto the very busy adjacent square. The pizzas were very good, tasty salad and I really enjoyed the truffle ravioli. Service was very good. My only criticism is that the soft drink sizes are too small at just 250ml.

We went a couple of times for breakfast on our holiday in dubrovnik. The staff are really friendly and the breakfast was tasty. They have a set menu, which is a lot of food but it’s good value, about £10 to include a hot drink, orange juice, fruit, bread and then other options like an omelette or croissant with ham and cheese. The restaurant looks over the sea and is really convenient for the old town.

Great food, great staff, great view.

Cannot fault this place, the service, the ambience and staff are all spot on. Prices are pretty reasonable too considering the location and the portions are generous.

Would highly recommend.

Great breakfast and lunch, although quite pricey..you can get a card which gives you 10% off which helps.
.staff very friendly. Good central location.
We were lucky enough to get a table by the railing just before sunset... it was perfection. The service was phenomenal and the food was amazing too. Would highly recommend to everyone!

Just outside the pile gate in a small plaza area. Huge great patio for outdoor seating.

Good service and food. Shrimp risotto was quite good, caesar with chicken good, fish for my main passable.
Friendly service. Part of a proud restaurant chain too.
Lovely location just outside the entrance to the Old Town. Wonderful staff and excellent choice of food and drinks

Just the ticket for mid morning drink refreshment, with lovely views of the sea and walls, after an early bird tour of the city.
Visited the sister restaurant ‘Gradska kavana Arsenal’ last night. Lovely food and attentive service there too.

the hostess and the our server mario & ivan were so nice! he even placed us beside the wall once someone got up so we had a better table with a view. i ordered a steak with hash browns & the mustard & gin sauce on the side (no pic cause i couldn’t wait to eat it). the hash browns were so yummy and the sauce is really the reason why i will be coming back. the meat from the steak was nice and overall the dinner was very pleasing. my sister got calamari and she said they were very delicious, soft & fresh. mario recommended warm apple pie with vanilla ice cream which normally i’m not a big apple pie fan but it was so delicious! for the entire dinner all i kept saying was “omg this is soooo good” the food & the service will really put you in a fantastic mood. the experience was excellent. 100/10 would recommend!

The views from this restaurant are amazing. Acompanied by a great service and friendly staff made it well worth it. We ordered two 'seemingly vegan' noodles which actually came with a milk cream. After mentioning they kindly brough us two good spagetti's with tomato sauce instead. Excellent service! Food was fine not too amazing.

Good to know you get a 10% discount with a Dubrovnik Card

Despite us being in a hurry, the waiter made sure we were able to eat something. Had a great lasagna for lunch! The location and the view are amazing. 

Thank you for providing us with such a quick and tasty lunch!

Very disorganized place so you should feel lucky if you get your food. We left the place without eating because they ”lost” our order and they didn’t tell us about this until we asked in about an hour. They aren’t professional about the business they are running and don’t have the basic decency to inform their customers since they don’t seem to be aware of what they are doing due to having too many customers and losing few wouldn’t hurt their business. Unfortunately there is no 0 star so 1 has to do but anyone reads this should take it as 0 stars. After all, this is a restaurant and serving food is what you would expect.

We stopped here for a snack between tours. The crowds over here are nuts but Dubravka was a good reprieve. You only see a bit of the sea, but you do sit outside right by the walls of the city so it’s still a pretty cool view for a few beers and a snack. The pizza was good. The fries were excellent. It was easy to find the servers when we needed one. It isn’t gourmet or anything, but it was just what we needed to chill for a bit and regroup.

We stopped here without a reservation and was lucky to be seated quickly. The views of part of the city walls and the Fort were amazing. The food was very tasty and the staff were friendly. It was the same price as the rest of Dubrovnik really. The portion size wasn't the biggest but definitely enough and was all cooked very nice.

We came here to Dubrovnik for a nice seafood dinner and we got it this is a nice seafood dinner with a lot of choices. Our server's name was Draźen and he is amazing handling confusing orders and there desserts are awesome just to die for. Amazing restaurant 
Ammmmaaaaaaazzzzzzzzzziiiiiiinnnnnggg.
Relaxed restaurant with a large outdoor terrace facing the city walls and ocean. Enjoy the views! It’s a great place to unwind before or after a grueling day of tourism

This is too crowded place for a nice dinner.
Food was 2 stars from five.

It is so much better for just a coffe with a good views.

Skip this.
The location is great close to all the activities.Very nice restaurant, tasty meals and excellent ice cream.Great customer service provided by the staff.

Excellent food and service at a relatively good price.Whether you like fish or meat does not matter as they are BOTH excellently catered for. The location overlooking Dubrovnik harbour is exceptional. So good you will need to book in advance as this is one of the most popular restaurants in Dubrovnik.

We came here for breakfast on our last morning before catching the bus to the ferry. The staff stored our luggage in the corner for us and were very friendly. 
The breakfast was delicious, generous portions and very reasonable. We both had the omelette option, which came with bread, jams, fruit salad, orange juice and tea/coffee. 72k
If we had found this early we would have come every day, far better than what we found inside the city.
Great views too!
This restaurant is also very beautiful but again the beauty of nature is over dinner. Food is more than wonderful for every honorable chef all praise. Looking at the screen.

I should preface this review by stating that everything in Dubrovnik is overpriced. This restaurant is no different. However, the food is reasonable and the service was good. We ordered the seafood risotto and the fish platter. Risotto was delicious - highly recommend. The platter was so-so - everything was cooked well but wasn't very generous and I had hoped for more local seafood (we were given a salmon fillet and pretty sure no salmon swim around here...). The view from this restaurant is stunning, so I'd recommend going for a drink, and only eat if you had very limited other options.

After visiting it’s sister restaurant (Panaroma) we tried this restaurant. The food was wonderful and it’s a wonderful atmosphere. Although we had some issues with the service (waiter split a whole beer down the birthday girl) they did everything they could to make our evening enjoyable.

Be aware, if you want to book this restaurant needs to be quick and before 2pm on the day. We didn't had a booking and we took a chance to walk in. We were very well hosted and they had a table for us within 5min. We were served by Jasmin, he has a great humor and made us feel really welcome. Food was great, we had the seafood risotto and veal with grilled vegetables and croquette potato. More than enough, good portions. We had the house white wine and we're surprised with the pouring amount.😀 Reasonable price. Really enjoyed and it was recommended by our hoste from Apart. Rebecca.

Thank you Chef!!

Booked & said we were coming for birthday celebration. Unfortunately nobody told waiter. We were given a lovely table on the terrace next to the wall though. 
Had a lovely meal, asked for wild garlic noodles & ended up eith wild garlic tagliatelle. It was lovely but when i asked where the noodles were i was told that in dubrovnik tagliatelle is noodles ! Seems weird that they had both on the menu !
Anyway the meal was lovely & the waiter chilled as we chatted. All the waittresses were smiley & friendly. 
It was lovely & i would ho back again.

Our family ate here twice whilst on holiday - great attentive service from all the staff - we had a toddler with us and staff made a fuss of her getting her a balloon etc - Food is very good -we were all 7 happy with our dishes and would definitely recommend - great view - we hadn’t booked either times but it is a very busy restaurant -we were just lucky

This restaurant terrace has great view on city wall and Lovrijenec fort. Best is to book table few days beforehand to get good table. Service is very good and food quality excellent. Prices are realistic and athmosphere is casul.

A local recommended Dubravka 1836 for dinner. Our party of 6 enjoyed a lovely, seaside dinner. Attentive service. We all cleared our plates! Items tried were pasta with salmon, prawns in ink squid pasta, pizza, and lamb. We enjoyed it so much, we came back for breakfast the next morning and were just as satisfied! We are here for a week, and I'm sure we'll be back.

Dubravka was close to our house and as such the closest option. We feared that given its location and amazing view, it would turn out to be a tourist trap but we were pleasantly surprised when it was not! The first time we went for a late lunch (around 4 pm) and tried the mussels and a mix fish plate and the octopus salad. All were amazing the beer was cold :) The second time we went with another couple for dinner (including a vegetarian) and the quality of service and food was again very high. On our last day we went for breakfast. One of us chose the omelette option and the other the eggs with cheese. Both options were tasty. Prices are as expected for Dubrovnik standards.
The most picturesque setting for dinner. A wonderful waiter who helped us pick the right wine to accompany the excellent tuna. Great experience.

Final dinner in Dubrovnik and based on location and rating, I decided to try Dubravka 1836.

It didn’t disappoint. Had the veal medallions with chanterelle sauce and it was very good.

Location and service were also very good
Very good service, very good and quality food but litlle bit high prices. Recommend if you would spend some more extra money
Combination of fantastic views, service and food! Marko was the best!! :-) We had the veggie Risotto, Hawaiian pizza and Spaghetti Bolognese!

I would say its worth getting table by wall facing water.I thought portions were small I had the squid (lignje na zaru)there were like 4 squid on my plate.My girlfriend had the seafood rissoto which was nice.We ordered bottle of kutljevo grasevina which I would highly recomend.

Great spot and good food. Extensive menu. You need to book to be sure of a table. Ask for one by the sea wall, so you’ll have unbroken views of the old town walls and out to sea. Service efficient and good.
Enjoyed a breakfast and late dinner at this location. Food and service were good with an excellent view. In often over priced Dubrovnik this is a solid find.

We had read that this restaurant was good and despite being so close to Pile gate it was not a tourist trap and it definitely lived up to its name.
Excellent service from very professional staff both front of house and waiters.
Excellent choice of food and drink at reasonable prices!
Also beautiful toilets !! 
Oh and a great location overlooking the old city walls and fort!
What more could you want.
Definitely recommend

.....enough that we went back 2 more times! Marija was certain to take good care of us. We visited for breakfast one day, lunch another day, and then dinner. All meals exceeded our expectations. The views are simply incredible, since it is right next to where the walls are. What a place to take photographs, too! Prices are very reasonable.

So glad we chose here to have dinner whilst staying in Dubrovnik. The restaurant was really busy and other people were waiting for a table, but we were seated within 5 minutes. Perhaps we were lucky as there was only 2 of us. 
We ordered a pizza each (Four Cheese & Ham & Pineapple), which were delicious, and two beers to accompany our meal. 
The staff were really attentive and provided a quick service. We were even offered a discount card if we were to visit again. Unfortunately we did not get the chance, but it was a very nice gesture. Would definitely recommend.

One of the best venues in town, offering good food and outstanding service skills at a fair price.
Open till late

Had the loviest meal at this restaurant, thrilled we chose it. We had a reservation - I’d recommend making one for a view table for sunset. Food, service, view was amazing and made for a memorable meal!

We were walk-ins but still got a seat near the walls at 7pm. The waiter was lovely and didn’t rush us. King prawns grilled were delicious and the creme caramel was a sweet finish. Not nearly as expensive as some of the mediocre meals we’ve had elsewhere. Highly recommended.

Great food that is beautifully presented and value for money. Very busy so best to reserve if you don’t want to wait. We reserved a water view seat and so special when dark and music playing. They gave us a 10% discount card and said keep it when we went back. We had 3 meals at night plus a morning coffee. Did not disappoint on any visit. Same great standard each time.

As far as touristy restaurants go this was pretty good Ambrosial location ! Plus the local rib eye steak with Swiss Chard was a standout dish with three of four of our party ordering and heartily endorsing. Service was friendly and sitting on the terrace looking at the ocean and 14th century walls with swallows flying around was about as good as it gets !

This was one of the best restaurants we went to on our trip. Great view, request a seat on the deck! We had the Prawns of Dubrovnik and the Seafood Tagliatelle. We went a second night and got other dishes but these were the best. Our kids loved the meals as well. Service was great. Just all around best place to go with a view! (We ate our dinner took quickly to get photos. That is how good it was. We completely forgot to get photos)

This is a lovely restaurant that is reasonably priced at about 180kn a main. The view is lovely and there was love music and excellent table service. Our waiter was excellent and ensured our drinks were topped up and regularly checked in on us. 
The food looked nice I had the John Dory and my wife had the prawns and black ink spaghetti. It was tasty but not amazing. 

The overall experience was enjoyable and the 1L of wine for 120kn was well worth it!

It is also just out side the Western gate of the city so is well placed, but this means every man and his dog is taking photos next to you. We didn't mind this too much as we like people watching. 

The only thing preventing this being 5* is the food didn't blow me away. It was good, but I've very good food I'm Croatia.

All was excellent as we were in a hurry.
Coffee and croissant was excellent
Orange juice was freshly squeezed 
Service was very good
Beautiful view

Came here once for lunch and twice for dinner. Got a lovely table overlooking the sea and city walls. Prices not expensive for the area and the menu is extensive. 10% discount for repeat visits with their discount card.

Its a friendly restaurant overlooking the front of the walls just outside Pile Gate. Polite & prompt service in smart surroundings. Nice food at reasonable prices. Always busy, but you can go just for a drink. Worth a visit.
We came for a birthday and Ivan made our meal very special- give him a raise ;) food was lovely and the musicians were great! Had the loveliest meal, thanks again.

The location is very lovely - we sat on the outdoor plaza area - and the servers spoke excellent english and the service was very good. We felt that the food was just mediocre, however. Nothing was particularly good or memorable.

We went here twice for lunch which was very good. We had the feta salad and a small beer. The menu is extensive with lots of options. There is also a great view of the city wall if you are a couple and get a table by the sea wall. not expensive but not just cheap eats.

We just wanted something to drink at first but the service was so good we decided to stay for dinner. Best decision - great food, great wine and fantastic service. O yes and the live music just put the cherry on the cake. Thank you
Lovely sea view, food was delicious and not over priced for where it is located. Service was great, waiting staff were very friendly.

My mother and I absolutely love this place. From the charming waiters, to the great view, to the delicious food and Croatian wines, it doesn't put a foot wrong. There is even live light jazz music playing in the background and it all makes for a perfect evening. Plenty of other people think the same, as it is packed every night. Look out for the waitor who looks like Michael Mackintyre!

This restaurant was recommended to us and lived up to it. As we hadn't booked we didn't manage to get a table overlooking the bay at this popular restaurant, but that didn't diminish our enjoyment of the meal and accompanying drink, as well as the complimentary staff service 😀
We came here for our last dinner and thoroughly enjoyed the food, the view and live music. We ordered seafood dishes and I like the risotto in particular.

We had mussels here and they were some of the best we've ever had! Great mussels, great fries and a wonderful view! The price considering the location and quality of the food was very very reasonable. The staff were also lovely.

The best location. Come at sunset. We travelled as 2 and didn’t book. Great food at reasonable price - pizza / pasta - great standard. 

We also came for breakfast one day, which was good too. A really good venue for evening meal in Dubrovnik

Had a lovely pasta dish here, service was good and friendly and reasonable prices. 
Very busy and had a mice atmosphere, tables for two a little too close for us, you couldn't really help but hear other people's conversations right next to you, so presumed they could hear ours too, we are quite private people and would have preferred more space, we didn't have any other options on the night as think we got their last table as we didn't book. Maybe you can ask for a more private table if you are happy to wait and or if you book in advance.

We arrived and unfortunately there were no seats outside so they sat us on the inside bit however our waitress came over 10 minutes later and moved us to a table outside which was lovely. The food was amazing and the service was excellent. Warning though the mojitos are strong!

My wife and I went here to celebrate my 30th birthday during our visit to Dubrovnik and everything about here was excellent. The food was delicious, the view was breathtaking, and the service was top notch! They even went above and beyond for my birthday as they not only provided a free dessert but also took the time to write "Happy 30th Birthday" in chocolate. I would highly advise eating at this restaurant!

As a solo traveller, you get used to being offered a table out of the way, not so here. This restaurant had excellent customer service, great staff, great food, good prices and an awesome location- it doesn’t get much better. If you buy a Dubrovnik card, you’ll also get a 10% discount. Try the seafood- it’s amazing

A slightly nicer spot just outside the city walls, on your way to the fort, Dubravka is part of a larger restaurant group. We went for dinner, arrived at sunset and sat out on the beautiful patio. The view is amazing, you really feel like you're on the Dalmatian Coast at this place. We had the lasagne bolognese and it was so fresh...my mouth is watering remembering it as I write this. The pasta basically melted in my mouth. We also shared a Four Sorts of Cheese pizza, it's covered in tomatoes, four sorts of cheese, oregano and olives. The crust was nice and crunchy and the cheeses were melted to perfection.
We went here twice. Nice food and nice view. Highly recommended. Seafood risotto was really good!!! Menu with lots of choices: from breakfast dishes to pasta, salads, meat, fish...

Was our first day in Dubrovnik, we had late lunch without a reservation was perfect, very good service, waitress very attentive, the Seafood Rissoto so delicious, the local wine soo good, we paid for 2 people Kn 370, good price, the view is amazing, the manager approach us to say hello and ask if everything was ok which is a very good point for that kind of business, on the following morning we had just a coffee there and service still very good, all the staff is very friendly. Highly recommend it.

Everyone here was so nice! It was crowded and glad we made reservation ahead of time. We had so much fun here. Unfortunately, we eat and drink in our hotel before to restaurant, so we did not taste much dishes.

After going to it’s sister restaurant, the Gradska Kavana Arsenal on the old port a few days back, we decided to try Dubravka. My first note was that it was very busy, granted this is in part to its location however the food is worth the queue to be seated. I highly recommend the ravioli starter with truffles and ham, this was fantastic. Service was great and friendly. Throughly recommend.

My wife and I ordered a chicken fillet + grilled king prawns. Both tasted fantastic, unfortunately a couple of things went wrong with the meal. However, Josip the on duty manager provided us with complimentary ice creams that were also fantastic! Our waiter Branka was also very helpful. Highly recommend this restaurant which is situated in a nice location as well. I hardly write reviews but this is something that was worth mentioning.

Enjoyed a fantastic night at this lovely restaurant for my sister in law Phil’s birthday. Ivan was our excellent waiter and made us feel very welcome. Food and location were brilliant, we would highly recommend a visit. Make sure you book a table first just in case. We sat under the canopy and listened to the live musicians who played beautifully. The fish mix was excellent, as was the lasagne. We would also recommend the steak.

Me and my two friends visited this restaurant in May 2019. I had also visited with my boyfriend in June 2017. 

Location - This restaurant is located right on the Pile gate, so right in the centre of everything that is going on and super easy to find. This area is busy as it's where tours meet and things like that BUT mostly due to the amazing view. You can be seated right on the edge which looks out to the beautiful blue sea and buildings of Dubrovnik. 

Food - We came for breakfast one morning and couldn't have asked for more, plenty to choose from and plenty of food turned up once ordered. My friend ordered an omelette and we also got a lot of bread, spreads and fruit! We loved it that much, we came back for dinner and I had Spaghetti Bolognese. I can honestly say it was the best spaghetti I've ever had - really really tasty! I also had apple pie for dessert, again just amazing. My friends also said their meals were incredible. 

Staff - All staff were really friendly and helpful, no issues whatsoever. 

Other - When we visited, the weather wasn't the best, but on each chair was a red blanket, super cosy and just a really nice touch. There is a large outside seating area, but the inside is just as beautiful. Considering the location, the view and quality of the food, it was really reasonably priced!

Overall, I would definitely recommend this to anyone for any time of the day and I would love to return!
Spectacular venue, wonderful views, great service and delicious food. I was in Dubrovnik for 3 days and ate here 3 times!
Great food, the tuna steak was amazing. Lovely setting just outside the city walls. Lovely outside seating area. Great service.

Great spot with clear views of the walls, sea and Fort.

We did wait an age for our pizza and thankfully it was very good. However, if a pizza lists olives as one of four toppings I do expect more than three!

The staff are full of Slavic charm, ie frosty!

We stopped for a late lunch. We had a great seat but it started to rain. Our server, Brako, immediately offered us a new seat under an umbrella. We shared the Weiner Schnitzel; it was excellent. Then our server introduced us to a fabulous after lunch drink with Prosecco, vodka, and lemon sherbet. Delicious!!

One of the oldest restaurant in Dubrovnik, it has one of the best views that you can have with your meals. Ideal for lunch and evening drinks when you see most stunning view of Dubrovnik coast.
Staff is very friendly and helpful. Food is good although not excellent. Some cocktails are worth trying.
Free WiFi is available.
Outdoor sitting is recommended.

Nice food and good service, attentive staff. Very touristy as its in a very good position with nice views and central. Fairly expensive but the restaurant offer 10% voucher card to those who return for the second/third time. Pizza was nice!

Wonderful meal last night for my mothers birthday! Great selection of food, pizza, pasta, steak, seafood! The seared tuna was incredible. 
Wonderful service & they really made it a special birthday meal!

This place has a great view and they capitalize on that. Although service was fast and friendly, it can't make up for poor food. The chicken on my salad was bland and rubbery. The bread was so dry it was probably the morning's left over toast. The fries tasted like they had been previously frozen and the veal schnitzel was average. 
Our waitress was helpful and very pleasant, especially considering the idiotic pigeon-feeding tourists that they have to tolerate at this place. The wine she recommended was also a good selection. She is the reason that I am not rating this a 2/5. Go for the view and set your expectations low if you're hungry.

We had a lovely dinner here. The weather was rainy but they gave us blankets and we were under cover (still able to sit outside). 
The views are lovely - even in the rain. The food was great and the service was amazing. 
We had a very friendly waiter who spoke excellent English and engaged in conversation with us. 
The truffle ravioli with ham was delicious and thoroughly recommended.

Arrived here for lunch. We were promptly seated. We were a hungry party of four. We waited about 10 minutes for the waiter to come to our table. I told him that we were ready to order and then asked for the wifi password. He answered " What do you want first? order or wifi?". Luckily, it was the end of his shift so he introduced us to his replacement a nicer lady. I told her that the password given was not working and added if it had a lower or upper case. 
She replied " Lower case, upper case, I don't know. Try both." Eventually the password worked. 

We never got a receipt for the food. It was 2 separate bills so she split the check but did not give us the bill. Prices were affordable about $30 per plate. 

Now to the food, it was good. My trout came with the bones and it was delicious. It was a cold day. All the tables had blankets. The restaurant has a nice view of Fort Lovrijenac. 

All in all:
Food: good
Views: Great
Price: Acceptable.
Service: Poor.

We came across this restaurant on our first night and ate their every evening. Our waiter was amazing, had advised us on the local wines and totally spoiled us during our entire stay. The ravioli with smoked ham and truffles was outstanding!
Great Pizzas and delivery quite fast. Good location after walking in old city. Outside the wall but superb view to the sea and ancient wall.

We went to Dubravka for lunch when we arrived in Dubrovnik. The restaurant is located right outside the Pile gate, so the location is pretty much perfect and as the restaurant is quite large it is easy to get a table. Big plus for location and availability. Basically this is an average restaurant for tourists (ie. tourist trap) who are not very picky about their food. 

I´m always sceptical of restaurants that have examples of the dessert menu in a glass container. Good restaurants do not usually do this, but Dubravka does. So the expectations for the food were not very high. 

We ordered the veal fillet with french fries and vegetables. The veal was pretty much tasteless, but quite juicy and the herb butter on top was good. The french fries were soft and did not taste anything and was quite disappointing. The vegetables were just okay. The view was definitely the best part of the experience and not the food. There are so many restaurants in old town Dubrovnik with more charm and way better food - although the view cannot be beaten. 

Would not go there again unless I was in a rush and would not recommend this restaurant to anyone but those wanting to have little time and just want to eat and move on.

Went 2 out of the 3 nights in Dubrovnik. Immediately outside the old city walls, so well positioned.We couldn't fault the food. It was excellent. Service was efficient and friendly.
One night was cold and windy, and they were able to block out the weather, even in the terraced part, so it was warm and pleasant despite the weather. If you go a second time you get a 10% discount

Great location overlooking the old town walls and seascape. Seafood risotto was delicious. Service really good offering blankets and cushions to guests when the temperature drops. Really pleasant experience throughout.
Great value for breakfast. Nice way to start the day with fresh fruit and bread. Decent service and a really nice patio.
Enjoyed lunch here on my final day in Dubrovnik. Great views from the terrace. Service was excellent and the food very good.
We visit this restaurant for lunch and we were amazed by their food and hospitality.Atmosphere is very nice .Highly recommended to visit 🙂

Ravioli with truffle will absolutely trickle your taste buds.

Service is very professional yet friendly. If you can try to speak a bit of Croatian that definitely helps i.e. greetings, thank you etc.

I went back the day after to do a take away for the Ravioli - they don't usually do takeaways but were kind enough to me.

And, oh yes, the view!

Lovely very plentiful breakfast. Staff great and great views. Gift shop and ice cream parlour on site, also good and marginally cheaper than inside the old town. (this is literally just outside pile gate and great for tourist info which is just a cross the square)

Came here for an evening meal (had the dalmatian prosciutto followed by the mixed seafood platter) and while I could wax lyrical about the food it is the service here which really shone. My waiter could not have been more attentive and the staff are all very conscientious and polite. 5 stars!
By Pile Gate, Great for Breakfast, Lunch or Dinner, or just a drink, Its great for people watching as it is also where people gather to take photos of one of the castles

Booked a table at this restaurant for my husbands 60th birthday. We originally booked a table outside for the lovely view but due to the weather we decided to move in the covered area outside. Lovely and warm and sheltered from the element! The food was beautiful and we all had clean plates at the end. Brilliant service with very pleasant and cheerful staff. Also very reasonably priced which included a carafe of house red as well as a couple of beers and coffees. As it was my husband's birthday the restaurant surprised him with a large slice of dubrovnik cake that we all managed to have a sample of! As we had previously eaten at the Panorama restaurant (at the top of the mountain by the cable car) we had a discount card which we used too. The restaurant had some live music which provided a nice background noise. Blankets also provided to keep our legs warm! Lovely views of the walls of Old Town Dubrovnik. A lovely end to the birthday celebrations!
Excellent service and view, just outside old town entrence. And the best apple cake I have ever tasted!

The food was fine, not memorable. The service was definitely mediocre bordering on poor. 
The location if you have a seaside table is pretty. 
Every restaurant in dubrovnik is above average in cost, this one included. 
Just don't expect greatness. It's fine though.
Nice eating place next to the wall with great views. Food was fine, don’t expect too much. Good service.

We had such a good experience coming for takeaway sandwiches that we went back for ice cream. It was the same guy who served us both times and he was so friendly! Definitely deserves to get some bonus points from the boss ;) 

PS. The guy was tell with dark hair and we came Saturday May 25th at 9:40 PM.
This restaurant is in the perfect location for a trip into the Old City of Dubrovnik. We ate there twice during our stay and shared some pizzas between the 5 of us and found it plenty for lunch.

We had lunch here, which is nice because we got 10% off after having gone to a sister restaurant in town and received a discount card. Great location, kind of chilly with wind but there are blankets on the chairs, and food was good (not amazing, but solid). Service was good.

We ate here twice during our stay, both lunches. The views on the terrace are amazing and it makes a great experience. 
Would highly recommend the pizzas they are some of the best ive ever had!! The iced coffees are also amazing.
Definitely worth a visit.

Amazing service and amazing food. Came for lunch and also breakfast for my sisters 30th birthday and the staff surprised her with a little cake and put on some candles we gave them and also gave us sorbettos on the house. Very well priced, lovely staff and great location. Would highly recommend for any meal of the day
Really loved IT here. Me and my friend ate lunch here. She Had chicken pasta and I truffle which was absolutly Amazing! Service was excellent! I certainly recommend!
Made a quick stop here for cocktails and to take in the fantastic view. I ordered a spritz and my husband ordered a seafood pasta dish after seeing it at another table. So good!!

My boyfriend and I had a great dinner here, we absolutely enjoyed the service, food, wine and the view. The restaurant was quite full but we didn't wait for nothing, even the hostess stoped by to check if everything is going good. We will come again for sure

We had booked this restaurant from the UK for our first night in Dubrovnik and were not disappointed. It is in a fabulous location and although we choose to eat inside as it was chilly evening we still had a lovely view. We both had fish dishes which were delicious and we pleased the waiter by ordering a bottle of Croatian wine which we enjoyed. We had such a nice evening that we booked again for our final evening (a Friday - definitely worth booking as the restaurant was really busy). This time we had a table on the terrace with a fabulous view (plenty of patio heaters and blankets provided !) and the food was just as delicious - pork medallions and garlic prawns with black spaghetti. The 10% discount card given on the first visit was a nice incentive. The waiters add to the positive atmosphere at this restaurant . They are polite and friendly and showed interest in you as a customer even during busy periods. Would highly recommend this restaurant.

Well situated place. Good for a romantic evening. The waiters kind of overplay it a little bit. But thats the rule of the game. They are quite polite a little bit pompous. But do not get me wrong no criticism from me. Nice place. Oh the food? It depends on your standards. I would rate as ok to good. I took the muscles croatian style. Nothing fancy. But I m a michelin guide type of customer. Enjoy. For me a 3;5 to 4.
Great place in old town near pile gate, excellent service, kind staff always ready to help you. The ideal place to relax, we would definitely go again!
We tested several restaurants for breakfast. This was the best: Excellent food, service and surroundings.

Lovely location and tasty breakfast options. However, despite all the positive reviews from previous travellers about the staff, we found the service bad. For example, once a table right at the end of the terrace with the best views became available, we requested to move there, but the waiters said it was 'reserved' and placed a reservation card on the table. 2 mins later, some new guests arrived and all of a sudden , the table became available! We over heard the waiters saying that the guests had 'cancelled' their booking within 2 mins of us requesting the table. Extremely hard to believe. The rude staff didnt want to move us. Simple. 

In terms of the breakfast itself, it was tasty and value for money. However you are paying for the view, not the breakfast and advise you not to sit near the tables near the right hand side where the general public are taking pictures (all the visitors get off the coaches and head straight to that spot and you feel like your eating your breakfast with them staring at you )

Spent a very pleasant evening here, we were given a table with a pleasant view and service was friendly and efficient. We ordered the grilled king prawns and the king prawns Dubrovnik style, both were delicious. For dessert, we shared the Dubravka cake which was very tasty. We used our 10% discount card is given to us at their sister restaurant Gradska Kavana. We ate at all 3 Nuatika restaurants and I would thoroughly recommend them all.
My wife and I stumbled across this restaurant located just outside the walls of Dubrovnik. We were shown to a table in the shade overlooking the sea. We shared a pizza and a cup of tea!

Lovely restaurant, lovely view and lovely food. Friendly staff. They even let you pick whether you want to sit in the sun or shade.
All in all, certainly a recommendation if you want to eat in Dubrovnik
Called in for a swift drink before doing Dubrovnik walls. As per the title, this place is all about the view. Beautiful...

Really worth a visit for the view alone but the food is great as well as the atmosphere. Nothing fancy, for that visit their sister restaurant if it fits your pocket. Nautica was simply out of range for us so this was a good alternative and we enjoyed the food and views. Make sure to book ahead and ask for a table at the end of the patio overlooking the walls of Dubrovnik. The only negative is that they allow smoking everywhere so it is unpleasant when eating and someone is smoking on the table next to you but this seems common practice in Croatia.

Just outside the old town / walled city. 
The service was top notch. The food was delicious and reasonable priced for what we ordered. 
I really enjoyed sitting on the patio with the heaters and blankets offered at the tables. 
The view of the walled city was stunning! 
Worth a visit if you are looking for a nice dinner. 
We had my little niece with us and all the staff were so sweet with her. 
Bonus - my sister who is celiac really enjoyed her meal and the staff were knowledgeable about gluten allergies.

We visited here 3 times on 3 different days, evening dinner on our first night, breakfast the following day and afternoon coffee and cake on our last day. 

On all 3, we could not have had a nicer experience. The quality of food and service was excellent and you enjoy a lovely view of the city walls in a very relaxed atmosphere.

Overall we had a most enjoyable time and have no hesitation in recommending.

My partner and I visited early evening as the sun was setting, what a fantastic spot! Right next to the walls with a view of the fort. Service was fantastic throughout and the food was excellent. Would definitely recommend.
We had breakfast and dinner here - everything was tasty, the staff were very helpful. The location was very convenient.
Went for cocktails and stayed for dinner - twice! Food was tasty, views are great and service (especially Ivan) was good. Would recommend for food or just drinks.
Great location with lovely views, attentive service, ate here on lunchtime and evening dinner and food was very nice, average costs I. Line with all others around the old town

After looking around for quite a while we choose this Restaurant for its great view and good selection of meals available.
We where warmly welcomed and shown to our seats, we ordered our meals and wine which was very reasonably priced unlike many other restaurants in the city.
The food was excellent also unlike most of the previous restaurants we had already visited.
Just as we settled for a lovely evening a party of women on a hen party showed up right next to us.
The staff when asked immediately took us to another table well away from the party, and thus bugun another lovely evening.
All in all l recommend this restaurant for its great food and the location is superb.
Don't miss it.

Let’s be honest, when you head somewhere with a view so good, full of tourists, on a sunny day, you can only hope the food is half as good as the view. I am happy to say the Croatian food, wine and dessert at Dubravka 1836 were just a good as the view. The seafood risotto was delicious as were the Posip and Dubrovacka Malvasija wines we had. I tried my husband’s Dubravka cake (chocolate and walnuts) delicious but perhaps too heavy for one person, best for sharing.
Visited the city then came out for a relaxing meal. Food was delicious. I had seafood salad then a pinacolada. Sitting in the sunshine with lovely views out to sea. Reasonablyou priced.

This restaurant is just outside Pile Gate has has lovely views overlooking it as well as out to sea.
We went here for breakfast a couple of times & I must say it was a nice experience,good food,friendly staff & clean surroundings,we also stopped here for a cup of tea after climbing the steps of the fortress is overlooks & again we were made to feel welcome.

Wonderful views of Dubrovnik city walls and Fort Lovrijenac. Excellent food. My wife had the mussels and I, the spaghetti bolognese. We loved the wine “Black” - a full bodied red with rich flavors. Our waitress was so pleasant and helpful. Located just outside of the main city entrance (Pile Gate). Highly recommend.
Nice selection of food, staff were lovely, atmosphere a little bit lacking but honestly no complaints, may just have been the evening we were there.

Despite surly service from the first waiter, Ivan was super helpful and friendly and the food was quick to arrive and tasty too. Add to that the views and the fact that this place is slightly cheaper due to being just outside the city walls and I’d highly recommend. 
One word of warning though - two of us ordered the penne arrabiata and the serving was so small, we ordered another main to share between us. All of the other meals served to us and to tables around us looked like good portion sizes so don’t let that put you off but perhaps order something else or a side to go with the penne...

I contacted the restaurant the week before visiting with a rather wishful request for a table of 15 for a friend’s 30th birthday celebration. Fortunately for us they were able to accommodate us on their covered (heated) terrace which was perfect as it was a warm but seriously rainy day in Dubrovnik. 

I cannot be positive enough about how great they were. The service was incredible, which given we were a large group with complicated dietary requirements was impressive. They were so friendly and responded to every request with a smile.

The restaurant itself is gorgeous, with a mural of the town walls and views of the walls and the fort from the uncovered terrace

The food was great, very generous portions compared to the other place we ate in the Old Town. Fresh and tasty seafood and ingredients. Everything cooked to perfection. Everyone loved their food. The two local wines they recommended were the best we had in a restaurant throughout the holiday and not overly expensive either.

They also brought out a dessert personalised for my friend at the end which was such a nice touch. 

If you are looking for great food and wine, in a stunning location with personal service. This is the place for you.

Just outside the Pile gate, with views of the fortress, sea and walls and a lovely interior too, these sights alone are worth a visit. The food was the most delicious we have had in Dubrovnik (we ate lamb and squid and shared an apple pie) so we will definitely return - when they also promise a 10% discount.

Our apartment was a few minutes walk away from 1836 and offers an amazing view of the walls and Fort Lovrijenac. 
At our first visit, we were lucky enough to have a table right next to the sea, with that view accompanying us as the sun set in the west. The service was brilliant. Our food was amazing. The fish platter for my partner, and a cheesy, beefy, grill steak (a local thing) for me. Fab.
On or second visit, we ate inside (a windy and wet day). The food was still good but the view, unsurprisingly, was not. You can't fault the service. Attentive and unobtrusive.
And a final visit, for breakfast. A simple omelette, breads and cheese and jam and OJ and coffee. Just 79 kuna and a perfect day-starter.
Highly recommend.

This restaurant has perhaps the most beautiful view I have ever seen for dining. We got lucky and got the front corner table overlooking the fort and the ocean. It was special and I already want to go back. I had fish soup to start and King Prawns for my entrée. A delicious meal and I highly recommend

Lovely place for breakfast. 
Plenty of choice and you gets lots for a reasonable price. Plenty of bread, jams, butter plus fruit salad, orange, hot drink and your main dish. 
Biggest plus point is the setting, big sunny terrace with a great view

During our stay in Dubrovnik we ate dinner here twice. The food and service were both excellent. We came without reservations but they gave us the best seats available. Quite a variety of food, from pizza, pasta, and risotto, to fish and meat dishes. Outdoor seating with heaters and blankets if needed. The views and atmosphere make for a great evening out. Highly recommend and thought the meals and beverages were reasonably priced. When we came for dinner the second time, the hostess remembered us from the previous visit and apologized for not having a table closer to the water.

Views of the Fortress and the city walls were amazing. Our waitress, Anika, was candid about the best dishes on the menu that matched our desires. She nailed our expectations with mussels and spaghetti bolognese and with Croatian wine “Black”. “Black” competes well with great Napa, Stellenbosch, etc. wines at a very reasonable price. Service, food, wine and views were exceptional! Joseph, the manager, checked in several times to ensure our needs were met. What a wonderful experience!! Much better than of the tourist traps nearby inside the walls.

Enjoyed a local breakfast and thanks for heaters as it is seasonally real cold here. Being gluten free my wife is restricted on menus so she was happy to find fresh gluten bread . The freshest she has ever had. We both enjoyed the bokar breakfast with a cheese and local tomatoes though the cheese was a tasteless motzarillo. Came with 3 kinds of bread and a fresh fruit salad with orange juice and a small coffee.

We booked and were very late arriving due to a ferry delay, the staff were lovely and we still got our table by the sea. Amazing views with excellent service. The food is good but not great...both our dishes were just nice...meat and fish good but vegetables were not...this did not spoil our lovely afternoon

This is a big place with options to dine inside and out. We went twice - the first time we ate outside right on the sea wall and then next time, because we knew we were going to get rain, we reserved an inside table.
This is an above average place for Dubrovnik (people dress up to go there) but at the same time we found it very relaxing. Staff are plentiful, friendly, and really efficient.
Over the course of the two nights we had salads, beef carpaccio, tuna steak, grilled squid and pizza. All of the food was good although the pizza wasn't the best of our trip . It also wasn't as expensive as one might expect given it's a really nice place.
If you've got a Dubrovnik card then make sure that you claim your 10% discount (helps pay for more white wine). It would be a first stop off for us the next time we are in town.
My friends and I had a great time at this restaurant, we visited it twice during our stay in Dubrovnik and found the atmosphere and service amazing each time. I would definitely recommend this place.
We went to this restaurant mostly because of the view. Unfortunately it wasn't as good as expected.. the food was good and the service nice, but still a bit pricey.

My husband and I enjoyed a wonderful morning tea this morning overlooking the beautiful wall and the sea. Great coffee and the most delicious Dubravka cake, made with rich chocolate and walnuts.
Wait staff very welcoming, warm rugs offered to those who needed it, and we were not rushed at all, being able to enjoy our morning tea. Thoroughly recommend this beautiful restaurant, situated right outside the wall.

This restaurant has a great location overlooking the sea and city walls just right of the Pile Gate at the entrance to the old city. The staff were friendly and the pasta and pizzas very tasty if a little overpriced - but that's probably down to the location.

A very pleasant place to eat and relax though. Three and a half stars really!

We enjoyed sitting outside with the views of Fort Lovrijenac, watching the kayakers come in below us, and the many alpine swifts flying around us in the early evenings.

Service was very good on both of our visits, and baskets of bread were brought out to diners. Their menu has a good number of vegetarian options. We enjoyed pasta twice, with the wild garlic noodles / tagliatelle particularly good! 

Prices are reasonable, especially given the location, and we partly chose to eat here because of a discount from the Dumotion Half Marathon event. We'd have been more than happy to go back a third time during our 2 week stay!

Had many delightful meals and plenty of cake and coffee here. You can chose your seating between overlooking the streets of old town, being indoors or out at the back overlooking the ocean. Our food was consistently excellent and the coffee was lovely (considering I'm from Melbourne and very snobby about my cuppa!). Everything was reasonably priced and the quality was great. Highly recommend the place.

Me and my mum went here for dinner during a short stay in Dubrovnik from London. The food, ambiance and service was great. We were given a table right by the walls which overlooked the fort and pebble beach, absolutely beautiful. They were easily able to cater for coeliacs. We recommend ordering the pizza, cocktails and grilled vegetables. Would definitely return and recommend to anyone.
Had lunch at the restaurant and I have to say it was the best food we had in Dubrovnik. The staff are fantastic and the cocktails are amazing. Would recommend to anyone.

After an early flight we arrived with luggage in tow for breakfast, the immaculate staff were extremely helpful with the luggage , the breakfast was plentiful and delicious, the views from the terrace are spectacular.
We came back for dinner on our last night in town, again the staff were very attentive providing blankets for when it got chilly later in the evening . The dinner menu was plentiful and varied it tasted good too ! I can not recommend 1836 enough.
We had breakfast twice and both times we left smiling. Service was friendly and food was good. They had nice omelette, fruit salad, chocolate croissant etc. Good value for the money plus great view.
We found the place a bit highly priced compared to the food. It was ok, but did not offer anything special. Tomato soup was delicious, pizzas average.

Visited twice during our family holiday. With the setting as beautiful as it is we expected the prices to show this but in reality no more expensive than the little street cafes within Old Town, and here you get the best view in town! No kids options unfortunately, not that we wanted ‘kids’ food, just a smaller portion of the main menu would have been nice, however our 7 and 9 year olds did justice to the portions they got. My 9 year old wants me to reiterate how delicious his Spaghetti Bolognaise was! Our youngest had the seafood tagliatelle and ate most of it but it was a big portion. Every meal we had was delicious- inc chicken tagliatelle and vegetable risotto. Very friendly staff and patio heaters and blankets brought out just as the chill started to come.

On honeymoon in Dubrovnik for a week. Eaten at many restaurants in and out of the walls. 

Just completed the stunning city wall walk and decided to sit and have a beer or two. Randomly chose the Dubravka so we could overlook the sea. I've spent many years in the hotel trade and the waiters here were perfect. Quick, pleasant, knowledgeable, upsold but were not pushy. Just lovely service, well done guys. 

We had a few drinks then decided to order. My wife had the Prawns Dubrovnik style and was given a bib and extra hand wipes, she needed both. It's a dish to get messy with but was delicious. I had the Penne Aribatta, reasonable portion but so tasty. Plenty of garlic and a touch of spice. I make it at home the other way around, but this was perfectly balanced. 

You can pay in Euros which was handy, and we did and left a good tip, well deserved. As the cool evening came in blankets were nicely offered and heaters came out. A keyboard and trumpet duo started to play great mood music. We could of stayed there all evening. 

Good food, great service, great view!

We had a great experience at Dubravka 1836! The host Joseph sorted us out when we booked in a few days earlier he put us at the prime seating location with the best views. The food was delicious we shared the gourmet pizza, vegetable lasagna and finished with a creme caramel. All were great! Dubravka 1836 is part of a three restaurant group which offers 10% discount. We visited the Gradska Kavana Arsenal restaurant for drinks and were give the card we didn’t realise when we booked that they were connected. They also have the panorama restaurant. Worth getting the discount card.

We visited here on the first day of our stay. The waiter asked me what I wanted and I had absolutely no idea because it all sounded lovely. I asked him to choose my meal so he chose the Tuna steak with salad and a Rose Gin. It was delicious best meal I've had here. Very pricey but the whole of Dubrovnik is.
