Oh and a bird pooed on me as there are lots of birds in the area but I can't knock them down a star for that! I hear it is good luck anyhow?!?

As you might expect to read, we loved this place. Really varied menu of typical Croatian food - probably the widest we saw from any restaurant. Yes, it is part of a small chain; yes we used the 10% discount card; yes we could have gone elsewhere. But the service was always excellent and the other various restaurants in the city just didn’t seem to offer the variety of food that we each wanted to eat. 
Fish and meat was always perfectly cooked, but the seafood tagliatelle was amongst the best I have had anywhere. Highlight was the mixed seafood dish - I can thoroughly recommend it.
If you have any room for desert, try a portion of cheesecake!

We visited this restaurant twice during our recent stay in Dubrovnik with my two sons age 17 and 12 . Lovely setting overlooking the sea and the city walls . Situated in a delightful square . Very good choice of food - I’m vegetarian and was catered for very well . Good selection of beers and wines and everything was reasonably priced . We had been given a 10% loyalty card when we had eaten at their sister restaurant panorama so we were able to use that . We had lunch and dinner here and st night they have patio heaters and blankets if you feel chilly . Service was not rushed but not slow and the staff were very friendly . Definitely recommend a visit .
Lovely food with a great view and location. Nice range of meals pick from. Quality of food was fantastic and enjoy 10 % off with the Dubrovnik card

We've used three of the chain of restaurants and although we've already had a drink here we came back for lunch. Great service and delicious food with arguably one of the best views of the Red Keep 😁

A pizza, mussels, large beer and white wine was only 230k.

Just popped in for a beer before we went on a tour and the views are stunning. Loads of outdoor tables and comfy chairs.

We only had time for a quick drink but the menu looked really good.

The waiting staff were also really nice.
Sister restaurant with Arsenal by old harbour and panorama at top of cable car. Excellent service, good food and wine 😁

Booked our meal here on Saturday 20th April. 3 people. The restraunt has a view of both fort Bokar and fort Lovrijenac, beautiful at night. The food was good, us having fish, and pasta dishes but the menu is varied. Part of s group of 4 restaurants and we ate in all of them. All good. This meal with wine was £77 for 3

The staff were attentive if not a bit to much at times. I found the food ok but average compared to others I’ve had in Dubrovnik , pricing is definately on the higher side but guess you pay that for the location. There are so many choices around

We ate here four times during our stay in Dubrovnik. Situated just outside the walls by Pile Gate, it benefits from lovely views without the ‘inside the walls’ prices. Breakfast was fabulous, with coffee, fresh orange juice, bread and preserves. Croissants, fresh fruit salad, cheese and ham completed the very reasonably priced breakfast. Lunch was equally as good. Highly recommended
This restaurant and bar at the site of the castle in Dubrovnik is an ideal place for cafe or a drink. Outdoor sitting is ideal.

We stopped here for a very enjoyable last meal in Dubrovnik. Food was delicious (I had the pork with gorgonzola sauce), view was excellent, but what made it most memorable was the amazing service provided by our waiter, Jasmin, who deserves a special mention. He was attentive and hospitable from start to finish, with great recommendations, friendly conversation and personable service. The type of service that makes you want to return for that reason, alone!!
After walking for hours in Dubrovnik we went for a quick bite and this was our choice, it's a nice place overall but it's touristic restaurant with common dishes.
Very nice place in front of the entrance to the old city offering mostly pasta and meat for a big price, too big for that but the service was nice and the view was spectacular
We arrived in Dubrovnik and headed straight for this restaurant. The ravioli and the risotto were both excellent and the service attentive. Great views of the sea and city walls.

After scouring the Internet for what seemed like hours in search of some good seafood in Dubrovnik at a reasonable price, I stumbled upon this one. It had great reviews and an excellent location so we decided to give it a go! 
We booked a table (on the same day) for 8pm and asked for one with a view. We were not disappointed. 
When we arrived, we were attended to immediately and showed to our table, which overlooked the sea and city walls. The atmosphere and service was impeccable. Our waiter was very friendly and attentive. However, the food was the absolute highlight!! We had the seafood salad to start (fresh and delicious) and the seafood risotto and seafood tagliatelle for mains... and it was just marvellous. It was flavourful, rich, and the seafood was so fresh. The pasta was also cooked to perfection.
We had 4 drinks, 1 large bottle of water, 1 starter, 2 mains and 1 coffee which came to 470 kuna. (So around £60.)

All in all, a wonderful evening, amazing food and unbelievable value. After seeing so many reviews for so many places, I am so glad we chose this lovely restaurant. Would definitely recommend!

Reasonably priced but totally delicious food - I had the seafood risotto which was a generous portion and really fresh and tasty - would definitely recommend! Also get great views of the wall and lovely to walk around the old city at night afterwards

We had reservations for dinner and ended up getting there early. The staff accommodated is and sat us immediately! The service was amazing, probably the best in Dubrovnik!! The food was fresh and tasty!! I had the king prawns and my husband had the sea food risotto!! I would definitely recommend making this a stop if you are in Dubrovnik!!

He had seafood plates including grilled octopus and squids, giant shrimps and vegetables. As a started we had salad of the season. This is at a beautiful place near the bus station and You can see the old city wall. The personnel is very friendly. With 400 kunas you can have a 2-dish meal for two with drinks.
Great view of the city walls and prices are reasonable compare to other restaurants in the city. Food was good.

Situated just outside the old city walls with views over the sea and kings landing. 
We visited last afternoon and had amazing pizza at very reasonable prices. They have heaters outside and blankets so you can keep warm as the sun goes down. Service was really good - loved watching the sun set

When we first came to Dubrovnik,our taxi driver drove us in front of the old city.On the right side there is a restaurant with the most beautiful view we've ever seen. We only had coffe and cake,it was pretty nice,but we wouldn't come here for dinner becouse we think they serve mediocre food. But deffinetly worth a visit.
We popped into the restaurant after walking the walls and had a drink but liked it so much we went back for something to eat later that evening

We had a lovely meal in this restaurant overlooking the “ red keep”. 
We were outside but kept nice and warm with heaters and rugs. Staff were all very nice. We wanted something simple and both opted for pizzas and a salad which came quickly and the pizza was hot and crispy- delicious!
Lovely view of the water and people passing by - can recommend this restaurant and its two sister restaurants as we have now been to all three! One is at the top of the cable car and the other by the harbour.

This restaurant is really great, you can have a perfect view while drinking coffee or beer. Very nice service personell, especially a waiter called Ivan (he loves cats 🐱☺️ - not, that this is necessary for being a good waiter, but there are cats almost everywhere in Dubrovnik).

There‘s also a special offer for guests to come again: For all following visits you can get a 10%-off-voucher.
Would recommend sitting in front row looking at the sea, the fort and the old town walls. You can have a good time here and the staff is very nice, especially Ivan. Will come back again.

Ate a late lunch here after walking down from Mt Srd, had lovely tasty pizzas with plenty of toppings, and excellent seafood tagliatelle. Great location, just outside the Pile Gate with views of the city walls, fort and shingle beach. Friendly attentive service, food arrived quickly. Definitely recommend.

This place is pretty much the first restaurant you encounter when you get off the bus from the airport. Its good quality and reasonably priced for its location. Good food and friendly, hospitable staff

Terrace with extraordinary sea view and Old Town. Friendly and helpful staff. Coffee and ice cream are good, although there may be a greater variety of flavors. Prices are fair and excellent atmospheres.

This restaurant hit most excellent marks. First, the food... Excellent!! Seafood at its BEST.. we had grilled squid, to perfection!! We had sea bass, fried, soo good!! Shrimp were cooked just right, succulent , melts in your mouth. Second, can’t beat the ambience, overlooking the old city walls, Adriatic sea. It can get windy and slightly cold, but NO Worries, they provide you wid blankets, if you choose outdoor seating. Overalla great dining experience. Service was also excellent, very attentive wait staff.

Had dinner recently at this restaurant. Great location just past Pile Gate and the restaurant overlooks the city walls. Nice decor inside. Staff friendly. Food very nice but you are looking at about £20 (on average) for a main meal per person, so your bill can soon add up quickly! However the location, decor and atmosphere make it worth visiting this restaurant 👍

Could not stop going back! Lunchtime drinks, afternoon cocktails and dinner. Food wonderful, staff attentive and friendly, views day and night stunning. 10% discount on all with Dubrovnik card and staff also gave us voucher for 10% off their other restaurants...simply beautiful.

Ok, so maybe the title is a little misleading. There’s a view alright, a spectacular one at that. I sat down at dusk after a long day of traveling. I usually avoid the places that seem touristy, and given Dubravka’s location just outside the Pile Gate it screamed touristy. All that said, I was more than pleasantly surprised. I chose pizza (Margarita minus olives - they put olives on EVERY pizza here, a concession to the region I’m certain) but the menu has far more to choose from. The service was friendly (and fluently English) and even though it was a coolish, breezy night, a patio heater placed right by my table kept me toasty. Because who wants to sit inside when you can eat dinner and look at the splendor of Dubrovnik’s Old City. I made the choice out of convenience but it turned out excellent.

This restaurant has an incredible atmosphere, kind and helpful service, and a little bit of everything on their menu to appeal to every appetite. After being on the road for awhile, I was craving something familiar. I ordered spaghetti and a rocket salad, which were both so tasty! Had I been in a more adventurous mood, this place would have also had some great authentic Croatian cuisine to try.
We stopped in here a couple of times for beers and coffee. Staff were friendly and attentive and what a stunning view. Was a bit windy but there were some heaters and blankets if you were chilly.

We ate here several times while we were in Dubrovnik. The staff were friendly and we were given a card that entitled us to a 10% discount from our second visit. The portions were not enormous, but the food was good and fresh. We had breakfast here once (it was copious) and dinner twice. The desserts were also excellent. Worth stopping off here if you are in the region.
Look no more, this is the place for good sea food, by the sea. Had spaghetti with Adriatic shrimps, loved every bite. Homemade beer has a huge thumbs up from me. Enjoy!

There is a Real Estate adage in Australia that states location, location, location.

Dubravka has one of the best locations any Restaurant could ever have but it is more than that.

The food menu is vast and varied, the portions large, the food is tasteful and one gets their moneys worth.

We had the Fish Soup, Tuna Salad, John Dory and Veal Medallions on Rice. Shared the Dubrakva Cake. All good and satisfying.

The restaurant is worth a visit for breakfast, lunch, dinner and anything in-between.

Highly recommended!
As you make your way to Pile gate, Dubravka restaurant is on your right, on a terrace overlooking Fort Lovijenac. The food is excellent and with the fantastic views, it is a good place to stop.
Really nice spot for dinner as you are just outside the entrance to Old Town. Everyone enjoyed their meals.

What we like here is that locals have discount. We ordered lasagne and they are definitely one of the best we ever tried.
Place is on the cliff, next to the sea and city walls. Stuff is friendly and professional. We would recommend this place to anyone.
Waiter was excellent. Food was very good; prices on the higher end but not unreasonable. Patio was great - heaters, and blankets at each table made it very comfortable.

The staff is extraordinary, food very tastefull and the prices are affordable.
Definite recommendation to everybody!

Stopped for dinner and the views are amazing!! Friendly, attentive service from Mario! He looked after us very well. Food was delicious and reasonably priced for the views you get! Would highly recommend and we will be returning on our next visit to Dubvronik! Thanks Mario!

I was with my girlfriend and sitting was lovley near walls and sea, one word beautiful. We have pizza which was incredible and for desert we take some very nice chocolate cake. Stuff were pleasant. Defenetly worth it and the prices are more than acceptable comparing to some other "rip off" restaurants in town.

This was our first food in Dubrovnik at suggestion of Airbnb host. Great table overlooking the bay. Food was great, maybe a little pricey but we should have purchased our tourist cards before not after to get 10% off. The owners have 2 other restaurants in the city, we aim to try at least one of them
Doesn't get any better than this in Dubrovnik. It has the best view in town along with delicious food. Price is fair. Highly recommend.

Situated right on the bay and with equal parts nature and people-watching, this is a lovely spot to have breakfast or dinner. I had the Bokar breakfast which was perfect and very filling, including an omelette, bread, fruit, juice and coffee/tea. I also ordered a croissant which was buttery and delicious. Good value for money and had I stayed longer I probably would have gone back.

Had luncheon here and was not disappointed. Spectacular views, swift, discreet service and fabulous food. We returned several times - totally unlike us - but it was DIVINE and we shall return again this summer. Don't change a thing!

This place is a gem for its outside seating area, granting views on the fortified city or on Fort Lovrjenac. You can't go wrong with the view if seated outside.

The service is ok, nothing special. 

Food-wise, the salads were good and somewhat generous in size, although we ate them all. We also had a seafood risotto, but the seafood portion wasn't very good and didn't look that fresh, unfortunately. 

Prices are reasonable though, considering the fact you should expect to pay a premium for such a spot. Four meals and drinks for 606 Kn, that's not that bad, all things considered.

Enjoyable meal at a reasonable price. We were fortunate to get a table overlooking the sea. Patio heaters and blankets are supplied. A lovely atmosphere. Would love to go back with the husband as it's quite romantic and was practically next door to our accommodation (old town apartments).
Outside seating with view of Dubrovnik walls and sea. Good soup and salad. Pasta dishes just ok. Good service and prices.

This was best restoran in Dubrovnik(we visited 8all together,they where all in betvin 1-50on trip adisor)
Nice view...exceland service and food was amazing,wouldnt change a thing...will be coming here again for shure...

We went here on our final night. We were sat on the terrace which was lovely. The Waiter was very friendly and took our order very swiftly. We both had pizza which was huge but they were delicious. The Waiter did forget our chips but he brought them out quite quickly. The view of the old walls were stunning

My girlfriend and I visited restaurant on 31th of December 2018. We where hosted very polite by young lady that find as best available table in that moment. We where lucky to sit next to the wall so we had beutifull view on old city. Since we came on short lunch we didnt stay long (we took some seafood pasta and pizza), but it was long enough too enyoj great surroundings, friendy and proffesionally staff and tasty food. 
We got what we where looking for, and hope we"ll be back once to take a dinner.
This is a great restaurant and the location is overlooking the Adriatic Sea and Old City's Wall. It was crowded but service was good.

Tried this restaurant based on the reviews and wasn't disappointed. Great location, view, drinks selection, staff, food and value. The Dalmatian stype rib steak with blitva was incredible. So good we went twice and also tried thier partner restaurant Panorama during our short stay.

The last time we were in Dubrovnik (2017) we had a delicious lunch at Dubravka and promised ourselves to come back one day. We were fortunate enough to enjoy Dubravka again with our friends in October 2018. Once again, the lunch was absolutely delicious (pizza, lasagna, great wine, fantastic cakes) with a view of the fort and the city walls. Will be back !

A foursome, we had a lunch here at the beginning of our stay. It was good, but seemed rather expensive. We came back for our last dinner, after eating at lots of other places, and understanding that Dubrovnik simply had elevated prices. It turned out to be the best dinner we had, with very good service, food and ambience.
Very good after walk on the walls of Dubrovnik old town. Not cheap, but good value for money. Staff very attentive and profesional.

Place located just outside Dubrovnik old city in a historic and romantic place specially during evening hours

Service is consider decent having in mind that this is a touristic place 
In this aspect it is also the quality of food 

Regarding prices we had two cappuccino, a milk shake and pizza which is 27 euros

Having been pleased with our evening meal we returned fir breakfast. Some great meal plans on offer I chose the meal (Dubrovnik?) which came with freshly squeezed orange juice , delicious coffee , cold ham , cheese, fresh fruit salad, and a wonderful basket of fresh bread , with choices of preserve .. oh and a donut . Couldn't eat it all, but they would have quite happily packed it up for us. Certainly the best breakfast of the week , very reasonably priced and again wonderful service .( the waiter recognised us and we got an additional 10 percent off for loyalty ). 
Certainly the nicest breakfast I had , and there were lots of choices, from a croissant and a coffee to wonderful meal plan with omelettes and meats. We enjoyed sitting outside, watching the canoeists ( so much so we went canoeing ourselves the next day)!

We popped in for an evening meal and we weren't disappointed . Food to suit all tastes ,I'm not very ambitious but loved the carpaccio , starter ( perfect for sharing) . Pork fillet was delicious ( I never choose pork when I'm out but saw it on someone else's table). Wine was very reasonably priced and service was excellent , attentive but not excessive. Went back for breakfast but will review that separately . The next evening we tried somewhere different ... wish I'd gone back here instead as it wasn't a patch! What I would say is if you go in the summer the setting is amazing ! Even in November we sat out !

This restaurant was on our walk in to the old town so we stopped in on our first night. We had 2 courses which were both good. Dubrovnik is just expensive though! No real complaints but we found another restaurant we preferred for a similar price hence why it’s 4/5. Given how busy this place is I was pleasantly surprised by how quick the food came.

For diner we end up having at the Dubravaka .
It was romantic and the their recommendation food was better than we expected.
For the daily fish we had gotten seabass and it was fresh and delicious. It was cooked to perfect. Crispy on skin and soft inside. Just how fish should be cooked.
Also we had veal and it was really tender and the sauce that came with was just great. 
Also before you order i would recommend you to ask for the less salt. Personally i thought less salt tasted better. 
For desert we had homemade apple cake. Apple cake was okay little too sweet for me but it was good.
Oh and if you want wine you should ask for the recommendation because they pick the perfect wine for me.
Overall my experience in this restaurant was great.
Had great food with great service~^^

Arrived just at the start of lunch service just for a cool drink. Staff were happy for us to take a seat overlooking the city walls and fortress. Great place to people watch too.
A lady called Anita served us and she arranged for me to watch my ‘Ragusa’ cocktail being made at the bar. She also put up with my attempts at speaking Croatian. We were so chilled that we stayed for lunch. Drinks and food there are on a par with prices in Edinburgh but the service we received was superb. Hvala vam puno.

Situated between the old fort and the city walls with tables inside and out. We visited for an afternoon drink and called back for an evening meal which was lovely. The staff were friendly, helpful and attentive. We sat outside with the chill taken off the air by the numerous patio heaters. 

Definitely recommend - great ambience and great location.

Really enjoyed our two evenings at Dubravnik 1836. Very good food, great service and a wonderful view of the sea and the walls of the Old Town. We also dined at two of their sister restaurants. Panorama and Arsenal and were very pleased with both. When you dine at any of their restaurants, they give you a 15% discount at any of their other restaurants which was very nice.
We enjoyed our lunch sitting in October sunshine whilst soaking up the view. Never to be forgotten. Excellent.

After a bad weather and no cable car to our originally booked restaurant, we pitched up on my birthday to Dubravka, was welcomed with a smile and lead to a nice spot with a fantastic view of the walls and the Adriatic sea. Birthday lunch was superb and they were super quick to dish the food out. Grilled salmon with seasonal veg and boiled potatoes were yummy, hubby’s grilled jumbo prawns with tartare sauce and rice were divine..beer and house wine were reasonably priced as well. Staff looked after us so well. Highly recommended restaurant and cafè to drop by when in Dubrovnik’s ‘King’s Landing’ 😬
This place has wonderful views over the bay and across to the old town. The food was nice, however it did take a little while for us to be seated. It’s a great place to come for lunch.

Had a nice lunch on a lovely hot October day
Food was excellent 
A very busy place with nice views and friendly staff
Prices not too bad considering location 
Would imagine it would be unbearably hot in summer,we had to move to a shaded table even though we ate outside at the very end of the holiday season.
Would recommend

We had a lovely lunch here on our first day and were surprised at what great value it was. We had the pork with Gorgonzola sauce and the steak cooked to perfection. It wasn’t a fluke- on two subsequent visits, for dinner, we also had delicious food and delightful service. If the cake of the day choc mousse cake is offered to you, do choose it. (Not too sweet). 
Location is great and the staff are friendly. Food comes quickly, portions are good size and there’s plenty of indoor seating if the weather turns.

I came for lunch the day I arrived in Dubrovnik and ordered their grilled calamari. Best I have ever had. Then I came back for breakfast and had a typical Dubrovnik’s breakfast. It was healthy (fruit, protein, grains) and delicious. Now I’m eating pizza, “gourmet pizza” for dinner and the quality of the ingredients are top of the line and the taste is delicious. One thing that has been prevalent in every visit it is the kindness of the personnel. They do pay attention to you and provide very good service. That combined with the excellent location of the restaurant, just outside “Pile Gate” and overlooking the bay with forts on each side, is the perfect combination for a memorable experience.

Good welcome and prompt service.
Gluten free options available including bread - the manager was fully aware of ceoliac requirements.
Kids spag bol was great. Grilled squid excellent. Perfect location if visiting the old town
Lovely ambience and great service. The food was just ok. I had the food platter n the salmon was undercooked, the calamari was a bit dry but d shrimp was divine.

The location is just amazing and the service was nice and polite. The food , sorry to say a disappointment. Nothing really wrong but nothing special. We had a pasta with grilled shrimps and it was one large grilled shrimp on Top and then several small in the pasta. A kind of wierd way of making it appear better than it is. No special taste and a bit overcooked pasta. But the view is increadible! You see the restaurant to the right in The picture.

Visited this restaurant three times during our one week stay in Dubrovnik. Our first visit was for a glass of wine, returned another day for lunch, and made it our choice for dinner on our last evening. Lovely location, great service, and food was excellent. They certainly know how to take care of their customers!
Literally says it all in the title. The selling point is the amazing view but they do not compromise on the food at all! Good portions and affordable prices. Would go again.

If you’re looking for variety and well prepared and presented food is important, overlook the fact that this place in next to the Pile Gate and a very busy square and coach stop.

The food is good, the portions are generous, the staff are very helpful, the views out to the city walls, the Adriatic Sea and Mincéta Fort are impressive. A very nice spot not too close to the hustle and bustle of theOld Town.

Very good place, right next to the city walls. Service was VERY GOOD. Beer, red wine were great and ravioli with truffles were really exceptional. Tourist place but they care, you know. Highly recommend.

We had the assorted fish plate. The King Prawn looked nice but was close to unedible. It was not spoiled or anything, just a total waste of time and money. The rest: World Class. The Sea Bass, the Salmon, the Squid, the Scallops. All cooked to absolute perfection, and with a wonderfull, fresh taste. I am from Scandinavia. I am _very_ fussy about sea food. I smoke my own salmon, make my own cheese. But this meal was absolutely perfect. (Except for the prawn, but it did not spoil the total experience). Go there!

We ate here yesterday and were lucky enough to get a table overlooking the bay. The view is beautiful! 
We enjoyed a leisurely lunch here. The food was absolutely lovely. The staff were friendly and we weren’t rushed at all. We would love to go back before we leave.

We called here during a storm. It is a rare chance to eat indoors just outside the old city walls. 
The food was Ok and service acceptable and there are some great views of the old city walls. However food and drinks prices in this area are very high for what you get. We much prefered to get a snack and eat outside the area in a place that wasn't so trendy and stuffed full of tourists.
.

Lovely location just outside Pile Gate. Food really good. There is a lovely relaxed atmosphere here at this restraunt. The Staff are really professional and friendly. Great choice of food. It may be a little more expensive but it is really worth a visit. You may even get 10 per cent discount as we did.

We so much enjoyed our first dinner at the Dubravka that we returned for a second dinner. We loved the food, the deserts and we received great service! Plus the view is stunning! The restaurant is not exactly a hidden jewel as it is located very prominently at the city gate but it is really isn’t a tourist trap - which we really feared it would be. Highly recommended!

First night in Dubrovnik and where to eat? Always a problem that. You either strike lucky or you don't. Luckily, we did. First thing to say is if you can get a table overlooking the bay, the view is stunning; particularly as the sun is going down. I would say the price of the food is middling for Dubrovnik but be careful the cost can run away with you;especially the price of alcohol. I had the Seafood Risotto which was wonderful both times we ate here and I have to say, it was marvellous. My wife had pizza one night and lasagna the other. Very nice too by all accounts. This is a laid back place. Food comes in a reasonable time and they don't rush to clear your plates afterwards - which was nice and relaxing. Finally, a big well done to the staff, all of whom were very friendly and very helpful. Recommended.

Right from the start the staff were very friendly and attentive, the waitress that served us was very good, prompt, offered further information on menu items and made some recommendations. 
The swordfish and the prawns were very good indeed and would definitely recommend them. 
The view from this restaurant at sunset at well were lovely. 

We're big Game of Thrones fans and the live string band played the opening theme song at the end of the night which I thought was a nice touch.
Superb location; delicious lamb & veal. Fine dining. Courteous service. Live duo - cello & piano. Recommended by our Tui guide TJ.

This was a very nice surprise for us. Being near the tourist bus madness outside the main gate to the Old City, we did not expect to have the fine food and service we enjoyed at Dubravka 1836. We were ushered to a very good table overlooking the fortress, bay and Old City. My grilled fish fillet was fresh and tasty. My partner's chicken pizza was quite good, with thin crisp crust and good ingredients. Service was prompt and attentive. We were both quite happy with this accident and recommend.

Great views from the dining area. We called into this place for a drink and I ordered just a dessert. Drinks came but dessert never appeared until we were leaving, very very slow service for a dessert which must have been already prepared. Staff were quite abrupt.

Food is mediocre but recommend for the views of the walls and sea . Don’t order noodles as u will get pasta as they say it’s their noodles. Very busy place and buzzing.nothing excellent about food . Staff are nice but are very busy to provide prompt service

We came here for Breakfast on our first morning here, and pudding/drinks on our last night. 

We loved it! The views are spectacular and we enjoyed the food. The breakfast menu was great and even the vegetarian breakfast was vegan. 

The waiter was very nice and gave us a 10% off voucher which can be used in 3 restaurants in Dubrovnik. The waitress on our last night, Ivana, was very pleasant and helpful and spoke excellent English.

Would definitely recommend this place for any time of day!
Had a really good lunch here. Service was good, prices were reasonable, food was good and the environment, the view in particular, was amazing. Recommended, when in Dubrovnik.

We had a lovely meal sat on the terrace admiring the beautiful view. I would definitely recommend sitting outside if the weather allows it. Service and food were both good, in fact the best we have had in Croatia.
Me and my wife visited here on our last night in Dubrovnik - it was simply stunning. The food, the service, the atmosphere and the views. Please visit here!
I had lunch, dinner and breakfast here and I loved all. Food is great, service is very good, waiters are friendly. I would recommend it to everyone.

We booked for lunch on the day of our arrival as we arrived in Dubrovnik at noon and couldn’t get into our apartment till 14:00.

We hopped on the shuttle bus at the airport and disembarked at the Pile Gate stop.

To our amazement the restaurant wasn’t 25 meters from the bus stop! ( no dragging heavy bags around the old town).

We were warmly greeted at the restaurant and they took our cases and stored them away.

We were led to a table right at the waters edge, idyllic .

We ordered octopus salad and a glass of posic each , what a start to our holiday.

The food was fresh and the wine delicious,the view was to die for.

The staff were very friendly and attentive, for it’s location the cost of the meal was great , they also knocked me 10% off the bill and gave me a discount card to use in their other establishments.

An excellent start to the trip well done Dubravka 1836!!

Had cocktails here and they were lovely.

Lovely View! Fairly priced for the location. Two cocktails were 145 KRK which is roughly £17.
 

Would definitely return.

Beautiful views with beautiful wine and food. The Napoli pizza was excellent, and so was our service by Branimir Giavinic. Very pleasant atmosphere and our waiter looked after us very well. The girls on the entrance were both very helpful too. Very good service. Willl come back again.
We came here twice in 4 days, once for breakfast and once for dinner. Both really nice with good views and quite reasonable prices for dubrovnik

The terrace overlooks the Pile Bay and Fort Lovrijenac - the Blackwater Bay of the “King’s Landing” in “Game of Thrones”. We had the most fantastic view by sitting at the edge of the terrace and could escape from the crowd in the old town. We love the cocktails during the hot summer day. Seafood pizza and tuna salad were quite good. With an awesome view, nice ambience and good service, the price is ok at such core location.

Best thing about this restaurant is it's exceptional views and terrific location. We visited the place for two meals- breakfast combo and dinner. The breakfast spread was quite okay, nice spread for marmalades however the fruits looked stale. Service was nice and prompt. However I personally liked the food better at dinner and considering they had quite good options in vegetarian meals, the pasta we ordered was delicious. Would recommend going here for exquisite views overlooking the Adriatic and fort, live music and good service.

This restaurant was recommended to us by our taxi driver and it did not disappoint. Beautiful live music, great service and the food was all delicious. The prices were also more reasonable than some of the restaurants in the Old Town.
Nice pizza with local beer. Hard to beat for lunch. It's location, just outside the old town makes the place. Great views. Ambience etc

They serve breakfasts until 11.30 am. I chose an omelett-breakfast of five alternatives. 
The fruits was best part of it. The omelett needed extrasalt and spice. The coffee ok.
We had seen reviews of this place on trip advisor and had a personal recommendation. We had pizza and salad, soft drinks and coffee. We had good service - total bill £45.
our 4th night here and by far our best restaurant experience. Great food, and exceptionally friendly service, great location.

The outdoor section overlooks the wall by the Pile Gate.
the service was great. the waiter recommended the local dish, which was great.
they also have a good WiFi signal.
It was a good spot to wind down and enjoy some seafood.

My husband and I stumbled on Dubravka after being dropped off nearby from our Uber driver. We did not have reservations, but we were able to get an outdoor seat with amazing views. I wasn't sure what to expect since this restaurant is right by the gate entrance to the Old Town and worried it might have sub par food catering to the busy tourist flow. I was definitely wrong! The food was delicious, the atmosphere was very nice, and our server was beyond great. Super nice, accommodating and it turned out to be a wonderful dinner. He even brought us a special dessert cocktail which I've now recreated twice back at home (champagne, vodka and lemon sorbet.....yum).
Great view, good food and lots of people around makes this restaurant the right place to be. Sea food was very fresh.

We ate at the Dubravka several times both for breakfast and dinner during our week in Dubrovnik. Conveniently located near the bus station and adjacent to the Pile Gate and the walls of the Old Town, the Dubravka has an extensive and varied menu and wine list all at reasonable prices. The food and service were always excellent and the views of the Old Town walls and the Castle over the cliffs are spectacular. The Dubravka offers a 10% discount to holders of the Dubrovnik card and also owns the restaurant at the top of the cable car on Mount Srd. The ice creams at the adjacent shop are the best in Dubrovnik !
We sat on the terrace where you have fabulous views. The meal and service was excellent! Just outside the city walls

Set just outside the main gate to Old Town Dubrovnik, Nautika Restaurant features elegant, relaxed outdoor dining in an amazing setting. We had dinner and enjoyed the most amazing sunset, highlighted by the entrance of the restored Game of Thrones galleon that cruised in at dusk. Definitely a memory to treasure forever.

Just outside the walls of old town, overlooking the walls and the nearby fortress, this estaurant has some excelllent views, especially as the sun sets over the Adriatic - magnificent!
Service and food were of a good standard for a very busy restaurant and the prices reasonable for the quality of food. We went twice in a six night stay, which is saying sometihing with the huge choice of eateries you have in Dubrovnik. Can be very busy for dinner, reserve a table if possible.

We visited the restaurant in September, 3 times for breakfast and once for dinner. Amazing breakfast, great atmosphere and service! 
I wish we had found it earlier..

Top restaurant with great service. Would advised booking in advance and requesting a table a view.....

Pros: 
- great food, wide choice to suit varying palettes
- service - waiters are professional
- well located - right next to Pile Gate of the Old Town 
- ambiance

Cons: 
- can be a queue if you don’t book in advance 
- tables exposed to weather - didn’t matter to us as it was hot

Would recommend
We ate here 3 times during our 10 day stay. We ate a late breakfast, lunch and dinner. All three meals and service were good.

The situation of this place outside the walls and overlooking the sea is worth the stop in itself, it really is a lovely spot. 

The welcome was warm and we were shown to a table of our choice promptly. Service went downhill from there. We were situated right next to a staff service station which was fine other than that the staff member there refused to acknowledge us or do anything for us insisting that we were not one of her tables and that we must be attended to by one of her colleagues who was situated quite some distance away. Attracting his attention was a challenge but inspite of that Anita refused to do anything, the ordering system is totally electronic and surely she could have taken our order just as easily as anyone else but she would not.

The food when it came was tasty enough but we waited a very long time for both food and drinks and it didn't appear that others fared any better. The staff numbers seemed to be more than sufficient for the number of tables so all in all, not great.

Party of three with a 1 year old, quickly seated under an olive tree just back from the wall of the terrace with just enough shade. Asked for a high chair, and full one with tray was quickly in place. Two iced teas and a draft of the local beer were ordered (peach iced tea seems to be the predominant bottled flavor), along with a cold octopus salad, a four cheese pizza, and a margherita pizza. Pizza dough was crunchy and flavorful. Octopus was well cooked, sliced, and presented on a bed of greens. All were excellent. Considering the location, the views, and the food, the meal was well priced.

My wife and I spent a week in Dubrovnik before a Dalmatian Coast cruise and we went to Dubravka 1836 at the recommendation of our travel agent, Peter Hazdovac of Adriatic Travel in San Pedro, Calif. 

Peter is Croatian-American and has been to Dubrovnik many times. He called Dubravka his favorite restaurant, and we could see why. It's in a great spot, with a huge, tree-shaded terrace with views of the the sea with the city walls. We ended up eating there three times, we enjoyed it that much. 

And here's the main reason we enjoyed Dubravka so much: Josip Grizely, the co-manager in during the day. 

When we first walked into the restaurant, Josip greeted us and I said the only words of Croatian that I knew, "dober dan," which means "good afternoon." His face lit up, he jokingly called me a "countryman" and led us to a table. During our meal, he would come by to briefly visit and check on us. 

Later in the week, I asked him to help us get reservations for four at another excellent restaurant the company owns, Arsenal, overlooking the harbor. He got us an excellent table and at the end of the meal, we were shocked when a dessert sampler was brought to the table, courtesy of Josip. Talk about good customer service. 

So, some suggestions: Try Dubravka, ask for "Josip with the glasses" and greet him with "dober dan." Do the same with any Croatian you meet and you will find the interaction much richer, and more fun.

We have eaten here 3 times in the last ten days.

The position is excellent and the food and service is very good. Not the most expensive or the cheapest but very good value.

We were in the old city and looking for a place to eat. It was quite late already and we decided to seat down at Dubravka. Ivana was our waitress and she is extremely pleasant: very attentive without being intrusive - very knowledgeable she suggested and amazing local Merlot (I don’t recall the name now) but it was to die for - easy drinking but with a character and body, simply amazing! She guided us through the menu and we went for the seafood salad and it was a Ka fresh as a fresh can be - lovely scallops, calamari, baby octopus and giant shrimps - truly exceptional. We had the ham and truffle ravioli with the fish platter with amazing fresh fish straight from the ocean to your plate! We managed to get a table again in the edge and with amazing views to the old town walls and the sea!!! 
Amazing dining experience and attentive staff - we just loved it!!!!
Had a lovely meal here on Thursday. Lovely food and setting. Staff were very friendly. Going back again tonight. Would definitely recommend it.

Headed in just for a drink but stayed to eat - really fabulous - probably the best meal we had in Dubrovnik - had the pasta and chicken. Would highly recommend - and try to sit by the wall for the views.

The location is wonderful and so is the view. Prices are moderate and absolutely pay off to the food which was delightful. Staff is extremely friendly and polite. It's a must-eat-at restaurant definetely. :)
Great pizza and cool covered terrace. Right outside city walls. I would go again:) . You can make reservations via Email if you like.

We went here on a night that the temperature dropped dramatically and the wind was howling. They “served” blankets to each patron and had heat lamps on top of that. Any restaurants that recognizes this need deserves a plus. But on top of this the food was excellent. We had fish soup and vegetarian risotto. The soup was very good and the vegetarian risotto was so good we took home leftovers to eat for dinner the next night. We also had John Dorey fillet, a first, and we truly enjoyed the fish. The wait staff was outgoing and went out of their way to be helpful. This is one of a couple of “brother/sister” restaurants which was more moderate than the other. Well worth the visit ambience (blankets on a cold night), food and service.
Ate a yummy pizza and had great drinks at one of the best terrace views outside of the Old City... look upon the walls and fortress in awe as you eat and drink!
This is a must ! Great view and food , service great. GOT fans - you overlook the bay and Kings Landing . Food was good and what an atmosphere

This resto has it all! Has an excellent location just as you approach Pile Gate, dubrovnik entrance, and not only can you enjoy the waters and view but also a great meal with nice team serving you. We enjoyed this tremendously! You get discount if you eat at the group restos, panorama and arsenal ..., we tried and loved all 3
Excellent food and service. I was here last week and I could not decided which meal to take because there was so many choice. I took the Dubravka beefsteak and it was delicious.

We visited twice and on both occasions we really enjoyed out visit. If you want a guaranteed view of the old walls and the bay then make sure you reserve, at least a day before! If you don't reserve but want still want a good view then arrive before 7 to not be disappointed. The staff here were so lovely, taking good care of us and serving with a smile. I'd definitely recommend the seafood risotto, it's under a starter but it's definitely big enough to be a main! The prices here are extremely fair, especially taking into account the view and you can be sure that everyone will be happy with a wide range of foods offered on the menu, both traditional and more conventional. Wouldn't definitely return again if I come back to Dubrovnik! Thank you to all staff! 

(Note: the adjoining souvenir shop and exchange service also offer great services with pretty good exchange rates, so I'd definitely pop by if you are visiting the restaurant!)

Located right at the main gate to the old city I went in expecting a tourist trap of overpriced mediocrity. Time was a factor so we barged in for lunch. Turned out pretty good! The view and some of the best restaurant service we had all trip was worth the up charge. From hostess to server to busser all staff gave friendly above Balkan average level of help. Food was good, not over the top good but nothing to find fault with. Reliable. Certainly above mediocre. I can recommend this spot for a good experience.

We were early for our walking tour and stopped in for breakfast. The views from our table of the fort and the sea was just amazing. Staff were nice and friendly and the breakfast was really good. Just a little too expensive for what we had.

The food is great, the service is polite and the setting and views are superb - and the prices are good too. You expect a place like this to be an over-priced tourist-trap.. but it isn't. Fried squid was excellent ( a really easy dish to get wrong). The food is not too fussy and haut-cuisine, mostly local and Italian style.

Situated outside pile gate bus station. Nice restaurant with views of the sea and city walls. 
A little pricey as in tourist area but food was amazing. 
Had grilled squid. Perfecto. Amazingly tasty and beautifully presented.

Just enjoyed an evening meal here - the views are lovely over the sea and walls. 
Service is a bit slow, it was busy but had quietened down by the time we were eating. The only strange thing was we waited a while for my husbands starter, then they brought it out along with my main course. Then my hubby had to eat alone with his main course. Just seemed a bit odd the way the meals were brought out! The food was good, and a lovely setting.

If you can wait and get a table at the rail you will be well pleased. Even if you have to sit back you will still be impressed with what you see. The food was above average, it the atmosphere that makes this place. The staff were great.

In a busy area like Dubrovnik it was lovely to have really good food.The staff were smartly dressed and gave really good friendly service.We visited twice during our stay.First we had steaks and then the second visit was a beef salad.The steak was beautiful.Its not too costly and if you look around where you are staying you might find their 10%discount card.Around the left side is a quieter seating area which we enjoyed rather than out the front.

Our 1st night in Dubrovnik found this restaurant very close to old town,nice setting. Service was ok we ordered fish and lamb it arrived in about 7 minutes as if it was pre cooked very disappointing. Its was like canteen food and not cheap.wont be going back.

Went here after visiting one of its sister sites (Arsenal) 

Stunning view of the fort with probably the best seafood salad in Dubrovnik.

Considering the location of the restaurant they could have charged a lot more for the food but everything was fair and good value.

We ate at this restaurant twice on our 4 night stay in Dubrovnik. The prices were reasonable and a wide range of choice on the menu. The waitresses/waiters were also very friendly and even took our picture when asked :).
The house wine was also very nice, as well as an extensive cocktail menu.
It is an added bonus that this restaurant has the same view as the neighbouring restuarant Nautika, but you will eat for a fraction of the price!
Excellent service surroundings and food. Were in Dubrovnik for 4 days and once discovered the gem ate there each day.... Recommended.

We enjoyed our evening so much, the view was great, the wine perfect and we ordered muscles and risotto which was yummy! A litte more expensive but with te view and the kindest and funniest waiters it was worth it.

For the location we assumed we would be ripped off here, but we were in a hurry and had a tour that started right outside so room the chance. Excellent views of the city and water outside. I had the tomato soup and tuna salad and my friend had the chicken salad. All were good, and priced as expected but not high for the tourist area we were in. Being that we were in a hurry, we of course had a slight delay in getting our food but I don’t think we would have noticed that otherwise.

We visited this restaurant four times during our visit, food was delicious every time. Service was excellent, very organised and staff are knowledgeable about the dishes and are happy to advise. 

Would highly recommend the king prawns and the catch of the day - beautifully cooked and delicious. Pizza great too. Reasonably priced for Dubrovnik and very popular.

After walking around Fort Lovrijanec we were desperate for a much needed refreshing drink & rest. 
This restaurant is in the very busy area of Amerling Fontana (where all the buses stop) Due to its location I didn’t have any great expectations, just wanted a drink & rest my feet. 
However, once we were seated with amazing views of Dubrovnik City Walls & Fort Lovrijanec we quickly changed our minds & decided to share a late lunch (pizza) 
Sat there for a good hour enjoying our food & the beautiful views. 
We were in there at about 4pm so probably a quiet time for them but it was very peaceful while we were there & at no time did we feel we were at one of the busiest locations in Dubrovnik. 
Surpassed our expectations.

Got straight off the bus from the airport and decided we needed a beer and some food. Ordered two large beers and share a Pizza. Pizza and beer was good and service was very fast. Be warned though that Dubrovnik is pricy.

Were able to get onto the terrace near the wall without a reservation and loved the scenery and setting. We even had accompanying soft music played live. 

The waiters were all really friendly and lovely and the pizzas we had were all delicious. Didn’t try any of the other decision (this time round) but if we have time will definitely come back. 

As we had the Dubrovnik card we received a 10% discount.

Ate here on the last night of our holiday having been given a discount card when we dined at the Panorama restaurant. We were given a table with great views and really enjoyed our meal. I can recommend the Jumbo king prawns which was the best meal I had all week.The ice cream dessert was very good and so was the wine. Our waiter was very helpful and efficient.

This is one of the most beautiful locations for a meal. A reservation is recommended if you would like to sit near the outside wall, where the view is amazing. The prawns cooked in garlic with squid ink pasta is particularly tasty. We had a thoroughly enjoyable evening in this gorgeous setting.

we didnt have a reservation but took a chance and was told we had to wait 15mins which was ok, but 5 mins in a party of four comes along and gets a table straight away. while we were waiting a couple wanted to book a table 4 nights away and that took at least 10mins. they went away worried that they still didnt have a table for that night. they rely on these microphones when they should just be using computers to look things up. but getting back to our dinner. the service was very good and the food was excellent. good sizes. we just had the house wines and they were very good. the view is very good also. didnt like the lighting in the place - had to use my phone to see the menu. but overall a good place to eat.

We went here on our 1st night. Initially I was surprised as most restaurants serve very similar food (pizza & pasta). The view was amazing & service was great. I had a steak which was gorgeous. Like most places in Dubrovnik it was pricey. £92 for a shared starter, mains with wine & an Irish coffee.

We had tried one restaurant with an Indian name for lunch , but found it to be Bosnian. It was more towards meat dishes. So we decided to try Dubravka.
We tried some pizza, risotto , fish and pancake.
It was well prepared. The best thing was it was served very fast.
Good place .
Lovely ice cream parlour at the side of the restaurant near Pile gate. 5 stars to the staff who gave our little boy a small free ice cream and a balloon - great touch.

Went to this restaurant as a last resort for an evening meal, after having read bad reviews I was expecting to be charged a ridiculous amount for average/ below average food in this ‘typical tourist trap’. However, after a slightly abrupt welcome by one waitress we were sat down in a nice spot and proceeded to order our meals. A pasta dish, the grilled prawns with side orders of grilled veg and chips. The food was fantastic, all cooked very well - favourite was the prawns, they were of a great size and tasted very fresh. Two different desert dishes, both recommended by our waitress and both were great. Excellent service throughout, lovely live music in the background and a really nice way to spend the evening.

We'd bought Dubrovnik Cards primarily for bus usage but they also included access to the city walls, some museums & a discount at several good restaurants, Dubravka 1836 being one of them. Our hotel was in the port region & as we were catching the bus in to Pile Gate most days the restaurant was easy to check out at it's situated right by the Pile Gate bus terminus. The area is particularly hectic & while this may not sound enticing, the further you go into the outside area of the restaurant, the farther away from the hectic area you get & we were seated at a quiet table overlooking the Adriactic which was beautiful & seemed a million miles away from the bus terminus behind. Service was very good & my dining partner opted for beefsteak Dubravka with croquettes & mustard sauce while I went for went for pork, broccoli & croquettes in a gorgonzola sauce both of which were very good.. We unusually did a lot of desserts this holiday - this time a creme caramel for my dining partner while I went for a fruit salad with marischino cherry. Our wine & food was really good & with excellent service & a beautiful location plus a 10% discount was an absolute no brainer. Recommended.

We found the place ideal by its location close to the old city walls, its casual chic atmosphere and convenient by service quality. The waiters are friendly and helpful (ours even accepted to seat us in an another area of the terrace for us to have a nicer view over the walls and the sea). I personally, appreciated very much the desserts:)

All restaurants and cafés in Dubrovnik are overpriced. This one delivers good food, excellent service and many of the tables have beautiful views of the sea, city walls and fort. Nice menu. Al fresco. Worth visiting.

Obviously loads of restaurants around Dubrovnik sell various fish dishes. They are all good but when you're paying quite a bit more for calamari than you would inside of the walls then it makes you feel like you've been had. 

Typical tourist trap, doesn't take away from the niceness of the place though. The views are great, better at night when the historic walls and fort are lit up. 

If you fancy going where everyone else does, this is the place.
This restaurant is in a beautiful setting with a lovely relaxed atmosphere and very tasty food and wine!

This restaurant has a very nice view in the city walls. We ate spaghetti Bolognese, spaghetti kozicama, feta salata and we drank water and beer.. The food was really good and the staff very polite. The next morning we had an excellent breakfast at the same place.. In this place you can have a lot of choices in various dishes...

We weren’t too sure about this place as it’s in such a touristy area but the food looked good whilst were looking at the menu. Gave it a go and loved it! Food was amazing and not overly priced. There’s a cellist playing and he views are second to none. We were lucky enough to have an amazing fireworks display in the harbour too!
Came without booking, very attentive service. I had the fish rissoto daughter had the tagliatelle. Quick service and reasonable for the city of dubrovnik

We had dinner here and was such a beautiful setting overlooking the walls and bay. Food was delicious, and the service excellent. One of the best meals we had travelling around Croatia. Well worth the visit. Need to make a reservation for the terrace.

We arrived here on our first night, extremely tired and pretty much went to the first restaurant we saw. Little did we know it is part of a chain of 3 restaurants in Dubrovnik and delicious! We had a table by the water and good service. I had the seafood linguine and my partner had the squid. For desert we had one of the cakes of the day the apple pie which was delicious. The pasta dish I would say was a large portion, but the squid was smaller, and so if you are hungry perhaps lean towards the pasta dishes. Also i would add that some of the restaurants in the old town are much more expensive so another reason I would recommend this.

You have to learn how to serve capuccino and coffee generally. It was only foam... its a pity in a so beautiful place... its expensive... they dont bring together water and biscuits. It doesnt worth to visit this place.

Its the first restaurant we went to after arriving Dubrovnik. The view was nice, service was pleasant enough however FOOD WAS BAD! 

We ordered grilles seabass and it was dry and didnt taste at all like grill at all, more like baked. It was the WROST FISH DISH i had in Croatia and I have had more than 10 times fish dish in my trip here. The fish dish came with some broccoli its the most terrible broccoli I've eaten in a restaurants its mushy and tasteless. Better not to serve this kind of veggies if they dont even know how to simply make brokolli s, replace with salad! 

We also ordered a margarita pizza it was too salty. A simple pizza but not done well either. Save your money go eat else where there are plenty of restaurants with great views. Take a cable car up to the mountain and enjoy much better view, food and services. This place is alright for a drink dont order food here!!!

Lovely location for a meal in Dubrovnik. 

We had two plates of Pasta/Risotto which were huge! 

Quick service considering how busy it was!

Having completed a steaming hot walk around the wall of the city (stunning) we had booked lunch here. Seated outside by the wall the restaurant was vibrant the view is interesting as it’s mainly wall! But if you stand up you can see down to the bay which is filled with bright orange and red canoes being rented for trips. The food was typical pasta pizza and steak. Inside was closed which was strange as it was the only air conditioned area.... in 35c
Dinner with a view! Had a very reasonaby priced dinner with my family at this restaurant! My spaghetti was lovely and sitting on the terrace was exceptional
Very popular and busy restaurant. Food was nice and service was good. Wine very good. Lovely dining view which is the main attraction I would say.

Best prices for what you get, never had to wait and the waitstaff was very friendly. Ended up being our go to when we just wanted a meal without being inundated but the heat and tourist inside the walls

Previously in 2016 i criticized this restaurant for the poor food that my wife was served.But wanted to try the food again,give it another chance.
But this time around she wanted to try out the Lamb fillet with the hash brownies and green beans,thought that the hash brownies was a strange combination but she loved it, in fact she likes lamb dishes and having tried it in about 30 countries that we have visited she has said that this was the best ever.I had the Chicken fillet with peppers and aubergine mines was simple but was tasty.On our last night we always return to the restaurant where we had the best experience, my wife wanted that lamb fillet again and was not disappointed . I again simply had the Spaghetti Bolognese which is served as a starter,no way that is a starter more of a main course,i could not finish it, no complaints.
Great location, great view. Restaurant a bit expensive. The food was nice, the service good. Very busy and noisy

Stopped in while in town. Quick service, nice service. Offered us several 'local' dishes, cheese and beers. Absolutely beautiful location on the water! It was large enough to accommodate our group with speedy service. But don't take me wrong, when I say speedy, that's good. They did not rush us, we were excited to see the city!!!
Situated just outside the walls of the city, so a little quieter than those inside the city, this is the perfect place to relax and enjoy great food in Dubrovnik.

Great location just at the entrance to the Old Town with great views from the terrace and staff who cannot be faulted.

However, the food is mediocre at best, very disappointed. 

Booked on recommendation from TripAdvisor, which can often mean that things aren’t all they’re cracked up to be.

This restaurant is just outside the city walls and hence very reasonably priced compared to those within the old town. It is vegeterian friendly and portions were more than sufficient for one person. We ordered 2 pizzas and 2 pastas.. would definitely recommend their penne arabiatta. The service was very good and they give a 10% discount card that you can use on the second visit..

When we arrived to Dubrovnik, we went to this place without any advice. Just found it, ask for the table and order the food. Fried squid and John Dory fish. Especially this fish is very good. We visited this place again, and also tried beefstak and fish carpaccio. Also very very good.

We had breakfast at this place. The omelet is not delicious but good. Croissant is average. They tried to make us happy. The location is also very good. 
 I can recommend for breakfast.

This place was excellent for Lunch, so much so that we came back here almost every day. The portions were a good size, the prices weren’t too high considering other local restaurants and the restraint catered for Gluten Free diners, providing complimentary GF Bread and adapting meals to suite. We particularly enjoyed the Chicken Salad with added Feta and Lettuce.

Had a lovely meal here of veal, potatoe rosties and rice, all beautifully cooked. My husband had the pork medallions on Gorgonzola sauce and if I had eaten there again I would have chosen that dinner as the flavour was super.

When you are seated you are offered bread and oils which is nice to nibble at while you are chatting. The staff were nice but I think we were a little forgotten. Service seemed super for everyone else I just think we got a little forgotten but this defiantly wasn’t typical. 

Location was super and the restaurant faces the walls of Dubrovnik and overlook the bay (for game of thrones fans this would be kings landing bay, beach and port). So super location. 

I always look at the vegetarian section of menus as my niece is vegetarian and it was one of the best I’d seen during my 12 days stay. 

I would definitely eat here again.
Awesome location, great menu and food, lovely service, great wine selection, reservation required for seating with amazing views.

After finishing the sightseeing bus tour we were all in need of a cleansing ale. 
Dubravka seated us easily and drinks orders were taken. Our meals came quickly and we settled into a casual lunch. Everyone was happy with their choices particularly the seafood salad. 
Our waiter was superb and engaged with us on All Blacks versus Australia which is playing today. 
Would highly recommend this venue for lunch.
The food here is fantastic, and the view is breathtaking. The stuff is kind as well! Prices are not too bad either.

We turned up at 6pm without a reservation and were shown to a table straight away. Right from the offset the service was fantastic! I ordered the stuffed tomatoes, which were technically part of the starter menu but our waiter said the portion size was somewhere between a starter and a main. Once it arrived the portion size was as I expected, not small but also not huge. The waiter then brought me a spoon (as the sauce was difficult to eat with a fork) as well as a complimentary basket of bread, as she thought I might still be hungry. This showed me that the staff here are willing to go the extra mile for their customers. We had a fantastic dining experience and enjoyed delicious food in a stunning location. I'd definitely recommend Dubravka restaurant!

Ate here based on my taxi driver’s recommendation. Has Croatian and Italian food including delicious pizza. Tried seafood and pizza, all excellent. There is English menu and the staff is great. I forgot my cell phone and when I returned back it was kept carefully by our waiter-so grateful for that gesture. Plenty of seating, nice ambience.
Lovely views! Waiters were friendly and the service was quick. We just had drinks but the food also looked lovely!

We are a dish recommended to us- Dalmatian rib-eye steak but my steak was very grissly and my husbands meal was very oily- we ate what we could but the waiter asked us if everything had been ok as he’d noticed we’d left food- so we just told him (but were not at all difficult about it) We then ordered dessert/coffee- the manager came over to see us to personally apologise and brought us a special drink each - which was very nice and totally unexpected. When the bill came we were also not charged for either main course- again totally unexpected! Amazing customer service in a very busy and popular restaurant!

Right outside the Pile gate is this lovely terrace filled with awning covers tables and reasonably priced plates. We stopped in for breakfast and while it took a while to get our order or the bill, staff were friendly, kind and helpful. Would be interested to check out their other two locations in the city - probably very, very crowded at night.
Very friendly & helpful staff- unfortunately we were sat outside and it rained! But the staff quickly set up umbrellas. Food was very nice and well priced- got a veggie pizza for 84kn.

Had a nice spaghetti Bolognese 
Here with family my daughter had pizza wife tagliateli all the food and service was great with a nice view 
Over a bay used in game of thrones
And you can pay by cash or card
We went back to the restaurant a few times whilst in Dubrovnick as we felt wE couldn’t find anywhere else that was better

Arrived in Dubrovinik and walked around the old town and ended up at this lovely restaurant - beautifully set with great views, for a cold cocktail at 4.00 in the afternoon and ended up staying there until 9.00 as the menu was very appealing for dinner as well and the staff were very friendly and patient! Visited it again 2 days later! All their sister restaurants are equally very pleasing !

We went for breakfast and we are very dissapointed in terms of quality of food. Bread was not fresh, butter was ice cold, omelette was more like a crepe filled with cold tomato and cubes of cheese. There wasn’t anything that could go wrong in the fruit salad so that was ok.
The view is one of the best in town however and the price is good (80ku pp for breakfast).

Was looking for a nice place to enjoy our last dinner in Dubrovnik. Found this restaurant on trip advisor. We called in advance and tried to make a reservation but were told that the restaurant wasn’t taking anymore reservations but that we should just show up (the hostess kindly recommended that we show up at either 7 or 9 to avoid having to stand in line). In the end we showed up at 7:30 and didn’t have to wait at all. Food was delicious and service was very fast and pleasant, and combined with the pleasant music from the live band playing and the nice scenery made for the perfect last dinner. Thank you!

We visited this restaurant twice as it is very convenient being close to the old town entrance gate and bus stop to return back to hotel.
The Dubravka cake was delicious.
They were also very happy for guests to stop and just have drinks if that's all you wanted unlike the Gallus opposite who turned us away!! They missed out as we were very happy to spend our money at The Dubravka

Eating in Dubrovnik can be expensive, this restaurant offers reasonably priced food in an excellent location - and only a stones throw away from one of the most expensive places in town. 
The service is good and the food is of a high standard, particularly the sea food as you'd expect. However I had a chicken pasta dish was was excellent too. 
If you want a drink, skip the cocktails and go straight for the house wine, its decent with the food and again, reasonably priced for the full liter carafe you get.

We loved the view and the seafood risotto. The Dalmatian pizza was just ok it tasted like the sauce was not homemade or tasty. Lacked flavor. Definitely not comparable to Italian Italy style pizza but enough to hit the spot. 

An evil pigeon landed on our table into our risotto and the manager was kind enough to take care of us or offer us a new risotto. Since the evil pigeon sat all up in our risotto! Rude pigeons lol 

Great place for being near old town just outside of Pile gate. 

Not the best food I’ve had in Croatia though!

The restaurant has a great view overlooking Pile gate and the bay, but this is where it ends. We are students and this restaurant's cheapest meals were just about in our price range. First of all, my Sex On The Beach cocktail tasted like juice and had a piece of dry crusty grapefruit attached to it that looked like it was chopped 2 days ago. 
The food was very disappointing. My boyfriend was very disappointed with his prawns and his measly bowl of rice that looked almost conjealed. I ordered a lasagne Bolognese as this was one of the only things within my budget. It was dry, it was chewy and it was crusty and not in a good way. I had to douse it in oil to even be able to swallow it. 

I understand that as a coastal town this restaurant may specialise in fancy seafood dishes, but if you can't even get a simple lasagne right, please sort yourselves out.

Spent a fabtastic week in Dubrovnik with family and friends. Dubravka Restaurant is in a fabulous setting close to the Pile gate and overlooking the walls. We enjoyed two fantatstic evening dinners in the restaurant. Our table on the first night was inside - we didnt book a table and were accomodated. On our second night we requested a table outside on the terrace and it's a unique setting. Fantastic food and really great staff. We almost went back a third time.....

My boyfriend and I stopped here for lunch today. It was lovely. Paul had the prawn pasta (had so much garlic) if you're not a fan of garlic!! I had the salmon salad which was nice but drenched in Caesar dressing. The views were lovely and good service.
Good food and good position. Lasagne was really good. The mussels and fries was very tasty although the mussels were on the very small side! Overall decent.
Food is tasty and delicious.the place is very nice on the walls of dubrovnik.the staff is verh nice and smiley
We enjoyed some cocktails & the most amazing cheesecake during our visit! The view is amazing! Staff were very helpful & friendly! Deff would recommend!

This restaurant is ideally located just outside the city's gate. The view of the walls and ocean is amazing. Great outdoor eating space. Great place to watch the sunset. Please ask for Maris to make your experience even more memorable.
The place is great, clean and with very good service, the Manu is large enough to repeat the following day. The views incredible

My friends and I arrived at Dubravka 1836, and the minute we came we’re given the most incredible service I have received during my entire stay in Dubrovnik.
 
Not only was our server Jasmin incredibly friendly and funny, he was super easy to talk to and was constantly making sure we had enough food and drinks. 

The food itself was jaw dropping delicious. I’ve never had such amazing sea bass, Swiss chard + potato, and feta salad. My friend who ordered the pasta also said it was incredible. As for drinks - definitely get the house wine. It was also perfect! 

The view was also beautiful, even at 9pm with the lights hitting the old town wall beautifully. 

I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone visiting Dubrovnik/stari grad. 

Thank you for making our evening so memorable. I/we really appreciated it!

My 3 friends and I stopped in here after arriving in Dubrovnik as it was very close to our apartment. The food was lovely, I ordered tagliatelle seafood which was very tasty! Pizza also very good as well as the spaghetti bolognese. Service was slightly slow as we arrived during a busy period but all staff were lovely. Views onto the sea and city walls are also lovely! Would recommend to anyone coming to dubrovnik!
Good food and good service 😊 The restaurant was full booked, but after 2 minutes we had a table. We had a Prosecco Sorbèt after dinner, gooood 😋
Decided to go for breakfast here as there was a queue for dinner. Lovely sitting by the sea and would recommend. Good price for the location
Great location and breakfast to start your trip around the old town. Not cheap but simple, quick, relaxed and quality.
Dinner here was super lovely views - quite a busy area but a great place to eat. Easy to walk to the Old Town from location. Very picturesque setting even at night time.
Lovely outdoor seating. Very good value especially given location. Pasta starters are large enough to be mains. Highly recommend

My son and I have just enjoyed a lovely dinner at the Dubravka Restaurant. The food and the ambiance were wonderful but what made it for us was the service we enjoyed at the restaurant. Jasmin was our waiter and he couldn’t have been more attentive - he really made our evening. We would certainly highly recommend this restaurant and shall be returning tomorrow - excellent service, food, atmosphere and value for money!

Myself and my girlfriend dined here one evening when we were in Dubrovnik. The setting is beautiful, set amongst some trees just outside the walls, and along the seafront. There was live music playing on the background which added to the ambience. The food and service were both very good and I'd happily return here

Having just completed a walk of the walls we chose this restaurant because of its location just outside of Pile gate with a nice view of the sea. The food and service were excellent and I would recommend this restaurant to anyone visiting the old town. As an added bonus they offer 10% discount if you have a Dubrovnik card or have eaten in one of their 3 restaurants before. Well worth a visit.

June 19, 2018 - After kayaking, we stopped at the take out ice cream section of the Dubravka 1836 Restaurant. We each got two scoops of ice cream to eat while waitinf or our local bus to take us back to the port to catch our cruise ship. The ice cream was delicious and cost a total of 4.51 euro or 32 Kuna (Croatian currency).

Highly recommend on a hot day at Dubrovnik near the main gate and near the bus stop.

Lovely views of the bay with the crowded bus queues for the cruise ships on the other side. We planned to have a quick snack but the waiter was so charming we had a proper lunch everything we had was very good and beautifully presented

We called for dinner before going into the old town

Very dark but great setting 

Service was very good

My chicken pasta was super 

My wife risotto was a little bit much and a little bit wet 

Would I go back 

Yes

We booked a table on the terrace for dinner.view was great.service friendly and efficient.shared chicken tagliatelle to start - great sauce and pasta.had a pizza and the prawns with garlic sauce and squid ink pasta.enjoyed everything especially the pasta.prices reasonable for the location and food quality.you get 10% discount with Dubrovnik card.would have liked to return if we had more time in Dubrovnik

We went here on our last night and it was fantastic! 

We sat out on the terrace which looks out at the city walls and fort(for game of thrones fans....blackwater bay). 

The staff were all very nice and attentive, the head waiter even recommended a lovely cocktail of vidka, prosecco and lemon sorbi 👌🏻

We also had the house wine with our meal which was nice and some cocktails, Dubravka mule, strawberry daiquiri and a bbc....all delicious! 

Our meals were the lamb, pizza and chicken tagliatelle again delicious! 

We then shared a dessert of Dubravka cake....yum! 

Would recommend visiting this restaurant as very good value for money especially based on its location to the old town!

Great atmosphere, we enjoyed the saxophonist’s playlist, it”s really nice especially if you look for these kind of musical moments.
We ordered seafood salad, which was very tasty, we also had ravioli with smoked ham (it was a good choice)and tagliatelle with seafood,but my boyfriend didn t like them so much,and we don’t recommend it.

We ate here three times during our stay in Dubrovnik which shows how much we enjoyed it. The food was delicious and the service friendly and fast. Book to guarantee a table with a view; it is worth it!

Arrived without a booking and told it would be 15 minutes. Waited an hour and ended up being forced into a hot location with no view despite there being two much better tables come up at the same time. They clearly don’t want families here or want to look after the locals. Great location, food was ok standard but service quality a real problem.
If you want good qality fish & seefood in a good place with nice views this is your choice ! 😍 Fresh inside & outside

5 of us had dinner here. An excellent gin cocktail with rosemary and rose buds got the evening off to a good start for my wife.
