My gin martini was just what I needed after a day sightseeing in Cavtat. The waiters were very friendly and efficient. The service was quick but we weren’t rushed. All our meals were tasty and plentiful. We all thoroughly enjoyed our experience. It is a popular venue so it is advisable to book a few days in advance. Reasonable prices by Dubrovnik standards and well worth a visit.

I was hesitant to come to what seemed to be such a crowded, tourist trap even though our concierge recommended it. I'm so thankful that we did though! The food was fresh and delicious, the views are stellar (insist on a good table) and the service was friendly if slow. Enjoy!

The food is delicious! What's funny I like the service as much as food. They are so kind, friendly and pleasant. I suggest this restaurant to everyone who wants to find a little paradise in a busy working day.
We had a dinner here which was lovely. Great if you can get a seat out on the deck overlooking the ocean. Great service.

Went here for lunch after picking up our Dubrovnik cards as it offered a discount that made the price a little more reasonable. The views are lovely sitting outside, even from the tables a bit further back. Pizzas were decent and a good size, and service was pretty quick. In the end they never even looked at our Dubrovnik card other than flashing, so it didn’t need validating to get the discount...

Came here on a Thursday evening at about 8pm. Waited only 5 mins for a table which seemed good as was very busy! Treated excellently by ladies at front desk and this continued by our waiters who were all lovely and attentive. Food came quickly and was delicious - very tasty and full of flavour. Bread and oil/balsamic to start and a lemon sorbet desert was a lovely touch! Would recommend and 100% will be going back before the end of our holiday! Thank you

We had dinner at this restaurant on our first night in Dubrovnik and really enjoyed the meal. The service was really good as well. We were all given a 10% discount voucher for a next visit. 

We visited the Restaurant again a few days later for Lunch. Again really good food and service.

City Tour was brilliant well worth a look and then having walked around in the heat and needing some food and drink we stumbled across the 1836 restaurant, easily seated 7 of us and were very happy to alter the menu to meet Gluten and Dairy free requirements, the waitress was very informed about the food content which gave us a lot of confidence about ordering the best for us. Service was superb and views over the bay were stunning also nice and cool as Temperatures were up to about 35 degrees.
 Food was excellent with plenty of choices I would recommend the Sea Bass superb taste and very fresh - well worth a visit if you are in Dubrovnik

You wouldn’t expect a place in such an excellent convenient location, right outside one of the gates to the old town, to try very hard with the food or service - but both were great on our visit - and very fair prices too.

Accidentally found Cafe Dubrovnik, it must have been the luck brought by drinking from the fountain in the Old Town. Beautiful outdoor setting under cool trees, with spectacular view across the ocean and the old wall. (Game of Thrones Fans this is a must!) very, very polite and friendly staff, (hi Maris 😊). Prosecco, prawns, perfect. Watching the world go by in this oasis in the middle of a busy city (literally... lots of tourists). THE BEST bread I have had in 7 weeks on my travels.... amazing fresh prawns with just a hint of spice in the delicious sauce. I guess you can see I’m a big fan!!!! Can’t wait to come back to Dubrovnik and this great cafe. ❤️

great place to dine, for lunch or for dinner.
Great food, great service, would recommend. We had some seafood and pizza as well, both very good, just a great place.

This restaurant is ideally located with views towards the walls. It serves good food for a not so expensive price according to Dubrovnik standards. In euros, that means 15-20 euros per main meal. The sizes are big. What I really liked here was the service. We were sat down at a table and ordered cocktails. We didn't even realize how fast the time was passing until the waiter came to us to apologize the food is taking so long and offered us another round of cocktails on the house. I then checked the watch and 25 minutes had passed. Talk about service.
Mario made our birthday celebration even more fun with his sense of humour and surprise dessert. View of Adriatic Sea and Old Town walls to boot! Food was delicious!

We had earmarked this restaurant as one to visit for a more upmarket dinner during our trip and it didn’t disappoint. Excellent service from the off as they ensured we got a seat right on the edge of the restaurant with the best view.

The food was excellent and I’d definitely recommend the wild garlic prawns with squid ink pasta. Don’t be put off by the colour, it tastes pretty much the same as regular pasta.

Given it’s proximity to the bus station and city walls, it is quite pricey but we thought it was well worth it. Total 400kn for two drinks and two mains.

Worth noting that this group of restaurants give out a 10% discount card so if you visit one of them make sure to pick one up.

We wanted to eat good food, seafood and local with nice wine and a view on the old city on the waterfront. Well we got it. For sure when you will go to Dubrovnik go eat here. Staff is very friendly and efficient. I would go here again if I would pass by.

Stopped by at 23:30 pm for some cocktails, at about 10€ which is quite okay. Nice, comfortable seating with a nice view on the bay and castle walls. Soothing, relaxing, athmosphere. Cake was nice also.
We went here on our first day in Dubrovnik for lunch. My son and I shared a pizza and it was good and filling. reasonably priced too. We went again the next day for breakfast again very nice.

We went here for dinner around sunset, and it was beautiful! Sit outside as close to the wall as you can for great views! The food was good, and the service was excellent! We ate at Nautika the night before....so if you want a great view with moderately priced food...go here instead!!!

We ate here 3 or 4 times during our stay in Dubrovnik late July 2018. 
Considering its proximity to the Old Town and the bus-stops, this seems like an "obvious" choice for people who either have just gotten to town or are just leaving. 

In spite of the restaurant being very busy, we never had to wait for a table and the view is nothing short of beautiful overlooking a small cove, city walls and a fortress on a cliff. 
Food and drinks were served in a timely fashion and was tasty. Prices wasn't half bad either, especially considering the popular location. Pleasant staff and an overall good atmosphere.
Great food. Excellent service. Spectacular view of the sea and the fortress. Went here twice in 3 days because it was so good
Enjoyed our Dinner at the terace of Dubrovnka restaurant. Waiting line was not long. Service very fast and nice (thank you Dario :)) enjoyed our food and the live music. Definitely good to go!

We are in Dubrovnik on a special tour. My wife and I decide just to walk out of the hotel and follow our senses for a memorable dinner. When we approach the Dubravka 1836 restaurant, we are asked if we have a reservation. While we say no, the manager decides that he will accommodate us. He leads us to a table for two along the wall overlooking the ocean and the great wall of Dubrovnik.

My wife loves her dish of vegetables grilled to perfection. My king prawns are excellent. And, the ambience. We are seated next to the duet of keyboard and muted trumpet playing great old favorites. I begin a dialog with the trumpet player by naming the tunes they are playing. As they start a new tune, I call out the name, and the trumpet player nods his approval.

This is an excellent and very popular restaurant with food, location, and ambience. If you get to Dubrovnik, I recommend Dubraka 1836 to you. It is one of three restaurants in the city that are owned by the same group. If you eat at one, you receive a 10% discount at any and all going forward. This is well worth it.
We only stopped for coffee and drinks but the service was nice and the food looked great. Definitely recommended for the view, come at dinner time if you want to avoid hordes of tourists.

We ate here on our first night as it seemed the most reasonable after seeing the prices in the walls. Very good Italian food and good service. I had seafood tagliatelle which was yummy and my partner had spaghetti which he loved. Nice setting that’s not going to cost you an arm and a leg.

This place has a great vibe and atmosphere, lovely delicious food and reasonable priced. My waitress Anita was very attentive and had great service!! Thank you
 
Would recommend a visit here if you're in town the view is worth it!!

Dubravka has the best gelato in Dubrovnik! Don’t waste your time getting it in Old Town. Step outside the gates and get it there. The owner makes it all from scratch and they are happy to share samples. We had the cheesecake, stracciatella and black chocolate, and they were all amazing!

Wonderful views form restaurant of the walls and fortress and for a very reasonable price. We had a litre of wine and 2 pizzas for just under £40. Very reasonable prices for beautiful views and fantastic service- felt like we could have been paying hundreds of pounds for it!

We ate here at our first night. Service was great and the food was good. The location is very good and the prices not so bad considering some of the prices around Dubrovnik. Not sure I’d visit again though.

The restaurant has common dishes so if you Are looking for something special you will not find It here but the second and most importane thing here is the view od the walls and Sea and that is something you have to Experience.

Finally a restaurant in Dubrovnik with high service standards, fresh and tasty food and a fair price. We had the mussels as a starter and pasta with seafood as the main. Our waitress was Maris , lovely , friendly and genuine person and restaurant.

Tried spaghetti with adriatic prawns, Apple pie and beer. Spagghetti taste good with fresh prawns. Apple pie is really good. Staffs are very friendly. On the next night, I decided to try restaurant from the same group at the other end of Dubrovnik old town.

We had two times delicious dinners in this restaurant. The venue is romantic outside the Pile gate and the staff service was kind and friendly. I highly recommend the dish "Mussels Buzara Style" which was the best mussels I have ever had (compared to Dubrovnik and Split restaurants). It was also a nice touch that we got free cocktail drinks from the kitchen in the end of the meal.

This was our final evening in Dubrovnik and this was an excellent place to spend it. Very nice food and excellent service from Ermin. The meal was well paced and we spent a lovely evening overlooking the water watching the boats, swifts and nightfall. Really very special.
Family meal - spaghetti Bolognese and pizza. Both where first class. Food cheap beer expensive. I live in England and that’s the best pizza from New York or England

Where does one begin? We were served by Ivana, who made the visit to the restaurant the absolute best. Everyone was extremely hospitable in the restaurant, ensuring that every one of our needs were satisfied. If you're reading this IVANA, you are amazing at your job and you have made my time in Dubrovnik so great, thank you for advising us with the menu...my parents and I left full and satisfied. 

We ended up ordering the Croation cheese plate, Chicken Salad, Sea food platter, Fried Squid, Mozarella and tomato salad and French fries (this was a lot for 3 people). The food was superb, literally one of the best quality seafood I've had. Quick service and great staff as well as great food literally made the restaurant 5*.

Just a little add, the view is beautiful from the restaurant, if you're sitting outside. Any pictures you take will look amazing with the view in the back.

Considering this is a real tourist trap I have to congratulate the owners as they run this place very efficiently. Food is of a decent standard and comes out super quick. Staff are also very polite and friendly. The view is amazing and a great place to sit and watch the world go by

Dubravka has a few restaurants in the area. We ate at two of them and enjoyed both meals. Additionally, they offer a 10% discount if you eat at multiple ones. I suspect you can just say you ate at another one and forgot the discount card. The food was pricey so I recommend trying.
Average breakfast but great view. Able to sit and watch the kayaks set off from the beach below and the wall of old town next to you.

Excellent unpretentious restaurant with amazing views and fair prices. We had some tasty mussels and salads and watched the sunset. Good seafood choices and friendly waitresses. Recommended for a light bite or full meal. Family friendly.

I visited this restaurant in the evening 3 times during our summer holiday! The food is absolutely divine, cocktails are wonderful and the location is unique. More so the staff are so attentive, friendly and go above and beyond. They even gave us a discount card as we had more than one visit for the other two restaurants that are owned by the same people. Would not go to Dubrovnik and not go here. Cannot fault it. 
(Anita and Jazmin were especially brilliant and are a credit to the restaurant)

We had lunch there yesterday.It’s very good restaurant my kids order pizza and it was very delicious and I order seafood and it was really tasty , and the service was excellent and was friendly and 
Helpful 
 Al Wahaibi family from OMAN

My wife and I stopped in for an iced tea this afternoon. The service was wonderful, with a smile and a joke from the waiter. The prices are very high, but you are paying for the location/view of the old town and the sea. I gave it 4 stars because the prices were steep, but the ambiance, location and service were all 5 star.
A unique setting. To compliment the ambiance, the food and service were also very good. Good value for money - especially the fresh seafood.

Overlooking the old city, just by Pile gate, this was a perfect spot to have dinner. A good selection of reasonably priced options and views over the old city and the sea. The food was good, as was the service.
What a gorgeous spot for a lovely breakfast and good coffee! Good service and reasonably priced. Al fresco dining at its finest!

Ideal spot to dine. Can go from dawn until well into the night. Have a meal or morning or afternoon tea. Food is very nice, fresh and tasty. Heaps of variety on the menu. Staff are nothing but professional.

We had breakfast twice - it was absolutely lovely and so sensibly priced. We had 1 lunch and 1 dinner here! Stunning seafood, lovely pasta and great selection of drinks. We would never normally go to the same place twice let alone 4 times during a holiday but we liked it so much! Service was a little difficult once or twice, but the staff were lovely and friendly, it was just hard to get their attention at times.

This was without doubt my favourite place during our whole stay!

Nice place with good food. Ate here my first night in town. 
Friendly staff, and nice athmosphere close to the sea.

We ate breakfast here twice. Our complete breakfasts came with omelets, bread, bowls of fresh fruit, orange juice and our choice of a hot beverage. The food was fresh and well prepared and the coffee drinks were excellent, and the service was great. We sat outside on both occasions in their large, covered outdoor area.

We had the privilege of being in Croatia for all of the World Cup soccer semis/grand final etc: what an amazing experience! 
We had a table (for ten) booked 9pm after the soccer game and the atmosphere was spectacular. We were celebrating a friends 50th birthday (belated because of cancer treatment) and the waiters made her feel SO special (sang her happy birthday with a slice of hazelnut torte/candle). 
You must book your table in peak season. Be prepared for an amazing dining experience: the view alone is spectacular (check subset times).
We even had fireworks that lit up the sky/wall/fort. Even though the Croatians lost their game they still celebrated and were so very excited (though there were still people that were devastated/crying).
Meals we ordered: several seafood risottos (one said it was the BEST she has ever had), grilled prawns, mussels (several people had this and were even given bibs), grilled chicken, creamy spaghetti (several) with (small) prawns. Everyone LOVED their meal: NOT ONE COMPLAINT!
Luckily I had mosquito repellent in my bag (for everyone) as there were lots of mosquitos!
There are lots of options to chose from which would cater for all price ranges. Drinks comparable to other restaurants.
Wonderful live music: vocals, keyboard and saxophone. AMAZING!
Definitely recommend. 
All of us felt this was a perfect way to end a day in Dubrovnik.

We came here more than once during our week stay in Dubrovnik.
The food was lovely and reasonably priced. The staff were always very friendly and helpful.

Try and get a table outside near the wall for a lovely view. You won't be disappointed!

Our second visit to this restaurant
Vegetarian food was delicious. Service good. Perfect sea views and great location. Prices okay with the discount card.

In port from a NCL cruise. Stopped here first for lunch. It is a beautiful view and the food was wonderful. We had mussels, appetizers and drinks. The staff was very friendly and social. Highly recommended.

The food was okay, we ate at a fancy and top 11 restaurant in the city the night before for the same price. So to sum it up, it was a bit expensive here just to have an avarage dinner. It was an okay dinner.
Restaurant over looking the water. Pretty view but we were not right on terrace. Rocket salad was good. Everyone liked their salads. Great pizza.

We came here on our first night in Dubrovnik and it was a lovely welcome to the city! Staff were so attentive without being too much, and the food was delicious and affordable too. Just lovely, thank you!

I enjoyed a very nice dinner and I waited 5 min to get a table near to the sea side in a cery busy and crowdy Friday! The food was very good made, tasty and the local wine proposed by the staff was exactly what I wanted at that time. Nice location, good food and Nice sun set to remember!

Located at the edge of the old town, with views over the sea, fabulous. This was our second time in Dubrovnik and we went back to this restaurant because we loved it. Staff are very welcoming, extensive menu, good quality food.

Firstly I ordered arrabiata with chicken . It was a very tasty homemade sauce ! The food was good and what you'd expect but what stood out is the level of service as the waiters and waitresses were very kind and polite at all times and the view is stunning!

The view is great if you can get a seat nearer to the sea. The seafood risotto was nicely cooked but the serving was slightly large for us since we are asians. Remember to ask for the discount card while paying the bill, which you can use on your next visit in dubravka or its sister restaurants.
Excellent food, fantastic service with a wonderful view. Couldn’t fault it. We had the chicken and steak.
The restaurant is more like pizzeria that some fine food restaurant but if you are sitting near the edge overlooking the waives crashing in the bottom the pizza becomes whole another experience
Excellent location, good food, nice stuff, I loved my salmon dish there 💜 Prices are normal for a Dubrovnik restaurant, they even give you some discount vaucher for a panorama restaurant
We had breakfast here one morning. Nice view from the outdoor seating. Menu was very basic with very limited choices. Good place to go on a weekend morning.

I had booked the previous day for a special occasion and requested table near the edge with a view. We wasn’t disappointed .We has a great table & View .
Both our starters were very tasty. tuna salad and seafood salad .
Mains and deserts were equally delicious. 
service was attentive and friendly. 

Overall a great dinner.

We were quite late as we landed in dubrovnik airport in the evening and we chose this restaurant following a recommandation. We were seated in front of the view outside and enjoyed our meals of grilled squid. Nice service and we did not wait long which was what i feared when i saw the size of the restaurant.

As long as you sit by the water, you will have a very memorable dinner. The food is good but with such view, food goes on a secondary plane. Ideally you need to make reservations to get the best tables. I was lucky I got a great table without any reservation

What a view and location!!! Stunning - the service was exceptionally fast and when I saw the menu I thought - OH - way too much choice here so the food will be average - I ordered the squid/calamari and when it arrived with a healthy option I was very surprised and it tasted really good.. not cheap but also not expensive - very happy with the food and service...

Nice setting and a full restaurant is always appealing, good reviews so we thought we’d give it a go. I had a salad with chicken which was dry and hardly any chicken and my husband had the moules which was a tiny portion and not the freshest either! It was a nice enough vibe with music and the shore, but was overpriced for the quality it says it is.
This restaurant is one of the best in Dubrovnik! With amazing views and fantastic food. The staff are extremely helpful and very friendly. Also very reasonably priced.

With an unbelievable view from the terrace the food needs to compliment the location. It does. We started with their special take on Gin and Tonic and then had to choose from a great selection from an extensive menu. The food was excellent, the service friendly and efficient and the whole experience was a pleasure.

My friend, sister and I ate dinner at this restaurant whilst we were visiting Dubrovnik. The staff were lovely and food was delicious! We ordered the spaghetti with prawns (they weren’t stingy on the prawns) and grilled chicken with veggies. The view was amazing, right outside the Walls of Dubrovnik.

I was in a hurry to go watch Croatia vs Russia match but I was hungry and wanted a nice meal.. I didn’t have a reservation but they promptly found a table for me. Service was truly excellent! All the wait staff was moving no one was idle. They were observant, kind and helpful. I ordered a nice house white and was easily the best white “House” wine I’ve ever had but not too difficult since Croatia has lovely wine. I ordered the fish of the day which was incredibly fresh and delicious. Only downfall was that I was in a hurry and couldn’t order dessert. I’ll see be back. Prices were average for Dubrovnik and the atmosphere was really nice w great view of the city wall.

We enjoyed our dinner at Dubravka 1836. We were staying at the nearby Hilton and really liked the restaurant’s outdoor seating area overlooking the sea and old town walls. We were lucky to get an excellent table and we both went for pizzas. My ham and mushroom pizza was nice but not amazing. The local house white wine was pretty good value.

We had a really nice evening and the view really made it for me.
Once you are hot, beat, tired and hungry you may find yourself here. It’s ok. Not the finest food but adequate and convenient.

We had breakfast in this restaurant 3 times as it was so good !! The Dorucak Bokar breakfast was particularly good and included a mozzarella filled omelette, bread and various jams, coffee and a fruit salad !! Vegetarian and gluten free options available aswell.

What a fabulous dining experience we had here.

For lunch we all chose different varieties of salads, as we wanted something cool and light. The food was great, and the service was excellent, and as it was our last day in Dubrovnik, and we wanted somewhere speacial to end our holiday, it was an easy decision to return here in the evening.

Having eaten indoors in the afternoon, we were shown to a perfectly situated table outside on the terrace. The atmosphere was excellent, and our food was superb.

The staff here are a credit to the restaurant, and we were served professionally, and with a smile. Nothing was too much trouble.

You will not be disappointed if you dine here.

When I saw that this more commercial-looking restaurant just outside the Pile Gate is under the same ownership (perhaps even management) as the excellent but rather pricy Nautica almost opposite my confidence was boosted so my wife and I booked what turned out to be a most enjoyable al fresco dinner on its terrace. The setting was lovely and quite romantic, service and food were very good and though, after several months, I fail to remember precisely what we ordered, my overall memory is decidedly positive. We shall just have to return one day to refresh our memories!....
This place it was the best we had in Dubrovnik. And there are lots of good places. The food is exquisit and modest prices. The view incredible. If you are in the city stop by here

We had a fantastic dinner there. The food was amazing, the location was top notch, the service was incredible... best of all, the price was very reasonable! couldn’t recommend this restaurant any higher! A must go to in Dubrovnik

My husband and I go to Dubrovnik every summer and stay for a couple of weeks. At least a couple of times we go to Dubravka because it is always perfect. The view from the terrace is stunning, service is impeccable and the food just perfect. Just note that there may be a little bit of a wait to be seated but there are many tables so the wait is never too long and it is worth it. The prices are reasonable and you can have a variety of great Mediterranean style dishes and wine without breaking the bank. 

This restaurant is also good for large groups. Enjoy!
Delicious food. I strongly recommend ravioli with truffles and smoked ham. Very kind stuff. Breathtaling view. Dubravka is a must during stay in Dubrovnik

We were referred by locals to eat at Dubrovka 1836. At first, we thought it would be just another touristy restaurant, given its location just outside the main gate to the Old City.

Happily, the food, service, and value (for Dubrovnik) were great! Best food we ate in Dubrovnik (ate here 3x (2 dinners and last breakfast) during our one-week stay). Special thanks to servers Mario, Marko, Dario, and the whole team. Super nice and attentive. Kids are welcome!

You can’t go wrong eating at Dubrovka 1836! The view is also amazing!
After a solid afternoon of climbing city walls and touring the old city this place was a welcome oasis. The staff is great the drinks are cold and the food is good. Sit outside and enjoy the scenery.

Dropped off at this place a couple of times during our trip. Friendly staff. Good food. Nice views overlooking the old town. Would definitely recommend. 
Also recommend skipping their dessert and getting one of the ice creams the same restaurant sells at the front of their building for your walk home. They were amazing!

I truly enjoyed my dinner here. Naturally, as we were sitting right next to the Old Town and sea that came with that gentle sea breeze, it was only apt that we had to try some fresh seafood and boy - wasn't it so lovely! The service was great too and everyone was friendly. This is a hot-spot for tourists so expect a ton of them here but that didn't bother us. Defo would come again when back in Dubrovnik. Thanks.

Ordered the simple pizza which had a great sauce and a seafood dish. Waiter had us seated and on our way due to being on a cruise schedule. Beautiful views all around. Would love to see a sunset here. Maybe next time.

Our family of 5 had dinner at Dubravka 1836 last night, and were totally impressed by their professionalism and service. 
The restaurant terrace overlooks the Old City wall - very atmospheric. 
We were attended to immediately, and received our food promptly. Everyone’s selections were delicious. 
We are having dinner at their sister restaurant this evening. Hold thumbs!

Each of the last 7 years my husband and I have visited this restaurant it has never failed to please. The service is very good, professional but friendly and welcoming. The menu is varied and the food is always well prepared, plentiful and delicious. We will be back again next year..........

OH and I had two lovely evenings at this restaurant, great food and ambience and attentive staff.
Would recommend

We spent a few relaxed hours at this place in the evening. The view of the fort on one side and bay on the other is superb. Food was excellent. We had a platter of cheese, salad, Pizza with Dalmatian ham. Creme caramel for dessert and Irish coffee to end the meal. Everything was excellent! Service was prompt and courteous. A really nice place to spend a few hours. The place is a bit pricey but absolutely worth a visit

Visited for dinner as a recommended place from our hostel. Food was lovely. Plenty of choice. The waiters were really friendly and couldn’t do enough for us. The setting is just lovely by the only town with view out to sea. Ambience enhanced by live music. Busy but not noisy. Would go back.

We ate here for a breakfast, a lunch and a dinner during our 5 day stay. Each meal was lovely and the staff helpful and attentive. Of all the places we ate, this was by far our favourite. The setting was gorgeous too. We stayed in an apartment in the old city walls and the heat within the city was unbearable at times and to come here with its lovely sea view and welcome breeze was great.

Finished a GOT walking tour close to this restaurant and we popped in because menu and the view looking great. My wife had seafood risotto and I had prawn pasta. Both outstanding. House wife was good value and good quality. The view and service could not be faulted. Highly recommended.

Went here for breakfast and the food was subpar.. seems like people mainly go here for the view. Most of the breakfast dishes consist of stuff you can cook at home and are not very good. Also the hit chocolate I ordered tasted like sweet hot water.
Stopped for a drink ended up having superb pizzas and lots of wine!! Very busy but lots of staff and excellent service. Just what was needed after a busy morning walking the walls etc.

We were lucky enough to walk into this restaurant for dinner and get a table on the terrace overlooking the sea - it was beautiful. The atmosphere was great, with live music playing and our waiter was extremely nice. The service was really quick which was great. We shared the seafood risotto for starters and would definitely recommend this dish although it was a large portion so one between two was plenty. I had sea bass for main and my partner had the seafood grill, we would recommend either dishes. The house white was nice too. Overall, the food and drink was reasonably priced. Towards the end of the meal, a huge storm hit and everyone had to go inside - the waiting staff were very friendly and ensured that we were happy, they offered us a free glass of sherry as a gesture! Would definitely recommend for the views, affordability and service.
Tasty food, good service. Reasonable prices. Not real sure what we ate but it was tasty regardless. Nice rest stop for tired feet.

Cannot complain really. 
First morning there got to the gate really hungry and stopped here. Got seated straight away right at the wall with great views over the water. 
Food was served quick and hot and tasted great. 
You get 10 per cent off with a 3 day dubrovnik card. 
Didn’t have dinner but the menu looked good.

We had booked prior to our meal and had requested a sea view. We were extremely pleased when we arrived to find our request had been met! (picture included)
I enjoyed marinated salmon to start with (whippy cream on top of the salad was an odd one for us Scots but we tried it never the less) followed by the seafood risotto. It was served to me piping hot and was absolutely delicious. Despite being busy, staff were welcoming and attentive throughout our meal. We finished our night off with a few cocktails which were also fab. I hope to return to Dubravka before our short stay here is over. Thank you for a wonderful evening!
Called for breakfast, unbelievable views, first rate staff and the food was excellent too, A good omelette with really good fresh fruit. A brilliant start to the day

If you’re looking for a restaurant in Dubrovnik that serves delicious seafood with good views and service, this is the place. We ordered the salmon salad, seafood risotto, tagliatelle with seafood and grilled prawns, and they were all just wonderul. Admittedly, the seafood here will not be the freshest that you eat so if you’re looking for something straight off the boat then perhaps this is not the place for you. We also had the creme caramel for dessert, which was delicious :) one of my favourite things about this restaurant was the ambience - not only was it looking out towards the ocean, the old city wall and fort lovrijenac, the music in the place was live gentle jazz, just enough to fill there gaps in conversation and put you at ease and at a volume at which it is easy to still have a conversation. Would recommend!

My partner and myself stopped here for some lunch as we had seen some great reviews. I ordered a grilled chicken meal and this was good but nothing spectacular, my partner ordered a pasta dish and she said this was quite average. Didn’t quite justify the price we paid but the views from the restaurant are very good but you can only really appreciate them if you get a table at the edge. Hoping to find something better.

Spectacular views, good service, and wonderful food The lamb with chantelle mushroom sauce was the best I’ve ever had. We also had the grilled prongs, the seafood pasta, and the prawn salad. All of them were very good

This busy restaurant was recommended to us by several people and is very central, easy to find. Unfortunately we were quite disappointed by our lunchtime meals of tuna salad and sea bass and there was nothing special about the service either. Nice views if you can get a table nearer the sea view. The local creme caramel style pudding was nice and the toilets were super air conditioned which was great on a very hot day.
We got into town early before our tour. Good place to rest and catch your breath before lots of walking. Good service and good WiFi. Very kind people.
Good service, location is wonderful! If they have richer menu, gonna be a plus ! I ordered risotto, well cooked

Quick bite, prompt service. Extremely busy area, definitely not suited to a romantic evening meal, nor for anyone with a fear of ballsy low flying pigeons!
Nothing wrong with it, just treat it for what it is - next to bus parking and taxi rank, front of Pile Gate.
We had lunch here on the day we arrived in Dubrovnik and decided to go back a couple of times once for breakfast and again for an evening meal. The food was very good and staff were lovely.

This became our cafe of choice while in Dubrovnik for a cool drink and the occasional meal. The staff are always really friendly and the food is good. Breakfasts are very good value and very filling. Make sure to ask for the discount card!

This restaurant is located just outside the main entrance to the old city wall. Nice surroundings, restaurant itself looks nice.

Fixed breakfast menus (5 choices) ranging from simple croissants to bigger combinations including a small glass of juice and any hot drink (tea or coffee).

Service was prompt and the food was quite delicious (several small jars of jam or honey & Nutella) included in the meal. Good value for money in a nice environment!

Moderately priced restaurant next to city walls overlooking the Adriatic. We enjoyed our food. I had a seasonal salad and spaghetti with prawns. Hubs loved his John Dory whitefish with risotto and veggies.

I ordered grilled prawns, it was terrible.
They only boiled it:(
Service terrible!
How can a restaurant afford not to tend the table? No one bothered to ask if we would like anything else. We decided to go for dessert someplace else, they don’t deserve the business.

Had breakfast here every morning while staying at the Miro apartments close by. Fantastic setting especially if you get a seat right by the wall. Had good set menu selection with bread, ham, cheese, croissants, fruit etc for a decent price considering (around 70 kuna). Staff very friendly and service prompt. Had dinner one night also but thought the food just ok.

My fiancé and I came here the night we were engaged and got a lovely table on the terrace adjacent to the city walls with a fantastic view of the Adriatic. The food was of high quality. I had seabass and my fiancé had seafood tagliatelle and both were exquisite. Wine was very reasonable at 140 Kuna for a litre. Would highly recommend this restaurant. We also got a 10% off voucher for having a drink at the sister panorama restaurant up on the cable cars Mount Srd. Highly recommended.

Had the most amazing breakfast there for very reasonable price. If you are early enough you can also get a place with nice view of the harbor and the castle. Service is very kind a speaks English very good.
This place offers a full meal breakfast for a very fair price, around 85 kuna, which comes with omelette, bread, fruits, coffee and jelly! Try to come by 8 am in order to find a place by the wall
the place has an amazing view, staff,was very nice good food, location couldn`t be better. breakfast was really good

Friends recommended this restaurant who had been in Dubrovnik last year. It sits near the entrance to the walled city with a stunning view of the sea. Honestly, if my friends hadn't recommended it, I would have passed right by this place, since it looks like the typical tourist place with great view/bad food. But I trusted the recommendation of my friends. And... We spent 3 weeks in Greece, Croatia and Italy -- and this was one of the best meals we had. We both had sea bass, which was on offer in many of restaurants throughout the trip. The fish was fresh, full of flavor and expertly prepared -- that describes the steamed vegetables that came with it as well. (This place had the best sea bass of any place we tried, hands down!). The service was friendly, helpful and efficient. Given this, plus the view, the price was more than reasonable.

This is the place to go for breakfast! My husband and I chose breakfast no. 4 - fantastic value for money -

A hot drink
Omelette
Butter, Bonne Maman jam, honey, Nutella 
3 different types of bread
Orange juice
A bowl of fresh fruit salad

After you dine here, they give you 10% discount card you can use over and over again here and in their other restaurants

Food was good but experience spoilt by Smokers during our meal. I know it’s not the policy for all countries to adopt but when you are a non smoker and smoke is blown towards you during a meal ruins the taste experience plus it’s not healthy!

If you want the views, great food (albeit not top fine dining), alongside an extensive menu, very friendly unpretentious service and a great atmosphere around you, pick Dubravka. Book in advance if you want a first row table, although nothing wrong with 2nd/3rd row; you will still enjoy!

We had breakfast here just prior to leaving to the airport. The breakfast was amazing with all the variety you could want: eggs, fruit, bread, butter and jam, NUTELLA, fresh juice and tea/coffee for very great price all with a beautiful view. Definitely recommend!

We only stopped off for a cold drink after the heat of the old town and I was pleasantly surprised that the drinks were a reasonable price. The views from the terrace are stunning towards the old walls and the sea. They also take Euros so we didn't have to visit a bank for Kuna.

Nice place. I was a little suspicious because of the location (it could easily be a tourist trap), but they really try to offer value to their customers. The service was friendly and very efficient and the food was rather nice. Typical Croatian menu though, no surprises.
Lovely breakfast with a view. Also went for an evening meal and was satisfied with the food and staff. Well worth a visit when in Dubrovnik
Two stars, just for the location. Dubrovnik is a very expensive town, unlike the rest of Croatia. Food is ok but nothing special. You pay for the location. Friendly staff.

We called in here for an early evening meal on our first day in Dubrovnik, it was the view that grabbed us as much as the menu, the location is hugely impressive.

We only had pizza and local beer, but on a warm sunny evening that can take some beating and both were really good, the pizza being thin, well cooked and with lovely fresh ingredients.

However, the menu is much broader and I suspect we’ll go back and try some of their delicious looking seafood and try the local wine.

We stopped here for a quick bite to eat, and were happy that the cost was not as high as it’s sister restaurant Nautica. Avoid the cold fish platter, unsure how fresh it was. The papradelle was delicious, however, and their wine selection was ok.
Recommended by our guest house owner, we weren’t disappointed. Lovely fresh fish and seafood, some great Croatian cheese and a great view out to sea past the Old Town walls.
Amazing food ! Amazing service! Amazing spot! Definitely worth a visit, well worth the money paid for fine food & wine 10/10!!

Top restaurant great prices super ambience. 

Staff were helpful friendly and sincere. A definite food put stop on a very hot day

We ate here 3 times they give discounts of 10% and one evening we had a storm which more or less cleared the place but they gave 30% discount as we stuck it out under a large umbrella + a free local grappa drink the pizzas are good value and again the local wine by the glass / carafe is great value for money

Great restaurant 
Romantic setting with good menu choices 
Recommend the seafood and service was excellent
We were served by mario who was rude to us from the moment we ordered. Food was 4/10 for breakfast. I would absolutely advise everyone to avoid this hell hole of a tourist trap.

Oh the food is so so so good here!! I got the chicken pasta and my friend got the spaghetti bolognese and we both loved our food! It was cooked so well and it was so flavoursome! So glad we went here and I recommend you to do the same. They have a club discount card too which is neat. The view is breath taking and the customer service was outstanding. They have such nice clean toilets too which makes me happy. I loved it so much made me so happy to have good food.

My wife and I dined here on a Saturday evening the service was superb and the food certainly didn’t disappoint. A really busy vibrant restaurant with live music.
One not to miss on a trip to Dubrovnik

Good food, Good location and great Hospitality. With Castle and Sea View, we had a great Dinner. Sea Bass Fillet and Rocket Salad combination was very good. On Saturday night there was great live music. The hosts were kind and helpfull. I wish to visit again.

We had pizza , beer and peach tea here, all very good and not expensive, they will take euros. The views from the terrace is straight out out game of thrones. A busy restaurant as all the buses dropping off for the Pile gate into the old town stop outside. The staff very very nice and spoke excellent English! Would recommend

Our first meal in Dubrovnik and we really weren’t impressed. I had the seafood tagliatelle and hubby the seafood risotto.
The pasta and rice were fine and so were the sauces but the seafood selection in both dishes was tiny - eg salad prawns, mussels and squid. 
None of the fish were in shells and I suspect they were frozen.
Service was ok but no one checked out our meals with us.

Most of the taxis and tour buses stop just in front of this restaurant. The place is convenient for breakfast as pick up is normally right in front or just further down from the restaurant. The restaurant offers gluten free bread. Breakfast is ok (ordered an omelette and the portion is quite big). 

The restaurant has very nice view and ambience. If you want to have peaceful breakfast with unobstructed view, try to make it before 9am (that’s when the crowd with flags start to flood the place). You might also be able to catch a glimpse of large wooden looking cutter ship sailing by against the blue background. 

Plenty of birds, but you are not allowed to feed them!

We were well looked after by all the friendly staff. Started with cocktails & then straight to the main course. All four of us were so impressed. Exceptional standard throughout with lovely atmosphere. We are definitely going back on 4th June for our anniversary breakfast.

The banana split was lovely and the service quick and and efficient. Our only complaint is that Croatia doesn’t separate smokers and non-smokers so if you do not, your meal and experience is dragged down by others.

Food the same price as everywhere in Dubrovnik, quality of food average but absolutely worth it for the views! Absolutely beautiful. If you can, ask for a table by the walls, it’s worth the wait. My boyfriend and I spent a few hours here drinking wine and relaxing, counting our blessings at how we had managed to get so lucky. Happy happy place.

Probably one of the best - if not THE best - seafood restaurants in town!
The place offers a wide variety of food however, the grilled squid is simply amazing and second only to the prawns in the special Dubravka sauce.
In spite of the heavily crowded period, Mr. Jasmin (no "e") took it upon himself to go the extra mile and made the entire culinary experience magical.
If you happen to be there in the summer, a glass of cold Pošip constitutes a great pariing choice with the fish.
For me the most attractive thing here is the view to be sincere. The food is ok, nonetheless can be better flavored and more variety. I recommend it still. Seafood is the best.

My wife and I had a fabulous evening meal here as the sun was setting in the background of the ancient city walls, top class food, the seafood risotto was top class and my wife also had a seafood tagliatelle which was also brilliant. If you are in the old town make the quick trip just outside the walls and enjoy the food and view
It was very delicious and our waitress was very kind and helpful!! We really enjoyed the view as well and we really recommend it!!!
Brilliant pizza 🍕 slices really tasty and huge! Good value 80 kuna (£10)! Great for a quick snack on the go
A beautiful view just perfect with a pleasant atmosphere, great place for a light holiday with good food and wine
A great view of the Adriatic Sea and great tasting food served by a wonderful staff. Highly recommend!!!

This restaurant is just in front of the Old Town, with a view on the walls.
The welcoming was wonderful, the service good. We ordered sea bass and salmon and it was very well prepared. The prices are also not too expensive, so we had a wonderful experience here.

During our stay we came here twice, once for just drinks and one for breakfast. We got very different service both times. When we were just there for drinks we felt like they weren’t very interested in us. Even though we had quite a few drinks a few being cocktails, so the bill wasn’t cheap. When we went for breakfast they couldn’t have been more helpful. But food and drinks were great both times. And the setting is amazing especially to watch the world go by. I also want to mention that they have the best baby changing facilities that we can across in our whole time in Dubrovnik! We also went to both of the sister restaurants and would recommend these also.

Nice service, but my King Prawns in tomato sauce were tasteless and disappointing.

No kids portions or kids menu

Wouldn’t bother to return.
Food middle of the road good, service excellent. Prices high. The setting (by the sea) makes it a good destination.

Dubravka 1836 is a gem of a restaurant. Conveniently located just outside of the Old City gates ,relax and enjoy a great meal while enjoying a spectacular view of the Adriatic. Portions are plentiful and the service is great. You may want to visit several times so ask for their discount card which covers 3 great restaurants . Save room for dessert ; the authentic Croation creations are worth it.
Fabulous spot, we had breakfast here twice and lunch once (wine by the litre :) ) and a 10 percent discount
Great spot for breakfast. Great service and great food. Nice choice of breakfast and you can get 10% off if you go back. We did.

We had the pleasure of dining here earlier this month. The ambiance, fantastic; the view, incredible; the food, excellent and the service (Mario), entertaining! The fried calamari was unbelievably good with extremely light batter and cooked to perfection. What a great way to end the day in such a beautiful place.

We had our last dinner in Dubrovnik here and it was excellent. The service is impeccable and the food was good. Menus in Croatia seem to all be similar and the quality of the food has thus far been excellent so we rate the menu only slightly above average. Doesn't matter though as the location and the service make it 5 stars.

We were lucky to find a seat without a reservation in the lunch time, especially by the stone fence. We had very delicious lunch. Portion doesn't meet the price, but this amazing view surely costs, so it's acceptable :D

Are you unable to walk to the gas station to buy canned fruit? Would you be worried they wouldn’t have jam or stale bread? 

Does the thought of frying an egg and throwing a piece of pre sliced cheese on top intimidate you?

If so, this place is for you!! The iron chef that usually works here must have called in sick, cause I can’t imagine who reviewed this place more than 2 stars. 

Oh wait. It’s the cruise ship people... who are EVERYWHERE. Look at the photos. Our bread was literally moldy. The juice is “sunny d” and how do you screw up eggs?? 

I shouldn’t have gotten out of bed this morning. If I throw up, it will probably taste better the 2nd time through my mouth. 

Seriously, how is this place rated so highly? They say, it’s one of the 12 great mysteries of Dubrovnik. 

....if only the walls could talk...

Enjoy my review? Instagram - “brutally_honest_reviews” for more
Food was good and tasty. Staff very helpful. We visited the restaurant in a busy time, so it was a little bit too noisy. However, this is a good restaurant.

We had a lovely meal here. Food was great. Waiters couldn’t have been nicer and were attentive but not pushy. Price wise it is extremely decent and the atmosphere was relaxing. The view is lovely, with a view of the walls of the old town and the fort. Defo worth a visit!

Just outside the Pile Gate, with incredible view overlooking the harbor and the Red Keep (St Lawrence Fort)
The octopus dish is a MUST - fresh, cooked to a beautiful color and texture, perfectly seasoned
Great coffee
Good house wine
Great service, attentive and friendly (cannot say the same for many other restaurants in the city..)
Reasonably priced

We visited this restaurant several times. We stopped for breakfast three times during our stay for one week. My favourite breakfast was "Lovrijenac" served with sunny side up eggs and "Bokar" served with omelette. We also had dinner at the restaurant three times. We recommend assorted fish plate, salmon fillet and beefsteak "Dubravka". Good service and very nice view from the restaurant.

We stopped by for breakfast. As a gluten-intolerant, it is difficult to find places that accommodate dietary restrictions. We ordered the set breakfasts which have fruit and eggs included. the food was filling and delicious. My favourite bit was the fresh fruit. The staff was very pleasant and the food served quickly. Highly recommend. Outdoor sitting lets you enjoy a beautiful view while dining.

We stopped by for breakfast. We were seated at a table along the wall, with a great view We ordered omelettes, which comes with cheese and tomatoes. Includes fruit, bread and 1 cup of coffee of choice. Refills cost extra. 
 We ordered cappuccino's, they were good. Service was friendly and excellent. Food was good. Great spot to enjoy a beautiful day. Price was about 78 kunas- about $12.each.
We liked the location so much we came back for dinner. 
My wife had salmon with vegetables. 
I had grilled sea bass with veggies.
Also had a nice salad. 194 kunas each. About $32 dollars. Each. 
Same nice friendly service and food was good.

We went here on recommendation and has just the most amazing location looking out to sea as well a view of the old city walls. Popular and to our delight the food was much better than expected as it's almost the perfect tourist honey trap. I started with a prawn cocktail which was nice although not sure what the oranges were doing on the plate and then had grilled chicken and chips which was actually , although pretty basic , really nice. Treated ourselves to a dessert afterwards and had some ice cream , partner had cheesecake. Its not going to win any culinary awards but was pretty tasty and enjoyable to eat. Service friendly and good and we really enjoyed our meal here , had a nice bottle of wine too. Recommended

We decided to patronize this eatery after a recommendation from a friend.

It has excellent views of the old city walls and a small beach. Early evening views are probably best.

The live music was the best we heard in Croatia. 

Entertainment aside, the food was rather pedestrian and boring although the menu was extensive. My feeling is that it caters for tourists who probably will never be return.

The waiters were polite and spoke English fluently.

In brief, go for the view but not for the food.

Great restaurant in a great setting. The highlight for us gin lovers was their Dalmatian G&T. This is a gin and rose liquor cocktail with a sprig of rosemary and pink rose buds added. Looks and tastes amazing.

We had just finished our walk around the wall and decided to eat here. We were welcomed by a lovely lady and were lucky enough to get a table with an amazing view.
The menu is great something to suit everyone. I really appreciated the waiters assistance and helpfulness. They even offered to open a bottle of wine to let us try before we bought it to make sure we liked it.. ps wine was fantastic..
I decided to have the risotto seafood and it was delicious and my friend had the seafood selection and it did not disappoint. Followed by dessert mmmmm... 
The staff where great the view was amazing and the food outstanding..
Great restaurant and really worth going.

Walked up to a charming restaurant in the shadow of the city wall and next to the water. The skies threatened rain, but we felt safe under large umbrellas. When it started to rain lightly, the wait staff moved us under a larger overhang. As we waited for our dinner it really began to pour and the wind was blowing like crazy. We were moved inside, and despite the lack of tables, they speedily got us seated. The staff kept good humor, but were genuinely apologetic for a weather challenge out of their control. 
All of that might have made for a disastrous night, but the food was absolutely delicious! The sea bass was the best we've ever had, and the salmon cooked to perfection! The meal was all we could have asked for, but the manager went above and beyond by visiting our table, and providing us with dessert and a discount on our bill. 
It turned out to be an unforgettable evening of great food, laughter, and 3 different tables! Thanks to Ermin and Joseph.

Lunch time meal overlooking bay and historic walled town. Great friendly service and more reasonable than restaurants in old town. Fries octopus was good as was sea bass. Discount if you visit sister restaurants Panaroma ( via cable car) and Gradaska Havana arsenal (in port).

T'was a chilly, grey evening but a friendly, warm smile greeted us. We hadn't reserved but we were shown to a table immediately. More into the season I would imagine a reservation is necessary in this prime venue. A very informative waiter was quickly on hand with menu and drinks order. Very good and well presented food at a reasonable price. Recommended.
Good position, great food and services. One of the most restourant in Dubrovnik who have very good services. Food exspecially.
We had lunch here three times. Amazing views.The wait staff was outstanding and very helpful explaining the menu and wines. Considering it was so close to old town, i found it to be reasonable
Great food, excellent location and wonderful service. Also, very reasonable prices considering the location. The view is spectacular, right by the sea with a view of the fort. Highly recommend!

We went to this restaurant for dinner at night and were seated on one of the tables closest to the sea. The restaurant was lit up by candlelight and the view of the walls and bay was just amazing. I’ve been to many different places but nothing else comes close to the atmosphere created by the views in Dubrovnik. It makes you feel privileged to be there. The food was gorgeous and the service outstanding. 
We then went back for breakfast and again it didn’t disappoint. Not to be missed when visiting this area.
Lunch salads were pretty nice, exept for the horrible fake black olives tossed In. Nice view to the walls of old town and over the bay.
Great service with good recommendation in an absolutely gorgeous setting, definitely recommended to visit this when in Dubrovnik.
Very goog dessert, testy, personal very kindly prices ok. very nice and helpful staff. Prices for an old city affordable. bardzo miły i pomocny personel. Ceny jak na stare miasto przystepne

If you are in Dubrovnik then you must try this restaurant. Stunning location overlooking the fort and walls. The litre of wine is lovely and food was fantastic. Mario was excellent waiter and stood out for us. Highly recommended!

Our party of four arrived and we're greeted by a lovely young lady. We sat outside and was looked after by our waiter very well. He was very knowledgeable of the menu and wines on offer. We chose the lamb, it was so tender and so well seasoned my taste buds came alive. My husbands steak served in a sauce was equally superb. The price for starters,mains, were very reasonable and including drinks and coffee. 798kuna. Fantastic, (compared to our first night at another restaurant in babin kuk, very expensive yet poor meal) , Definitely recommend restaurant Dubravka very romantic setting and very clean.

We visited Dubravka 1836 mainly for the views and hope of nice food. We ordered the lasagne and tagliatelle with chicken and were very impressed by both. The staff were very friendly and the service was faultless. The only negative was my partner had asked what flavour the cheesecake was, the waiter said lemon however when it arrived it was a plain cheesecake with a tiny sprinkle of lemon zest on the plate for decoration. I would recommend making a reservation for the sea view as these are mainly for reserved customers only.
Good service and food was excellent. Nice view of the old town walls .would definitely recommend . Also the prices are also very reasonable

This Restaurant was our first food stop in Dubrovnik for an early dinner. The Restaurant location was really good but I was not really impressed with food and service. The Price for the food is reasonable for Dubrovnik Old City.
We booked this for the 1st night of our honeymoon and we had a table reserved right beside the view of the water. Cocktails, food and service we couldn't fault and really set the mood for our trip.

The restaurant is placed next to the main entry to the Old Town, but given the location it offers very reasonable prices. The food is good and tasty, and service is fast and waiters are very efficient kind and professional. You can try fish or seafood dishes, as well as variety of meat dishes. We had squids, plate of mixed fish and seafood, spaghetti with shrimps and pizza, and everyone enjoyed her/his food. The only thing I would change was a piece of grilled salmon in a mixed fish and seafood dish, as it would be better to have yet another piece of locally available fish instead of it. But anyway it tasted great so no big fuss about it. If you are using the DU Card, you'll get 10% discount.

This place is in a beautiful location and we expected prices to be steep but it was quite reasonable for what we had. I ordered the seafood risotto, absolutely delicious, hot and cooked to perfection which is not always easy for risotto. My husband had the specialty pizza (#7) which was great. Service was impeccable. We ate on the terrace overlooking the ocean, setting is beautiful and it gets busier as the evening goes on. They also make a great cappuccino (decaf if you want). Overall a great experience and will probably go back before the end of our vacation.

What a refreshing find! Superb food, excellent quality and the loveliest service from our waitress Anita. We enjoyed lunch so much that we returned the next day for dinner. The staff couldn’t have been more welcoming and the choices for a vegatarian were good. Would highly recommend A*

We came here for our last night in Dubrovnik and knew it might be a bit expensive. But the prices were actually very reasonable for the location.

Food was delicious, I had a chicken tagliatelle which was beautifully creamy and my boyfriend had chicken breast with roast veg which was also very good. Beautiful location in the evening, attentive but not fussy staff, they left you to comfortably eat at your own pace but ensured you had water and wine. Very good service. A lovely evening, and 2 mains with wine just over 300 kuna.

We went for dinner on 31st March night and had an absolutely delicious dinner- would highly recommend
Also as part of the tip, I had put in 50 euro instead of 50 Kuna and the honest waitress Anita realised my mistake and returned it to me .... Restores your faith in the goodness of people

Maybe we went on a bad night but we found the experience disappointing. My wife enjoyed her meal but I found mine average. The waiters were very busy and it took a long time for the meal to be served.
The house wines, both red and white were very good and the live music was excellent.
Ambiance v.good but over priced for the quality of the food.

We found this restaurant on our first night in town !

It has great views overlooking sea service is friendly efficient and professional.
The food fish and meat were good and wine was great.

I would recommend arriving early as best tables overlooking sea go early!

All in all I would say seven out of ten!

Beautiful place, beautiful view on Dubrovnik city walls. Very friendly and helpful waiter. To recommend Croatian champagne for aperitif, afterword pasta with shrimp, Then filet from brancin wit home vegetables and for desert apple strudel. Of course red wine. All together not very expensive for Dubrovnik.

We made a reservation for the terrace and that turned out to be a good idea. When we arrived, the balcony and terrace were full with people who enjoyed dinner and food on this lovely spot. The menu contains some good suggestions for fish and meat and they serve food for vegetarians, an exeption in meat loving Croatia. We enjoyed dinner with good service, the price quality rate was quite reasonable. Excellent service made this for us an experience we will cherish

A nice corner right outside to the City walls, facing the sea. 

We ordered a vegetarian Pizza and were delighted to have it. 
5 stars to the service, hospitality And location. 
A good meal. 
Also recommended is the Dubravaka Cup a pleasing desert with fruits. 

Enjoy

We went to Dubrovnik for a long weekend and decided to try this restaurant on the Saturday late afternoon. We were so impressed that we came back again on the Sunday and were just as delighted.
The restaurant is in a very lovely setting, just outside the City Walls at Pile Gate with stunning views out across the Adriatic Sea. 
We decided to eat outside on the terrace and were quite happy not having a table next to the low walls because the pigeons can be quite annoying! 
On our first visit my husband had the tuna pizza whilst I had prawns with spaghetti in a cream sauce. On our second visit my husband had the penne arrabbiatta and I had chicken with tagliatelle in a tomato sauce. All of our food was freshly cooked, delicious and huge portions.
On both occasions we decided to treat ourselves to a 1L carafe of house red wine which was very tasty.
Although the restaurant was busy we weren't rushed. An extra nice gesture is that the staff put out patio heaters and offered blankets as the temperature suddenly drops when the sun goes down at this time of year.
All of the staff are very friendly, welcoming and helpful. I would particularly like to praise Anita who served us on our first visit and to say that she has a lovely singing voice!
This restaurant is very reasonably priced bearing in mind its location and quality of food and staff. It is obviously very popular and so at certain times of the day you might have to wait a while to have a table. But you won't be disappointed!!
Thank you for making our weekend break even more memorable. We will definitely be back when we return to Dubrovnik.
Lovely staff, yummy food and 10% off with a Dubrovnik card. What’s not to love?! View of the fort and sea is amazing.

Nice place to have coffee ☕️
Didn't try the food there but the location has a wonderful view.

Do not feed the pigeons.. they won't leave you in peace! 😄

Went for our first night in Dubrovnik based on reviews. Views were great, but not exclusive. Service was good, but a bit intrusive and the waiter took away my half eaten pizza without offering to box it for me. 
Had the Greek salad, spaghetti bolognese, and seafood pizza. The salad and spaghetti were fine, the pizza had very little seafood on it and the crust didn’t seem homemade.
Good food, awesome view, excellent service and genuinely kind, attentive waiters especially.......Branko. You really made an impression. Thank you Branko, the girls from Holland ;)

A must go to restaurant when in Drovnack. On the Adriatic Sea on the other side of the wall of old town. On Saturdays, they have some very nice entertainment which is exceptional.

The food is great with good selection and the service is outstanding. Prices are very fair. must go to restaurant when into Broadneck! 

The food is great with good selection and the service is outstanding. Prices are very fair. Thanks

We arrived at Pile Gate after a very early morning flight from the Uk and were tired and hungry. This was the nearest restaurant. Very pleasant friendly staff, the food was freshly prepared and a rsasonable price given the location. Get a table overlooking the city walls if you can.

Whilst in Dubrovnik, we used this restaurant for quick coffee breaks & a meal on a Saturday night ,
Services was first class ever time ,
Staff were polite ever time , no waiting for tables or to be served 
Food was great & came up hot ,
Compare to inside the city walls , just by stepping outside & looking on to the city walls ,
Much better views , 
Prices were much more reasonable,
You won’t be disappointed with service, price & food 
First class

We paid the same (70hrk) for breakfast that you would anywhere else but here the view is lovely, the bread fresh and homemade, and the service friendly. Breakfast here was the best meal we've had in Dubrovnik. I would definitely try them for another meal!
Delicious food and drinks and great staff! WE had great time. The view and the athmosphere was divine.

Amazing view! Kind stuff.we had an accident with our drinks and they
Replaced the beer without even
Ask them! Thank you!

During our stay in Dubrovnik this restaurant was our favorite place to eat. Staff is great, especially waitress Ivana. Very attentive, helpful and friendly. Food was above average and prices were also acceptable. The view from terrace was stunning. Highly recommended!
Had some cold seafood dishes, which were pretty good. The place offers a nice view of the sea and Dubrovnik‘s walls.
In this restaurant you are paying for the location mainly, the food is quite ordinary compared to the numerous outstanding restaurants in Dubrovnik and the prices are ridiculous !
Amazing experience! Staff was more than kind and helpfull. Great location near the water and amazing views over the fort and city walls. Food was delicious!

Our tour guide recommended here as a relatively cheap place to eat in prime spot, and we were not disappointed. We managed to get seaview seating overlooking the Fort and ordered 2 freshly cooked pizzas and 2 glass of wines for just over 220kuna. Also if you have eaten at any of their sister restaurants (as we had – Panorama on Mt Srd Cable Cart) you get 10% off your bill (we were given a discount card by the Panorama Waiter)

This was my very first meal in Dubrovnik. After my early morning flight and subsequent travels I was famished. This restaurant offers everything. Fantastic views, ample selection, amazing seating and friendly staff. I ordered a "Bokar" breakfast and it was simply delicious. the omelette was perfect. The croissant was delicious, everything you could hope for after a long day of travel. I'll be going back before I leave.
P.S - If you purchase a Dubrovnik card you will receive 10%off.

Lovely view across cove and fort. Not as expensive as you would think for location. Extensive food and drink list. Ate there twice. Get given loyalty card giving you ten percent off at this and sister restaurants. Seafood risotto excellent as was the lamb.

Popped in for a drink at the end of the day. Ivana was our server and she was very friendly, gave us some great recommendations and provided us with excellent service.
Our drinks were perfectly chilled and served promptly, that combined with a wonderful view, made for a very enjoyable time.

There were about 15 of us at the dinner. The food was good, not outstanding. But the view and the surroundings are amazing. Service was nice, since the night was a bit chilly they offered us some blankets + there were heaters.

Located right outside Pile Gate, you can enjoy a wonderful meal overlooking the city walls of Dubrovnik and dramatic view of the ocean. The day we were there was raining and cold, but the staff quickly provided heaters, blankets, and made sure we did not get wet. The seafood entrees were excellent, and the spaghetti bolognese my daughter ordered was so good that my wife and I ended up sampling from it liberally.

I just had my coffee here today and soaking up the sun , enjoying my coffee with friends and looking at the city walls makes this a perfect location for that choice. Professional and kind staff makes it even better. Always a win win situation !
But I was wrong. It's not the cheapest but once you see the view it is very justified good quality food and ideal location.
Nice food and decent service. Provides bread and blankets, overall very good restaurant. Will be returning.

We ate here two nights out of our 4 and both times had a good meal. 

The first night we had spaghetti bolonaise and it was great, cooked and seasoned well. We even got a 10% discount with a card and they have three restaurants. 

The second night I ordered lasagne and it was a little over cooked and the pasta soft. But not enough to complain. My son had the pizza and it was huge. 

They had heaters and blankets for the cold evenings and the service was good. 

However the ice cream is to die for! We stopped there each day after lunch to get some and tried many flavones. Again good value for money.
The best place to have lunch after walking half day (city walls, cable car, museums...). Service is excellent, food is amazing and the view from the terrace is simply spectacular

The ice cream here was delicious. Tried two places and this was the best one. The man who made the ice cream also let us sample the flavours. This place is just before the old town walls, and definitely worth buying before heading inside the walls. I had hazelnut and pineapple, which were both delicious. The texture was creamy and not icy. At 20 kuna, this was relatively well priced compared to the other ice cream places inside the old town of Dubrovnik.

We ate here both nights we were in Dubrovnik. Located overlooking the western section of the Walls of Dubrovnik it almost seems surreal. We had the old favourite pizza and a glass of wine and it was delicious. Such friendly and attentive staff made the evening a treat. Enjoy.

Totally do not understand the high rating of this restaurant, apart from the beautiful view, the food were absolutely disgusting. The sauce of all the pasta were actually the same and tasted awful, pasta were overcooked and none of them were acceptable.

AWESOME place to kill some time and great place to have food and drinks with a work class view. We needed a place to relax for a bit and this was great...i had seafood risotto and my spaghetti Bolognese and both were super for a good price. Our waiter Marijo was really off the charts great and funny.
Great location . Nice view .Great prices. We ordered seafood .Kids had pizza.Everyone was satisfait.

I expected this place to be overpriced because Of the lovely location. But actually our meals were very reasonable and it’s hilarious that they label the seafood risotto a starter because it’s HUGE. And very delicious.

Great food, good service but don’t order starters and mains at the same time. Main course arrived before I had finished starters. Must say that the waiters were great and not their fault but please give people a break in between
It was our first station to get cup of coffee and to eat something light. We got it :) The food was tasty, very good spriz aperol, nice view and very polite personal

My gf had the seafood tagliatelle, I had been, both were very tasty, plenty of seasoning and not bland at all. 

The view of the small inlet outside the walls was very nice too. 

I got a cool cocktail that had a banana carved into a dolphin head which was hilarious and pretty delicious.

My only complaint was the pigeons flitting around but that's not much of an issue.

Great service, good food and breathtaking views. 

Tip: If you order in Croatian, there’s a discount. 😏😉

Great views overlooking the sea from the terrace if you get one of the wall side seats. Service was fast, food was excellent and local beer and wine were superb. We had late lunch and it was pretty busy. I imagine this would be a top spot for dinner in high summer. Prices reasonable.

Dubravka is located near Dubrovnic Old Town's Pile Gate.

It's a cosy restaurant that is very busy during meal times.

There's indoor, Al fresco and covered seating. Take your pick, but if you don't like being bothered by cigarette smoke then go indoor. If you sit outdoor and it's chilly they provide blankets and infra red lamps.

We visited this restaurant twice. They first time for lunch and we had spaghetti Bolognese, 4 cheese pizza and squid. All were delicious. On our second visit we were there for tea and ordered cakes which were just as good.

While not really cheap the prices are reasonable for the good food and service.

Dubravka is a cozy restaurant right on the water at the Pile Gate of the city wall. They also have a terrace section available. Large portion sizes and wonderful dessert. Large wine selection! Nice and friendly service!
Stopped by after our guided tour yesterday and felt very welcome while only enjoying a snack and coffee. Great staff, clean restaurant and bathrooms and plentiful menu options.

Excellent food and the best location. We were supprised because the best reastaurant ends to be the cheapest we paid for a meal in Dubrovnik! Basket of bread is complimentary not like other restau, bread basket is separate price. We were also given 10% discount on our 2nd visit and after visiting Panorama Restaurant. Service was very good, prompt and friendly staff.
Such a nice place! The service was excellent, the waiters know how to take care of clients. The food was cooked really good.Everything that we ordered was delicious.

This restaurant is right outside the Pile Gate into the Old City. My wife and I decided to try it for dinner one evening in March. We sat outside but were kept warm by the electric fires and the blanket that was provide on at least every other chair. The staff were very friendly and the service was very good. We both had a 2 course meal with a glass of house white wine for about £40 which I considered to be good value, particularly having regard to the prominent position of the restaurant right next to the main entrance to the old city. I had chips with my grilled chicken and they were very dry, not at all greasy. My wife had medallion of veal which she also really enjoyed. We were so pleased with the meal that we went back again a couple of nights later and found it just as good as first time. It is worth noting you get a loyalty card which gives you 10% discount off any future visit to this restaurant or 2 others in the same group also in Dubrovnik.

We stopped at the Dubravka for coffee on a rainy morning during a recent trip to Dubrovnik and enjoyed the visit so much that we decided to come back for dinner later in the week! The food and drinks are very tasty with good portion sizes. Very reasonably priced. Staff were brilliant with an extremely high level of service. The views of the city walls and out to sea are really lovely. Would recommend sitting outside but if you go out of season the staff are more than happy to turn on the heat lamps and give you blankets to keep warm. Would definitely recommend and would stop by here again on the next visit.
Visited a few times to shelter from the rain, lots of outdoor heaters and warm blankets. Good Coffee!

Food good . Views amazing. Waiter very pushy throughout meal hinting for a tip which I found very rude . He was quite helpful but will not return because of this . WE always tip over the odds when it is deserved do not need to be asked 4 times . Thank you but will not be coming back...I suggest going to porto good fish restaurant in old town or Orsan in marina amazing food and service well worth the extra money and the tip

Lovely views from outside seating area, wasn't very busy while we was here, had to flag down waiter both times to get drinks, seemed to seat us but wasn't bothered with serving us, food locked amazing but didn't eat here
This is a very good restaurant, his quality is always the same... My husband and I went here a few times and it was always very good..

This restaurant was very nice. We were told to get outside, to see the view and under the sun. We had blankets and heat not to get cold outside! That was perfect. The dishes were very good, we loved that place! I recommend without hesitation :D

Recently visited and had a mixed opinion. We had two great meals and one very disappointing meal. However, the service experienced both during the meal and with the complaint was tremendous. Staff couldn’t be more friendly or attentive without being overbearing or more apologetic. The staff done everything they could to rectify the situation and would definitely give them another chance if we were to visit Dubrovnik again.
