Had a lunch here but we were not really impressed with it.The views are spectacular and the service was good. Nice glass of wine as well.

The views were the best, unfortunately I can not say the same about the plates. I doubt that my seafood risotto, which is so glorified here, was made of fresh seafood. The taste, state and size correspond to nicely refrozen stuff. Another plate- a squid was not bad, but the garnish- cooked carrot and broccoli- had no taste, no salt, nothing but water, why! Quite poor. I wonder why so many people write that it was the best meal they have ever had there. It is just a tourist trap.

I went over there with my friend and we were sitting outside on the terrace. And I have to admit they have amazing view. 
We ordered Strawberry decry and fish dish. 
Food is very delicious and service is very very good.
I would come here again.
Excellent location looking at the walls and sea. Food matches the view, too! Great Mediterranean cuisine. Well worth stopping to dine!

We had arrived in Dubrovnik and had not yet entered the Old City. There was this restaurant literally right outside the entrance to the moat in front of the city walls and we were hungry so we thought we'd give it a try strictly out of convenience. It ended up being our favorite restaurant and we came back over and over again the whole week that we were there. First of all, the restaurant is perched on the cliff so you can sit out on the terrace and have the most breathtakingly beautiful view of the sea and the Old City walls and the fortress on the opposite cliff. If you go during the evening, the sky changes from a lighter blue to a deep blue velvet and the moon shines over the water and the fortress walls are lit up around you. The swifts (similar to a swallow) will fly by as fast as lightening as day turns to night. Up on the terrace a trio of musicians start playing around 8 PM and the saxophone's beautiful music truly makes you feel as if you are on a romantic movie set. At this point, I'm good with a glass of wine, just wanting to pinch myself that I am even there but yes, there is food, delicious food, prepared perfectly, and they even had some suitable choices for one of our party who is vegetarian. The menu is considered Mediterranean casual, with pasta, salads, pizzas and seafood. Something for everybody. The service was excellent, the waiters were friendly and helpful without being overbearing, We did eat inside the Old City walls too, but found prices to be much higher than what we found here so we were really happy to make this "our" magical restaurant!

My friend and I went here for a dinner because she is local and she suggested the place. All I can say is that food is amazing, the view is to die for and service was nice. Only thing I noticed is that is a good thing to have a reservation.

We had spent the morning walking around the old city and needed somewhere for lunch. This place is located just outside the old city gates. 

If you can get a table overlooking the sea, fabulous views are worth it. 

We had a great lunch with good views.

On the terrace over looking the medieval fort walls with views out to sea on a warm sunny winters day, eating local fish, salad and pasta, a nice bottle of white local wine called Posip, who could ask for more.
This wine is a local secret. They don't make enough to really ex port so we had it at most meals ( well we are on vacation)
Just fab all round.

After a walk around the Old Town, drinks here was just what refreshed us. In spite of the crowd, the service was fast. It is a perfect place to people watch as it is right on the Pile Gate where most tours drop off and pick up their guests.

While waiting for your pick up, just sit in one of their tables and enjoy a refreshing drink. You won't miss your pick up as you can easily see it.

I've been coming to this place for years and I can't recommend it enough. Dubravka has it all - great food, lovely ambience, friendly and professional staff and the sea view to die for. They have a large selection, I'm sure everyone can find something for themselves. Oh, and cakes, amazing cakes.

We had a close-up gorgeous view of the lit up medieval walls and Fort Lawrence at Dubvravka Restaurant. One wall was open to the outside but we were given blankets to keep warm. We enjoyed grilled lamb and steak with cheese, ham, asparagus and a cream sauce and wine. I'd suggest an early dinner here because it gets very crowded. There was a very good singer when we were there.

We easily got a table on the side of the terrace, a delicious first meal in Dubrovnik. 
Attentionate personnel !

This restaurant has one of the greatest views I have seen. Not only are the views of the sea amazing, the food is outstanding. The menu is extensive and lots of sea food options are available. I ate her twice during my stay. Fresh,fresh and fresh describe all of the food. I was quiet impressed with the staff. They were helpful, attentive and knew all about every menu option. I would certainly return here the next time I travel to Dubrovnik.

We walked in expecting average food and service; after all this restaurant is so strategically located -- it's next to Pile Gate -- that it could attract clients even if its food was below average -- it has a captive market. Yet the service was excellent and the dessert and coffee were far above average. There is a clearly an effort on the part of staff to ensure that standards remain high.

I booked ahead and Anita was very helpful in booking a nice table for a birthday meal.

It was very windy so we moved indoors, and the staff was very helpful in doing this.

The good was good and they gave us a free glass of wine for my partners birthday. 

Staff were lovely, I would recommend.

Much much better than I expected!
On a rainy night we didn't want to spend too long finding a restaurant.
We came here on a recommendation.
My first thought had been that it was a touristy restaurant but I was pleasantly surprised.
Excellent food and very good service.
All in nice surroundings with a great view if you are lucky!
Would recommend.

We saw the Dubravka 1836 Restaurant from the top of the city wall and thought it looked inviting. We got a seat overlooking the water, were served promptly and professionally, and had two delicious lunches at reasonable prices. We had a lovely meal - a five star experience.

With blankets and heaters available for cooler times this perfectly situated waterfront restaurant has the best views ever. The food is exceptional and sensibly priced. Staff were attentive and friendly. Discounts are offered if you use any other restaurant in the chain within Dubrovnik. We used all three.

Restaurant near entrance to Old Town with a fabulous view - unfortunately the food was not up to the same standard. Like most eating places in Dubrovnik it can be a bit pricey ( £30 - £40 for a bottle of fairly ordinary red wine) and in this case food was only ordinary. Choices of restaurants is amazing, side streets, little alley ways - difficult to make the right choice every time - the Jazz at an open bar just inside the entrance to Old Town made up for everything and we finished on a high note - well, Clarinet actually !

After a long 10 hours in the Old City, we stopped here for late night drinks before calling it a night. We got a seat right at the edge for a beautiful view of the harbor and walled city at night. The cocktails (Cosmo and Dry Martinin) were well made and service was spot on.
Nice and fast service...pleasant meal with great view...waiters very profesional and fast..nice ambient with a touch of an old hospitality...

We had a fabulous dinner here last night, adults had steak which was perfect and the kids really enjoyed their pizzas. The service was excellent - attentive without rushing us and we enjoyed the recommended local wines. Location is really great, lovely atmosphere with live music and warmth from the patio heaters. Highly recommended.
Had very good meal here on the terrace overlooking the walls. We did book via their website which is worth doing. A good balance between price and quality. Service very good.

Our last night in Dubrovnik and we chose the Dubravka and it was a very good choice. We sat outside, it wasn't cold though they kept offering us blankets and sat by the wall with great views of the city walls and Fort Lovrijenca. 
To start we both had the seafood platter of swordfish carpaccio, prawns, anchovies, capers and olives. Very good but rather too much lettuce and onion for my taste. This was followed by grilled squid. Five whole squid with vegetables and one potato. We rounded off the meal with the delicious chocolate and walnut cake Dubravka. 
Service was excellent, price reasonable but the location and views made it superb.

Went after reading reviews but not the best of experience. Quit rude demeanour of staff. No water served. We had gone for dinner and even before it was 22:00 hours, the waiter began clearing tables off condiments! That was quite rude in my view especially when we are still dining. Food was ordinary to say the least. Felt the Ines within the main square was far better

A really enjoyable lunch in a beautiful setting with most attentive, polite and warm staff. Excellent quality of food and drink as well as a thoroughly enjoyable dining experience.
It was a pleasure to dine at Dubravka Restaurant and a highlight of our visit to Dubrovnik.
We visited here on our first day for a snack before exploring. The service was mediocre as was the food. I wouldn't rush back but it's acceptable for a quick bite.

We loved this restaurant! Open all day for breakfast lunch and dinner. The breakfast was awesome and also came with a fabulous view. We also ate dinner here which was just as good and the view at night is well lit up. Situated only 2 minutes from Old Town entrance and for the Game of Thrones enthusiasts right near screening locations. Very reasonably priced and great service.

We had a nice meal at this restaurant on our last night in Dubrovnik. We made reservations, which definitely paid off! We had the best seat in the house, overlooking the water and Pile Gate. We each enjoyed pretty good entrees (one sea bass and one beefsteak Dubravka ,the sea bass was better!). The service was friendly, but most of all, the views were stunning, which made this visit worthwhile.

Wonderful location, atmosphere and food. Perched near the castle overlooking the sea The service was very good and the food enjoyable. I had penne arabatia my wife salmon pasta and a bottle of local wine a lovely experience. not the cheapest meal we have had but well worth it

Great wine and food + lovely atmosphere and excellent staff! high recommended restaurant.
we will back soon😁😁😁

Just stopped for breakfast in a town which is packed with restaurants. Friendly personnel, no problem at all to put 3 tables together. Good coffee and enough items for on bread. On the side a nice view over sea and fort

We decided to have a snack and drinks at this restaurant as the location was fabulous. We were lucky enough to get a seat near the wall overlooking the Fort Lovrijenac and the Ancient City Walls, it was stunning. We had the cheese platter and tried the Croatian wine all of which were lovely. Cheese platter was a little over priced but well worth it when combining the atmosphere and location. Would recommend.

First night in Dubrovnik thought we would give this restaurant a go. Location & views are great but prices are what one would expect in Dubrovnik over priced. We ordered the Croatian cheese platter for starters which was disappointing, 4 crackers, handful of olives, cherry tomatoes & walnuts & 6 sticks of cheese 92kn, in saying that the Ravioli with ham & truffle & the steak were nice. Service was great very attentive 5/5, food 4/5, value for money 3/5

Very good restaurant with the best location in Dubrovnik city. Amazing view.
Excellent food, wine and service.
Good location with reasonable prices, good food and excellent service (fast, fresh/delicious food and friendly staff)

My dad and I shares a lovely pizza with a view overlooking the old port and fortress. We also had breakfast there another day. Both were excellent. You pay a little more due to the location but we expected that.

My husband and I came here for dinner tonight.
I had pre booked a table and they gave us a lovely table by the wall outside, which had stunning views!
The food was delicious. But what stood out the most for me was the incredible service.
I would highly recommend this restaurant as it has it all: great food, great views and great service

Came off the round town bus tour,well worth doing incidently.
Got seated quickly nice table great coffee bit of a mix up re cake my fault mainly
Decided good place to go back for breakfast
Peter
Had two lunches here. Good service a wide menu and quality food. A great view just outside the old city walls and a view out to sea. Well worth the visit.
A quick stop in Cafe Dubravka, for yet another 'long" white coffee and tuna salad. Very nice location.

My girlfriend and I visited dubravka on impulse as it looked so nice. Great views of the walls and after a good walk round them and Dubrovnik we needed a good meal. We opted for the steaks. Cooked perfectly and tender with a lovely jus. We loved it. Our waiter was the real star so attentive and made us feel very special and welcome. Borna Janjanin we appreciated your patience and humour. There was a house band playing too. Excellent musicians and very friendly. What a lovely place. We were cramming lots into 1 week so couldn’t go back but there’s always next year. I highly recommend the dubravka 1836 restaurant. Top marks.
Like others exploring the old town we needed somewhere to eat and on a sunny day, view over the sea, great food (and a beer), attentive staff too. Not a bad price either.

We bought an ice-cream on a very warm day. Prices as one would expect in Dubrovnik are expensive, 46 kuna, about £5.50 for two cones with two scoops of delicious ice-cream.
Come prepared to pay over the odds for the privilege of visiting this city!

We pass by the restaurant and we saw the decorations from outside and we decide to go in! And as we pop in we got a very good welcoming from DIANA and then we have got a table with an awesome view. And ROBERTO RAGGAZO was our waiter, he treat my friend and i very nice. About the food was just delicious my friend took an octopus salad and i took a seafood salad and it was just yummy. We can smell the sea as all the dish was fresh! I would recommend you this restaurant with close eyes. 
PS : you have to try the ice cream also down the restaurant the girls were also very very nice GABRIELA AND NEVENCKA MARIE. 
HVUALA...

Wonderful setting, amazing food. Ivana went out of her way to make you feel welcome. Lovely big heat lamps and blankets supplied as it does get quite blowey. 
Can't fault it, try it yourself

The food took 45mins to arrive to our table, we were there before 7pm and the place wasn't that busy. The food itself was pleasant enough - can recommend the chicken tagliatelle. However our server had a sour face all night, ignored our table for the most part, and got very offended for the food left on our plates - even after we insisted it was good, just too much.
Good for the sunset view.

We visited Dubravka 1836 one lunchtime during our recent trip to Dubrovnik. We only planned to have a light lunch but the atmosphere was so inviting that we spent all afternoon and evening. The food was absolutely delicious as were the cocktails. The staff were very attentive placing outdoor heaters as the sun went down and offering customers a blanket. We will definitely return to enjoy more of the menu.
The food was really good (beef carpaccio and feta salad) but was was really impressive was the service. The best service I've experienced so far in my week in Croatia.

If you are in Dubrovnik then this is a must. The ride up was good and the view amazing. We first had tea in the restaurant and booked a table for lunch. The walk around at the top was really interesting and a wonderful opportunity for photos. We then went back to the restaurant and had a really good light lunch, which included the toasted steak sandwich, which was very tasty and the steak melted in your mouth. The staff were very friendly and helpful. After lunch we went to the War Museum and were pleased that we had decided to do as it was very interesting and well worth a visit. Reluctantly we made our way back to the cable car for the trip back down. In our opinion an experience not to be missed.

When we first arrived to the old town the view was so stunning we didn’t want to leave so we went into Dubravka for a quick bite and some wine. We were lucky to be sat beside the water with great views (I’m a huge Game of Thrones fan so I was extra excited). We got a vegetarian pizza and chips to share and a bottle of rosé. Everything was lovely. 
Prices in Dubrovnik are higher than most places I visit. This was one of the more reasonably priced restaurants over the course of our trip. The staff were friendly too.

Again after an excellent dinner in Panorama, we also booked a table in the terrace with Dubravka. The service was the also as amazing in Panorama and they also offer a very nice view especially for the sunset. I love every bit of it! Again on the terrace while having our dinner during sunset. We are a big lunch so we were not super hungry for our dinner but the food selection made us hungry! I had seafood risotto and my bf has tomato soup for starter and grilled squid for main. The food was amazing! When we are ready to pay the bill, the waitress came back with a slice of cake and said it was from them and greeted us a happy anniversary and another waiter also came and greeted us! OMG that's very thoughtful and so sweet! My bf and I looked at each other and we were so touched and amazed! The cake was amazing and thank you for doing this Dubravka! You made us so happy by just this simple gesture! I will not forget how you made us feel. 

We were also given 10% off as we have Dubrovnik card and even without the discount, the prices of the food are really cheap but very very sumptuous! Thank you again, Anita (sales manager)!

Sat along the old stone wall looking over the Adriatic Sea on our first day here. Had the seafood pasta which was hot and quickly served by very friendly staff. Can’t get a better view anywhere so it would be easy to skimp on quality but they didn’t. The service was pleasant and attentive and the food was first rate. Would go again.

Went for a light dinner. Pricey but probably not out of the norm for a restaurant in the old city. Food was mediocre - bread tasted stale, seafood pizza didn't have much seafood on it. Also had the rocket salad and fish soup, passable. 

Service was also mediocre (though we noticed our server was much friendlier and attentive to Caucasian diners). 

You get a great view from the terrace though, so probably go for lunch or before sunset for the view.
Excellent food, stunning view, brilliant service and good value for money. If we ever come back to Dubrovnik we may just eat here every night.

I split the seafood tagliatelle & seafood pizza with a friend, both were lovely! Seafood was cooked very well & the views were amazing. Not too pricey considering the location. Would definitely recommend.

My husband had thought about at booking Nautica for the view but when we looked at the prices it was a bit much so we looked at this restaurant instead.
We booked a day ahead and they promised us a waterside table, weather permitting, and gave us a 10% off discount card for when we came.
When we arrived the following evening the restaurant was very busy and I did wonder just where they would sit us but they put us on the best table in the place right at the front of the restaurant in the middle of the bay - bless 'em! It was just wonderful - we watch a storm out at sea while steeped in history - marvellous!
The food is good too - standard Italian but well presented and good value for money and the staff were delightful - not once did we feel pressurised into leaving our table and the amazing view.
Thank you for a lovely evening Dubravka!

Because of the location, you might mistake this restaurant as a tourist trap but, we walked by one night and decided to sit down and watch the sunset with a glass of wine. Then we decided to order dinner and the food was fabulous. The atmosphere was great, lots of locals and visitors, great waitstaff and beautiful views. One of our favorite stops on our visit to Dubrovnik...

Ate here 3 times during our week stay! Had something different every time and all done to a great standard! All staff are very friendly and always very busy! This restaurant is popular but no need to book as plenty of tables ! Situated just outside the old walls fantastic views also of the sea ! After our first visit they gave us a card with 10 % discount to use as they have 2 other restaurants in the area!

Dubrovnik isn't cheap, so it was great to find somewhere in an amazing location where you can get excellent Italian-style food at a reasonable price. There are more expensive options too: I was rather envious of the party nearby eating pasta with Istrian truffles...

You can just have drinks, or go for breakfast, and the cakes looked good too: and they don't hassle passers-by to get them to eat there, unlike most of the restaurants in Dubrovnik!

All in all, just a great place.

Location is stunning and food was very good - we had lunch. A large beer, fish platter and a chicken breast salad cost around £40 which we felt was expensive, but worth it due to quality and location.

The main issue on paying was that the waiter, without asking pressed ‘pay in GBP’, meaning that the exchange rate was set by the Croatian bank (I’m unsure whether the restaurant make any money from this or whether he thought it was being helpful). The meal ended up costing almost £3 extra which upset me, as my bank doesn’t charge any commission (most charge 2.99%) for foreign transactions.

Sorry about the rant, but important to mention as this could work out £10+ if you had dinner with wine etc. or if a family were dining.

The card issue left a bitter taste in my mouth, hence the rating.

My advice - worth a visit, although maybe pay with cash!

An ideal resting place for lunch just outside the Old City Walls of Dubrovnik with stunning views on a sunny day....

Outdoor terrace tables or indoor options...

We enjoyed a light lunch with reasonably prices and pleasant service... I had a Pizza Delicate (Dellikates) for 92Kn and Beer look our for -10% voucher cards. A lovely lunch...

We had a delightful experience at Dubravka 1836 Restaurant. Located near Pile Gate, a stone's throw from the Old City, Dubravka is know as one of the most beautiful view restaurants in Dubrovnik. Lovely view spread in front of your eyes from terrace situated near medieval walls, just overlooking the Bokar Tower and fortress Lovrijenac, it is a perfect place for having breakfast, lunch or just drink coffe and watch the flow of people going to and from very touristy square. So you can enjoy a stunning surrounding while enjoying your meal! Togehter with a warm service make your stay a pleasant memory.

We booked a table overlooking the sea we ordered drinks & then it started raining very heavily the staff were wonderful moving every one under cover & within 10 minutes everything was back to normal.The food & wine was lovely as were the staff who were helpful & friendly

We were told about this by our apartment host. After just arriving in Dubrovnik we wanted to find somewhere close our apartment and get something quick. The restaurant is just outside the Pile Gate where most of the buses stop from the airport etc. The view from the restaurant looking out to the sea is beautiful but for me that's the best bit. Myself and my partner both had pepperoni pizza which was just average. Nothing special compared to other meals we have had in Dubrovnik - I think there are better places.

A great restaurant with fair prices next to the Old Town! My friends and I got recommendations about this place by the locals and we are happy that we did. Our waiter was extremely polite and answered quickly to all of our requests. Meals were well prepared and the portion suited the price. The view was also a big plus!

Well it just would, wouldn't it - after a super sunny day, the rain finally won and we took refuge in Dubravka. Expecting to be a caoitic cafe right near the bus stops and hundreds of tourists, we were pleasantly surprised to find a well ordered and calm oasis. After snacking all day we didn't have much appetite but managed the Dubravka cake, ice cream, hot tea and ice cream! Very nice I have to say and moderately priced at 160 kuna, worth the visit for sure.

Just returned from exquisite Dubrovnik where we visited this restaurant the last 3 consecutive nights. We had a wonderful welcome from all the staff who made us feel very special. Service was 5 star, ambience wonderful. Can't wait to return and this restaurant will be our first choice.

Dubravka seems like a big touristy restaurant (and it sort of is) but the food is excellent. Great spot for a quick lunch - we had pizza and salad and both were really good. The best thing, though, is their ice cream; theirs is perhaps the best we had in the Balkans and they give huge portions. You can see people eating it all over the main square outside the Pile gate, and for good reason! The peanut ice cream was particularly incredible.
Anniversary meal was absolutely gorgeous food was great, staff very attentive and had a great laugh with people we met at next table 😀

We came to the place because of wonderful TripAdvisor reviews and got really disappointed. 
There are a few options of sets for breakfast on the menu. I took an option with eggs with cheese and ham, bread and jams. Eggs were somehow way too fatty and cheese was just on top of an egg, not really melted or anything and didn't taste like anything. My bf had omelette with tomatoes, fresh fruits and bread with jams. His omelette was just average. Jams are served in cute little jars. Coffee was not good, tasted more like an instant coffee and latte macchiato was served in a normal coffee cup, so there was no difference to cappuccino at all. 
It's a great idea to have such sets for breakfast, it's rather cheap, but the taste is average or even below average. 
If you're happy just with bread and jams, then it might be a great place for you, but if you expect a bit more from a breakfast probably it's worth it to go somewhere else.

Service is such an important part of a meal. 

I'm not demanding but I do like a smile, some eye contact and a feeling that I'm welcome. 

I didn't get that here but the view and food is lovely. 

Do try it. Perhaps you'll get a different person.

We were in Dubrovnik for 3 nights and we ate here twice for dinner. The food is delicious (especially the pizza)! I myself am a vegetarian and I had no problem at all finding something to eat on the menu. The staff are very friendly and helpful. In my opinion, the price of the food is very very reasonable and worth it. We paid a lot more for food which was nowhere near as good. The atmosphere is quite romantic, live music and singers and the view is spectacular. I would definitely recommend this restaurant.
We ate twice at this restaurant and were impressed on both occasions with the food, service and location. We had different salads for lunch and they were all very good quality

Visited twice during our stay, both times for drinks only. Located just before the Pile Gate entrance to the old town, this restaurant had a nice atmosphere, plenty of seats on the wraparound terrace and lovely staff. Views of the sea or city walls both enjoyable, can get a little breezy in the evenings and staff provide blankets to those feeling the chill.

Beautiful setting with soft music, surprised by the good breakfast. About $13 for expresso, fresh orange juice, fried eggs with ham & cheese, 3 different breads with butter, jam, honey, and nutella. They take credit cards.
Located in the very centre of the city, you don't expect such a nice service and reasonable prices. We were so satisfied with our dinner so we went there for lunch the next day.
Good wine and nice food. A couples retreat from the rain. Enjoyable atmosphere and pleasant music. Waiter for attentive and ambience lively.

Had meal here last Friday evening while on a long weekend break. The place was very busy which seemed like a good sign. 
The service was friendly and reasonably quick. I had king prawns and my wife had veal both of which were excellent. Prices are reasonable and a litre bottle of the house wine was of decent quality and price..
I would definitely go back.

We came here on a Friday before a day of exploring old town. This was by far the best deal that I had in terms of price, what you receive, and the view!! The location and the brunch meals don't get much better; orange juice, any hot drink, plenty of toast with jams, butter, and nutella!, omelette and fresh fruit. All for less than 10 EUR.

First night & we wanted a view of the famous walls of Dubrovnik & this place didn't disappoint. Under candlelight on warm evening the view was perfect.

Service was minimal & slow, but we quickly learned this was the norm throughout the country. 

Tomato with stuffed salad was delicious, almost like a risotto texture. Pasta was okay and my fellow guests said their meal sufficed however was unremarkable.

the menu here is basic but just fine - good breakfast options and convenience given the location to the wall and tour buses; dinner is so-so - pizza is frozen out of a box, but the wine including the house wine is fine and reasonably priced. The service at this restau is excellent - we ate breakfast here every day given the proximity to our rental flat and dinner one night because we'd overeaten so many other nights - and the people who work here are friendly, fast, pleasant and in a horrendous rain storm, showed good humor and effort to get everyone into a dry place!

We ate here after reading the previous good reviews on TripAdvisor. I totally agree. The food was to a very high quality, the flavours were amazing. We both had pasta dishes with wild garlic sauce - delicious! Desserts were also very good. The service was friendly from all staff. Add to that the amazing views, perfect evening in Dubrovnik.
Had a quick drink stop here and found it to have a nice view but the staff were blunt to the point of rudeness. Drinks were of good quality but pricey.

we went there six or seven times, each time the food was great and the staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. The restaurant is located near the entrance to the Old town and has magnificent view of the City walls and sea. Absolutely great experience every time!!

The restaurant is in a fantastic location with great views, however it is let down by the poor food.

Having pages and pages of items on the menu is never a good sign! The food was ok but nothing special (I had the lasagne), service was good.

I would return here for a drink but would eat elsewhere.

We came here to enjoy a leisurely lunch on our last day in Dubrovnik and were not disappointed. My sons chose pizza and I a pork fillet - both were delicious. House wine also good. Best of all was the torta dubravka, rich and delicious, enough for all 3 of us! The waiter was friendly and attentive but not obtrusive and the cost was not outrageous for a location in a prime spot between the shore and the Pile gate - a major entrance to the old town. Recommended
The food is OK, the view is nice but the restaurant is too commercialized for me. The service wasn't the best and it seemed like most tourists went to this restaurant.

Came here on a recent trip to Dubrovnik for some dinner because of the fantastic location. Whilst the location, service and price were good the standard of the food was pretty average. 
I had the chicken pasta and the sauce was nice however chicken was pretty tough and chewy and had been over-cooked. 
All in all I feel like it definitely trades more on the fact it has a great location more than the quality of the food. There are definitely better places to eat in Dubrovnik and would suggest this place is better suited to coming for a drink to enjoy the view.

We spotted this restaurant outside the walls. It was a very busy restaurant but they did try to keep up with the clearing and refreshing of tables. It's a nice setting over the sea and next to the old town walls. We had the breakfast with omelette, a small plate of fruit, small juice, hot drink, bread and pastries. The omelette was freshly made with mozzarella and tomato. The breakfast was reasonably priced at 76kn. Would recommend this place rather than going inside the walls where it is extremely busy.

Myself and my husband visited here last night for our final night in Dubrovnik. What a perfect choice! We did not book and were luckily seater right at the front of the restaurant with the best views in the house! So impressive and a great atmosphere. My husband chose bolognaise pizza and I had lasagne. Both were very tasty and reasonably priced (compared with other restaurants in Dubrovnik). Thank you for the most wonderful evening!

Visited Dubravka twice in our four day visit to Dubrovnik. Ideal location - with indoor and outdoor seating. I had the seafood risotto, and seafood tagliatelle which were both really tasty and had a very generous amount of seafood. Bread provided with oil and vinagerette to start which was a great touch. Service was very good - attentive waiting staff. Very reasonable prices compared with other restaurants in the old town, definitely recommend.

My husband and I had a meal in this wonderful restaurant close to the old city walls in Dubrovnik.
It's is delightfully situated with wonderful views . The food and service were brilliant. The night we ate here there was a cellist and pianist playing which made the experience even more pleasant. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone visiting Dubrovnik.

We ate twice at this restaurant (lunch and then dinner) as it was reasonable for Dubrovnik, the food was good and the staff were friendly and helpful.

Would definitely recommend

We spotted this restaurant whilst walking the walls and searched it out immediately for croissants and milkshakes. The location is very convenient - immediately adjacent to Pile Gate. The prices are very reasonable given the location and the waterside views. The strawberry milkshake was as good as I have had anywhere, thick,creamy and delicious.
A great restaurant overlooking the sea. A good selection on the menu from fish to meats.. Pizzas.. Pasta.. Good selection of wines and liqueurs..

Amazing setting overlooking the city walls and the sea, views that are equivalent to that of the significantly more expensive Nautika located next door but at half the price.

Service was impeccable, with a varied menu. The only negative comment would be that the fish tasted like it had been cooked in cheap oil and unfortunately this did take away from the overall enjoyment of the main course but that said dessert was amazing.

Located right in front of the Pile gate, it certainly will attract a lot of customers. Lots of food variety for all meals. I had dinner here (Tuna steak dinner). It was really tasty and price is fair considering we're in the heart of where tourist congregate. Service was fast (seriously fast), yet everything was made to order. No complaints here :) Stop by and have a meal. Great views of the fortress and wall, as well as people watching.
Had been here twice over the past week. Great location for coffee and cakes break before entering the walls of Dubrovnik. Good attentive service. Expensive but worth it

This is a good value restaurant, considering Dubrovnik prices. There is a good choice; it's not fine dining but it's in a great location,overlooking the sea and close to the city walls. The staff are very helpful and friendly and on the night we were there there was a bit of a cool wind so they brought out blankets to keep us warm! After trying other restaurant, I would definitely say try Dubravka.

Wanted to be on the terrace but it quite busy. Served very quickly and were recommended a local wine which has won awards a little pricey at £40 but was worth every penny it was fabulous. Had the seafood risotto which is listed under starters, We were told its a lot bigger than a starter and they were not wrong it was huge and so tasty could have done with a bit more seafood in it but it was still great. Service was very good although felt a little rushed. The boys had Spaghetti Bolognese which they also enjoyed.

We stayed in the walled city of Dubrovnik for 5 days and ate at several restaurants for breakfast lunch and dinner. This was our favourite and we returned to it on several occasions and at least once a day. 
Why?
Friendly helpful service. Great menu. Food well prepared and attractively presented. Delicious! Good choice of wines.
The location is fantastic, just by the walled entrance at the Pile gate, and with stunning open views of the sea. Beautiful place, so light and open, and stunning.
Good lunch visit after city walls walk - good service and food in a great location even though it was busy.
I'd recommend this place for breakfast as it has spectacular views and you can get coffee, juice, eggs/vegetables/meats and fruit for around 70 kuna, one of the most reasonable in Dubrovnik!

At the old city pile gate. Dubravak serves local mussels and many other dishes. A large shaded outdoor seated area overlooks the ocean and the stone wall of the gated old city. Make reservations if you would like to sit along the sea wall. We had a large bowl of mussels and the black pasta with shrimp. All delicious. Reasonable prices

Had dinner early, they seem to rush you , food was not the best !!would not recommend this establishment! Good view , but that's all 
Dubrovnik in general is very beautiful, but locals are not friendly at all, give me your money and go , attitude ! 
Don't know what people rave about it !?

This morning we decided going to Dubravka for breakfast as it was recommended by our host. I've to say it was a pity we hadn't had breakfast there on the previous days! Previously, we were charged much more for not worthy breakfasts. We loved the service and the food. For 68kn you have a full breakfast with orange juice, doughnut, bread, jam, butter and a hot drink of your choice :) Waiters were very friendly and the views to the sea really relaxing. A perfect start of a day! :) Don't miss it!
We had pizza and seafood pasta--incredible but the best was a very reasonable bottle of Sancerre. I would highly recommend for lunch. Also a good house wine.
Best breakfast we came across in Dubrovnik during our 5 days trip. Nice and friendly staff, delicious food. Highly reccomended.

Would highly recommend this restaurant if your staying in Dubrovnik. If you want a table with the best views, book a few days in advance to be sure to reserve.

Food was amazing the gratinated beef was the best meal I've had during my stay in Croatia the combination of all the ingredients worked perfectly and were extremely tasty.

The pizza my girlfriend had was full of fresh toppings.

Not too expensive considering the location

Staff were nice and helpful too.

Went for drinks only, and enjoyed our experience. The Dalmatian G+T had rosemary and rose liquor and was the most photogenic drink I've ever seen, but tasted like a straight up gin and tonic. The Dubrovnik mule was deliciously spicy with chunks of fresh ginger, and the sorbeto with lemon sorbet, vodka and prosecco was delicious, but small. Be prepared to pay a small fortune for whatever you order, but the view is awesome and the drinks are tasty and service adequate.

My partner and I went here for out final night in Dubrovnik. The food was of good quality and well prepared. It was reasonably priced for the area. The portion sizes were adequate. The service was very good and the waiter could not do enough to help.

This was the restaurant where I had the best meal in Dubrovnik during my four day stay. The esplanade near the city walls makes the place gorgeous for a perfect dinner. Food and environment was fantastic 🙂

We booked Breakfast here after reading the reviews on TA. The customer service was really good as are the views. We liked the overall service and food options so much we returned for lunch (The pasta was finger-licking delicious!). One note: Our experience of good service is based on the fact that we avoided the peak hour rush hours (early breakfast and later lunch time).
Such a picturesque location between the sea and city walls. I tried their breakfast menu and the pasta both of which tasted extremely fresh and beautifully prepared.

The place has been highly recommend by tour guides, bloggers and TripAdvisor. However, the only thing going for the place is it's location by the sea overlooking the old town. The food was below average (we've been in Croatia for 12 days now and have eaten at a variety of places so can safely say this with some authority) and expensive.

Visited for dinner after walking the city walls. There were plenty of options at reasonable prices, even for fussy vegetarians - we both had penne arrabiata. Service was wonderful and speedy, and of course the view was stunning! Hope to return later in the week.

We stopped here after our walking tour for a bottle of water and a sit down in the heat. 

While some restaurants can be funny about people just having a drink there was absolutely no problem here - even though they have a fabulous view over the bay and seemed to have a steady stream of customers. The staff were welcoming and friendly. They quite happily gave us the WiFi code and we were able to catch up with "stuff".

We saw lots of lovely looking food being served - but were not tempted as our time was limited. We intend to return to Dubrovnik and will enjoy a meal at this more welcoming restaurant.

Came here for lunch, and it's located conveniently right outside the Pile Gate to the Old City. They have a wonderful terrace overlooking the bay, which was a great spot for lunch. Prices were reasonable, consistent with prices found inside the Old City with much more comfortable seating. Would recommend the seafood risotto! Also really enjoyed the coffee there. Service could be more attentive, but it is a very busy spot so it was understandable. Would recommend!

As soon as I arrived in Dubrovnik I wanted to drink something, the restaurant seemed nice with an outstanding view. The waiters were very nice and the service was relatively fast. I enjoyed the service so much I went there later that day to try the local beer. The only piece of advice I'd give you is that you exchange to Kunas before, even if this restaurant accepts Euros, you won't need to worry about exchange ratios and since a lot of shops don't accept euros it's killing 2 birds with one stone
Excellent food accompanied by stunning sunset, we both had pasta which was delicious - hope to go again sometime soon

We came with no reservation and although busy, we got one of the best seats and views in the restaurant which was great. Food was slow to arrive, fine. When it did arrive it was enjoyable but nothing amazing and a bit over priced. We would have happily returned here and eaten again however our server ignored us the entire time. Not once were we asked how our meal was, if we wanted more drinks etc. She was preoccupied with talking to a Canadian couple in front of us about her trip to Canada all evening. She went back to them and another table several times getting them more drinks and dessert. We signalled to her more than once to get more drinks and were told '1 minute' every time which never came. We decided to eat up and leave. After waiting 25 minutes with our empty plates on the table we got our bill (after several requests). When it came to paying we ended up giving it to a manager as we waited 10 minutes for it to be collected for our change but nothing from our server. The restaurant was half empty by the time we received our meal so being busy wasn't the issue. We would have spent more money on drinks and deserts but the poor service really put a dampener on what had been lovely food. Won't be returning.

My wife and I ate hear on a recent trip to Dubrovnik. The location is fantastic and we had requested a table overlooking the water, which we were allocated looking across to Pile entrance and a couple of the forts. The food was good quality and plentiful, with the abligatory cats hanging around for any leftovers. The staff were attentive and knowledgeable about the wine they offered. We had booked the table for 19:30 which was a great time as just before sunset (Croatian sunsets are magnificent) and we watched the kayaks returning from the day adventures and saw a spectacular bird show of the swifts or swallows returns no to their nesting areas. Lovely food and great place to eat in Dubrovnik. Only problem was organising the booking in the first place.

After a disappointing start due to the attitude of one member of staff, this place improved a lot! It's good for coffees / breakfast with a beautiful view. We also went one night for pizza which was very tasty and generous portions. We had tried to reserve at their very nice sister restaurant Nautika across the street but sadly no tables were available. That said, the more relaxed atmosphere at Dubravka 1836 probably suited us more that night. 

The house wine was surprisingly good and served in 200ml measures rather than the seemingly standard 100ml Dubrovnik measure. 

Unfortunately you'll struggle to get a table near the edge with the fabulous view unless you're eating although we did get a table there just for drinks one night. The food is good though so if you have to...

The best restaurant I ate at during my 5 day stay in Dubrovnik. I went here twice.
Why?

My parents and I found the food the most pleasant to taste, clean and healthy tasting.

The service was really quick and did not require advance booking.

The ambience of the place is fantastic. Really has a great vibe to it.

Friendly service. Received a 10% discount as a repeat customer.

Also the Hawaiian cocktails are divine. 

A must go to place while you're in Dubrovnik! Location is excellent as it is right by the entrance of the old city ancient walls.

This is a delightful restaurant, located on the edge of Dubrovnik old town with a a lovely ambience, the Food is very nice, the service is very good, staff very friendly, Its ticks all the boxes. this Restaurant is suitable for all. Although it can be Romantic if you have a seat at the edge of the restaurant overlooking the sea.

Lovely staff made me welcome.
I only had a wine/hot chips but sat for quite a while. Not moved along. Beautiful day. Nice muck playing.
Clean environment......Reasonable price for a house white. Busy part of town but this place is a bit away from the crowds.

I had a lovely experience overall in Dubrovnik, however was extremely disappointed when I visited this restaurant for a drink on my last day and was treated poorly by one waiter in particular, "Borna". He made us feel very uncomfortable and unwelcome in the establishment from the moment we sat down. If you treat all customers this way I am surprised you still have a business.

One of the first restaraunts you see once coming off the coach's at Pile gate. Very spacious, great view over the Adriatic and the walls of the old town. Good selection of food and attentive staff. As with most places in Dubrovnik, prices are slightly on the expensive side.
Views were beautiful and the food was delicious with something for all tastes. It is expensive but no more so than many other restaurants in the old city.

Straight in front of the Pile Gate - Cafe Dubravka is THE meeting point for all tours. So we expected high prices. Actually we`ve been positively surprised. The breakfast was really very good and the price was fine. Service was fast - even a bit too fast - they don`t expect you to stay too long. If you are lucky and sitting in the first rows you can enjoy an excellent view.

These two cafes are situated right at the top of the mountain.l next to the cable Cart which has the best view in town. It is a little expensive but by far the best view. They don't serve food until 11am. The breakfast was very limited.

The other cafe is in the city, we had breakfast there and it was ok. A good experience with a nice view just outside of old town on the north side.

We turned up Saturday night, with no booking. We waited a short while but were seated right along the edge with a great view over the city walls. This is a great spot. Service was good, food was decent but not exceptional. Live music was pretty good and not out of place. Enjoyable evening, great location.

Great location with simply prepared delicious food. Grilled fish, grilled chicken, grilled vegetables. Simply seasoned with olive oil and salt. Gluten free bread available. Delicious. Friendly wait staff.

Dined here a couple of times. Prices were on a par with most restaurants in town. Service was good, food was good and the location is perfect. This would be one of the first restaurants I would return to if I come back to Dubrovnik.

Just outside the Old Town walls by the Pile gate, with views of the old city walls and the sea. Excellent menu and decent wine list, with very good help from the waiter on which wine to choose. We were able to get a table for 4 at 7pm even though it was quite busy and had been recommended by our tour guide. During the day you can get anything from a cup of coffee, cake, or beer / spirits to a full meal.

We were in Dubrovnik for 3 nights for a wedding. Two of these nights we ended up at this restaurant, we just couldn't resist. After our first night of going here it was all we could think of. 

The location was so perfect, right in front of the walls to old town with a view overlooking the beach, you feel like royalty looking over from your castle as you eat your food. Our table was perfectly placed against the wall and it was a very romantic setting. 

We ordered the truffle ravioli for starters and the gourmet meat plate (both to share and we ordered the same on both nights as it was so nice) with sides of mushrooms and steamed vegetables (as the meat plate already came with croquettes). 

As romantic as this place really is it is also perfect for families. Service was on point and you couldn't fault it and when we left they even gave us a 10% off voucher for their sister restaurant at the top of the cable car. It was reasonably priced for the location and quality of the food and we ended up paying around 500 kuna for 2 including alcohol which we didn't think was bad at all. HIGHLY RECOMMEND! 

Instagram: @katykatess

A very nice restaurant near the gate with nice views on the citadelle walls and the bay. A table by the balcony allows to benefit most from what this restaurant has to offer. The food is good. Service can be slow during peak time. You have to call for the waiters
A great location to enjoy the view of the walls and sea views while enjoying a nice meal that was very reasonably priced. The staff were pleasant and accommodating. Definitely a great stop.

We didn't book, but were seated after a ten minute wait, which was okay, but we were told to go to the other side of the restaurant entrance to be seated. The restaurant is very busy, our table overlooked part of the bay, which is just beautiful. I had a greek salad for a starter which was pretty good, my husband had beef carpaccio, which was tasty, but laden with mustard. He still liked it, but I would not have liked it with mustard at all, I prefer my beef carpaccio with thinly sliced celery, lemon juice and slivers of parmesan. Our waiter Mario was very friendly.

For mains my husband had Tuna steak, was asked how he prefers it, and said medium rare, but the fish is cut so thin, it came well done. The children were a bit tired by this point, so we did not send it back. I had a seafood mix, which was actually good, the scallop was a bit overdone, but the prawn was succulent, the octopus very good, as was the white fish and salmon. Vegetables a bit bland, and overcooked, but not unpalatable.

Whilst the food was not terrible, it was rather expensive, but I guess you pay for the location. Service was reasonable, we asked for butter for my youngest daughter, but it never arrived, however the waiter apologised when he remembered he forgot the butter. The atmosphere is pretty amazing though, it is bustling, and there was live music, a bit of jazz with a trumpeter and keyboard, were pretty good, we enjoyed that.

Been to this Resteraunt several times. Although always busy you never have to wait too long for a table. Great for large parties. Staff are extremely helpful and very professional. Views are stunning and people watching is a must. The day I last went we experienced very strong hurricane winds. All the waiters rushed to the umbrellas to hold on tight. The winds were so so strong that several just splintered. Ours came down on the table luckily missing us. I was drenched by the flying ice bucket but after a free bottle I soon dried off.

Same bland horrible tourist rubbish served up in the rest of Dubrovnik. 

Had the Sea bass and would rather have had frozen fish fingers and chips it was that bland and horrible.

Pizza wasn't even wood fired, base average, tomato average and cheese was cheap. 

Dubrovnik is a beautiful town destroyed by tourism. Lacks any kind of soul or identity simply relies on its stunning heritage.

I live in London and for this kind of garbage you don't pay these kind of prices pure and simple. 

All
Of it was totally and utterly over priced, even the pigeons which swarmed the surrounding tables wouldn't eat it.

We booked a party of 10 for a birthday lunch. They gave us an excellent table on the terrace with views of the city walls and sea.

The food and drinks were both excellent but mostly the service was amazing. The staff were extremely accommodating to our large-ish group.
The restaurant is in a great location just outside the city walls at Pile Gate . Fabulous food and service. I would definitely recommend this restaurant.

We had such an amazing time inside the city walls of Dubrovnik and were looking to eat something good, but we didn't want to eat inside the city walls since most of the places there are really expensive and not very good ...

Considering this restaurant is right outside the city walls, We were pleasantly surprised how good it was, and reasonable in price .. 

We both had mussels with fries and a couple of beers and glass of local wine ...

The restaurant is big and busy, but we had a really friendly waiter who spoke great english and recommend us a place to go see ...

Recommended if you are looking for a place to eat that is not inside the city walls.

Restaurant do take reservation if you need by the seaside table.

Food wise, nice and well present. Love the tout fish and grilled squid. Highly recommend dark noodle with prawn, make sure asked less salt. Too Salty for our dinner.

Price wise, cheaper compare to restaurant inside old city. 

Service, to be honest much better compare to other two I went two day ago. 

Highly recommend.

After a GOT Tour for 4 hours the tour guide recommended this restaurant. The food was very good with good prices. We sat outside and had a terrific view of the Castle Walls. The service was friendly and they also had wifi

Would definitely eat there again. We had seafood mussels and pizza and salad

Many many years ago, in South London, I received an A in English Literature GCSE. The book we were asked to study was "Lord of the Flies" and I very proudly managed to get an A without reading the book. True story. In the lessons leading up to the exam, my English teacher would discuss the themes of the book and basically told everyone in the class that the book's themes were a reflection of world politics at the time however just to be annoying, I argued that the book reflected religion, the perceptions of heaven and hell. I had no idea what I was talking about as I never actually read the book and my teacher kept telling me that I was wrong and if I wrote that in the exam I would fail.

Exam day, I sit down with the book in front of me as the clock starts ticking. Everyone around me is writing away with their prepared notes at hand. I sit there not knowing what to do. I open the book to the first page and start reading. 5 minutes later and I'm bored. I have 2 hours for this exam, I don't have enough time to read the book so I decide just to go for it. It was at this moment I had a choice; do I write about Churchill and the politics that I was told to write about or will I write about heaven and hell? I decided to write about heaven and hell. I wanted to test my teacher's theory to see if I actually wrote a valid argument, would I still fail? Then to my amazement, I got an A. For blagging my way through the school year without reading the syllabus then writing random rubbish, I was awarded with an A. Enter my smug face into the next English class.

Now, that was probably a sign that I could get by for the rest of my life without reading things properly. Well thanks to Dubravka, I may have finally learnt my lesson for if I read the menu correctly, I might've enjoyed my meal a bit more. Although I suspect everything else on the menu may also have been equally average.

Following a long day exploring the lovely Old Town, cute girlfriend and I had already decided that we will end our day at Dubravka for our last meal in Dubrovnik following a recommendation from our AirBNB host. We had just finished walking around the city walls, we were tired, it was hot and we were hungry. We arrive at Dubravka and have a quick glance at the menu by the entrance before going in. The menu was a surprising 10 pages or so. There was so much to choose from yet nothing was standing out as a signature dish or a must have. I was unsure. Cute girlfriend was unsure. I was too tired to look for another place to eat so I was reluctant to go anywhere else but I was compelled to leave. I was just about to turn to leave before the hostess caught us looking at the menu and offered us 10% off our meal. Suckers for a bargain we decided just to go for it.

We were seated immediately at quite a nice candle lit table in the middle of the outdoor restaurant with an amazing view of the sea and Old town Walls. Once seated, I looked at cute girlfriend and she was happy. I was happy. This was nice. For our last night in Dubrovnik at the exact moment of the sunset, this was a perfect and romantic setting for the occasion.

The very polite and happy waiter places the menus in front of us. Despite spending 5 minutes beforehand looking at the menu deciding what we could have, this was crunch time. I needed to make a decision. I started having a good look at everything then noticed the prices. It wasn't cheap. Although I had a 10% discount voucher in my hand, the prices were still a bit high and so I discreetly count how much money we have left in my pocket before making a choice. I have enough for 2 main meals and drinks with just about enough left over for potential ice-cream later on in the town. But definitely not enough for starters. I usually like to get starters. I think chefs like making starters. Little appetising bursts of flavour to excite you before your main meal but unfortunately starters at Dubrakva are simply out of our budget range. I ask cute girlfriend if she wants a starter and she says no. This is good, we can afford a meal. But I can't help but feel a bit annoyed at the price given we could've gotten a large pizza for 2 elsewhere for the price of 1 main at Dubravka. Roll with it. YOLO.

The waiter approaches to take an order for our drinks. A bit more time for me to make my way through the novel sized menu. I felt a bit dehydrated so I opted for water. This also felt like the sensible option given the expensive prices for food. Cute girlfriend opted for blueberry juice. The waiter asked her again. She again said blueberry juice. He was confused and looked at her as if she was making up items that weren't on the menu. He had never heard of blueberry juice. To be honest, neither had I, and I was also confused as to why she had opted for blueberry juice but it was on the menu and she wanted to try something different. He began naming the juices that were available such as orange juice, pineapple juice, apple juice but didn't believe that blueberry was an option. Cute girlfriend then turns to the menu for evidence and shows him the option for blueberry juice. He still looks confused but writes down the order. We were a little bit surprised but given the 8000 items on the menu, you can forgive the waiter for not knowing everything. He returned with the water and the blueberry juice apologising for his confusion.

I have finally decided on a main dish. I decide on the Veal medallions in chanterelle sauce whilst cute girlfriend opted for Fillet of pork with gorgonzola sauce. Googling of "chanterelle" and "gorgonzola" took place before confirming our order with our waiter. But the sauce aside, I was mainly just excited for the veal. I didn't really pay attention to anything else. The waiter took our orders and walked away. I was confused as to why the waiter didn't ask how I wanted my veal cooked but I had faith that it would be good.

Some bread arrived at the table. A lot of bread in fact. I started to wonder if the surcharge for the food was to account for the amount of bread you were given. But granted, the bread was good. I was victim to "if you put food in front of me, I will eat it". I ate a fair amount of bread before cute girlfriend stopped me. Then as we waited for our mains with a cold drink at hand, I had time to sit back and appreciate the restaurant's atmosphere. The outdoor setting in the middle of a crowded tourist filled area was surprisingly peaceful. With the sounds of some gentle live music playing in the background and slight breeze in hot Croatian weather sitting across from cute girlfriend in candlelight, everything was perfect. Maybe the food surcharge is fair for the location and the atmosphere that makes it impossible not to fall in love with this beautiful town.

The food arrives and to my surprise, my veal is served with brussels sprouts and vegetable fingers whilst cute girlfriend's pork fillet was served with potato croquettes and broccoli. I don't like brussels sprouts or vegetable fingers. I like broccoli. I didn't remember seeing brussels sprouts and vegetable fingers on the menu. But I wasn't going to let that bother me. I wanted the veal and I got the veal. Excited, I'm ready to tuck in. I cut a piece of my veal and take a bite. My face drops. It's completely overcooked and rubbery. I'm shocked. I start thinking to myself, have I had veal before? I definitely have and it's never been like this. Doubting myself, I turn to google. I search for pictures of veal steaks and see what I expect, pieces of veal cooked perfectly at medium rare. It's not inedible, just not anything enjoyable. Accompanied with 2 sides that I don't like, I'm starting to regret my meal. Cute girlfriend cuts a piece of her pork fillet and puts it on my plate. I try it and it's better than my veal (annoyingly) but it's still the same; overcooked and rubber. So between us the only appealing things on the table is the broccoli and what's left of the complimentary bread.

We try not to let the over-priced average food bother us too much as the setting and atmosphere was good, let's focus on the positives here. So we talked about what was nice about the restaurant ignoring the food. We agreed that the staff were very nice and attentive and the live background music was a nice touch. We decided to have see where the music was coming from to realise that the live music was actually coming from another restaurant/bar next door. The price of our meal is once again popping into my head; the surcharge we're paying no longer covers the music.

We make it through our mains, the brussels sprouts left behind as we sit back and review the meal. It then dawned on us that the vegetable fingers and the potato croquettes must've come from frozen packets surely. And if they came from frozen, how much of the rest of the menu was from frozen? Was the broccoli from frozen? The brussels sprouts? Quite possibly. Then we came to think, what about the veal and the pork fillets, is it all from frozen? Is that why they had to be cooked well-done with no other choice? Is this equivalent to a frozen ready meal? It might actually be so. With my inner Sherlock coming through, I came to think that with an average sized restaurant, how can they possibly offer about 10 pages worth of food on their menu? How can they possibly store that much variety? How big is their freezer?

We catch the attention of the waiter to ask for the bill and he nods and says he'll get it right away. As I sit there eating the remains of our "free" bread waiting for the bill, I start concluding my experience of Dubravka. Was it worth it? In short, the answer is no. Despite the amazing atmosphere, it's an atmosphere that you can experience for free by standing right next to restaurant's outdoor seating area. There you'll be able to experience the perfect view, light breeze and the relaxing music from the establishment next door. The only thing you won't get is very disappointing food, most probably from frozen on a candlelit table. 

The bill still hasn't arrived. We catch the attention of the waiter once again and he once again nods. We start thinking about whether or not we should go get some ice-cream in the town. Dessert at Dubravka was out of the question. With this in mind I do start to think, ice-cream anywhere would've been out of the question without the 10% discount that we were given so we must be thankful for that and although our waiter is struggling to juggle his tables to get us our bill, he was very nice and welcoming and so there was nothing really horrible about our experience. The bill still hasn't arrived so we catch the attention of another waiter who instantly gets our bill. Our original waiter notices and intercepts him to present us with our bill personally apologising that he's been a bit too busy. We're not fussed and politely pay the bill giving him the 10% voucher. He tells us to keep the voucher so we can use it next time and thanks us for our custom. That 10% voucher won't be used again.

As we get up to leave, I notice the live band playing next door as I stop by the entrance to take a quick peek at the menu. Cute girlfriend stops confused as to what I'm doing. I look and my suspicions are correct; I am my own worst enemy. Brussels sprouts and vegetable fingers were listed as sides to the veal but I didn't read the menu properly. I should've read the menu properly. I flashback to think how different my life may have been, how enjoyable my meal might've been, if I just learnt the importance of reading in school during GCSE English Lit.

We went there for dinner and had to wait for 10-15 minutes because of the wait list, We had heard it's a landmark and have always seen it crowded and wanted to experience it for ourselves. We got a cozy little candle-lit table with a good view of the sea. The servers were attentive and the food orders came out swift and precise in-spite of it being a house full. The food was great and we had a great experience on our last night in Dubrovnik.

I strongly recommend! We went for breakfast, it was delicious! I had Bokar and my friends took Lovrijenac, called by fortress. We also had beautifull view and it's not so expensive. Stuff was very generous!

If you wanna enjoy your meal without being stressed by the thousands of people that walk around the old town you can sit here. It is not very expensive and it offers a wide range of dishes, the treat is great, and the views are cool!

Word of warning - they only accept Kuna in this restaurant so change up your Euros beforehand or pay by card. Very friendly staff. Quick and efficient service. Lovely view of the city walls and the sea.

We went for breakfast whilst staying in Dubrovnik. The option I chose was about 65 Kuna and included fruit juice, hot drink, toast with a selection of honey, butter jam and Nutella + a croissant with ham and cheese. The terrace is shaded and overlooks the sea and a pebble beach where kayaking is taking place. Everything looked very clean and tidy and service was timely.

Had a lovely lunch on the terrace. Lovely grilled squid washed down with cold beer.
Very good service and well priced for the location

Dražen was a fantastic waiter. His professional and friendly manner made the meal far more enjoyable. The food was great and well priced for the hear of Dubrovnik. The drinks and meal came out promptly and I would recommend this to anyone.

Super nice place & view overlooking the walls & lovrijenac castle , elegant place & welcoming staff in addition to very nice food . Expect waiting time especially at night but it's surely worth waiting for , do not miss it whenever in Dubrovnik .

Our first night in the old town and this place was recommended to us. If you get a seat near the edge the view is amazing as the sun sets. It is a busy place often with a line up to get in. Food was good - go with the recommendations as they were all great, food and wine. Service was attentive and witty, so made for an enjoyable night.

Came here twice for dinner - although it can be busy, you don't have to wait too long for a table. Food came very swiftly and was delicious! I also liked that they give you a 10% card at the end of your first meal which you can use for your next meal or at the Panoramic restaurant at the top of Mount Srd.
We weren't lucky enough to get a table outside, but still had pleasant views under the terraced part and air conditioning!

We ate at Dubravka twice on our stay in Dubrovnik. Once, on our first morning, we were slightly too late for breakfast and so had two salads which we shared between us.  They were delicious and made all the more tasty by the wonderful sea view we had.
Second time we were in time for breakfast and had a very enjoyable breakfast with the same great sea view.
The service is good, not overly friendly but if you make an effort you'll get a smile and bit of chat, and the views (especially if you book in advance) are fantastic.  The cost is proportionate for most of Dubrovnik and, unlike other restaurants, they don't try to rip you off and will happily serve you tap water.

Came to this place mainly due to its nice location just next to Lovrijenac castle. The service at the restaurant was good, but the place itself is very touristy (like almost everything else in Dubrovnik). The setting is very nice next to the castle, and if you're lucky, you can get a seat next to the edge where you can enjoy the view while you eat. I had a pizza, which was OK but nothing special. The prices are quite high, but you pay premium for the location.

On our way back from a swim at Dance beach we stopped for a great lunch of amazing fresh oysters with a wonderful view.
 Dry relaxed atmosphere in the shade avoiding the harsh midday sun.

My partner and I visited Dubravka for dinner on our first evening in Dubrovnik. We had arrived at our apartment about 8pm so we did not head out for dinner till about 9pm. We were slightly worried this was quite late considering we hadn't booked but we soon realised this was the peak time for an evening meal. The restaurant was full at this time so we did have to wait about ten minutes for a table outside but that didn't really bother us too much. Once seated we had great service even though slightly slow but I cannot fault it due to how busy it was. We both had pizza and a couple of drinks which was of good standard and not too pricey. The restaurant is in a great location just outside the city walls at Pile Gate and although we did not have a seat with a view, I imagine it would have been fantastic. I'm sure I'll pay Dubravka another visit the next time I'm in Dubrovnik!

We went to this restaurant three times during our stay and would like to describe them all.

First visit was for my boyfriends birthday and I booked it online requesting to consider it was for birthday. They replied via e-mail and confirmed.
On a day - meal was pleasant, had lovely seat facing That game of thrones wall. After we had our food - nothing happened in regards to birthday so i had to ask waiter making this too obvious to my boyfriend if they could do something about it. Waiter was in doubt but then managed to get this Jazz band to play little birthday tune and bring a slice of cake.

Visit number two was very short as we were willing to have some breakfast in the morning. We were on the way to the beach so I was in biquini top and shorts and this waiter let us in leading to the terrace seat as suddenly another waitress behind me rudely asked if I had a shirt to put on top?? Well I had no shirt so that was what I said and so then another guy jumped into the scene screaming I could not be there in swim wear. This just gobsmacked me and we immediately left. Really ruined my mood for the rest of the day. Just seemed they were not organised in regards to their guest rules or whatever regulations or was that some sort of fashion policing as in the rest of old town where you might pay apparently up to 200 kuna in case you decide it is really hot and you wish to be without a top!

So third visit was quite nice as on morning before our flight we decided to try this bloody place again as they have quite nice breakfast offer and as this time I had a top on I was brave enough to go gain. although we asked for extra bread and had to wait for quite a while, also ask twice.

Our hopes was really high with this one, but it only looked good from the outside. Service was slow and unkind, pizza was ok, but gnocchi nothing special and not too much. The view is fantastic though. Staff were disturbing, they collected the parasols while we were sitting there, it made us feel really uncomfortable.

I was being an awkward vegan and accidentally ordered something with cream. They changed it for me with no problems and even helped me pick something else. The friendliest staff I have met here and the most delicious food! Highly recommended this place for a beautiful evening.

Had my son's birthday meal here. Not cheap but food very good. 
The service could have been a bit more attentive.
However definitely worth a visit for the location (overlooking the walls and the sea) alone!

We came here for dinner with a group of 11(8 adults and 3 children). The service was friendly and prompt. The menu has a wide variety where everyone found something that looked good to them. The food was good and the location was excellent with a beautiful view.

Service was fast. Had some cocktails and lunch, both were very good. 
Try get a table next to the wall for the views.

We had a very pleasant breakfast there and loved the staff and the service beside the very romantic view of Lovrinejac fort. If you are a fan of Game of Thrones you remember the scene where Sansa and little finger talks when they are facing the sea in a bay, if you are seating in the front table yes this is the view also where you can see from the restaurant. I haven't been there for a dinner but I bet it has also a great atmosphere.

Located near Dubrovnik walls, this is a classy restaurant, service was very good and atmosphere was nice. Offers very nice view too. Not the cheapest, but compared to other restaurants nearby, left a feeling that the stay was worth the money all in all.

Tried to book a table here at 2 o'clock on the day we wanted but none were available. They advised us to turn up later as they always have some unreserved tables. Turned up at 7 o'clock and had a great table out on the terrace with good view of the city wall and sea. 
Staff were very professional and the service was great. 
My Feta Salad for starter was excellent and the Atlantic salmon for main was even better. Topped off with a lemon sorbet with vodka to clean the pallet. 
The waiter recommended a Croatian white wine which we liked and will be looking out for it in the local shops. 
Unfortunately we only had one night in Dubrovnik or we would have returned. 
It was a bit expensive but you get what you pay for and I would definitely recommend this restaurant.

Sister restaurant to Nautika and Arsenal but food and service seemingly aimed at different market. 

Food is pretty standard fayre with longer menu aimed at families I suspect. Pizza was nice (can't really go wrong in Dubrovnik with pizza) steak was overcooked and bit tough. 

We had a mix up with our reservation (luckily I had reservation email when they denied we had a booking). Service was then rushed - got the feeling they wanted to get you out and fill the table again. Arsenal and Nautika are the better siblings in this family.

From starters to dessert this was one our best meal in Dubrovnik. The mozzarella caprese was so fresh and flavorful. The Assorted Croatian cheese was nice as well. Tagliatelle with seafood and King Prawns-Dubrovnik Style were both very fresh and I would recommend either one. The prawns come in the shell so you have to get a bit messy FYI. 
There was live music on the terrace which was a lovely touch and left us with a wonderful experience on our last night in Dubrovnik.

This meal was the best we enjoyed on s month long trip to Europe. Food, location & service was wonderful. I had tiger prawns in a spicy sauce, my partner had the beef. We shared a Greek salad, the house red wine & dessert, a lovely hazelnut chocolate torte.

Probably the best meal we have had since we arrived in Dubrovnik @ 900 for the four of us. 

Nice setting and the food was really nice. 

Well worth a visit.

We were walk-ins to this restaurant and we were provided with a table quickly by friendly and welcoming members of staff. The menu was varied and reasonably priced. The food took a little while to arrive, but this was not a problem as we had a great view of the ancient city walls and the sea to take in as we waited. I would highly recommend this restaurant to others visiting the Dubrovnik old town!

From appearances it looks very busy but after eating here last night for dinner around 9 and by that time there was no wait. Out door seating with views of old town walls and the fort Lovrijenac. The food was good and less expensive than in old town. Our service was friendly and efficient as well. I would recommend this place for a nice dinner al fresco with views.

We stayed in Dubrovnik for three days at the beginning of our holiday and we ended up having breakfast here twice, dinner once, and we came in a couple of times for a drink during the day. The main reason was it's perfect location. You have a great view of the outside of the old city walls. You also benefit from a breeze coming in off of the sea, which you don't get when you are in the old city. The food and drink was also of a very high standard and reasonably priced. We were recommended this place by Edi of Edi's Sea View Rooms Old Town. We are heading back to Dubrovnik tomorrow for one night before we fly home.
