It was instantly agreed that this is the place where we will go to eat. Be aware that in the busy tourist season you might have to wait for a table at busy times during the day, but this is nothing unusual in Dubrovnik and there is a quick turnaround. They could cater for those waiting by offering a place to wait and have a drink. That is the only thing that we say could be improved.

Great location just outside the walls and beside the Pile Gate, with sea views as well. Very busy but attentive and prompt service. A wide choice of dishes on the menu. We enjoyed our meal there and I know it was proving a popular venue with some of our travelling companions.

When arriving at the Pile Gate in the Old Town area of Dubrovnik, this is one of the first restaurants that you will see. With its superb location in such a popular tourist zone, you would be forgiven for thinking that the pricing and quality would not match up to your expectations- however this is definitely not the case here.
I was treated to a superb Seafood Risotto, followed by the Fried Squid - both of which were heavenly and clearly made with the freshest ingredients. My wife had Sea Bass, which was perfectly cooked in a simple but effective way.
Unfortunately there weren't any tables available next to the wall overlooking the bay, but there was still a very good view of the floodlit castle/ city walls from most of the tables.Service was excellently provided by our waiter.
The only negative, was a reluctance to provide a jug of table water to go with our drinks - everyone knows that the water here is safe to drink, so a little poor that only the expensive bottled stuff is an option.

Beautiful setting by the sea and castle walls!
Live Jazz the night we were there.
Ordered pizza and pastas which were good.
Excellent service. 
Highly recommend this restaurant!

Just a snack but a welcome oasis with comfortable seating in the shade on a very hot day overlooking a glorious view. They take the trouble to chill the beer glasses here and the staff are welcoming and prompt. In a city where few places seem to take euro this was a welcome respite.

Myself and my friend are managers in hospitality and I can happy say our server Branko was quite possibly the best most attentive server We have ever had.

From every detail:

I dropped my fork and before I had even put it back on the table he had brought us. New one.

Incredible product knowledge 

Everything he recommended was exceptional 

We where genuinely speechless

100% must go !

Just outside Old Town & beautifully set overlooking the Old Town Wall & the sea..
Great sunny, front table view overlooking the Adriatic for a late lunch &.watching the kayaking below...Staff very helpful & friendly.
Menu & wine great choices. Would not disappoint . They also own the Panorama Rest up at the top of the cable car.

We stopped in on a whim for just a drink because of the view, but ended up staying for lunch. And we are glad we did. Although simple, pizza and beer, we loved every minute. From the service to the food but most especially the view! Get there early enough to get a table with that marvelous view!

I have now been to this restaurant 4 times and every time was brilliant. Friendly staff, amazing food and outstanding views all at a reasonable price. I wish I could take this restaurant home with me!

Branko is the MAN as a waiter, professional, funny and attentive. 
Food is great and ambience to match it. Second day on a row for dinner and still not disappointed. Great place for people watching as well. A must visit for sure and see BRANKO.

Loved it! One of our favourite places we ate in Dubrovnik. Beautiful setting watching the sunset over the water wkth live piano music in background. Food was very tasty. Had octopus salad to start which was packed full of fish and then we both had a pizza for main which we both enjoyed. Loved the Dalmatian G&T cocktail. Staff were very friendly and service great. Very reasonably priced too and no cover charge. Definitely recommend visiting and recommend booking in advance and asking for table with view.

Thought this would be a bit of a tourist trap but not a bit of it. Lovely pizza and salad and all of the staff were friendly and helpful. Good value when you consider its stunning location overlooking the sea. Would happily go back.

I went with my wife and daughter on a busy Saturday night. The restaurant seemed nearly full but they were very nice and accommodating to find us a table. The food was very good - the pizzas especially. When we mistakenly ordered the wrong dish, our server brought us what we wanted anyway, assuring us that it was no problem. Good value, great view, and best restaurant service we had in Dubrovnik.
Tasty food and perfect view. Service is really fast and friendly. They arranged a meal with seafood instead of chicken for me at the same price. I want to go again.

As we lived beside the pile gate, this restaurant is the most nearby one for breakfast and dinner. We visited it once or even twice a day because it is so convenient. The food is satisfactory there. Now we become a frequent customer of this restaurant in these 3 days.
Then we talked about the food. I strongly recommend the breakfast 3, that is, eggs with cheese and hams. The ham they used is good, not the one used in Hong Kong. Also the breakfast 4, that is, omelette with fruits. The omelette is tasty. 
There are 3 types of bread. The normal white bread, the wheat bread and the sweet bread. There are different jams, nutella and honey the serve with the bread. We like to use honey to serve the tea and coffee. The taste is great and it is good for the stomach.
The dinner is good, too. Strong recommend the lamb with harsh brown.
Please remember to show your dubrovnik card during ordering food. The restaurant will give you 10% discount!

We dined here on our last night of our holiday and our son's birthday. The waiter was very efficient. Brought a desert secretly with a candle for my son and the food was delicious. We had beef steak in gin and mustard sauce, lasagne, pizza and Bolognaise. A variety of desserts were also delicious. The views from the terrace made it a special night indeed. Thank you.

View made breakfast better. I had an omelet it came with fruit toast coffee. All good but not beyond average breakfast. View is worth it. Convenient to Pile Gate. It was quiet when I was there but having been in the area at lunch time it gets very busy and tourists are everywhere. Would recommend for breakfast. Service was very good.
Beautiful view,great food and kind staff. Prices are affordable.Definitely the restaurant that deserves to be visited.

With a great breakfast deal !
Very friendly, accomodating & professional service.
Billion dollar views
Choice of breakfasts including:
fruit
home made corn bread
Cheese
Ham
Condiments (jam, honey, Nutella, butter)
Fresh orange juice
Water
Croissant

We went to Nautika straight off the bus from the airport feeling tired, thirsty and hungry and were shown straight to a table directly overlooking the fort and sea. What an amazing view and what a wonderful way to start our holiday!
We both had salads and a beer and were served quickly. The mozzarella salad that I had was just right and the food that we saw going to other tables all looked very good. Despite the restaurant being very busy we were not made to feel rushed and enjoyed another drink while looking at the view.

Amazing location and views -
Delicious cocktails and huge thin crispy pizzas. Extremely nice staff. Wonderful evening.

We were in Dubrovnik for 8 days and ate breakfast, lunch, dinner & dessert at some point at this lovely restaurant. Beautiful location with great views of the wall and Fort. Good menu, nice service. I spent several hours one cold rainy morning lingering over coffee and breakfast and they didn't try to rush me out. Best patio if the sun is shining!

We went for a bit of lunch, no reservation. Our table wasn't next to the fabulous views, but since we just came in off the street, we weren't expecting it.

Our waitress was lovely, very funny, and also efficient. I forget her name, but she was from Zagreb. A credit to the restaurant.

We were happy with the food, (mussels, pizza, salad), which was very good. With a lovely bottle of wine we paid 500kuna, which felt right. Given the location, you might expect some overcharging or average food, this was not the case. Very enjoyable.

Beautiful place and beautiful surrounding! Ok food and wine. Definitely good service, but not an amazing place like we first thought. Menu looks very tacky like most restaurant menus do around in croatia. Bit pricey but we are glad that we can help the good croatian people.
Love to come back and eat at this very nice restaurant with good service and very nice food. Fish menu is very good and fresh.

Though I had been told the restaurant was fully booked for that Friday evening, we decided to give it a try anyway and were lucky enough to get a table for 6 after only 10 minutes wait. All staff were very friendly and we had a great evening!
All of us managed to find a course according to their taste, from a light veggie risotto to a large spicy sausage pizza, through fine fish dishes. Everything was really good and I would personnally recommend their grilled king prawns which were cooked to perfection. Delicious!
All this for a "reasonnable" price for Dubrovnik.

There are obviously many restaurants in Dubrovnik. This one was recommended by a waiter at another restaurant. We enjoyed a wonderful dinner, fantastic views and delicious desserts. Our waiter, Dejan, made the experience all the more enjoyable.

We were a party of 4 without a reservation, the staff were very nice and found us a table immediately. 
The food was ok, although we weren't asked how we would like the steak cooked, so could of done with being a bit rarer. Mussels were cooked well but were very small, the sauce they came in was good. 
Slightly over priced for what we had but then you are paying for the view.

Amazing food, staff and view! Make sure you ask for a seat '1st row' to get the best view. Staff are very reluctant to allow you to change aspects of the dish, a simple request of sauce on the side was not allowed but gorgeous otherwise!

Because of the excellent location we expected this to be a tourist rip off but we were given an excellent table, we did book in advance.
Service was slow to start but very good after that. We asked advice on the wine and were given samples to try, top marks for that. Best wine of the holiday.
Excellent ravioli for a starter.
Good meal.
Only let down was they could not book us in again as they were full for days ahead.
This was our first time in Dubrovnik and of course our first try here. The view, the staff was extra. The food was excellent. I would deff recommend this restaurant to anyone.

I came here for breakfast with my son.

So, great views of the city walls and the bay, and it's very accessible when you arrive in town. On the plus side the service and presentation were good.

But, and a big but, although you expect high prices in Croatia these days and in Dubrovnik in particular (the cruise ships line up daily to dock just down the road and discharge their load), that is no reason to then serve your hapless customers barely warm coffee, watered down orange juice, and a sheet of rubbery cheese lying flaccidly on two forlorn fried eggs for breakfast. No sir, not at these prices.

To be honest, I'd probably avoid if you don't want to feel ripped off for the rest of the day. 

Note to management: keep the prices high if you must, but at least make an effort to serve decent food. Please.

We reserved a table at the restorant. Were seated at the best location possible. Just by the fence with a great view. It was calm night and we went to take it slow and enjoy. Everything was wonderfull. The staff was above polite and kind. I never felt this much of a kindnes and welcome like at this restaurant. Need to say big thank you to everyone that works here,esspecially to a waitress called Anita who made our dinner even better. Will come again apsolutelly. Hope she will see this review and be glad. Al the best to the restaurant and it's enployees. See you soon again!! :)

Recently visited here for dinner, two couples. We had asked our hotel to call and book but were advised that they had issues in the past booking tables and that it was okay to just turn up. We were happy enough to do so and were welcomed in to a table straight away - keeping in mind this was during peak dinner service. Wait staff are friendly and very professional.

Food prices are very reasonable and the food does not disappoint. We could not fault any dish that came out. Minimal wait times and excellent standard. 

Recommend the house wine - red or white. Comes in one litre carafe if ordered by bottle and is well priced. Meals were finished with a complimentary cocktail/liqueur. 
 
Lastly the view ... well it is stunning! We watched the ships sail past on the ocean by the city walls with the sun setting and in the background we had the gate to the old city! 

Highly recommend this restaurant!!!
What a lovely place to visit!

Amazing dinner at Dubravka! Food was excellent, staff was very friendly and polite. Had an amazing chocolate cake! Wine was more than perfect! Special thanks to our amazing waiter Borna, he made our night special 😇😊 Love it, and definitely will come again! 💙🔝

Nice lunch and fantastic view at the city gates. Unfortunately our waiter was ridiculously rude to me. I asked for extra chopped tomatoes as my salad had 1 cherry tomato chopped in half. He made a big deal of that. Charged for it. Also tried to shortchange us. Friend tried to leave a tip and he responded "why do you give me this?". Very impolite.

Excellent location, friendly and prompt service, nice food and reasonable price. Most of the table have sea views. 
Also we benefit to the 10% Discount off from total bill as we use their money change service right next
Lovely location just outside the city walls with a good selection of reasonable value breakfast options. We didn't manage to try it out for dinner as it was constantly rammed.
We cane here on the first day. Lovely setting with good vies and he service was fine. Have to say that it was a bit on the pricey side.

lovely restaurant with views of the gates and sea. food was delicious we actually visited this twice on our trip! did make a reservations on both visits as was always busy! Fairly priced and service was still good even though busy we werent rushed out like other places
This restaurant is located in a gorgeous spot with breathtaking views of the sea and walls of the old city of Dubrovnik. The service is outstanding and the food very good. It's a must see place.

This was a perfect place for lunch by the sea. We had pizza and seafood pasta, both delicious. Not too expensive either considering the great location. The service was effective and professional, which we appreciated after having just arrived and were eager to start browsing the city. Very nice!

a nice place to relax and have a break from the crowds as its outside the walls and in a great position with greta views (for those lucky enough to get a table by the seaside), serve is patchy - one of these restaurants where everyone seems to have a different job to do - the person who sits you doesn't take food orders, the other one doesn't bring the bill, seems to be only one person who does everything...anyway food is good and tasty but so are most places in Croatia, drinks are expensive - a good place but many options in the city
Great setting ,between the city walls and the small castle .Very good service , good food good selection of beers .not cheap .

We had an evening meal here just after sunset. We had to wait about 10 minutes for a table without a reservation. The setting was beautiful, just outside the city walls with a view of the floodlit walls and fort. The food is more reasonably priced than the restaurants inside the city walls. Around £12-£15 for a main course. We had pizzas which were extremely tasty. Our meal was accompanied by very nice cello and piano music creating a relaxed and romantic atmosphere.

My husband and I ate here in July and we had such a lovely evening. Cannot fault this place.
We booked a terrace table which had amazing views of the sea and the castle. 
The food was great and had a wide selection. They also tailor made me a cocktail that wasn’t on the virgin cocktail menu which was really nice of them. They also gave us a complimentary drink at the end. They have another restaurant next door (Nautika) but Dubravka is a little more relaxed and less formal.
I cannot recommend this place enough. Definitely will visit again when we return.

We have come to this restaurant after meeting a lot of advertising.
In reality it was overcrowded, service was very poor, the dishes were quite ordinary. Prices are typical for the tourist destinations.
The view at the terrace is good but there many places in Croatia with a better one.
Every time you come here you will find very polite and attentive staff, service is amazing, nice surroundings. Relaxing music. Book a table in advance. Food is just ok. Give it a try. Recommended.

We got here early and got a nice table outside without waiting. Unless you reserve a table (probably days in advance), you won't get a table by the water with the nice view but it's still a nice atmosphere outside. The service was quite good but when we left around 8pm there were people queuing to get in. For that reason I'd recommend booking or coming early. The food was nice and the price wasn't too unreasonable either.

What a wonderful dinner outdoors on a hot balmy night enjoying views of the ancient city walls all lit up. Attentive staff and a comprehensive menu made for an enjoyable night out. And the food was pretty good too!

Disappointed.... My son ordered the prawns with wild garlic. There were 7 prawns on one side of the plate with a large mound of "wild garlic" on the other. Yuk! It was like slimy black tasteless pasta. My own meal was OK but not the standard I would expect

Booked online before arrival in Dubrovnik.Had a table overlooking the sea and with stunning views of the fortress and city walls.Very busy restaurant and the service was professional,friendly and efficient.We had whole trout and John dory fillet in caper sauce,followed by Dubravka cake.all excellent.So good that we booked again for the following saturday.This time I tried the ravioli with smoked ham and truffle.The most delicious pasta dish I have ever had.House wine was very good too.A must do when in Dubrovnik.
Food was ok, pizza and salads were good. There weren't any seats left right at the edge of the cliff, but it was still a good view. Prices were reasonable.

We recently had a light lunch here after walking the city wall.

It's right outside the wall and by the water, so nice view from the patio. The food was good - we ordered a veggie pizza and various ice cold drinks and a banana split. Quite nice especially after the long walk on the wall.

My family and I went on a holiday to Croatia for a week and decided to end the holiday in Dubrovnik. The reason for the trip was my dad's 70th birthday and I had booked a dinner at Dubravka 1836 to make sure our last night would be special.
When I made the booking a while ago I had mentioned that it was a special occasion but the dinner exceeded all our expectations. 
The food was really amazing, and the view was something from a movie. 
Our waiter and the staff made us all feel very special, and they even sang a birthday song with a little treat on the house for my dad. 
Its something we will never forget and its the little things like this that makes a restaurant stand out. 
Thank you so much for making my dads birthday and our last night in your beautiful country, one to remember. We will definitely be back.

Recommended to us for its good food and location. This is an ideal restaurant to take in views and if into people watching can enjoy your meal while watching the world go by. The restaurant was in a buzzing setting. The staff were all very friendly and the food was lovely. I would recommend it here, we had a very enjoyable meal and was not too expensive.

We had lunch and breakfast there, and each time were very satisfied. Good food and beautiful view. We also stopped by for take away ice cream and fresh squeezed orange juice. I would definitely recommend at least one visit!

this restaurant is in an excellent location, it is right by the entrance to the city walls and overlooks the small Port where kayak tours take place and out to sea. We got seated straight away on a Saturday night (party of two) The food was amazing, very fresh and full of flavour, my friend and I both had pasta dishes and a crepe for desert. The reason for my 4 star is that he service wasn't brilliant, we did not get a menu for a while after being seated and had to wait about 10 minutes for the desert menu aswell, the staff also weren't the friendliest.
Wonderful and fresh food with decent prices for a tourist city. Excellent service, beautiful atmosphere frequented by locals.

My partner had the Gnocchi Gorgonzola of perfect serving size and subtle flavour. My John Dory was moist and the vegetables crisp and tasty. Beautiful location. Unfortunately the service was a little disappointing ... started well but lost interest and forgot a portion of the order. Still worth a visit.

We arrived without a reservation at about quarter past 8, waited less than ten minutes before being seated at a fantastic table overlooking the bay. Couldn't have asked for better.
I had the 'Dubrovnik style' prawns with buttered rice, absolutely delicious, and it came with a bib with the design of a tux on it to protect my dress, which was hilarious for my boyfriend. He had the lamb fillet with chanterelle mushroom sauce and hash browns. We were both very pleased with our meals and the price was very good for right next to Old Town and with such a great view. The house white wine is local and easy drinking.
The staff were brilliant, so helpful, friendly and funny.
Would definitely recommend eating at Dubravka whilst in Old Town.

We were very lucky and got a table right at the edge along the wall with the best view out to the fort and the sea. The staff were very friendly and extremely helpful! We had brilliant seafood meals all fresh and full of flavour.

Very busy restaurant right next to one of the cities main attractions. Visited early evening and joined a small queue but were seated within ten minutes. Nice surprise to be sat with an ocean view and what we considered to be one of the best in the house. Superb attention from the staff and a truest fantastic experience, give it a try you won't be disappointed.

We decided to stop into this restaurant for lunch, the person that took us to a table was so impolite and rude that we walked out. This was definitely not the type of experience you would expect from a restaurant like this.

Recently dined here with my husband and it was FAB! I had made the reservation about a month in advance with Anita, the sales mgr. She was superb in juggling our rez for this restaurant & their sister restaurant next door, Nautika. I had requested a table by the wall for the view and when we arrived they accommodated our request with the perfect table to watch the sunset. The waiter was very professional & friendly. The entire staff was on top of it & we had a lovely experience. There was also live music playing outside which really added to the mood. Our drinks & food came out perfectly! 

I would HIGHLY recommend dining here! You won't regret it!
Arrived in Dubrovnik fr.o.m. The AirPort and had a Good lunch with a beautiful view over the sea. Kind servant staff

Lovely setting and atmosphere in the restaurant with friendly staff, however, the food was poor. I ordered sea bass which came with plain boiled vegetables with no sauce or even butter. I often order sea bass at restaurants and this was the worst I have ever had. It was edible but definitely not worth the price. I ordered a side of croquettes as well which tasted and looked like the cheap frozen ones you get in a supermarket. Overall, I wouldn't recommend this restaurant for dinner but maybe it would be better for a light lunch/drink to take in the lovely views. 

(I'm regretting not taking photos of the food to prove how average the food really was)

Had an excellent last meal in Dubrovnik here. We made pretty thrifty choices but all our food was very tasty and fresh. The service we had was probably the best we had throughout our stay - Branko was our waiter and he was polite, attentive and good humoured throughout. Service was also fairly quick for such a large establishment and the setting of the restaurant (with the walls and Fort Lovrijenac in view from the terrace) is hard to beat. We ate at a couple of more expensive restaurants in our week's stay in Dubrovnik and this meal was far better value for money in terms of the quality you got and the service. It's location, right beside Pile Gate, is another plus.

We were recommended this restaurant by our waiter at their sister chain up in the Panoramic Restaurant besides the cable car. We popped by on our penultimate day in Dubrovnik and booked a table for the following, final night. We saw a restaurant that smelled delicious, was completely full and absolutely buzzing with life- not to mention the perfect views of Pile gate, the city walls and the Adriatic sea.

When we arrived early for our booking the following night, the staff were expecting us by name. Although we were early they kindly sat us down and offered us drinks before moving us to a table right besides the wall and sea within minutes of our initial seating - such wonderful hosts and absolutely brilliant service. The service continued being spectacular with our multi-lingual waitress who we could hearing joking with guests in a multitude of languages. 

Whilst the service and views (and drinks) were absolutely spot on; the food wasn't our favourite. I opted for a traditional beef stake with boiled potatoes and found it a little bland for my liking, whilst the wife's pork was also a little 'without'. Even the bread came with my soup somehow didn't live up to the expectations. The cocktails, however, did. The Dubronik Mule and Kir Royals went down a treat and made for a fantastic night with great hosts, great views and great vibes - even if the food was a little under par. Would I recommend it? Yes... but I'd perhaps steer away from the 'meat specialities' page where we were both left so underwhelmed.

We went here for breakfast. They had different kind of selections of breakfast that you can choose from. We had omelette with tomato and mozzarella with some fresh fruit. The food was ok, but the price was a bit high. But the view was great!

The setting is to die for, and the food is simple but really well cooked. It was served super quick too. The staff are friendly and charming. The live pianist was very accomplished. The swallows flying around added to the magical atmosphere. We will eat here again before we go home.

Well done to the owners in being able to maintain these standards in such a popular tourist trap. Prices are higher but that's standard in this type of location.
Not as pricey as the restaurants in the old town. You get an amazing view (if sitting outside) with great food!
Ate breakfast and lunch here and really enjoyed both. Fantastic views, tasty food and friendly staff. What more do you need?
Lovely view,good service ,enjoyed dubrovnik walls, nice soft music ,the food was good, we found something for everybody , good beef carpaccio.
The restaurant is quite large so you easily get a space. One of the few pocket friendly restaurants in dubrovnik with good food! Also get great views of the walls from the terrace

We visited the restaurant this evening after a recommendation from our hotel concierge, however when we arrived they said they didn't have our reservation, and were very unhelpful in trying to accommodate. We had our daughter with us and when we asked if they had a children's menu it was as if we had offended them!

The food was fine, location and view beautiful, however it really did feel like you were on a conveyer belt......

Travelling as a party of 6, including 2 children (10 & 8) we left Cavtat early fully intending to have breakfast in Dubrovnik. I asked a local cab driver for a recommendation and we were so lucky he suggested Dubravka 1836! An excellent choice of freshly prepared breakfasts, delicious coffee, freshly squeezed juices, and teas were the perfect accompaniment to croissants, brioche, local honey and the tastiest bacon & eggs. The waiters are great fun and cheerful (without a hint of fake sincerity), the view is lovely, and the presentation ensured the whole experience was absolutely perfect. Our 10 year old grandson declared this 'the best breakfast of the trip" - enough said I think.

We went with no booking and luckily found a table on the edge overlooking the fort and old town and black water bay. It was late afternoon so the weather was very pleasant. The waiter was excellent in his patience, communication and explanation. He took his time to take us few photos despite his busy job. The food was even better. I had sea food / grilled sea bass. The desert hot apple cake with ice cream on the side is not to be missed. We would do it again. Perfectly priced meals.

Nautilus, Panorama and Dubravark are part of the same chain but they differ so much in the quality of their menu in the same order. Nautilus has the greatest reputation ,Panorams was very good when we ate there but the food in Dubravak was disappointing. This large restaurant is situated just outside Stari Gradi Durovnik just opposite the Nautilus. The staff are very welcoming and nice.the soup ribjlja Jura was nothing special. We shared the file of brancina or bass fillet which was absolutely tasteless and the veggies were few as in most of Croatia where we had eaten.A very pleasant evening but disappointing food.

Seated at about 2100 after a 30 minute wait which we didn't mind. The food was sadly very mediocre - squid was the best thing we had but it came with cold boiled veg which reminded me of school dinners. The mussels were cold although the sauce was good. Wine list was long and varied which was nice to see - good variety and range of prices. The entire meal was saved by the fantastic waiter we had. 

The place is nothing special but the view is excellent.

The service is excellent, there is a wide variety of food on the menu. The staff are always willing to accommodate any changes due to allergies in the family. We had visited the Dubravka on many of our holidays to Dubrovnik, we have never felt rushed or waited too long for our food.
The setting is beautiful with views over the Adriatic, watching the alpine swifts at dusk is just amazing.

We didn't have a reservation but were able to get a table for a lunch.The service was very prompt and efficient, the food delicious and for a good price too. Amazing view and magnificent atmosphere.
 A definite place to visit.
Nice stuff, nice view, perfect food... really good and really like this place. I hope I will come back again

Four of us went for Dinner after doing the cable car trip. it's just outside the Pile gate, and has the benefit of a view of the walls whilst being quite spacious.
The service was very prompt and efficient, the food delicious and for a good price too.
What'not to like for the ideal post-tourism dinner!

We tried to eat here while waiting for a tour that started nearby. I have to say "tried" because the service was so horrible that they had not even asked us what we would like to drink after 20 minutes of waiting. This was despite the fact that they had plenty of staff walking around and it was not during peak hours. We decided to leave and find food elsewhere.

Great seafood, amazing view, what more could someone want (other than a nice cold beer to wash it all down with!) 

Dubravka served up exactly this. We came for breakfast one day and were quite impressed with their menu so returned that night for dinner. We didn't have a reservation but were able to score a table just one row back from the ocean view. The prawns were simply incredible.

Waiters were quick with service and didn't leave us lingering for long, clearing dishes away promptly but also allowing us time to review the menu when required. A definite place to visit.

Dinner was exceptional. Food was superb, service was impeccable. Highly highly recommended! It is in front of the doors of the old town. Drinks arrived before we could even finish asking for them. Orders are done on tablets. Even though restaurant is packed as it is huge, food came very fast and we didn't wait.
Great food good view and under trees at the bus drop off point into the old town. Can't fault the place.

We arrived at Dubravka just after 5 where we were able to get a table for 6 without prior booking. 

We were quickly attended to by the waitstaff and placed our drink order. When the drinks arrived, 1 person in our party did not receive their drink and this wasn't noticed by the waitstaff. Several minutes later we brought this to their attention and the drink arrived. 

The same occurred with our meals. Meal orders were taken when our meals arrived, one meal was missing. Timing was terribly off!

My husband and I ordered a bottle of sparkling wine. Our glasses were left unfilled for sometime so I filled them myself. The maitre d' came over and made a joke about me filling my own glass and the restaurant hiring waiters. Ha ha! Our glasses remained unfilled for the rest of the night. 

While the meals we ordered were well prepared, for the most part, the lack of attention to orders, poor timing of meals, and glasses left unfilled cause me to reduce the rating of Debravka.

If you can afford a slightly more expensive experience, I recommend PROTO! You will not be dissatisfied there.

We were looking for somewhere to eat in the Old Town and this was recommended by our Rep, along with the Restaurant opposite.
Once we worked out where it was situated, I was a little dubious about it, presuming it was a bit of a tourist trap as it is right by the entrance to the old town where all the the cruise ship buses pick up and therefore crowded with people.
We chose the Dubravka a bit by default as it was the cheaper of the 2 options that our Rep had mentioned, and the other one had tableclothes that were far too white and waiters that were far too smart ( not that the Debravka guys were'nt!)
And I am so pleased we choose it- we ended up eating here twice, returning here for our last night in Dubrovnik as this was our favourite place to eat during our 10 days in the Dubrovnik area.
The food was lovely, the service on both nights was fantastic, really attentive without being overbearing. The house red wine was the best we had anywhere on our hols and the view and position of the place were amazing, topped off with the sight of a huge owl sitting on the roof of the restaurant opposite on the look out for his dinner.
I can't recommend the Dubravka enough, made even better the second time by a discount card giving us 10% off.
If we ever go back to Dubrovnik we will definitely return and I can't recommend it enough- wonderful!!!

The seafood are very very fresh and delecious! It was a perfect dinner! 
There are lots of wine and cocktails.
The view is amazing next to the famouse Dubrovnik castle!
Loved their view so much that we had 2 breakfasts in a row here! The set menu with an omelette, basket of bread, fresh juice, coffee and fruits was filling and the staff friendly and helpful

We visited Dubravka several times , for lunch, dinner of just for a glass of wine. The location is perfect, looking out to the bay next to the wall and castle. The food is excellent and decently priced to the Dubrovnik standards.
The service is really good, nice waiting staff.
One lunch I had tuna with a very nice balsamico sauce, but a the end of the meal I added some balsamico vinegar from the table, but the bottle wasn´t closed very well , so I spilled some on my shorts. Because the were the only pair of shorts I had on this short trip, I called the head waiter Josip and he offered the get them washed. So the next morning I could collect my clean shorts. Perfect service , thanks Josip Biocic !!!!!

This Restaurant is nestled close to Pile Gate by the old city walls. Great views of the bay and the sea beyond. 

It is ideally placed as a tourist trap, but the service and quality of food and drink was excellent. Whether just for a drink or food as well the service was as good as it could be.

Certainly deserves to be hired ranked than it is.

Recommend a visit.. YES

Thought we'd give this place a go given the great reviews on TripAdvisor and a 10% discount voucher we'd picked up earlier in the week. So pleased we did. This place is excellent. The atmosphere was great. We had a table overlooking the Old Town walls with brilliant views and a really good saxophonist playing throughout the evening. The service was first class and the food, every bit as good. We enjoyed our meal so much that we booked again for the following evening even though we'd told ourselves only a little earlier in the day that as there were so many restaurants to choose from there was little point eating in the same place more than once!!!

This restaurant has two locations one at Pile Gate the other at the top of the cable car we had lunch at the bottom Pike Gate the restaurant sits just at the entrance to the old town. We sat in the inner part although it was still open and airy with great views of the city wall. Food was great and staff were friendly and helpful and it was reasonably priced. When viewing from the front there's a takeaway to the side of the entrance this belongs to the restaurant and caters for those who just want to grab a slice of pizza and walk through the town which is popular. Don't let this put you off once inside you wouldn't know it was even there.

I am unsure how this restaurant is not in the top five for restaurants in Dubrovnik. My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our meal here. We started with the house white wine, that was very reasonable in price, and quite good. We then had the vegetable soup which consisted of a creamy based soup with zucchini, carrots, greens beans, and other fresh vegetables. My husband then had the lasagna bolognese that was very good, and my sea bass fillet was delicious! As though it couldn't get any better, it most certainly did with dessert. Apple Pie served warm with a scoop of vanilla ice cream. It was so scrumptious! I highly recommend this restaurant!

We went here on our first night and were blown away by the views over the bay and sea which really are breathtaking. It's a large restaurant and has the look of a tourist trap but the food is excellent and staff on the ball.
We stopped off here for wine and cocktails and what a view. Staff couldn't be nicer. Absolutely recommend this place. It is reasonably priced, amazing staff and don't forget the view.
I can highly recommend the Dubravka for the wonderful location, excellent food for a reasonable price and first class service.

Nice place to have breakfast at terrace with magnifisent seaview.
Service professional, warm and friendly.
Price reasonable for Dubrovnik standards even it is located right next to the walls of Old Town.
Little bit busy but lovely relaxed start for the day.
Our best breakfast in Dubrovnik.

Came here for our 35 th anniversary, our concierge booked our table for us we were welcomed straight away , our waiter I think his name was Helmit was a brilliant guy ! We had good food and even better drinks , we will never forget that fantastic night thank you so much 😊

We were here on drinks two times and really suprised with nice view.
Service was really fast and we'll be back next year :)

Pizza in Dubrovnik? Sure! Hubby really enjoyed it while I had the ravioli with truffles. We started with the tomato and mozzarella appetizer, and the cheese was the creamiest I ever had. People flock to this place because of it's seaside locale and views of the Old City walls. Romantic setting.

Some restaurants I've gone to here haven't had great service - this place was great our Waiter Ermin was super helpful and gave us a lovely dessert sorbet/prosecco drink! We split several entrees- ham ravioli, tuna steak, lamb filet, goat cheese appetizer (Croatia has amazing creamy goat cheese), the typical Dalmatian side of Swiss chard and potatoes- all amazing- so far best meal, with a pretty view of the city walls!

We had an absolutely amazing experience at Dubravka. We were a group of 9, and the service was outstanding - the waiters were attentive and friendly. Everyone's meals were great too. They had an excellent trio of musicians, who created a fun and uplifting atmosphere. It would be amiss not to mention the location with fantastic views of the small west harbour. Overall, even though this is a touristy spot, it didn't feel as though you were treated as transient visitors.

We ate here twice when coming into the Old Town for some site seeing. Both times we were immediately seated next to the balcony overlooking the bay, which was a brilliant view. There are many umbrellas so you can choose easily if you want to sit in the sun or shade. The servers are very friendly and polite, and the menu is available in multiple languages.

Everything we tried was delicious and a really good value for being in such a fast paced tourist zone. The portions are a good size, and the fish is very fresh. It is also a great place to grab an afternoon drink or cocktail. I definitely recommend trying the Croatian wine!

Just outside Pile gate this feels far more relaxed than restaurants within the walls but with a great view of them. The service was great and the food equally good. I had the garlic prawns with the black noodles and thought they were stunning.
This restaurant located outside piles gate. It has wonderful terrace - with great views over sea & fort. Service was very good. Meals quality was also good.

We called in here 3 times when in the city for a week..First time was for a large pizza for lunch, second time for a full evening meal, and third time just for cocktails in the early evening. Every time we were treated very well, the staff are very attentive, and the food and drinks very good... The pizzas are excellent.. and if you are lucky to get a table overlooking the sea, then you are lucky, but you can reserve them.. Prices are in line with many of the restaurants in the city walls. It does get busy after 8.00 pm. There is also an indoor area, and also an area under cover.

We passed this restaurant a couple of times each day and it was always very busy. However on our last night we went decided to try for a table and the waitress was very helpful and even tried to find us a table near the sea wall. The service was very good and quick. We took a seat in the middle of the restaurant between two large tables where customers were only drinking. Unfortunately one of the tables had someone constantly smoking and the smoke was drifting across our table and food. We asked to be moved and the staff immediately took control and found us another table nearer to customers who were all eating and actually against the sea wall. We could not have asked for better service and both sets of waiting staff at the two different locations in the restaurant were A1. The food was excellent and the wine and we would definitely recommend this place to others.
Dubravka restaurant is great restaurant. Hospitality and food are very good. Terrace view is amazing...defintly one of best buy restaurants.
We had dinner here on our first night in Dubrovnik. I had risotto and my husband had pasta. Very well cooked, if not a little bit salty. The view is very nice and all staff very helpful.

Located closest to the gate, the pictures below are from the undercover area. If you book many days in advance you can sit overlooking the sea in a very beautiful atmosphere

Service was great
Staff friendly
Access all areas without steps

Prices are high yet not as high as the restaurant opposite. This is tourist hub so they can afford to charge. 

Food was superb
They serve all day breakfast thru dinner, have an ample menu and reasonable prices. This is a good alternative to the more traditional restaurants.
Perfect service, great atmosphere and really nice food! Streat 5! I would recomnend everyone to visit!

Although it was pretty packed we didn't have to wait on either occasion we visited - very friendly staff, good choice of pastas, meat or seafood dishes by super-efficient waitors/waitresses, reasonable price (even before 10% discount with Dubrovnik Card) . Excellent location just outside the walls near the Pile Gate and overlooking the Lovrijenac Tower and the Adriatic down below.

We had dinner here our first night in Crotia and our first taste of Dalmatian dining. It was wonderful. Love the swiss chard and potatoes. Great view of the sea and city walls. Huge patio and if the wind is chilly they have blankets for you! We met our tour contact there for drinks as well. I highly recommend it as a place to dine.

Couldn't reccommend this place enough! Amazing quality food at a very resonable price. Me and my partner visisted here 2 nights in a row during our stay in dubrovnik, each having 2 completely different meals and both times were brilliant. The restraunt is associated with the panorama restraunt at the top of the mountain so we recieved 10% off up there which was a nice touch.

We saw this restaurant as we were walking and the view was so breathtaking and food smelled amazing. Since it was the dinner rush we didn't think we would get in, but they sat us right away and then even moved us next to the water once a table opened up . VERY good food and friendly staff. 10/10 would recommend.
Had drinks there a couple of times. Nice location, nice surroundings, service OK but a bit slow. Good views over the harbour and outside the wall.
Fresh fish and very good wine. The waiters were quick and experienced. Beautiful panorama. Highly recommended

We had breakfast here at recommendation of our apartment proprietor- and we were pleased with our selection. Just outside the old city overlooking the sea. Great views and lots of locals, and the coffee was good. We both had a cooked breakfast as had skipped dinner night before. Small range ( making dejection quick and easy) but perfectly adequate choices. 

X
Delighted with the service and food. Just had a tuna salad but it was well presented and very fresh.
The location is fantastic. Would have been nice to be seated closer to the water but still great. Food was really good.

My husband and I had a remarkable lunch while on an excursion into the town. We were lucky enough to score a table with a great view. Our server, Borna, was super! So friendly and grand sense of humor. My husband ordered sea bass with veggies and I chose prawns in shell/spicy tomato, both dishes were divine! We also tried a Croatian white wine which was suggested by Borna, it was delightful. This was a memorable meal and visit! Thank you Borna for making our lunch such an outstanding occasion.

Ok, this is a super touristy restaurant, but if you are a tourist, why not enjoy the great view?? We sat on the wall with views of the two forts, and it was a great way to start the morning. Service was a little rude, and breakfast was average, but totally worth enjoying the beautiful spot.

We went for lunch and just had salads. The place was crowded but we got quick service and the food was good. We were seated on the terrace near the overlook. So we had a good view. It is a tourist place but they did a fine job meeting our needs.

This place is in a beautiful setting and very busy with a great atmosphere, we all really enjoyed our meal and service was impeccable. Grilled chicken was tasty with nice salads for starters, local wine decent too, so didn't disappoint!

Arrived Sunday and toured the old town in the day. Staying at Hilton we were looking for somewhere quite local for casual dinner

Had read good reviews of Nautica but very expensive by comparison so went with sister / neighbour - just outside the walls. Sat just inside of the terrace we could see the birds flying as the sun set and the skies went punk over the sea below. The trumpet and keyboard played.

Very generous portion sizes we went with the soup, carpaccio and tomato/mozzarella for starters, prawns in wild garlic sauce with black noodles, entrecôte and gratin steak for mains and various liqueurs (honey, cherry) and Irish coffee to finish off a very pleasant evening

I went here for my 30th birthday. The restaurant gave us a 10% off card upon request when entering. The food was great, and the view was amazing. A tall, thin waitress with short blonde hair was serving us that night. She was great until I asked for the cheque. When she returned, I remembered I had a 10% discount card. Upon seeing this, she genuinely went crazy. She gasped and immediately started shouting 'oh no no NO!!!!! I need a manager to change this!!!!!! NO!!!!! In the future please PLEASE PLEASE SHOW THIS FIRST!!!!!' , all the while flapping her arms and spinning around in anger before storming off to a manager. We were in absolute shock. I have never been treated so absurdly anywhere in a professional capacity. A great lesson on how to go from a massive tip to zero in about 10 seconds.

Myself and my girlfriend visited here on a Thursday afternoon on our holiday and it was super busy, but they allowed us to wait inside until a table outside became free. 

I had the Frutti De Mare pizza and my partner had the 'hot starter' Seafood Tagliatelle - both were around 70kn each (Around £7 each) and drinks were about £3.50 each. Food was really enjoyable and the portions were really good. The view outside is a real treat and the staff were very friendly. Highly recommended.
It's located at the entry of old town, so beautiful scenery. However as Not tasty, not recommendable~
Restaurant has several different kind of options to choose from. We tried omelette with mozzarella and cherry tomatoes, fresh fruits and tasty bread. Service was very good as well.

I've been three times to Dubrovnik and each time we've eaten at Dubravka....twice at lunchtime and once in the evening. The staff are wonderful....very friendly and helpful. When we ate In the evening it was cold and windy but we wanted to sit outside so they provided us with blankets and a heater.....perfect. We intend visiting again...next time we want to try breakfast which everyone has said is excellent

The restaurant has an amazing atmosphere, fantastic helpful staff, especially Ivana, she could not have been more attentive. The food was good and we had a wonderful evening. We sat outside on the terrace very relaxed watching the world go by. The restaurant was busy but they did not try to rush us for the table.

We stopped here for a drink on the way back to the old town after going on the cable car and were so impressed we decided to come back later for lunch. We were seated at the wall overlooking the sea between Dubrovnik walls and the castle, a great place to be on a lovely warm sunny day. My wife ordered the mussels Bruzza, which was a huge bowl and were eagerly demolished with chunks of bread to dip in the sauce. I had a really nicely cooked ribsteak with swiss chard, potatoes & lots of garlic, washed down with a local beer. Service was excellent, the prices very reasonable for the quality of food and would highly recommend.

We ate here with friends during our holiday. The service was good and friendly and the food of a good standard, but nothing spectacular.

I would recommend this restaurant for larger groups (6 or more) as it will likely be far easier to get seats than some of the smaller places inside the walls.

We only went here to have breakfast almost every day we were in dubrovnik, and it's an awesome breakfast! You get a lot, it's healthy, it's cheap and it tastes great. Plus the service is awesome! 
One tip: it's the same company (probably) that owns dubravka, nautika and panorama on the top of the mountain. If you eat a breakfast at dubravka you'll get a coupon giving you 10 % off on the next meal on any of the above mentioned restaurants. Take the chance to give yourself some luxury by eating a real fine meal for that 10 % discount

Always stop off at Dubravka for a mid morning coffee when we get off the number6 bus. The location is stunning,the place is busy and bustling and the coffee is good. Have not eaten there but the breakfasts at adjoining tables always look appetising. Service is cheery and professional.
Very relaxing dining experience..had helpful friendly staff willing to recommend various dishes if you are looking to try something new...would recommend
Excellent food, amazing view. Great service from friendly Mario. We had some troubles with payment, but he sorted it out really fast. Would recommend and definitely will be back again!

If you are heading to the old city and city walls, you can have a tasty and complete breakfast just outside of it for a decent price (we paid 130 Kunas for two) including eggs, bread, fruits, coffee and orange juice. The staff were friendly and quick with the service which helped us to have the extra time to keep visiting the city. And the views were just amazing!

Located on the right just outside the pile gate this was a wonderful dinner choice. I would suggest reservations. The setting is beautiful. I was there on an evening with a torrential downpour. The staff assisted everyone and went out of their way to make everyone comfortable while still serving etc. The food was very good and the prices were very reasonable. In addition they gave all the patrons for the evening a 30% discount on our bills due to the weather. This is a very nice restaurant!

Located directly next to the Pile gate and overlooking the city walls. We booked for 7pm and was directed to our table overlooking the sea and walls so a perfect location.
My wife had steak and I the pasta with wild garlic (5 vegetarian dished on offer) , both were very tasty and nicely presented.
With wine and 2 courses the bill was £65 so not cheap but still cheaper than within the city walls.
I would recommend.

This restaurant is excellent the food choices extensive, glorious house wines perfect service and affordable prices. Don't be fooled by the fusion restaurants charging £30 for a burger and chips 
 This restaurant serves fresh home cooked food with a smile.

I had booked this restaurant online before our holiday and was worried that it might not be as nice as it sounded, it was for 6 adults on our first evening in Dubrovnik. 
I need not have worried we had a splendid evening despite arriving 40 minutes late in a thunder and lightning storm with torrential rain. I had specifically asked for terrace table but obviously everyone had been moved indoors or undercover yet despite this we received amazing service, free drinks and nibbles offered immediately while we waited at the bar then a lovely table was ready in 20 minutes. The waiters were helpful and efficient particularly when choosing our wine which was really lovely, everyone thought their meals were delicious and we were not rushed at all despite it being late. 
We spent a week in Dubrovnik and ate out every evening and this was our favourite overall, we did go back for a coffee so we could see the stunning view that we missed and it was certainly worth the effort. 
Although our bill was not cheap it was worth every kuna.

Saw this last night but had already eaten out at another place.

Chose this for lunch and was pleasantly surprised, nice chicken pasta 

Nice grilled chicken with grilled veg

Nice pizza freshly prepared

Worth a visit fir the views

4 meals all under 400 kuna with drinks

Must visit
Classy restaurant with good food and attentive staff. Good setting overlooking the Old City Walls. Provides a good contrast of venue if you are staying within the Old City,

Four of us visited here for lunch and were welcomed to a lovely table with a view of the wall, the harbor and the sea beyond. Our waiter was helpful, and the food was excellent. The portions were very filling, and so good we were inclined to eat every bit. Very nice experience.
Lovely food. Great location. Very helpful and friendly staff who gave us a 10% discount card for their other restaurant on top of the hill by the cable car which was useful!

The staff were quick to seat us, and they were very friendly.
The food arrived quickly, not bad for 7 people in the group.
We all found the food tasty and serving of a good size.
They have a 10%discount if you return, but they gave that anyway, and we did return to different staff with the same positive attitude.

So many restaurants to choose from but excluding the Hotel More which is were we stayed and the food was exceptional 
The small Atlantic a walk from our Hotel was great they made their own humus and we could not get enough of it

We could only get an early booking to sit by the wall, which we were more than happy to take. The view was stunning! The service was great. 
We ordered a pizza and it was delicious! My husband said it was one of the best he's had. 
We ordered the Gorgonzola gnocchi for mains and the mussels. Gnocchi great, muscles yummy, just super small muscles.
Would highly recommend this restaurant and reasonable prices for what you get.

The first morning we used the 10% discount from our city card, got free glasses of water and loved our choices. The view is unparalleled and if you go early enough, you have your choice of tables. The 2nd time we went we paid full, got served a bottle of water that we paid for and a chain smoker sat right next to us ruining our air space. I understand smoking is a cultural right here but for Americans, could we please have a separate non-smoking section? In spite of this, I would recommend them for breakfast. Other meals looked a little too expensive for our preference.

We visited Dubrovnik for 4 days, we ate at this restaurant 4 times! We found the price and choice very good compared to others. I would've expected it to be expensive owing to the amazing location and views. Staff were polite every time and food was good.

Lovely views of the city walls, the food is excellent, the wine is a little on the pricey side. We asked for steaks medium, which they probably werent as they were really thin [but still very juicy]. A little heavy with the garlic on the swiss chard too. 

Otherwise, they were excellent. Worth a trip there instead of Nautika

This was the first bar we came across on our walk down to the old town. The sun was shining as we arrived at the entrance to the old town and wow what a view! Perfect location looking out to sea with a fort right in front of you. Surreal! Stunning! Breathtaking! Best of all the prices are reasonable where you think you will be charged the earth. The pizza we had as a snack was very tasty and the staff were friendly and attentive. We came back 3 times in the 3 nights we were in dubrovnik, once for a pizza to share, couple of times for a late evening drink and a light lunch. You must check it out even for a pint of their local beer. Perfect!
We were lucky to havew a table right next to thev sea wall with stunning views. Service was great and the food excellent.
Ambience was fabulous. We ordered a pizza and a pasta dish and both dishes were very good. Highly recommend.

This terrace of the restaurant has fantastic views of old city Dubrovnik, Lukram and the Adriatic. The menu is nice and short with excellent selection of meals. The staff were extremely friendly and catered to all our needs. There was live music that added further to the experience. We traveled all around Croatia and ate in many places and this was one of our favorites for quality food and good value. A 3 course meal for 2 with wine and bubbles set us back just over €100. Try get a 10% discount card before you go

This is a much recommended restaurant, primarily for its location right beside the sea, and it is lovely. The food was pretty good, but it's a big restaurant and it felt like mass catering at times, a little rushed and not so intimate as other places in Dubrovnik.
Beautiful view of city walls and sea. Service very efficient. Good choice of food- the grilled squid and also the steak were excellent mains. Really good local wine.

This is a well run restaurant. Staff are very efficient and the food as first class. Prices are okay for the quality.

The fish plate selection as a main course was cooked to perfection and good value at 178 Kon. The vegetation risotto was also very tasty and excellent value at 71 Kon.

Bread with the meal was free which seems to be the case in most restaurants weave been to locally.

It was windy outside last night but the views and setting are very good.

Could not fault this place and will likely return again during our stay.

Our intention today was to go from bar to bar until it was time to join our group and return to our sail boat. We were disappointed at one bar which name I don't remember....the expensive wine and the house wine were equally awful. We continued in our search for a nice place being that Dubrovnik is not longer what it used to be. After visiting the Dalmatian islands, who needs this city.

We were invited in as soon as we approached the restaurant. It looked very nice, it had a nice view and we settled down without anticipating the very good wine we were about to be served accompanied by shrimps in a divine sauce with garlic and black pasta.

Mario our server was very attentive as well as Niksa, the manager. The inside of the restaurant is very nice.

This place is easy to find just before you enter the old town. Go there and enjoy the moment, you would not be disappointed. Relax in a serene atmosphere away from the noise and bustle of the other restaurants.

Best,
Visited today, May 27, 2017

A wonderful setting on the city wall in Dubrovnik. We had dinner here one evening and cocktails two subsequent evenings. Service friendly and courteous each visit and a thoroughly pleasant and relaxing context. A good experience in a brilliant setting.
Really nice busy restaurant with great choice on the menu. Lots of heaters and blankets to keep us warm to send the evening watching the sunset

The restaurant was pretty good, offered lots of seating and solid service. Nothing special compared to some of the other restaurants owned by the same company. The manager was solicitous when there was an issue with my food but still charged for the new dish, maybe that's an American thing though.

As locations go, this restaurant is very conveniently located right outside Pile Gate overlooking the bay and 3 historic fortresses. The view from the restaurant is simply awesome. 
The food too matches the ambience. We had ordered a vegetarian platter and a grilled tuna, both outstanding dishes. 
The service was prompt and efficient. A wonderful experience.

On my very first day to DUBROVNIK I walked out of my HILTON HOTEL to admire the fantastic views of the rocks, the ocean and the imposing fort walls. It took me into the pages of GAME OF THRONES, but what was particularly charming was the restaurant staff who gave me a nice table even though I said I was not eating but only having a glass of wine. The waiter was very knowledgeable.. spoke very good English ( Croatians speak very good English) and recommended what has become my favourite white wine
Dubrovka Vajiska.. He also brought me a lovely vegetable soup and welcomed me to the city with a discount coupon for 10% off each visit. I since dined on excellent seafood salad, sea bass cooked in a paper envelope with lemon and courgette and a local caramel custard.. 
Prices are very reasonable.. so please find time to visit.. I know I will..

This restaurant has some of the best views of any eatery in Dubrovnik. They were very busy when we arrived and we had not booked. We were seated on the terrace and then had to decide what we wanted from the varied menu. We settled on Chicken Pasta and Octopus Salad for starter followed by Steak in Gin & Mustard sauce and Dalmatian steak with Swiss chard. All the food was prepared and presented beautifully. As the evening drew on and it got cooler, the waiters distributed warm blankets to diners. A fantastic location and great food.
The food was amazing and the view was even better! You can dine inside or outside I would recommend outside. The staff was great!

Sitting on the terrace at Dubravka for a meal is a lovely way to while away an evening in Dubrovnik.
The food and cocktails are reasonably priced for the quality and ambiance but stay away from the bottled water at 40 kuna (!)

Me and my fiance reserved a table here by the wall and it was just incredible. Watching the sun go down from this spot whilst sipping cocktails was lovely. The staff were very polite and helpful. The food was delicious. The pork was cooked to perfection! Be sure to use your 10% discount card if you visit the panorama restaurant in the top of Srd. Would definitely recommend this place.

Everything was very nice. The food, the location, the view, the staff, the atmosphere, the facilities, the price. The only negative was the size of the mussels, which were tiny inside the normal size shells. I don't know if that's an Adriatic thing. Very tasty though.

Had dinner at the Dubravka with my family of 4. Very friendly staff and a very good selection of food. I had the seafood tagliatelle which was really tasty and fresh. Reasonably priced as well. The restaurant overlooks the side of one of the castles of the old town so try and get a table at the side.
Really recommend this restuarant

Stopped for fabulous cocktails here on our first night and loved the location (and the huge choice of cocktails!) Returned for dinner on our second night which didn't disappoint - the seafood risotto was absolutely delicious! Visited again on our third day for a drink in the sunshine. Lovely atmosphere and wonderful staff - would definitely return!
We really enjoyed our night at Dubravka. The food, and the service were absolutely perfect. The view is amazing. Highly recommended!!
Just outside Pile gate this restaurant has a great view of the wall. Service is very good and food is good too. They close at 10PM so plan it.

We booked in advance and requested a table by the wall. The views are stunning. Our waiter Ermin advised us on wine and food choices. All turn out to be superb. Do try Croatia Black wine.We were so impressed that on the next night at our chosen restaurant we were a little put out not to get the table we requested and we're surrounded by a huge party,we walked out and returned to Dubravka. We were lucky to get in but as returners we were given special treatment,table by the wall again and 10% discount on the bill.
Juust stopped for a beer after a long walk. Excellent service and our waiter said with conviction "best beer in Dubrovnik", He was correct out of the selection of draught beers I tasted over 5 days!!
The coffee is wonderful and one of the few places you can get decaff and the views are worth the cost of the coffee.

Arriving at the Old town for the first time, we just wanted to eat anything. In the middle of the bustling square, this place is nicely locates on the waterfront. However we did notice the high prices and looked to go elsewhere. We walked a bit further on and entered into what looked like a different restaurant. When greeted by the waitress we were then led back to the main seating area where we had just come from! A total trap! 

Anyway, the vitamin smoothies were nice enough and the John dory fillet was probably 7 out of 10. It's the prices that get you in this place. Over 400 kunas for a main and a drink for 2 people....£50+! They know how to take advantage of the large bus loads of people that are dropped in the main square! There are much better value restaurants in Dubrovnik.

Views are visually stunning, especially if you are lucky enough to get a table next to the wall overlooking Pile harbor. The food was consistent and good all three times we visited and better priced then in the city walls. The waitstaff was very efficient and food came out quickly which was not the case in other restaurants. Good people watching too as hordes of people are taking pictures outside the restaurant. We did two dinners and a breakfast during our time there. They will give you a card that has 10% off at their future restaurant visits in addition to their sister restaurants, Nautika and Panorama (which I highly recommend). I enjoyed their seafood risotto and my husband loved their chicken with bacon.
Very well situated restaurant, with acceptable service, nice view, affordable prices and relatively good food.

Finally arriving in Dubrovnik, after my little Koto(u)r, I found myself terribly hungry. I usually don't save money on food and I like to spend, but I must confess this place is pretty expensive. Though food is good, it would probably be better to find some tour-guide to show me some hidden gems of restauraunts where you can eat good and not have to spend a lot of money. Since I'd like to see some other sides of the city, besides the usual hot-spots, I'm really hoping to get a glimpse of lesser known Dubrovnik and a cheaper one. Saving money for more travels so I'm definitely avoiding places like this!

Dubrovnik is a city of restaurants, swallows and gentle tolling bells. Restaurants are in every narrow street, all look inviting and at lunchtime and dinner, the contrast of smells is tantalizing beyond belief. Dubravka 1836 is just outside the Pile Gate, the open air terrace overlooks Fort Bokar. It's a shady spot and the cool breeze from the ocean is a welcome respite from the midday sun. Food is "Mediterranean" style, and includes seafood and risottos, and huge fresh salads. We were "walk ins", but they managed to find a table for eight overlooking the ocean. Our order included prawns in wild garlic sauce served with black ink noodles, pork neck with vegetables, fresh trout with almonds and grilled octopus. The consensus was "delicious". One tip - drink the local wine, the white was dry with overtones of citrus ... perfect with our lunch and half the price of imported wines. Service was professional and attentive and the restaurant is open for lunch and dinner.

Had lunch there last week with family & friends and couldn't have wished for nicer surroundings, the restaurant sits adjacent to the City Gate & Walls and overlooks the sea. The food was fantastic and reasonably priced, I would certainly look to visit this restaurant again in the future and would recommend it to family & friends - Well done to all the staff

A friend in our group organised lunch and we were greeted very warmly by the hostess. They didn't seem to mind we had bought an extra guest and were so accommodating!

We were served by 'Super Mario' such a lovely server, very funny, attentive and patient as we were quite a large group! 

All food was delicious as we ended up tasting each others dishes. Also we revised some of the dishes adding this taking this off and nothing was too much trouble!

Lovely compliment paid by Mario saying that he would not forget my face!' I'm sure you will Mario but thank you for a lovely lunch on our last day in Dubrovnik! 

Such a pleasure visiting especially when you're away in one of the most scenic cities in the world!

I had a great time at Dubrovka 1836. My reservation table was ready as I came and the waiters were always on hand to check on me.

I ordered the house steak with wine and it was cooked perfectly. I truly enjoyed my solo dinner by the water. 

Beautiful! Will definitely return in the future !

We saved the best till last when we decided to eat our final dinner at Dubravka Restaurant just outside the Pile Gate? My sister and I had enjoyed our meals each night in different restaurants, but the meal at Dubravka tonight was absolutely amazing. My seafood risotto was the best I've ever had and my sister's pizza was very tasty and a generous size.
We both thoroughly enjoyed our mojitos.
Mario looked after us for the evening, checking to see if we enjoyed our meals and if we wanted anything else to eat or drink. He was very attentive without being pushy.
I would thoroughly recommend this restaurant for the food and the service. Obviously it has a good name, because it is always very crowded, which speaks for itself.

We visited Dubravka Restaurant tonight for dinner and I would have to say it was the best dinner we ate in the 5 nights spent in Dubrovnik. The food was simply divine. We ordered a Seafood Risotto and a Dubravka Pizza and couldn't quite get through the two meals shared between two of us. We also thoroughly enjoyed a Mojito each which was also quite generous in size and very tasty, good to the last drop. Our waiter, Mario was very attentive without being intrusive and had a lovely manner, a real professional. Our meal and drinks were well priced and we walked away very happy. Dubravka has one very big advantage over most of the restaurants in the old town and that is its location beside the town wall near the Pile Gate but overlooking a little cove and out to sea so it is blessed with a superb view. It is also the biggest of any of the restaurants nearby and you have a couple of choices for your seating. We were lucky enough to get a table outside which I would strongly recommend. The last detail I will mention was the large menu with quite diverse meals on offer, something for everyone.

We saw this place and it looked busy and ok. We were seated, but had a grumpy waiter. Another young waiter arrived with our water and went to pour only for grumpy to snatch the bottle and dismiss the other. Really poor uncomfortable service. We order the mussels and they arrived, how disappointing, tiny, tasteless and nearly cold. Nobody seemed to notice so we left, there are plenty fantastic restaurants in Dubrovnik old town service great value fresh seafood - do not waste you valuable time or money here.

Beautiful view of the sea and city walls! Food was mediocre. If you just want a drink with a view, I suggest combining it with a walk around the city walls. 150 kuna to walk (it's worth it) and there are a couple of places to have a drink along the way. The view is much better from atop the walls!

I visited this restaurant as I wanted to have lunch with a view over the castle towers and sea just outside of Dubrovnik. The menu was rather uninspiring bur decided to eat here anyway because of the views. 

I regretted eating here. Although we got a table with a good view, the food was poor and very pricey for what it was. I paid around 180 kuna for a bad cut of veal, 3 small vegetable sticks (the kind you can find in a frozen food aisle at the supermarket) and 9 Brussels sprouts. My boyfriend fared slightly better with the spaghetti bolognese. 

It was nice to sit and watch the sparkling azure ocean whilst having lunch, but I feel really ripped off paying so much for such a poor quality meal.
Good value compared to most of the restaurants in the area, fish dishes very tasty especially the trout and salmon,house wine not badly priced about 17 euro a bottle
Brilliant location, very personalised service, great sea food !! Went back the very next day as it was that good !! 👍👍👍

Out of the many restaurants we've visited in dubrovnik it's the first family friendly one we've come across. Lovely food and good service with excellent views of the jetee where the kayaks depart from. Good prices too.

Very touristy but excellent... it's a tourist town. I had fried fish very tasty and a big draft beer. Splendid view and good service in spite of the crowd.

Make certain to get a Discount card for Sister Restaurant, Panorama at the top pf the Cable Car.

Stopped here for lunch and so glad we did. The pasta was delicious and will definitely visit again. Prices very reasonable - especially considering all we'd been warned of in the Old Town of expensive restaurants serving nothing special - couldn't be further from the truth!
Service was great and very happy with a great meal.

It would be difficult to find a more delightful location to have lunch. Perched above the Adriatic just outside the old town and the city wall, this is a perfect place to sit and enjoy the afternoon. Try the local food, beer and wine, the staff really appreciate when you do.
Friendly service, tasty food and excellent libations. When we paid our bill , our server treated us each to a glass of different local liqueurs, which were delicious. Perhaps a nod to our effort to sample the local offerings. Worth a visit.

Dubrovnik was a port call during our recent med. cruise and whilst wandering this beautiful city came across this lovely hotel/restaurant. We sat on the terrace overlooking the square but there was another one at the back overlooking the old harbour. Both locations were lovely. The staff spoke good english and we were looked after very well indeed. We only had coffee but the food on offer looked good when served at other tables. Wish we had been there longer to sample the food.

We've had breakfast here one morning as we had the discount card from the Dubrovnik city card. It was a really nice meal, but oh...what a view. I am still dreaming about that morning so for sure I will stop by again when in Dubrovnik :)

Located right outside the Old City and offering a panoramic view of the sea and the city wall from the outside, the restaurant is excellent in ambience, especially when you sit al fresco, just a couple of tables away from the light jazz that a duo plays live. The food is good and value for money, relative to the other restaurants in Dubrovnik. The service is fast and the waiters are attentive to our needs. I only wish the portions are a little bigger.

The 1st place we visited while in Dubrovnik. The people are very nice and kind (they missed serving our coffee and felt so bad that they gave us free croissants!!)
But great food and very nice people...
We had a very relaxing and pleasant dinner here in July. The waiter was very kind and had a good sense of humour. The food was lovely and the setting was beautiful. We were surrounded by the sea.

The restaurant food, staff and view were fabulous, especially Mariojo
and Jasmin. Nothing was too much trouble. There was a very varied menu. Reasonable prices and great view. Would highly recommend.
Great food in brilliant setting. Excellent service and not too expensive. Would very happily eat there again.
I loved this restaurant. Reasonably priced food and drinks with beautiful views over the water. We had pizza and salad here with cocktails at lunchtime and it was the perfect setting

Dubravka is a great first stop of the day. Had breakfast here several times in a row while staying nearby. Marjo, our waiter, was fantastic and very welcoming. We enjoyed sitting on the terrace and sipping coffee while enjoying the view of the sea and Dubrovnik. Very calm next to a very busy area. Great breakfast options. They even have blankets if you get chilly. Looking forward to return. Will need to try the cakes next time. I do recommend the chocolate walnut cake, which they have (I had it at their partner restaurant panorama on top of the hill behind the town).
