Friendly and attentive staff, varied menu, and good food. Spend a couple of hours in a lively restaurant, people-watching and enjoying a good meal and drinks in a beautiful spot.
We first popped in for a drink on one afternoon, then went back later in the evening for something to eat. Amazingly, out waiter remembered us, and offered a 10% discount!

Amazing from beginning to end. Located right outside Pile Gate with stunning views of the harbor and city walls. The service was prompt and professional and the food delicious. Our only regret is that we didn't have the time to come back again.

Decided not to book a table somewhere on our first night, came across this restaurant and asked for a table for 8.

The food was amazing, I had tuna and it was amazing. Some of the group had pizza, salmon, chicken and all were really happy with their meals.
Would recommend.

We ate here twice in our 7 day trip. The views are great and the food very good value for money. The staff are really friendly too. There are so many restaurants to choose from in Dubrovnik, but this one is definitely worth a visit.

Besides the view, waiters were perfect
Sea bass and asorted fish plater were well done and the walnut pie was perfect, best pie ever had
fantastic location, very good food, attentive staff, nice wine list. A nice change from restaurants inside the city walls, this one has a great view, especially nice at sunset.

My husband and I ate at this restaurant a couple of years ago and a few weeks ago we returned and had two lunches on two different days. The food was as we remembered two years ago - tasty, good and pleasant service and a lovely setting. Would return again and would highly recommend.

This was a wonderful breakfast to start my stay in Dubrovnik. I had the tomato and mozzarella omelette which also comes with fruit, bread, an assortment of jams, and coffee and juice! The staff was friendly and the view was amazing!

Title says it all really.
We ate here and enjoyed a glass of house wine after touring the old city and sat at a table right up against the stone wall with view to the small harbour outside the walls.
I enjoyed the ravioli with truffles and prosciutto in a creamy dressing and my partner scoffed the seafood pasta, which was chock full of seafood and the sauce was very flavorful.
We also had dessert each.
Service was very good.
Total cost for 2 mains, 2 desserts and 2 glasses of wine was 415 Kuna. Excellent value, especially considering the location!

While I find the menu a bit limited compared to the USA... this is a great value and the staff is excellent
Food is very good and it turned into lmk breakfast place every day.
Tomato and mozzarella omelette is great as is the cappuccino 
Very welcoming staff and amazing views
Can't do better here

We selected Dubravka based on location only. The restaurant sits right next to the Pile Gate entrance to the old town and was the first restaurant when we got off the bus.

The food was excellent and so was the service. And not a lot to complain about the food either.

The menu has a little bit of everything and everything seemed delicious. Don't be put off by the fact that the menu refers to some dishes as starters (warm & cold). They are sizeable portions and enough as a lunch main course at least.

Probably not the cheapest of places but with mains, desserts and beer, wine plus soft drinks for 3 people 750 kn (100€) didn't seem that bad.

With the sun shining on the terrace and a view to the sea and the city walls, I was very happy with our choice.

Thumbs up for Dubravka 1836.
Good location, Friendly staff and quick service, food average. Just nothing to write home about. It is ok. My wife's pasta was ok and my pizza was ok.

My sister and I came here for lunch today and we decided to try their cocktails! We haven't been impressed with the cocktails in other bars so far but this menu seemed different! My sister had the espresso martini and I had the toasted almond cocktail and they were amazing! Very reasonably priced too!
After a dinner in the Old Town, we dropped in for cocktails. Nice view to the walls and the castle, very good mojito and swift service.

We went to this restaurant on our first night, we had a table overlooking the water and the walls of Old Town. The house white was lovely and very reasonable. Our meal was served quickly and the service was excellent. We did not feel rushed at all and we were given light wraps to keep the evening chill away. The restaurant is very busy but we did not have to make a reservation and we ate at about 8pm.
The view and ambience is fantastic good service although a little touristy and a little overpriced for drinks

My partner and I had a late lunch here in May 2017. This cafe is not 'fancy', but it is reasonably priced with a great view and good service. The fish tasted fresh and the vegetables were definitely welcome after a week eating carbs in Italy!

We visited Dubravka several times during our stay in Dubrovnik, as it was on the way to the old city from our hotel. There is a great view from their terrace, where you can sit, and we did for a drink once, although it was very windy and quite cold - they supply blankets to wrap up in! Another time we had a drink inside, which is also open to the sea on one side so was also cold when we were there (more blankets) and we ate dinner there one night. After over-indulging a bit we had just one course - steak (him) veal with mushrooms (me). Both very nice and quickly served. This is a popular place and always very busy but we didn't need to book as we went early for a drink or a meal. On a hot day I'm sure it would be packed out. Stunning views and a place not to miss.

Fantastic last night meal here at Dubravka 1836 Restaurant. Great food, wine and service! Staff were friendly and happy to help with food and wine choices. 3 of us started with the fish soup which was tasty and a little filling for me! The other starter was swordfish carpaccio which looked delicious. We all had the main course recommended by our waitress which was beef gratin; beef cooked as you wanted it served with smoked bacon, mushroom and asparagus and covered in delicious melted cheese; yummy! Not as keen on the potato hash browns served with it; seemed a strange choice with such a tasty meat dish! Wonderful local, dry, white wine to accompany the meal was delicious! The boys had warm apple pie and cream for pudding which they said was not warm enough but tasty. The girls had cream caramel which was beautifully smooth and tasty. Coffee completed a very nice meal. A really great restaurant with excellent views during the day and great, friendly service.
Great place with amazing food and very proffesional service. Definitely coming again!! Highly recommended!

Ate a plenty of times at Dubravka - they always keep their high level of service and quality. Even it is one of the most frequent restaurants at the main Pile entrance into town you can relax over here and enjoy your lunch, dinner or just a glass of Prossecco with a stunning view on the city walls & sea or on fort Lovrjenac & Bokar.
Nice pizza, pasta, fish & meat dishes, but also great cakes.
Best staff - friendly, professional & quick.

Great food, perfect setting on the terrace overlooking the sea ( suggest you book! ) and above all excellent service from our waiter Mirko. What a lovely experience! Throw in a great bottle of Posip recommended by the waiter, a couple of complimentary local brandies and you have the best dining experience in Dubrovnik. A real treat for our last night in this beautiful city. Many thanks
The location was very easy to find and the views of the old city walls and the sea were beautiful. We really enjoyed our meal and especially loved the chocolate walnut cake for desert.

We were a large group which they accommodated very well. Service was very good, friendly and efficient. It was a cold evening but the heaters and blankets provided kept us warm. I had the king prawns Dubrovnik which were excellent in a very nice sauce. This restaurant is reasonably priced and has great views of the city walls.

What a delight. So close to the old city that they probably do not struggle to attract people in but the food and service was excellent. Great views and extremely friendly staff. We had a great three course meal here.

We arrived without a booking and were straightaway ushered to one of the best tables they had to offer. We were sat against the wall that straddles the clifftop overlooking the fort and the walls of Dubrovnik's historical defences. 

Considering the location the food is very affordable, with different options from pizza and pasta to fish and meat dishes, including several choices for vegetarians. I ordered the grilled squid with boiled vegetables and potato. Though this sounds bland the natural sweetness and freshness of the squid carried the plate and proved an enjoyable meal. The greek salad was rich, filling and delicious too. 

There's not much more to say except the food was delicious, staff pleasant, and the view extraordinary. This place scores extra points because unlike most places inside of the walls, they don't have staff stood outside trying to drag you inside. As such, very much worth leaving the city walls for this venue and conveniently outside the main entrance to old Dubrovnik.

The title says it all. We were a party of 6 and they seated us quickly. The service was attentive without being overbearing. All the dishes were very good, ranging from pizza and pasta to salads and seafood. The seafood was very fresh and tasty and was complimented with some excellent local wine. Who knew Croatia had such tasty grapes!

With mains (no starters), soft drinks, beer, & wine, we spent less than £25 per person. The waiter added some discount coupons for this and their other restaurant for future visits (nice marketing!). We will definitely be back.

We went to Dubravka 1836 for dinner and to enjoy the views of the city wall. Service was decent, although the staff mixed up our orders and replaced our vegetarian meal with one containing pork. They were apologetic and quickly rectified the situation. Meal was adequate.
The restaurant has nice view on city walls. The food and service are very good! Visit if you get a chance!
Come for the view- food is average. Pizza/ pasta like you can get anywhere in the city. Right next to Nautika which is way more expensive, better bargain.

This restaurant has great views, out door dining looking over the sea and toward the walls. The staff were friendly and we were served promptly. When the food arrived it was bland and lacked any seasoning. The John Dory, the sauce just tasted like a flour sauce and the prawns (3) in a tomato again lack any flavour. Didn't stay for dessert as we were disappointed with the mains. This restaurant has wonderful views but it was let down by bland food.

we went for our first late breakfast but as it was late, we ended having lunch. The views are beautiful, you can see the ocean, the walls and a location for GOT. The food was delicious with plenty of options. The staff was friendly and attentive. A little pricey but worth it. They even have a nice shop. I think it is a must visit when you are in Dubrovnik.
Beautiful view of City walls and the castle, fresh seafood, best service and is a good place to chill with a glass of wine or coffee.
Excellent for family dinner. Nice view, good service, food ok. We loved the heating in the terrace. Didn' t wait too long - si good if You are with kids.
Friendly staff, good food and lovely setting. Food had good portions and good taste! Would definitely recommend this restaurant.

Amazing view from the restaurant! Food was awesome and staff was very nice and attentive.
I highly recommend!!!

Set just outside of Pile Gate the floodlit city walls add character to the restaurant. The menu was extensive with so many good choices. We had the seafood platter which was excellent. Staff were very friendly and helpful and there were musicians playing in the restaurant to add to the atmosphere. Well worth a visit.

The food here is so tasty and really reasonably priced for the portions and quality of food. When converted back to pounds the price was so cheap and well worth it! There's a great atmosphere and the staff are very accommodating! We had an issue with one of our meals where it wasn't served as we asked, we requested a plain steak with no garlic butter on top for a particularly fussy eater and when it came out with the butter on top the staff were so apologetic with every member of staff who passed us offering sincere apologies! A fresh steak was soon to our table and was at the same high standard as the best of the meals! Definitely worth going whether it's for drinks, evening meals, desserts or just as a coffee stop throughout your day

We found this place delightful. The food was very good and the service absolutely excellent. Our waiter was extremely nice and highly professional. I would recommend anyone going to Dubrovnik to try this place for food, or at least a drink!
Really great food and atmosphere. A little bit on the expensive side but worth it. Also waiting staff were friendly and accommodating.

My partner and I went here for breakfast and had a great time! The breakfast was decent but what really made the experience great was the stunning view. It's located right next to the ocean with views of the city walls and forts. Reasonably priced for its prime location

Impeccable service - Breathtaking view of the water
Game of Thrones fans will love the view...

Staff is very friendly and professional.

If you're sitting outside and it's a little windy they bring you blankets, and have heat lamps when needed.

Recommended: Seafood pizza and the two eggs breakfast with the cheese on top

Great location and staff. Wide selection of good food and good size portions.Heaters and blankets readily available so that you can enjoy the food in beautiful surroundings al fresco.
Great cappucinos to finish a filling and enjoyable meal.

The restaurant had a very relaxed an romantic vibe. 

There was live instrumental music which was a lovely touch.

We sat outside and when the temperature dropped there were blankets and heaters to keep you warm.

To put it simply...

The food was amazing

The view was amazing

The staff were amazing

I highly recommend the restaurant.

Excellent service from all staff, the restaurant was very busy but we never had any issues with slow service. They were very attentive and went above and beyond to make sure we were comfortable and well taken care of. 
We sat outside and were surrounded by outdoor heaters and soft blankets for our laps which was a lovely touch. 

Extremely well located with a beautiful view. 

The meal was delicious and the local wines recommended to us were also lovely. We took white and red options to compliment our courses and were not disappointed.

Thank you Dubravka 1836 for a lovely evening and meal!

Yes, it is a touristy place, but that does not necessarily mean bad food and/or bad service. On the contrary. 
I wanted to enjoy the stunning view from the outside terrace and have late lunch. The food was very tasty and of high quality. And what I enjoyed most (apart from the view) was the exceptional, authentically friendly and attentive service, the crew is really great. 
I can absolutely recommend Dubravka 1836. Prices are Dubrovnik standard and ok for what you get.

Really nice atmosphere and OK food, but, like all of Dubrovnik, a bit expensive, which is amazing when you compare the town to the rest of Croatia. My spaghetti Bolognaise was actually quite tasty but the wine was expensive and firmly "adequate", not representative of what we paid. In all, if you have to eat in town this is s good as any place and the staff makes you feel special.

The restaurant is located just outside the pile gate, close to the water. The waiters were friendly and accommodating. 

We enjoyed the starters with pasta and risotto with seafood. The main courses were ok but not out of the extraordinary. The best one was the platter with different kinds of fish and seafood.

Spectacular view and excellent services
Food is average and the price is fair
May come back because it is very homey and comfortable 
Nice wine selection is a plus

We have stopped there just to have a nice ending of our day trip , relaxation and overseeing the great view , before going back to our hotel .
Well located flowery and friendly place with nice welcoming waiters.

Cakes were amazing ( apple pie , chocolate cake and cheese cake).
The cheese cake is one of the best my wife ever tasted (and she did a lot of tasting...).

A bit over price coffees and 4 cakes were around 35 euro) , but still worth the sweetness left in our mouth). We will come again later this week!

This is a lovely restaurant, which me and my fiancé visited twice in 5 days. 

The food was amazing and the cheese cake is an absolute must! 

We went once and sat in the centre of the outside, but the second time, we reserved a table next to the wall with a beautiful view of the sunset. 

Really highly recommend.
Location is superb, Prices are mid range. Food very good and unfussy. Staff excellent, plus a 10% discount on the next meal.

Located just outside Pile Gate, this restaurant is an excellent choice for al fresco dining. During our recent visit to Dubrovnik, we enjoyed our first lunch here and the salads and light meals were very good. The terrace has lovely views and service is attentive.

We had breakfast here all three mornings we stayed nearby as we couldn't think of anywhere better to go than this restaurant with the most beautiful view. You can probably just share one of the breakfast deals by adding on another coffee and croissant between two of you. Gorgeous start to the day. We also had pizza there on our first evening which was fantastic.

This looked like a touristy spot to avoid but my husband wanted to take in the beautiful, sunny afternoon views overlooking the Adriatic and right next to the city walls. It was packed so we had to wait for a table and the first one to come open was the furthest from the views so we took it but told the waiter we would like to switch to a waterfront table if one came open. After setting our entire table and serving us drinks, within a few minutes, they picked it all up again and whisked us right over to a beautiful waterfront table. Great service!! I expected touristy, mediocre food. I was so wrong!! Our food was delicious and perfectly prepared. We had some fresh seafood and some pasta. So pleased we came here!!! I would highly recommend this for a beautiful view and meal with professional and nice staff.

I had thought that a restaurant just outside the walls of the Old Town would be much like other tourist spots but this was a very pleasant surprise. My meal was fresh and excellent and the wine (which was local) was outstanding. Kudos to the servers for their attentiveness as well. And, of course, the view!!

We choose our last dinner in Croatia here. What a good choice! The waiter and waitress here are nice and patient. The waiter recommended us a kind of great white wine. It's sweet and strong ( Be cautioned if you have to drive back to your hotel!)
We sat outside the store, just next to the old town. We enjoyed the great night view and traditional Spaghetti Bolognese, Fish Fillet( I forget the name), and Tagliatelle Seafood. All the pasta were great cooked with thick sauces. Fish is good and fresh, only the vegetables were tasteless. We dipped the vegetables into the pasta sauces to get flavored.
After the main dishes, we ordered a walnuts pancake. We did not like it. The walnuts tasted non-baked. We should just order a chocolate one.
All the little dissatisfied points couldn't ruin the great view here. If you come to this restaurant you must sit outside so that you could enjoy the old town view. 
However there are still some defect sitting outside: 1. There may be some guests smoking- I couldn't stand that, but it's usual there, especially while sitting outside. 2. There would be some small bugs or flies around- not a lot, maybe only tow or three around us, but they would fly into our wine glasses and flaw on the surface of the drink......3. It may be cold outside- the restaurant provide some blankets, It's useful to us. But if you do really feel cold, then sitting inside would be a good choice.
Great views, good location overlooking the sea. Professional, friendly and helpful staff. Food was quick, fresh, and delicious. Totally recommend!
Good location, staff friendly , food ok but not spectacular . Good value for money. We had the rib steak and kale and the meat was very tender.
We had rib steak and Risotto........ Both were outstanding! The service was great and the ambience and scenery was amazing!

Stopped for a quick drink whilst passing, then having wondered all around the old town looking for somewhere to eat headed back. The service was friendly the food is really good the view and ambiance exceptional and reasonable price considering location, what more can you ask for.

The food was very good, nice view on the city wall.
Service was excellent,coffe was vefy good.
Thanks!
We ate here 3 times during our stay, fantastic good, amazing staff and really good prices! Not to mention the beautiful views!

Very good restaurant.
My husbant had fillet of fish and it was increxible.
My grilled fish made to perfection.

Higly recommended!

We had dinner outside with a sea view.in this restaurant just outside the city walls. It was a little windy but blankets and heaters were provided which kept us warm. The service was excellent as was the food and the price was reasonable. The menu is extensive and caters for breakfast, lunch and dinner. At dinner we booked a table to ensure we were at the edge and had a good view. This would certainly be essential at busy times.
good food at a reasonable price and staff very friendly nice atmosphere and not rushed to eat up good experience
Beautiful view of the sea, fresh seafood and deliciously prepared lasagne. Great service with a lovely atmosphere. Some heat lamps that keep you warm on the breezey nights :)

This is a great place with ample seating and a wonderful view of the old city walls and the sea. There is inside and outside seating under canopies and the staff are friendly and attentive without being to 'in your face'. A nice varied menu means that there will be something for everyone and they do offer discounts if you go back to them - normally 10%. It's also literally next to the entrance to old Dubrovnik so it's the perfect rest-bite before exploring.
Amazing view from the outdoor restaurant. The staff was very nice and attentive. We ate there for breakfast, lunch and dinner and all three meals tasted really good - especially with the price!

A lovely cafe and restaurant in the old town overlooking the sea. Plenty of places to sit outside - they also have heaters and blankets outside should it get a little chilly!

Menu includes pizzas, pastas, salads, meat and fish dishes. Tasty food, nice cocktails. Friendly staff. We also had 10% off the bill but prices were good anyway. 

We went back to eat the next day as well. 

Overall a very nice place to eat.

Dubravka 1836 sits at the main gate into the old town, right next to Pile Gate. We sat in a huge outdoor seating area overlooking the gate and the waterside. It is mainly Italian food with pasta, pizza and other meaty offerings. Husband and I split the dubravka pizza - ham, cheese, green olives and egg - tasty and plenty for 2 to share for lunch. Staff are lovely. When the air turned chilly they came out with fleecy blankets and heaters were switched on. Bright, lively, recommended.

Lovely starter - seafood salad was hearty and fresh. Pizza for Main which was very standard. Good but nothing special. Draft beer was great and the coffee to finish was lovely with a very tasty traditional croat sweet. The staff were attentive and friendly and the views were amazing. Great patio heaters and blankets too. An amazing experience all round

We stumbled across this beautiful Resturant on our first afternoon in Dubrovnik. The seating area is in a lovely courtyard overlooking the sea and the beautiful walls of the old town. The staff were so friendly and helpful. I had the tomato soup and cream caramel which was delicious for lunch. My husband had the fish soup and the Dubravka chocolate cake which was made of crushed walnuts and chocolate. We used this venue on further occasions as the food was so good. Each time my husband couldn't resist the soup or cake. We also tried the pasta,salmon and chicken. All were good sized portions. On our last visit it was too chilly to sit in the courtyard so sat on an enclosed veranda over looking the city walls. As returning customers the staff gave us a 10% discount. Most of the chairs have blankets if you should feel cold and patio fires trained on the tables. A really lovely restaurant which gave us some happy memories of our stay
The food was okay. I think the food is very Croatian? Reasonable prices. Service was good. Nice view just next to the city wall.
great view if you eat outside, I ate here for both lunch & an evening meal. on both times the service was good,as was the food. good value food & service in a great location.

Service was good. The waiter didn't hurry me and did not push me to order more than the seafood salad. Salad was delicious and a good portion with lots of seafood...octopus, anchovies, fish, scallop, mussels...The waitress also had the initiative to ask if I have the Dubrovnik card to enjoy 10% discount.
View is lovely looking out to the sea.

Evending dinner for two. Lasagne was great 10 out of 10 and good portion. Pork medallions were excellent too. Friendly service,not pushy, great location by city walls and Fort, with bonus of table heaters on a chilly March night. Better than sitting in alley within town walls. Also not too expensive for area. No room for desserts but can recommend ice creams from here as we have had several in the day this holiday.

This place has an amazing view towards the sea, with the fort Lovrijenac in the background. Good prices and very good service. Also, is right before the entrance in the old town, so we loved the thing that we could enjoy our meal away from the crowds in the old city.
Ate twice and both times was fantastic. Food superb staff great and view of forty and city walls were incredible. Cannot recommend highly enough

Perfect food, excellent view on fortress Lovrijenac.
It was honestly on the top of our list of dining experiences ever.
Great service,perfect location.

We were eating here less than two hours after landing in Dubrovnik. We each opted for a pizza and my Bolognese pizza was delicious. The staff were welcoming and attentive, even moving the outdoor heaters to keep diners warm. It also seemed as though the ice cream was a very popular choice with most customers.

Perfect view. You can look beautiful Adriatic Sea. We eat two times.
It was very good. Recommend to all!!!
We came, we had our plaids, they switched on UFOs and we started to eat. And I was full. No, wrong one, I was FULL. Really, really tasty and big portions and very pleasant staff. Definitely a must!

Another fine restaurant in Dubrovnik. Great selection of mediterranean food and pizzas with a wonderful view on the fortress Bokar together with live Dalmatian music is the perfect combination to spend s time during evening. To secure your best sits next to wall make a reservation beforehand.

Dubravka 1836 is a very nice restaurant in the center of Dubrovnik, next to the gate to the old town. It offers an amazing view on Adriatic sea, Fort Lovrijenac and the old town city walls. Food is nice and staff are friendly and helpful. It has free wifi and no parking place. The restaurant is a bit expensive, but the prices match with the overall prices in the city, since the city itself is expensive.
The restaurant is on a terrace with a great view on the city walls. The service is perfect and the food awesome. The prices are not so high as you would expect from a place like this.

Just spent a long weekend in Dubrovnik and visited this reataurant twice - and given there is a wide choice of restaurants in and around the town the fact we went twicw says it all. This is a quiet time of year but the team were very attentive both visits and the food was very good.

Dubravka Restaurant has an excellent location just outside the Pile gate, overlooking the sea. Pleasant terrace, friendly staff, good selection of snacks, salads and main courses. We had a seafood salad which was delicious and filling, and the sea bass which was beautifully cooked. Good value and would certainly return.
Clean and fresh interior too, but this place is all about the terrace and views !

This was the first place I ate upon my arrival and I liked it so much I had to come back a few more times. Excellent views of the City Walls and the Adriatic make it a perfect setting. Very friendly and attentive staff. The menu isn't too varied (which I found to be the case in a lot of Croatian restaurants to be fair), but the pizza is so good it doesn't really matter. Very affordable too, plus you can get 10% off if you visit the Panorama restaurant at the top of Mount Srd.
Very good quality pasta, delicious sauce. Parmezan could be better served (ribbed on spot). Prawns very nice and fresh. Price was ok for spaghetti and wine. Very full glass of wine, nice waiters.

My husband and teenage daughter and I wanted to have dinner. We are vegetarian, so it was so nice to have a place that wasn't just able to serve pasta. Our waiter, Ermin, made sure that everything was perfect,. He helped us figure out what to get, and even told us about the beautiful Castle that we could see from our table.
Very cozy restaurant, professional service, fine meals. My recomendation is to taste their House White Wine! I love it!
They have too many tables and food is too simple, but you have nice view to the fort Lovrijenac and its good for a coffe break. Near the Pile gate, close to everything.

Located just outside the historic city walls close to the Pile gate is Dubravka. We were fortunate to go there for lunch on the opening day of the season.
The service was excellent as was my octopus salad & local wine. On another day we came for dinner with the great views of the Dubrovnik walls lit up at night. The food service was equally as good as when we came for lunch. Also, it is competitively priced compared to other comparative restaurants located close by.

We've eaten here three times now. Once in June last year, September and now Feb. 

The food is great, very fresh fish, and what I love about the food is it is unpretentious! It's good grilled seafood next to the sea! The seafood risotto is amazing as are the king prawns. 

You do pay a small bit more but it's far more reasonable than say prejiko steet where you'd pay double for not as good quality food. Dubrovnik is expensive as it has become more popular but Dubravka is great and would definitely recommend it.

Disappointed. Food came out within 5 mins of ordering (never a good sign). Clearly microwaved - tasted distinctly average to poor. Most irritating thing was the price, for the quality of what we received the cost was ludicrous. Awful, would not recommend to anyone.
Really nice food, good service and a good price. Nice choice as 70% of the restaurants were closed! Had a good mix of meat/seafood.
Nice view , nice food . Also, the service is good . Finally the prices for this location of the restaurant is very reasonable.

This restaurant was just being reopened for the season as we arrived for our short break. We called in on our way back from a long walk to admire he views and relax. We ordered the mixed local cheeses, mozzarella and tomato salad and a few glasses of white wine. The staff were lovely and most welcoming and we did not feel rushed to finish our food as we sat in the beautiful sunshine. It was so lovely we decided to make a reservation for dinner. We were glad we did and had the best meal of our trip, up until then I had been somewhat disappointed with the meals we had eaten out. My husband had the beef steak and I had the bolognaise, both were delicious. A local merlot was recommended by our waiter who chatted to us about it.s origins. It was a little chilly outside but we wanted to eat on the terrace as the views are spectacular, not to worry as the patio heaters gave off great heat and I was given a blanket. a lovely meal in a fantastic place , made even more special by the kind and helpful staff!
The best fast food restaurant where I was. Great location and quick service but nothing more than that.

Visited this restaurant in September 2016. We were on a cruise ship excursion and after a morning full of touring Old Town Dubrovnik, we had about an hour and a half of free time before meeting up to go back to our cruise ship. We needed to "refuel" and it was close to our meeting point so we said what the heck and got a table. What a good choice it was, a beautiful location, on a beautiful afternoon in Dubrovnik. 

Being it was just two of us we ordered a margherita pizza (a perfect size for two people) and a couple cocktails (yeah we needed a second wind in that way as well). Frankly I was so hungry at this point I would have been happy to have something to eat at the Croatian equivalent of a hot dog stand. But I was so happy we chose this restaurant. 

The service was great, the hostess and our waiter were very welcoming and friendly. It was so relaxing, I felt like I could have stayed there for hours, not to mention our pizza and cocktails were excellent. If I wasn't so hungry (and had the rest of the afternoon to spend there) I would have looked at the menu more and probably ordered multiple items, that's how good that pizza was, therefore I can only imagine that their other meals are just as good. 

If you're visiting Dubrovnik, you should really check out this restaurant. If I'm EVER back there (I hope so, one day) and this restaurant is still there (I hope that is so also) I would definitely go back.

We loved this restaurant so much that we ate here TWICE during our 6 hours in Dubrovnik. We were shaded from the sun, and still had the beautiful view to allow us to further enjoy the tasty food and drink selections. Our service was very good, but there were others around that were not so happy with their waiter.

This restaurant has indoor and outdoor seating. We had outdoor as it was a warm day although a little windy at times. The setting looking out over the wall to the sea is good.
We are not fans of Game of Thrones, but upon Googling it, we saw we were next to where they filmed some scenes. 
We had starters. Tomato n mozzarella and ceviche with fish and capers. Very good.
Mains were a pasta dish, lamb chops and again, pretty good. My daughter wanted a crepe for dessert. The crepe on their menu was without strawberries and we asked for some. The waiter paused for a while before telling us he would see what he can do. He managed to pull off this incredible feat somehow and strawberries were produced. 
Overall, this restaurant is not amazing in any way, but it's competent and satisfactory.
I would mention the lack of enthusiasm and politeness of the staff, but this is something we encountered at every restaurant in Croatia except for one. They don't make you feel particularly welcome like the Greeks do, for example. If I'd wanted to be served by people who don't make you feel like royalty or don't make much of an effort, I could have gone to a restaurant at home in England. 

The food is good here. A lot of eateries in Dubrovnik of a similar standard.

We stumbled upon this restaurant by accident the first evening.
Lots of variety in food including vegetarian options, good size portions, always too full for dessert! Service was excellent- the staff let us sit and talk for hours without bothering us. Really enjoyed our visit.
We ended up visiting three times in three days!
Portions are small, food tastes only ok and everything is expensive. Not to mention the rude waitress who tried to charge us extra. Disappointed.

In mid-September 2016 we found Dubravka 1836 to be an unexpected but most enjoyable and delicious mid-day meal and escape. The Old City was crowded and we were looking for someplace and something to eat, and were expecting to have to settle for a typical low-quality tourist facility. But, Dubravka 1836 was close by and there was a table available. So, even though the restaurant was fairly large and busy, we took the table. We found the service to be prompt and courteous. With room between tables, umbrellas to shield us from the sun, a view of the small bay and the sea outside overlooked by the Old City and the restaurant, and excellent wine, coffee and light food, we totally enjoyed our experience. One of the better parts of our visit to Dubrovnik.

We were excited for the view, but it was too cold to sit outside. We were excited for the octopus and squid, but it wasn't great, just good. The risotto was the best thing we ordered. It was very good. It was a fairly expensive dinner that was good, but not great. The waiter was not that friendly, but I do have to say they were very nice about giving us a table where we wanted and changing the time when we decided to come earlier - probably because there was lots of room though. We had better meals in other places.

Fresh seafood not too much seasoning simple n nice. Reasonable prices n good service. After your meal thr will giving 10% discount for your second visit, another restaurant on top of the cliff ..for picture lover u can took nice pictures of Dubrovnik city wall .. best place for sunsets pictures

While visiting the amazing old town of dubrovnik we had some coffee at dubravka 1936. The coffee was good and the staff nice. The staff spoke English. The views are amazing from the terrace. They overlook the city wall and the sea.

Had dinner here on the last night of our trip.The venue has stunning views of both castles and the sea, however we were here in November and it was dark at the time although both castles are floodlit. Service was attentive and the food was tasty and not overpriced. The restaurant is just outside the walls and is priced accordingly. Would recommend.

Good coffe , cakes and nice view.
Very friendly staff , I enjoyed every second, I will come again....
This restaurant is just outside the wall; there's a great view of the ocean and the wall itself... We enjoyed a nice dinner here. Not a bad price for how nice the setting and food was.

The day after we arrived in Dubrovnik, we stopped in early afternoon looking for breakfast. Dubravka Restaurant doesn't serve breakfast after noon, so we didn't stay. Later in the week we decided to have dinner here, after perusing the menu and finding several interesting possibilities.

We can't dine where there's smoking, so we were escorted to the front patio overlooking the sea and provided with a personal heater and blankets to keep us warm. We were already very impressed with the wonderful personalized service, and the quaint cozy ambiance. Views are spectacular, especially if you happen to catch sunset.

We started with a glass of wine and a coffee with Baileys. Creamed vegetable soup arrived not long after our drinks, and it was excellent. 

Hubby ordered the lasagne, after ascertaining that the meat was 100% beef, and I ordered turkey steak in mushroom sauce with penne pasta. The food was fantastic, well prepared, good quality, and presented beautifully. Our server checked on us regularly, as did the manager to ensure that we were comfortable and our meal was as expected.

Our total bill for drinks, soup, and two entrees was 310 kunas, but out of the blue the restaurant reduced our bill by 10% - off season discount, I believe the server mentioned. We spent a total of $40 USD plus tip.

This was one of finest dining experiences we've had in almost four weeks traveling throughout eastern Europe. We were very impressed and pleased with every aspect of Dubravka Restaurant.

This was our first stop for lunch when we arrived in Dubrovnik. It was so lovely to sit outside in the sun with such a beautiful view. The Red Keep and Blackwater Bay to any GoT fans. Staff were helpful and the food was tasty.

Almost all our food is precooked/prepped. My guess is because they have a lot of customers. All our food was cold or barely warm - and it tasted ok. The service was great and when I complained they were prompt to say sorry and were eager to give a free drink. It was a nice gesture but they question is....why not just improve the quality of food?

My family stayed in Dubrovnik for a week in October 2016, and visited Dubravka restaurant quite regularly. The menu is great (Adriatic pizza being my personal favourite), the staff are very helpful, friendly and spoke good English, and the setting, is beautiful. Highly recommended!

Went there just for breakfast ... nice view from our table on the terrasse !
Food/coffee was good, price reasonable for Dubrovnik !
Good food and ambiance. Service could be better . It was a chilly evening but we sat inside with provided blankets and loved the evening .
Beautiful view and good food. Most of us took pasta and the menu says it's "hot starters". The size was big enough for a full meal however. Gnocchi was very tasty but a bit small in size.
I really liked the service. Very nice view and the food came out quickly. Nice lunch and dinner! If you are in old town you should deffinetly try this place :)

This was one of the best pizzas we have had anywhere. The mussels were also excellent. Our drinks took some time to arrive and when they did they were on the house. When we are in Dubrovnik next we will be back.

Just outside the old town walls and at the transport hub, we suspected we might be heading into a tourist trap. No fears, the outside patio provided an excellent introduction to Dubrovnik, with views of the harbour, the city walls, the sea and Fort Lovrijenac (Game of Thrones Castle). The food, if slightly expensive (conditioned by a discount card), was pretty enjoyable - simple seafood and salads.

On arrival in Dubrovnik this is the first restaurant we came across, ideally located in a prime position just outside the old city main entrance and with great views. We were greeted by the very friendly staff and given a table on the edge overlooking the water and city walls. We were promptly served our lunch which was fantastic and we enjoyed it so much we decided to book a table for our second night for dinner. This didn't dissapointed either, the food was excellent and the service from the staff very friendly and attentive. We kept an open mind about where else to eat for our last two nights but ended up coming back again for dinner for the rest of our stay and lunch again one day too. We also ate at their other restaurant The Panorama at the top of the cable car which was also excellent. We were provided with a 10% discount card after our first visit which can be used for life and given a complimentary dessert one evening for dinner and drinks another. This restaurant serves good no nonsense food, served by very friendly staff and at a reasonable price and was always busy and atmospheric including live music in the evenings. Another much more expensive restaurant next door always seemed empty by comparison.
Thank you at all at Dubravka, look forward to seeing you all again when we return, highly recommended.

The view is definitely what attracts people to this restaurant. Didn't book in advance however managed to get a table around the edge of the restaurant with good views. Not a great selection of starters so we only had the tomato soup which was good. We then had beef steak and the lamb for mains, and ordered fries also which were not needed as meals big enough. Beef steak was lovely however lamb wasn't as nice.
Staff were attentive. Wine was good quality. Was let down by the food that, whilst it was good, was overpriced for what it was.
i went there for a drink and the view is incredible. i tried the goatcheese salad but it wasnt very good. Still I would recommend going there for the great view

We have just returned from beautiful Dubrovnic and we chose to eat here twice.on both occasions the service was excellent and the food was of a good standard. First time I had the local beef steak Dalmatian style and on the next visit I had the seafood risotto ( delicious) . Local house wine ( white and red ) are excellent and both meals we had were very good value. I would recommend this restaurant to my friends .forgot to mention the fantastic location .

Ate at this restaurant twice during our stay. Friendly staff, good food and lovely setting. Dubrovnik is expensive for eating out, but this place is fairly reasonable price wise. I had a problem with one of my dishes, and they took the cost off my bill without any problem. Would definitely recommend this restaurant.

Spectacular view of city walls. Located just outside the west gate. Managed to accomodate our group at short notice and gave us excellent service. Food had good portions and accepted a 10% discount as had a voucher fron their other restaurant at the top of the cable car.

My wife and i used to always like visiting for dinner here on our visits to Dubrovnik,but this was not a great experience for my wife .
Okay i had the Pork cutlets in Gorgonzola sauce and i enjoyed it,but for my poor wife she ordered the beef Granulated steak in a Mushroom sauce,strange that she was not asked how she wanted the steak cooked.However the food arrives only to find out that it was rare,she asked for it to be returned and done to medium,after some discussions with the waiter who said that`s the only way it could be cooked under the grill ?? if so let the customer know that on the menu.Anyway he took it away and said they would cook a fresh one for her. I think they must have forgot to talk to the chef because another arrived cooked the exact way,by that time i had finished mine and she was put off waiting any longer and declined their third attempt to put things right.I paid for mine and we left.Toni`s 5 cheese Lasagne saved the day.
we sat to take a drink and was very nice. The dark beer was delicious so much. A good tip is to go in late afternoon and enjoy the view of the old town, sea and the Sunset. Excellent reception.

Beautiful view to the bay and walls of old city of Dubrovnik. Good food for reasonable price. We ate Fish, Risotto and steak. You don't feel overstuffed if you plan to eat here and then visit the old city. Portions are good sized and quality is good.

We had our wedding dinner here. Food was great , I'd particularly recommend desert. The atmosphere is fantastic and you're eating with great views of the cliffs. Staff were very attentive and professional. We also came here for breakfast the next morning. Breakfast was a bit pricey compared with alternatives but was satisfactory.
This restaurant offers both indoor and outdoor seating the food is very well priced and to a very high standard, great staff well with a visit.
Had a lovely relaxed 2 hour lunch here. No pressure to move. Lovely situation just outside Pile Gate Reasonable prices. Huge Pizza

For us this was really a good choice ! Dubravka Special Prawns + Finger Bowl + Bib

Waiter First evening was Jasmin Brkovic - 2nd Visit Waiter Mirko Lesjak - Excellent 

Their Over Manager both Evenings was SINGRIGAR not sure of the spelling as he doesn't wear a name-tag ! Charming Genuine Knowledgeable Staff and Service

OK Not Cheap but you may only visit Dubrovnik once - would have visited Cable Car Bar Panorama but no available time when up there .....plus "Vertigo " problem.

We had lunch here...the food was nice but not very hot. My sparkling wine arrived with a fly in it. Waiter was not very friendly. Lovely venue in good place but not worth the money we paid.Also no child menu!!

We ate twice here and would have made it three if I hadn't double booked for last night in the city. Staff very friendly and efficient. Food very good for the price and nice portions. They gladly split pasta portion on request to share for starter. We had lasagne, mussels, mixed seafood tagliatelle, veal fillet, john dory, creme caramel during our visits and all were delicious. After first visit they provide 10% discount card for future visits (unlimited). The whole experience was a pleasure. Good wine choice too with well priced prosecco and nice local reds and whites. Themed coffees too! Yum!

We agonised about the choice of restaurant for our final night of a short stay in Dubrovnik. We had settled on one, albeit hesitantly. On the walk into town, we passed this place and on a whim we went in. What a find. The biggest and best pizzas we had ever eaten - anywhere - and superb service. Live music ànd unrivalled views of the Pile gate, with prices less than lesser restaurants inside the wall. To finish, a complementary schnapps. All in, I with a large beer and generous glass of house red, came in at less than 250kuna for 2. Thoroughly recommend.ed.
We enjoyed a nice lunch and a great cup of coffee here, on a nice day it is really enjoyable to sit and look out at the water and relax.

This is a well located restaurant just outside the walls overlooking the water and part of the wall.

The service was superb, good choice on the menu however the taste wasn't superb but good. After a long day exploring it goes down well.
The food and service here were good with huge portions but nothing special so it is definitely the location for which you are paying. There was pleasant live music to enjoy.

My wife and I visited the Dubravka restaurant for lunch while on a day trip to Dubrovnik old town and we were blown away with the service which I shall give you an example of later. Let's start with why we visited.

The restaurant is perfectly situated just outside the city walls. We had a very nice table outside with views to the sea.

The food is reasonably priced and excellent. We had a three course lunch and couldn't fault it.

What made this restaurant stand out was the service, the waiters were very attentive. It was around 2.30pm when we arrived and the sky was overcast. The staff began to bring out heat lamps for all the diners and each one was offered a red rug if they were cold, it was about 19 degrees, my wife and I had shorts on and t-shirts!!! That one thing really impressed me. At the end of our meal when I asked for the cheque I was told that they had not charged us for dessert and gave us a voucher for 10% off on our next return.

Would I go back.... Oh yes.

Visited here for afternoon drinks. Really nice setting with great sea view. Waiters were very attentive. Had a litre of local red wine for £15 equivalent, was very good value for money. Didn't eat hear so can't comment. Would recommend.

I selected the mussels Dalmatian style "Bouzzare" and was disappointed. It look good but as mussels are harvested locally I was expecting more than very small mussels inside. My wife had the turkey steak with pasta which was rated very good.

The views of the old town and fortress are outstanding, so this means many tourists use the restaurant to take pictures with lots of loud talking. Inside would have been better, but then no decent views.

We had good service at this restaurant and were able to enjoy beautiful views and delicious food and wine. We tried both red and white Croatia wines as recommended by our waiter and liked them both. The seafood was delicious too. This is an expensive place but you are getting what you pay for.

Very good pizza, reasonable prices. They serve a cheesecake to die for. What is really great about this place though is that the servers are extremely welcoming, funny and professional, which unfortunately isn't often the case in Croatia (from my experience). Great view, great staff, good prices and nice food.
Really good food with great choice, excellent value for money and excellent service, i first came here 3 years ago and was pleased to find it was still as good as I remembered, couldn't fault it.
This restaurant has a good ambiance for relaxing after touring the area. They serve delicious seafood and it also have free wifi.

Had dinner on the terrace here after a day in Dubrovnik. Great food. Efficient service including complimentary blanket and outdoor heaters to keep the chill off on an October evening. Shame dinner was cut short by the arrival of a lightening storm. Would recommend to couples and families

Place is in very vivid location on Pile gates. I was there with my business partner who wanted to meet local cusene from sea. We had 4 coureses lunch where he got very clear picture what we eat over here. We had octopuss slad, seafood red risoto, and monkfish final...
Everything was in perfect timig, friendly staff a well made.

We have been on holiday in Dubrovnik old town for the past week and have used this restaurant 5 times! We came on the first night just for a few drinks and we're given complimentary drinks. The cocktails are amazing in particular the Soberto!! We came back the next day we were recognised and Jasmin the server brought our drinks over.. he also gave us 10% for loyalty which really put a smile on our face. Everytime we entered the restaurant everyone was welcoming and said you're back! Lovely place, beautiful food but it really was the service that made this restaurant stand out for us! We will be back on our next visit! Thank you Jasmin, Mario and the rest!

This restaurant is located at the entrance of the old town. The ambience is good and there are great views of the sea. The menu has a wide choice of seafood. The food and wine were quite good but not exceptional. Prices are reasonable considering the location. Overall, a pleasant experience

This was recommended by our host. We arrived without a reservation and was duly seated in their courtyard with panoramic view of the ocean. There was heating throughout and blankets were provided should you require. Hubby ordered a Fried Calamari and I opted for Sea Bass. The serving was quite big and comes with a salad and fries with the calamari and vegetables and potatoes with the fish. Both tasted good. The waiter was very knowledgeable on local wines and recommended a good wine to match our dishes. Complimentary appetisers and pear liquors were served which was a nice touch. If we had a Dubrovnik Card, we could have 10%discount off our bill. We were given a a discount voucher for the Panorama Cafe by the cable car. All in all, a very pleasant introduction to Dubronik's dining scene. Would recommend it.
Great place, we went to Protos first and got ripped off. This this was great! Great food and nice wait staff

The menu is standard costs with standard taste. But panorama and ambiance is perfect. We had just ate fried calamari. It was standar too. But don't forget, the costs are %10 cheaper with Dubrovnik Card.
The price wasn't too bad considering this is the entrance of tourist area (old town). I had the seafood pasta and it was very delicious. Service was friendly and the waiter was quite caring as well.

Food was 'OK' only as a touristic place. The service is great and luxurious. 
Location is beautiful out side the walls of dubrovnik and next to the sea.
The food is good, but nothing to write home about. The view is spectacular. Go for the pizza and the risotto

We dropped by as didn't kind of know where to have dinner. Service was super! Accidentally our meals where missplaced, and we had to wait a bit longer (not long), but nice drinks, extra glass of redwine and desserts with coffee was on the house!

We had a late lunch here on our last day in Dubrovnik and thought we would sit and enjoy the beautiful scenery one last time - this place has gorgeous views! The food was good (we just had pizza and pasta) and plentiful but the service was very average. There seems to be so many staff yet everything takes twice the time!

We ate here twice during our stay the food was that good. This was our first food stop in this city after arriving late. We were extremely surprised but the beautiful views and great quality food.

Having been here a few days we decidedto revisit for lunch on our final day.

The pasta was delightful and the service efficient. I have no hesitation in recommending this venue

The host (Ivan) at Villa Ankora suggested we try this restaurant just outside the Pile Gate entrance to Old Town. What a wonderful suggestion.

We sat where we could see both the Pile Gate and the ocean leading out to Fort Bokar and Fort Lovrijenac. As the evening progressed, the ambience became more romantic as the lighting changed (both ambient and transmitted) and the recorded music became live with a duet of a keyboardist and a cellist who played popular Western music in a jazzy uptempo.

My seafood salad was the BEST I have ever had with every bite including lots of octopus, capers, onions and other seafood morsels in a delightful dressing. I should have ordered two!

We also had lasagna bolognese (amazing flavour and texture) and tagliatelle with seafood (I could've sworn I was in pasta heaven!). The first and subsequent tastes were so fantastic, we both forgot to sprinkle freshly grated Parmesan onto our dinners. There was NO room for dessert.

Did I mention the bread? Wow! We WILL return!
Good food but flies were a nuisance. Found this restaurant by chance and spent a good few hours enjoying the view and the food.
Can't beat the view on a nice afternooon or sunset! Lunch was just average and service was not so great.
Very generous - gave free cake for wife's birthday. Lovely place and view for rainy day. Went for breakfast, variously Different types of breakfast. Good coffee.

Great food,ambience and location ,unfortunately the service is terrible.There was so many waiters but still they have forget to bring our drink,move our plates after dinner because they were so busy countig they tips and discusing which guests leave a better one
I recommend this place mainly because of its location next to the old town and the magnificent view of the sea.
Good food, great view. We came back here 2 times. Nice breakfast. For dinner red beef. Too red... quiet music.

My wife and I had a seat by the terrace wall with an excellent view of the old city wall and the ocean. The service was great the wine pairing excellent and the food delicious! We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves!

Great location just outside the Pile Gate. Ate here for lunch and dinner. Delicious food including grilled squid and lamb. Penne arrabiata was very tasty. The gourmet pizza was so good I had it twice (normally don't eat much pizza!). Delicious house white wine. Friendly helpful staff. Live music. What more could you want?!

Sister restaurant to the Panorama at the top of the cable car and equally excellent.
Service was above and beyond the call of duty!
Started with seafood tagliatelle followed by pork in gorganzola sauce. Both excellent.
Finished with a vodka laced lemon sorbet that was VERY good. The staff even made an alcohol free one for one of our party who couldn't drink.

We wouldn't normally go for a restaurant that is located in such a prominent tourist spot, but our accommodation host recommend this place, and we had Dubrovnik cards that entitled us for a 10% discount. 

We enquired earlier in the day (Friday) if we could make a reservation, and were told by staff that wouldn't be necessary. So, we returned just before 7.00pm - waiting staff came and said they'd have to check if they had room for us (it seems they DO take reservations!) but we were soon seated. We didn't get a seat right by the sea wall, but this didn't bother us. 

The menu is quite big, lots of options, but they are broken down into sub-sections (ie pizza, seafood, etc). I selected beef carpaccio starter and lamb fillet main in chanterelle mushroom sauce, which I enjoyed and were tasty, however, my husband selected the marinated salmon starter, and mussels main and thought they were both average. (I don't know if this was due to my selections being slightly more expensive) The portion of mussels was generous, but the mussels themselves were small. We also shared a "Dubravka cake" for dessert which was nice.

There were plenty of staff, as the place was busy, and we didn't have to wait too long for any of the courses. If we hadn't had the 10% discount, we probably wouldn't have visited here, and we wouldn't rush back if we return to Dubrovnik.

We were told this was a must visit when in the old city. Situated outside one of the gates it's in a great location. The restaurant was very busy so I was expecting the food to be very good. My husband had pasta and said it was good. I had chicken which came with what seemed to be frozen wedges. The portion was very big almost off putting. I couldn't eat a lot and the waiter asked was everything ok I said yes just very big thanks to which he turned and spoke to a waitress in Croatian and they laughed loudly. I find this rude. Especially when your a paying customer. I left the restaurant
Feeling uneasy did something happen the food before it left the kitchen. Wouldn't recommend. Rude staff
We came twice for breakfast. The menu are really good and generous, and served quickly. The bartenders are nice and welcoming. The place is beautiful and peaceful

When in Dubrovnik, you more or less have to have at least one meal at Dubravka on the patio, facing the water. Typically though, these places would be your typical tourist trap of bad food and high prices. Although not perfect, Dubravka delivers

What I liked: The outdoor seating, the view, the relatively typical Dalmatian menu, featuring fairly decent seafood options. Quick and efficient service. For a place that busy, food quality was above average while prices remained reasonable.

What to watch for/could be improved: This is a very busy place and as great as the setting is, I would not say that this is a "relaxing" place, especially during the busiest part of tourist season.

All in, recommended

It's the cafe situated near the pile gate square outside the old town in dubrovnik. One of the most visited restaurants.
You can enjoy an amazing view of the adriatic sea and the old town wall while eating tasty food in a perfect location near the old town.

Initially we were put off by all the crowds around the Old Town Bus Stop areas(Public & Tour) when we first visited the Old Town area. However we went back after 7:00pm and had an excellent dinner at the Dubravka. Menu is varied with a variety of local specialties and some standard items for the less adventuresome. Service well excellent, very efficient and low key. Food was well prepared using fresh ingredients. All in all a very good value for the price.

We were looking for a simple lunch in Dubrovnik and hoped to enjoy a nice view away from the throngs of tourists. We ended up at Dubravka 1836 based on many trip advisor reviews and are glad that we did. Lunch was relaxing, delicious and we were seated at the restaurant perimeter overlooking the water and city wall. Just as we finished our expresso, the waiter arrived with a surprise lemon sorbet and prosecco dessert. Lovely end to a lovely lunch.

This is a great restaurant and we visited twice during our weeks stay. The pizzas are delicious and service is good. They will give you a 10% voucher with your bill in case you want to visit again. 

The coffee is some of the best we had in the city, worth a stop just for the coffee. The views in the evening are nice right by a little bay and just outside the city walls and main pike gate into the old town, the walls are uplit at night and the atmosphere is always good in the evening. Worth booking a table in high season to ensure you get a table or in less busy months, to ensure you get a good table by the bay. 

It was busy every night we passed it and we were able to get a table without a booking in late September but not near the bay side of the seating. Anywhere outside is nice though.

Cannot praise this restaurant!! Brilliant - fabulous setting, the most polite staff I think I've ever met - look out for Mrko, Borna, Ivana in fact, all of them - where nothing is too much trouble, literally. Evenings started to cool down so blankets were available should you need them, outdoor heaters were efficient and plentiful. Service was how you wanted it, fast if you were in a hurry - we weren't! - slow if you wanted a lazy experience. We used it frequently for lunch and dinner and there was no difference in the quality or service. It was so good we only tried one other restaurant in town - boring, I know but, when you try it, you'll understand why!!
Just a few metres form the Old Town, in a lovely setting overlooking the walls and sea. Good portion pasta dishes. Well priced and friendly staff.

Here is one of the best restaurant experiences that I have ever had. I went here several times during my fortnight long stay in Dubrovnik, mostly for lunches, and each time was special. This restaurant has arguably one of the best sights; you can watch the ocean right from your table. The food is awesome and consistent. I was recommended to try the fish from the Croatian cuisine… and it was delectable. My personal favourite was the salmon cooked in dill sauce. I loved their pasta too; it was just too good. I could go on and on about the various dishes and beverages that I enjoyed, however I would rather leave by just saying that this is one place you shouldn’t miss if you are in Dubrovnik… and yes, its value for money.

We enjoyed a pleasant lunch here at a table overlooking the water. Quite lovely. The grilled squid was superb as was the risotto with seafood. Prices were reasonable and service was good Well worth a visit.

Dubravka is nestled just outside the western Pile gate and extends over a large terrace that overlooks the Dubravka is nestled just outside the western gate and extends over a large terrace that overlooks the Kolorina, or Blackwater, bay, the city walls and overlooking the Lovrijenac fortress. It has a variety of menus for breakfast, lunch and dinner and has a large ice-cream outlet at its front. Sitting at one of the tables, in the sun, taking your time over one of the breakfast menu choices is a great way to start the day, whether you are travelling inside the city or further afield. The price and service are very reasonable considering the location. The ice-creams are considerably cheaper, just as varied and Dubravka isn’t as swamped by the hordes as parlours inside the city walls.
We had a lovely time there for lunch. We we placed right in the front with a wonderful view. It is expensive but the food was good and I will recommend it.

Service was a little slow loads of busy people running around, the place was packed after all. 
Situated just outside the city walls the terrace is lovely, well worth the price. The food that we ordered was lovely, my only complaint was they need to say or ask if you want anything else to go with it.

This place, just outside the city walls, is a nice location for an evening dinner while watching the sun set over the sea and behind the city walls. The food was good and service swift. Our waiter checked in frequently to see if everything was alright without coming across as pushy, also offering to fillet the fish I ordered at the table and he did a great job at that, hardly leaving any bones.

First night in Dubrovnik and the restaurant was recommended by our hosts. The place was quite full and the location was excellent, by the city walls, the water and overlooking the fortress. Looked very touristy and the menu reflected that. The waiter was very good, Asked him to decant our red wine. He searched for one and brought it to the table. The Dalmation style steak I had was cooked as I wanted it and the whole trout grilled, deboned at the table that my wife had was excellent. Overall a great start to our visit.

Having delicious dishes at this romantic restaurant beside Dubrovnik Castle was an unforgettable dining experience. The restaurant was just seated beside Walls of Dubrovnik, so we could enjoy a great castle and sea view accompanied by moonlight while dining. Their beef steak was perfectly cooked and tender, and their staff was really friendly and humorous, having fun with us guests while serving. The restaurant was divided into indoor and outdoor area, so reservation might be required to have a seat in outdoor dining area. All in all, their food, environment, and service are all stunning and satisfactory, and it must be my first choice next time I visit Dubrovnik.

Ate here the first night of our holiday. Service was quite slow but all the staff were friendly. Lots of choice on the menu. Can absolutely recommend the seafood risotto, delicious and perfectly cooked. Great little spot to watch the sunset & they even provided blankets for later in the evening once it got chilly for those sat outside.
Beautiful views, beautiful food and beautiful service. A really perfect place to come for a special lunch.

Greeted by the friendly smiling face I knew this was a place for us. Best service we have had in all of Europe this trip. The food was excellent, not fussy, but prepared fresh and bright. We had salads and the mixed seafood that included wonderful veggies that were cooked perfectly as was all the seafood. The ambiance of the view was made perfect with relaxing live music. We left in a better mood than when we walked in.

Lovely relaxing restaurant just outside the city walls. Beautiful views and good food, what more cam you ask for. 
Definitely worth a visit.

Visited here with friends so a table for 8 was needed although they would not take a reservation due to the weather, (outside terrace) they did accomadate us once we arrived, and we was not dissappointed. The service was very good our waiter answered any of our questions regarding the menu, he recommended dishes and wine for some of our party, my meal was a shrimp salad starter and chicken with a mushroom sauce penne pasta both dishes I would recommend. Our meal was not rushed our waiter suggested a time out between starter and main because the portions were large, we took his advice and he knew exactly when to serve the main meal, we declined dessert, but we were brought over free of charge a light lemon sorbet with vodka inside it was one of the most lovely dessert/drinks I had tasted, it was extremely light and pallet cleansing which you drank through a straw. One of our party did not drink alcohol and they made them one without the vodka, which I thought was very observant and kind. The restaurant is situated on the edge of the old town it's terrace looks out accros the sea to the old town wall to your left and a fort to you right it is very picturesque, beautiful surroundings, good food and wine, Kir Royle priced extremely well, waiters were very attentive and informative, a must place to visit.

Airport bus lets you out at this cafe, and after a tiring travel it is charming place to sit and watch the City Walls. The beer's price was the same as anywhere else in the city. The coffee was OK. The waiters were super friendly.

Excellent food, atmosphere and view.
Mirko, our waiter, made it an INDELIBLE experience....a true professional !

We had only just arrived in Dubrovnik and we're waiting for our apartment to be ready. Decided to pop in here for a quick lunch. Firstly it wasn't quick, secondly the food was average. The octopus salad was fine, well seasoned. The Caesar salad was v poor - over dressed limp rocket leaves and too much Parmesan.

My husband and I visited on his birthday for desserts and drinks and we immediately regretted having gone for dinner somewhere else. Dubravka is wonderful - polite, attentive staff, amazing and very generous ice cream desserts, great prosecco cocktails. And the views! Beautiful. Music playing in the background was a lovely addition to the great experience. We will definitely return next time we are in Dubrovnik!
Had a good meal here tonight. Food was great. Wine was very nice and service very good. Great location as well. Would definitely recommend.

Food was very good, we had the Lamb dish and the prawn dish. 
Personell is very correct and descent. 
Try to get a table at the edge of the terras, view is excellent. 
Would recommend
Overall, the food was overpriced and underwhelming. I got a pizza that was just gross (I didn't order well, but still it was nasty). Wine was good, service was good, and the view is amazing.

At first glance this restaurant can appear rather "touristy" based on its location and menu however my Mother and I had two meals here and loved it both times. First and foremost my Mom and I found the location to be among its most appealing assets - the restaurant is located just outside the city walls and allows you the opportunity to enjoy beautiful views of the old city without having to brave the crowds of actually getting into the old city. Additionally the tables are nice and spread out and almost everywhere in the restaurant offers you great views of the city walls. We also really enjoyed the food here and had great meals!

We had dinner here for five nights whilst on holiday in Dubrovnik. Food is absolutely fantastic, brilliant service in a very busy restaurant. It is located to the entrance to the city walls with fantastic views of the Adriatic and city walls. Will definitely return if I go back to Dubrovnik

This is a lovely restaurant with a great choice of food and perfect setting.
I had the truffle ravioli which was really good, hot and tasty. The pizzas looked and smelt Divine and I managed to get a taste of my daughters - delicious.
The prices are good considering the location and quality of food and the local wines are well worth trying.
I recommend booking this restaurant and request a table with a view.

It is right next to the entrance of the old town. View of the adriatic sea and walls was amazing. Service was very good- nice, friendly staff! Food was good and well priced! We had vegetable risotto which was yummy! A really good experience!

Very tasteful Sea food, wine, deserts were served in front of a fantastic view of city walls. We were also lucky for having a fullmoon which made the view unforgetable. The music was also great. I want to send special Thanks to jasmin from The Staff. He was very helpful and friendly to us.

My husband and I stopped in after a long day on a tour for dinner. We were seated straight away. Service was great, waiter was friendly and efficient. I had the ravioli, which was amazing and my husband had the chicken pasta which he said was very good. There was live music, and amazing atmosphere. Would definitely recommend a visit!

Just got off the shuttle bus from the airport and stopped here for some lunch. Waitress very kindly took our suitcases and put them inside. Very good service and a great view - right by the old town walls and the sea. Really tasty food but very expensive! Having just arrived, we weren't prepared for old town prices! Would recommend though, great buzz about the place :)

No reservation, but very accommodating. Friendly service. Enjoyable atmosphere with live jazz music. Our vacation ended on a high note.

Octopus salad: good presentation; well season and delicious; 5 star.

Mussels: good presentation; delicious, good portion size. 5 star.

Grilled Prawns: good presentation, delicious, perfectly cooked, fair portion size. 4 star.

Good price.

Highly recommended: 4.5 stars out of 5.
Delicious food. Great service. Terrace overlooks the west harbour and Fort Lovrijenac - superb place to have dinner and watch the sun go down. Mid price.
Amazing food and a really affordable price. The views from the restaurant are amazing. Staff and extremelly friendly and helpful. Nothing is too much trouble. Highly recommended .
Great location and lovely staff. Food is good value for money. Nothing spectacularly different on the menu but cooked better with better flavours and ingredients than many other places
Expected tourist trap but we're pleasantly surprised. We had great lunch, drinks and service. Even if we had not, would be worth it for the view and convenient location outside the main pile gate.

We didn't do the GoT walking tour but felt we didn't need to just sitting here at this great spot. Enjoying the same views as the upmarket partner restaurant, this was great for light lunches and drinks.

Just returned from an evening meal at Dubravka and it was fabulous! 

We pre-booked by emailing asking for a table by the water edge on the terrace - well worth planning ahead! 

Only downside of the whole evening was that it rained meaning some neighbouring diners had to be moved to avoid getting wet - the waiters dealt with this very well and made sure everyone still enjoyed their evening.

The live music was great - we particularly liked the game of thrones theme tune! 

The food was great - we had the seafood risotto starter as a main - it was a very generous portion that we didn't finish! We also had the the feta salad which was very creamy and well prepared. 

Though the rain didn't spoil our evening at all - The waiter took 30% off the bill. We followed this with a large tip which was throughly deserved. 

We're hoping to back back at least once before we leave Dubrovnik. 

You must check this restaurant out!

Very obliging staff especially understanding regarding gluten free had gf bread for my wife. The service was extremely good as was the food with great views. In a bit of a tourist congregation area but when in the restaurant you can let it all pass you by. Highly recommend

We returned 3 times to this restaurant during our time in Dubrovnic .We were impressed by the friendly service, the wonderful location and the reasonably priced food.
Various Pizzas were delicious and we enjoyed the octopus salad and the beers.
The ice cream bar attendant was extremely rude. I bought a juice and was drinking it in front of the shop when he asked me to get going. Outrageous.

Decided to call at the Dubravka for our evening meal and were well received by the staff. I had the marinated beef fillet which was delicious and my wife had the salmon which was also good. The house red wine was very good and for a litre excellent value. The service and staff were first class. We will be back.

Ate here on our last night in Dubrovnik and weren't disappointed. The restaurant was very full having not booked but within minutes we had a table for four. The service was outstanding and food to match. Two of us had tuna perfectly cooked to our liking and pizza for the girls who said they were lovely. A stunning view onto the city walls lit up at night is a sight to see! A must visit!

Being situated on the cliff overlooking the old city walls and the ocean you have to expect this restaurant to be a bit pricy, but if you are willing to pay for it the view is amazing, the service is of good standard and the meal sizes are very reasonable.
Great cocktail list, and healthier menu choices then what you usually find throughout Croatia. There can be a wait for a table to go early or late and request something along the edge.

After visiting the old town we stopped to eat something. The restaurant Dubravka is located near the main gate, very handful. Everything we ate was delicious and we enjoyed the view of the beautiful city walls as well as the fort Lovrijenac in front of us. The prices are normal.
