Last day in Dubrovnik so we came in early and had breakfast here. Great coffee and omelettes. View is good too. Staff very attentive and service prompt.

Went here with a large group of friends with no BookIng and managed to get a table very quickly. Such a beautiful dinner and environment! affordable prices for such great food. Would definitely recommend!

You can be easily overwhelmed when trying to pick out a restaurant in Dubrovnik, but Dubravka has an authentic feel and comes well recommended.

The food was lovely - simple but tasty and not overpriced. We enjoyed fresh fish, lovely wine and homemade walnut cake.

The restaurant terrace looks out over the old town wall and fort, which are architecturally lit at night providing awesome views.

My only minor criticisms would be that the menu has photographs of the dishes (which generally speaking can put me off), and the food service was a little too quick for the romantic style of our evening.

Staff were very friendly. Would recommend booking a day or two ahead in high season to ensure a table along the wall in order to make the most of it's winning location.
Good food at a reasonable price. Had both dinner and breakfast here. Managed to get a table with a view both times
Lovely restaurant with cosy blankets and heaters at night to keep the chills away. Late night pizza and wine very romatic

This a testament to Roberto our waiter, who was just fantastic! Entertaining and attentive, he was part of an enjoyable meal at this restaurant. We didn't have a reservation at all but were shown straight to a great table and all 4 of us enjoyed our meals. We'll be back!
Dubravka 1836 is a nice restaurant just near the main gate of the Old town. It has a good variety of food and a great service. We tried the Tuna salad and the pizza Bianca both were good

We had lunch here on our last day in Dubrovnik, and do not regret it.

Lovely view of "blackwater bay" (Game of Thrones), perfect sipping wine.

We got the mussels and seafood risotto, all very tasty and at a reasonable price for Dubrovnik !!
I came here with my fiance. Our waiter was grumpy and not helpful at all with the questions we asked him. My mussels were good but my partner didn't enjoy her risotto.

We went for breakfast and the view is amazing! Cheap as well, we were gonna go to restaurant nautika for thr view but we changed our mind since its the exact same view but 90% cheaper! Highly recommended...
Best service...good food...enjoy great sea and city walls view... place for coffe..lunch and dinner..throughout whole day!! 😊🍴🍷

The service here was very quick but not overbearing .It was a welcome relief from the hustle and bustle of Dubrovink Old Town ( being just outside Pile Gate ) 
The tables were not too close togethere there like restaurants inside the old town, so it felt really relaxed .
The views are spectacular but most of all the food is worth waiting for if you have to wait for a table .
We booked ahead via our hotel and had a dream of a table. 
The Gnocchhi was amazing for a starter. 
If you go book a table in the second row , you have brill views but are not to close to the edge nor the pigeons !
Don't book the table on the far right , that is a table for two as after the restaurant ends there's a general area and loads of tourists appears to take their selfie shot and we observed that groups of selfie takers were getting close to the people sitting at this table. 
Also note the prawn risotto on the starter is a bit prawn limited , so you may want to consider another option . Finally the house Croatian wine ( white) is really good in case you feel like a glass or two !

Overall a great restaurant just outside Pile Gate .
Really enjoyed it .

Happy holidays 
Carol Watt

Veryy good! Price is a little more than medium range but it is situated just on the entrance of old city, and it is more than ok for dinner...we eaten at four place in Dubrovnik and that is on second place, food is fresh and nice present

This is one of the best places I've been in Dubrovnik because of good quality. Prices are maybe a bit too high, but it was so good. I was served by a waiter called Borna and he was so kind,maybe too much kind,that is the only thing that actually bothered me,everything would be okay if he didn't talk to me all the time in some strange way.. I can say without hasitation that was flirting! Maybe too much.. But everything else just overshadowed it.
Lovely restaurant with excellent food and service. We were served a lovely drink at the end of our meal called Sorbetto, it was divine and complimentary , a must when visiting Dubrovnik
Really nice view and really nice food for breakfast,lunch and dinner. Very friendly personal. My first lunch in dubrovnik was here-that is when I felt that my vacation started.

During a week long stay in Dubrovnik I think we visited this restaurant 4 times!

The food is outstanding, clean, fresh, tasty and the views are also outstanding! 

It is very reasonably priced and the staff are very lovely. One night my friend and I were both given cheesecake on the house which was a very nice touch!

By far the best restaurant in the city and I wish there was one in my home city!

Sweet little spot - great service and an excellent spot to watch the passing traffic without being caught in the hustle and bustle of the tourists. We enjoyed our brunch before heading inside the city walls to explore.
This restaurant overlooks the city walls and a fort. It is large and spacious with plenty of tables. The food and service is excellent. We went twice during our holiday.
We were there for drinks in a super hot summer afternoon. Service was quick and very nice, with a wonderful view. Try the chocolate walnut Cake, you will love it. Standard Dubrovnik (high) prices.
Amazing food and brilliant staff. Best food in dubrovnic. Had dinner here at night time. Wit my girlfriend, Could not fault and it is lovely setting beside town walls.

Where to start, restaurant had a good variety of food and price was more on the expensive side so expected it to be good. Service was good at the start, we ordered a spaghetti bolognese and penne pasta. The bolognese was very bland and the penne pasta wasn't cooked and almost raw it was that hard. Finally asked for the bill and it took them 15 minutes after asking 3 separate times for the bill. Would not go back

We spent two evenings dining at Dubravka and were thoroughly impressed. Delicious food and fantastic service. Our waiter Branco was very attentive and gave us discount vouchers for future visits. The setting is fantastic in the evening and the live band added a nice touch. Well worth a visit.
Coffee is ok but overpriced. I'd come here if you care most about the view. Super busy and touristy.

Great view,quick service,nice waiters,excellent food...def worth a visit !!

Its a bit medium pricey but anyway dubrovnik is pricey
It all depends on how much you want to have..

Highly recommend "grilled mushrooms"

Located hust next the old towns walls. Nice view, good tastes, perfect place for having even a cup of coffee, beer, cocktail, dinner... Low prices and lot's off people waiting.. mind you there are 2 ways in. One on the front on the square and the other behind the old towns gate :-).. so be clever :-)

My friends and I came here for dinner after discovering it at the Pile gate entrance to Dubrovnik old town, and we enjoyed a good meal! 
The restaurant was packed busy, so we unfortunately missed out on a table towards the front of the restaurant overlooking the sea, but we still had a great table.
Our waiter provided us great service and was very friendly. I had 'Ravioli with Black Truffles and Smoked Ham' for my starter and Sea Bass for my main, which came with boiled vegetables. The sea bass was pretty average and the veg that came with it was unfortunately cold, so I was disappointed with this. However, the ravioli I had to start was absolutely beautiful, and I would definitely recommend it! 
Overall, our experience was good, just not amazing. Still, if you want a restaurant with good choice on the menu and a busy atmosphere, I'd recommend Dubravka! I'll be back for the ravioli!
Right next to Pile Gate entrance so it's busy area and somewhat touristy. But good spot for breakfast with a number of options. We had omelette with fruits, coffee, juice.

Excellent food and staff,especially Anita.The view is amazing.We have no objections.
We will for sure comeback.

Food was average , service was OK. The best part of the meal was the view. We did not order a starter and ordered two mains instead. We ordered chips with our main course but they decided to give us the chips as a starter, perhaps because they had cooked spare and did not want them to go to waste.

Because of location this place makes the restaurant one of the best, we went for drinks and I had a desert as well, I founded quite average the place, to crowded, staff was polite but not well coordinated, there was a hostess who walk us to table where actually somebody else was seated in front of us by some other member of staff...

I did not feel the meal was worth what we paid, and really you're just paying for the view, which was a disappointment. The cheese plate was pretty lame, with crackers and walnuts kind of like what you might buy at a grocer or airport snack stand, and the "prawns" in my fettuccine were tiny salad shrimp. That said, the view was nice and the wait staff very welcoming. Too bad they can't offer cuisine to match.

This is a touristic restaurant that offer quick service, nice staff, outstanding location and great food. Pizza, risotto and chicken fillet were just great. Portion were quite lqrge too. Sword fish carpaccio slightly too much dressing. Desserts just great. Overall the 5 of us enjoyed. It all ended up at a very reasonable price. Note you can also get in a cosy romantic part of the terrace.

The view is great but the food is poor. We ordered arugula salad with tomatoes which is hard to mess up, and it came with a white sauce and dried tomatoes. We also ordered a steak and lamb and both didn't taste good and were overpriced. Pizza would have been better.
We stopped in for breakfast before a walking tour and before the real crowds descended into the city. Perfect view with a friendly Croatian welcome.
Great location and lovely to eat outside in this very busy restaurant but the food was disappointing compared to other restaurants we visited in Dubrovnik

Food was very enjoyable and service was excellent. Wide range of choices with regards to food also. 

Very atmospheric restaurant with live classical music and beautiful views of the Dubrovnik city walls and the sea. 

Moderately priced, excellent value for money in my opinion. Drinks were expensive.

Would eat here again without hesitation.

Scenic spot looking back at the City walls and out over Fort Lovrijenac with the Adriatic as a backdrop. The staff were courteous and if you have to wait a few minutes they offered complimentary wine or soft drinks...nice touch. The food was better quality than I had thought might be served in a very touristy spot and the prices were reasonable considering where you are sitting. Worth a visit. Also a little live music in the background...not intrusive but a nice touch.

This restaurant is just outside the old town walls next to Pile Gate. It is a tourist trap - but, the views of the sea and the walls in the evening as the sun goes down are glorious, the food is never less than good, and the service is attentive. Prices are not too expensive as well, so all told this is an excellent choice for dinner if you want to escape the hustle and bustle of Old Town Dubrovnik.
Nice view and restaurant that hit the spot had the seafood salad great views and good start to Croatia.

We enjoyed an unplanned late lunch at the Dubravka 1836 restaurant. As we turned up at around 3.30pm, we were lucky enough to choose a table at the edge of the balcony, and the fabulous view (see the photos!) made what would otherwise have been a tasty, but unremarkable meal, special. 
The restaurant is in prime tourist position by the Pile Gate, but the atmosphere managed to be relaxed, the food decent quality, and the bill no more expensive than anywhere in the old town. 
We had the mussels, a pizza, a portion of fries, a bottle of water and a litre of the house white (very palatable) for a total of 348 kunas (just less than £40 at the current rate). The service was good, particularly from the lady who was front of house. A good choice for a reliable meal, with food to suit everybody - and if you can manage to get the table we did, you won't regret it :)

After a disappointing evening at Posat, we decided to go here for desert as we'd noticed it was always busy and in a lovely setting. The staff were so friendly and, in spite of the fact they were full enough to have a waiting list, they were happy for us just to have desert and a drink. We had a short wait and they brought out complimentary glasses of wine and then seated us at a prime table with a view of the city walls! The food and drinks were yummy. There was gentle live music and it was altogether the perfect way to rescue our otherwise disappointing evening!

Recommended by our villa we went there with a 10% discount coupon. Service was good, we were promptly greeted, offered our choice of table and were even prompted as to the better option. Beers were large and crispy cold and the risotto was delicious, amongst all other meals allegedly. Do try as its on the heart of all the action and very enjoyable.

This is a large busy restaurant and has a large number of balcony tables along with indoor seating. the food was top class and the service was exceptional. We came back twice more during our visit. Prices were reasonable but certainly helped along by a 10% discount card.

We ate here twice whilst we were in Dubrovnik (despite my rule). Food was lovely. I had the dubravka steak in a gin stroganoff type sauce with potato croquettes. Try the local wine: Really good! And the setting, well the pictures speak for themselves. Little steep, hence 4*.

My wife and I spent an evening there and we were given a table by the Adriatic Sea. The view was incredible and we had a wonderful waiter serving us. My wife ordered a Gilthead fish and I ordered a vegetarian risotto. The fish was cooked to perfection and was very very appetising. The vegetable risotto was by far the best I have eaten in Europe. We had a wonderful evening and highly recommend this restaurant.

The environment is pretty cool, with nice views and the location is top, right on the Pile Gate and in front of the Red Keep of Game of Thrones. Is kinda pricy but worth it. Pizzas are really tasty and also very good service. Would recommend it.

You eat outside with the view of the walls, there a very nice Jazz trio playing good music. The food is great, there was just nothing wrong with this place. Make sure to reserve and ask to be seated outside.

The location of this restaurant is perfect, just outside the city walls. However, it was very busy and despite having booked our booking had been overlooked. That said, the staff were very accommodating. The food was a bit average but I only had a pizza and it was quite expensive. Worth the experience though.

Stopped here for a drink and snack one afternoon, then returned for dinner on our last night in Dubrovnik. Although it's a very busy restaurant, one doesn't get the impression that you're being rushed through your meal. The service is fast and efficient and our waiter was very helpful with wine recommendations. Prices are quite reasonable, more so than many on the Stradum in the Old City, and you have a beautiful outlook to boot. We both had a typical Dalmatian dish of meat with a huge serving of silver beet with potato mixed through, oh, and lots of garlic! There was a cellist and guy on small trumpet playing lovely music softly in the background which added to the ambience. We enjoyed our meal thoroughly and feel that you get good food, great service at a very reasonable price.

We spent the evening in Dubrovnik as we stayed in Cavtat which is 6 miles away. After looking around a couple of restaurants we decided to eat in Dubravka after reading other TripAdvisor reviews. We weren't disappointed.

When we arrived, we were warned by the server that they was a possibility of rain as they only had tables available outside. She let us know that it may not come, but she didn't want to let it ruin our meal. We decided to take the risk and luckily it was nothing more than a couple of droplets of rain - not even a light shower.

I'm a big foodie and particularly enjoy seafood. I asked our server what he recommended rather than looking through the menu. He suggested I try the Kozice Dubrovački (Shrimp Dubrovnik) as in his opinion it was the best thing on the menu. It was delicious! If you're a fan of eating with a knife and fork, don't order this as you've got to de-shell and remove the heads of the shrimp yourself. For everyone else - try it, it's delicious!

During the meal, there was a cellist and pianist playing jazz arrangements of well known popular songs. I've never heard a version of Eiffel 65's 'Blue (Da Ba Dee)' quite like it! It was awesome! Other music included Rihanna, Katy Perry, Abba and theme tunes to films and TV shows. All equally well arranged.

With my meal I had an Espresso Martini which was very good. The total bill 2 Gin & Tonics, an Espresso Martini, a Sprite and the Kozice Dubrovački (for 1 person) came to 372kn so not bad considering the quality of the food, the service, live music and setting which was beautiful.

This place was packed when we were there. It's the first restaurant you see before you get to old town and it's so expensive for what it is, I'd advise skipping it and finding somewhere down a laneway in old town a few minutes walk awah

Couldn't fault the service - they didn't have any tables on the terrace available so they allowed us to sit at an inside table and order a bottle of wine before moving us when a terrace table became available. The terrace has great views back to the old town wall and the fort. The cheese and nut board was fresh and both our seafood pasta and salad was delicious. The price is equivalent to old town prices which for the meal we had and the view was certainly worth the price. Definitely recommend.

I may have shed a few tears for the truffle ravioli with ham. I also ordered a salmon salad (the salmon is smoked, which I was surprised by, but I also LOVE smoked salmon, so the salad was quite lovely). The ravioli (and the view, as my friend and I were sitting outside) was the best that I've ever had. Service was quick, attentive, and friendly. I'm sad (but my wallet is glad) that I did not discover this place earlier during my stay in Dubrovnik, as I would have come back several times. Reasonably (maybe a little on the expensive side) priced for incredible food.

Delicious food with superb service!
this is one of the best locations in Dubrovnik and this restaurant has some delicious meals, great pasta dishes and sea food! Prices for Dubrovnik are good!
I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone!
Best seafood risotto I've had in my life, period. At a reasonable price too, with great relaxing vibes and a good view.

The location is great with views of the City Walls. We had no problem getting a table since we dine early (18-ish). Our waiter mysteriously disappeared for a long time during the main course and when we wanted to pay. Hence, we couldn't be bother to complain about the dry tuna (ordered medium, got more than well done) since it wasn't to expensive so we just paid and left. The rest of the food besides the tuna was OK. The house wine was good and staff fiendly when possible to attract their attention.

Very Nice place and the waiters were welcoming. A concert was given : good music, and my prawn risotto was very good. I recommend, more than restaurants inside the old town which can be more expensive and not as good.
very friendly, courteous and efficient staff. Food was good and prices were reasonable. We were given wine on the house while we waited for our table. Service was quick.

Me and my bf went there for dinner and it was full so we had to wait about fifteen minutes. Which could be boring, but they gave us an offer drink that we could choose from several types of wine and water (for free!). They had free wifi wich also eased the waiting. After we sat and ordered it didnt take long and the food was very good and well served. The wine we ordered was also well served. The environment was good, we sat at the esplanade. The price was what we expected since they had a pricelist outside the restaurant.

Stumbled across this restaurant on our walk into the Old City purely to refuel and use the shade to apply sun cream. The lunch, however, turned out to be absolutely delicious. Great value for what we got and beautiful views overlooking the water and the walls of the city. Would strongly recommend the iced coffee if you've got a bit of a sweet tooth!
For a special meal in a perfect setting,dont think twice The waiters just want to please very quick and efficient.Something for everyone whatever your taste.Highly recommend .

Have eaten here 4 times this holiday, great service, good menu, great food and child friendly. They have a 10% voucher scheme which helps (ask for the discount card), and the panorama restaurant at the top of the cable car is part of this chain and has the same discount. Our 7 year old son loves this place, especially Angela!!!

It was our last night in Dubrovnik. The hotel Concierge told us that all good restaurants would be booked solid. This was because it was Saturday night. Our tour guide suggested this place as it's located conveniently just outside of the main entrance into the Old City. We were given a table with a great view and the couple playing piano and violin were right next to us. A memorable evening.
This was by far the best restaurants wee ate in in dubrovnik the waiters were so polite and nice would recommend to anybody

We got off the bus and looked at the menu as we admired the view where this restaurant was. Whilst looking we were offered 10% off. We were not disappointed. We were given a lovely table overlooking the walls and sea near to where the music was going to be all perfectly explained. We started with the mixed fish salad which was beautiful - swordfish carpaccio, prawns and anchovies and tasted delicious! All presented with rocket and sauce. Next I had tuna which was unbelievably beautiful and succulent served with salad, grilled tomatoes and slices of roast potatoes. My partner had trout with almonds which again was delicious served with a head of broccoli and rice. The portions were large and we could eat no more. The bill came to about 499 kuna - about £50 for the two of us with the 10% off including a beer for both of us and one glass of wine. We were expecting to pay more in Dubrovnik to what we had paid on the islands. I'm not sure why I'm only giving 4* - probably nitpicking but the presentation of the menu does not do this restaurant justice- it looks amateur but the food is impeccable not touristy as you may expect on first views.

location: Emirate of Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates
review: We visited this place in June, it is in the old city with a great view on the castle and the sea. It has a quick good service, with food variations. Close to the bus station. If you don't have a breakfast with in your accommodation this place is perfect for that

Dubravka is located near Pile Gate at the entrance of the old town with a beautiful view of the walls, Lovrijenac and Pile Bay. Usually I would question having lunch in this kind of place because it is 1/ designed primarily for tourists 2/ expensive and not the best quality. Actually this is a very good restaurant at a very decent price for Dubrovnik and a nice place to rest. They serve a wide range of food, including pasta, seafood, meat dishes and pizza. I had fried squids with veggies, excellent. House wine by the glass is "plenty". Service very efficient and quick.

We had lunch here and ordered many plates and salads, and all in all its very well presented and really delicious. Waiters are friendly and smiling, even though it was very crowded. The only negative point was that the management did not preview some fans for the outdoor area on hot days, like this one.
Excellent restaurant considering quality/price, tasting king prawns! Professional team and amazing view

Couldn't rate this restaurant more highly excellent.
Seconds outside city walls and very near bus stop to our hotel.
Went there first night for drinks.
Fancied a water front table for next night .
When we went back it was waiting for us. Waiter remembered us. Possibly because of my 25 year old daughter.
Food wonderful. Carafe of house white lovely (I am fussy about my wine ) slightly cheaper than in the walls .
Staff excellent. Soft live band playing. Wonderful experience
friendly knowledgeable staff and food way above average for such a locus.we went back for a second night despite the fact that there was a queue on that evening

We hadn't made a reservation, so we thought that we would never get a table for a dinner. But we did! And while waiting (under 10 minutes) they even offered us a glass of wine for the inconvenience. Food was great (trout, pasta)! Service was nice and quite fast. Good live jazz music! :) And the surroundings and view..wonderful! And the prices were ok too.

We had to wait to get a table on the terrace but it was well worth it. The staff are friendly and knowledgable and the food was terrific. Added to that we had live music and a fabulous view of the city walls. I'd definitely go again.

My mum and I stumbled upon here one afternoon as we couldn't get in anywhere for lunch, we were lucky enough to be given a table with an amazing view looking out to the sea. The staff were lovely, despite being very busy she was extremely helpful and the food was spot on. No complaints here!

Dropped by without a recommendation and soon regretted it. Well located by the Old City and a tourist trap. Pizza was doughy and cheesy with barely any salami. It was a classy gesture to waive the item off the bill. Tuna steak was lacking in taste. Very unsatisfying experience. Service was poor. Waiters try not to make eye contact and rush past all the time. They brought table bread - but several waiters had to be asked before we were given olive oil. Go here for a beer/ice cream in a nice location. Otherwise, Posat and Restaurant Dubrovnik, both within 90 seconds walk, are 100x better for food quality and service at barely higher cost.
Not really expensive and with the Beautiful view, This is a Restaurant I definetely recommend to you! The Staff are very Nice too, you feel marvelous there!

Only bad meal of our 2 week holiday. Unfortunately as this is based just at the old town gates they have prime location and don't care about food standards.

When I asked what was in one of the pastas which literally just said "pasta with prawns" the waiter told me to just look at the photo, should have really been my cue to leave but my gf convinced me to stay as she was starving. I was presented with a watery creamy pasta with mushy prawns which were clearly frozen I love my food and left most of it
We have the chicken and the fish salad - excellent , and good portions The views are also very good. A good value restaurant
The service was great! I had "seabass", and it was a nice meal, but I have had betters! The view was really nice!
This is right next to the Pile Gate entrance to Old Town so is very touristy, but the food was good ad the staff are all really friendly and helpful.

During our 3 nights in Dubrovnik, even after scouting out lots of other places, we ended up 3 times (a snack, lunch & dinner) at the Dubravka 1836. Excellent service, a wide range of dishes (including vegetarian choices), stunning views of the ramparts & sea - and delicious. Live music was a nice touch.
Waiters Roberto & Daniel were great! We've never had such attentive service .
Had a lovely meal here and enjoyed the sunset from the terrace. The service was fantastic and the food was very good. Not too expensive for a nice dinner with beautiful views.

Friendly staff and nice breakfast
推荐这家餐馆 位置极佳 员工服务满分 我们早上过来吃了早餐。性价比挺高的
 唯一不好就是有点吵。在Pile大门附近。城墙下面有船

This place was quite expencive so, being cheap, I picked the cheapest item on the men: Fried squid. Might have been the best squid I have ever tasted! On a side note:My friend picked something more expencive, and while not disapointend, whished that he had picked the squid instead.

In the hot, humid July afternoon, it was really nice to have a drink in the terrace of this restaurant. Really potive experience in the crowded and commercialized Dubrovnik. The waiters were hospitable and very polite with helpful tips about the town.

We stumbled upon this place because we heard the live jazz music (which we love) being played on their terrace. It did not disappoint! 
Our server, first of all, was amazing. He was charming, funny and very helpful with suggestions. The food was amazing and so were the views of Pile. 
Would definitely visit again and recommend!

For a highly tourist based location, this restaurant actually has pretty decent food. The pizzas, mussels, risottos are decent fare. Their Cafe on the side does some good take away and gelato as well. A good bet overall.

The food here is lovely and fresh. I had the cheese, olive and crackers followed by the trout and rice, then I finished off with a slice of the chocolate and cake. I washed it down with a beer and a cocktail and I really enjoyed it all. This place is definitely worth a visit.

Visited for dinner, mainly for the view. The service was good, waiters polite and friendly. 

Ordered a pasta and pizza. Pasta was tiny for £10. A child's portion in the uk. The pizza was soggy, had to use the napkin to dry it

Wldnt visit again and would only recommend the view

Following Trip Advisor advice, we reserved a seaside table at 7:30 p.m. Here we watched kayakers return to base, and the evening light change over the City Walls and Fort Lovrijenac. Food was very good, but the service and atmosphere even better. I enjoyed sea bass @ 142 kuna while my husband had a sea variety @ 178 kuna. Not an inexpensive evening, but worthy a romantic celebration.
This is an amazing location to soak in the ambiance of the city walls and Sea into the distance. The food was delicious and the pizza huge. (We like huge pizza). Highly recommended for the breeze :-)

It is a big resturant, food is good But nothing special. Pizza, pasta, sallads etc. The chairs are comfortable and if you get a good talbe the view is really really nice. It is good for a lunch or maybe for a big company with lots of different tastes.

We thought the location might up the price but actually this was great value and they gave us a 10% discount card valid for any future visit and ago valid in their restaurant at the top of the cable car. Food excellent. Great atmosphere
The view from this restaurant is incredible and walls of the old city are so beautiful at night. We had the mussels, gorgonzola gnocchi, and the seafood risotto which were all amazing.

The view from the balcony was beautiful. Right on the water and extremely close to the wall. My brother and I ordered a pasta dish that was very delicious, although the portions were extremely small for 78.00 Cunas. Don't get this if you're hungry... I noticed a few tables ordered pizza which looked to be a fair portion. The service was good... Nice and fast. And the beer was cold and delicious despite the foamy poor.

We walked through the old city and decided to have a drink at Dubravka... we landed up staying for dinner. Delicious food and the most friendly waitresses in all of Europe... Branka was so much more than a waitress... she was a Croatian host and true ambassador. The views are exceptional too so this is a 'must do' for a bustling vibe. Highly recommended

We ate at this restaurant on a recommendation from the owner of the AirBnB we are staying. The restaurant has a great location a shame about all the people smoking but that is the cliental not the restaurant. The staff are very pleasant, the drinks are great and the meal was lovely. I did have one issue with the meal, we did not want the vegetables or mayo due to allergies and requested a small salad to replace the vegetables. The meal arrived with the vegatables and mayo which they removed but charged us for the little bit of lettuce and tomato. I feel that this was not very good customer service back home we often request this and it is no extra charge maybe this is a cultural thing. We did enjoy the meal and would recommend this eatery when in Dubrovnick.

The views from this restaurant are beautiful, you get to see the outside of the Ancient Walls and the Fort St. Laurence whilst you dine. 
Cocktails were great and I highly recommend the Sorbeto!!!!
I ordered the Chicken fillet and it did taste very nice, however, it was just extremely dry! It needed something else to make it more than what it was, price wise the restaurant is standard pricing for the Old Town location, cocktail prices were better than others inside the old city! 
I would recommend the restaurant but not the chicken dish!

Restaurant Dubravka is located outside the walls of the old town. It's a beautiful location and relaxing atmosphere and offers a nice range of dishes. There are classier restaurants around but for a nice mid-range meal this is worth a visit. I can recommend the mussels.

Stunning view & very popular. Whilst we were there, there was an almost continuous queue of people waiting for tables. And the meal was not disappointing. I had the vegetable risotto & my husband had turkey steak with mushroom sauce. Both were excellent. We also shared the "local" walnut cake. Wow, a must try. The price was reasonable for the quality & the service could not be faulted.

This restaurant is just outside the old town gates. It has seating for many customers and serves a wide range of food. We ate pizza which was excellent. It can get crowded in this area of the city, but worth dropping in for some nice food.
Extremely good food! I ate "Dubrovnika" steak and I highly recommended it! Risotto was also very good.

We had a nice meal here the setting was beautiful looking out at the ocean and the outside of the old city walls. The service was good as was the food and the live back ground music added to the ambience to make the evening most enjoyable.
We had the Tagliatelle with Chicken for 85K
Spaghetti Bolognaise for 77K
And a seasonal salad for 29K
It came with complimentary bread.
The restaurant has an extensive drinks list and my 500ml tap beer was 43K.
Also on the menu:
Breakfast for 68K
Pizza from 69K
Lamb fillet 176K
Beef Steak 165k
Bottles of Pinot Noir & Chardonnay both 200K

This is close to fine dining as it gets at a stone throw away from the old city of Dubrovnik. Wait staff were very professional and quick to locate a table for the family and I. Food was prepared on time and was fresh and delicious.

Had dinner here twice. Returned since this is a reliable, good quality restaurant unlike some other ones in Dubrovnik. The location is wonderful and when we had made reservation beforehand, the table was perfect. They did a good job with our family dinners.
Lovely meal in popular restaurant. Waiters busy but efficient and friendly. Had lunch here twice and both meals were excellent. The view across the bay and Old Town Walls is spectacular.
The food was very good and the service was speedy. The waiter was both pleasant and very funny. And above all, the place gives you nice views of the walls and the sea.

Took a table here pretty late in the evening. 
The food was average, the ambience fair, but the main issue was the lighting , it was so dark that you could hardly see the menu. 

As it was our first night we couldn't compare the food but on the whole was pretty average food, if you want chips with your dinner then maybe it's for you, 
We ate at much better places in the holiday.

Food was great at this restaurant and the view of the castle nearby was phenomenal. Great selection of dishes - pasta, pizza and my favourite - seafood! The service was good and prices reasonable. Worth a visit!

Ate lunch here with husband, and children aged 13 and 10. Menu is wide and varied but everyone found something they liked. Very patient waiter coped with our "off piste" orders. Food quality good. Big and busy restaurant and probably more expensive than many but views and location command a premium.

The location is very nice, right outside the walls of the old city, with very nice view of the sea and Lokrum island. The prices are indeed of $$, much more reasonable then most places in the old town. The service is ok.
Visited first time summer 2015 and now 2016 again. Food is still very good, location is wonderful, at the western entrance to Dubrovnik's Old City.
The cheese plate was incredible, a selection of different cheeses from the area. Our meals were wonderful as was the service and awesome views, definitely recommended

My fiancé and I ate here after arriving in Dubrovnik very shortly before. We were very hungry and saw that this restaurant had a great view, luckily they were able to seat us by the water with short notice. The staff were very polite and attentive from the get go and were happy to answer any of our touristy questions which we were thankful for. I ordered the mussels which had a beautiful flavour and were well seasoned (I did not have to add any salt or pepper which is a first for me in Europe so far) and my partner ordered the Hawaiian pizza. He said this was better than the pizza in Rome (however we may not have been eating in the right places in Rome so don't quote me on that!) either way, this was a very pleasant start to our first trip to Dubrovnik, would definitely go back!

We had a very nice meal & service here. The location is wonderful, right on the water overlooking the Old City walls and the water. Food was very good. We had the Feta Salad, very fresh then the Prawn Risotto & the Rib-Eye, both were flavorful & delicious. Service was friendly & attentive. Menus in English & the staff spoke good English - thankfully. We did not have a reservation & was able to get a table right away.
It was a lovely time & would go back.

My partner and I chose Dubravka restaurant for breakfast one morning, after touring the city walls. We had worked up an appetite and chose the 'Dubrovnik Breakfast' each - this consisted of an orange juice, hot drink (we chose a coffee), a portion of cheese & Parma ham, a selection of breads with butter/jam/honey/chocolate spread, and last but not least, a marmalade doughnut.
It was a delicious meal and the setting is perfect - the views are amazing. The waiter gave excellent service and once we'd paid the bill he gave us a card which we could use for 10% off our next meal either at this restaurant or the Panorama Restaurant.
Average restaurant with a range ofmostly pizza and fish dishes.if you're lucky enough you'll get a table out front so will have a great view. If not, there's deinitely better places close by.

We recently ate at this restaurant during our short break to Dubrovnik and love it for both lunch time drink and also an evening meal. The food and service were great and good value given the location which is magnificent

We ate here on our first night having booked from the UK. We had high expectations. Our table was ideally located but the food failed to meet our expectations. The starters were just so uninspiring we decided to go straight to main. This is a first for me. What no starter 😰. I chose Tuna, my wife a rib eye steak. The food arrived literally a minute after our drinks. The waitress realised this was not good and apologised. She was very attentive likewise the head waiter who realised they had made a boo boo. I do have to say they did try very hard to make it right which has to be a credit to them. This is a tourist restaurant and they could have quite easily thought 'who cares'. So well done on that. By the way my tuna was over cooked and my wife's rib eye was served with slimy boiled to death chard. Yuk. We decided to have a desert encouraged because they were to be complimentary. They were very nice but mine was a just a take on a sundae and my wife had pancakes. We decided the menu here is like one from the early 80s, the only thing missing was Arctic Roll. Hey ho hopefully we'll make better decisions for the rest of the week.

I ate at the restaurant during on a Sunday afternoon. Myself and my girlfriend ordered a main course the prawn risotto and the fish sampler. The prawn risotto was quite bland and needed a lot of salt and pepper. The fish sampler was good however the veggies it was served with seemed like they were cooked yesterday and white flavorless. Would go back for drinks and the view but not not food.
The food was some of the best had at the Old Town and the view is just amazing with the Old Town harbour and the fort right next to the restaurant.

We went to 1836 for our last dinner in Dubrovnik and the view and location are great at pile gate. The food was good but the service less than satisfactory. I counted more than 12 wait staff and at times it took over 15mins for someone to take a drink or food order. The restaurant was only half full and they just stood and the waiter station and talked amongst themselves. We spent €160 for two adults and a child without wine so one would expect better service at these rates. Customer service is not a high priority!

We ate here twice during our stay in Dubrovnik. The first time the service was excellent, food & wine good and heating provided on the terrace even though it was not a particularly cold night.
At the second visit, the service was poor, our first course took 40 minutes to arrive and the second course arrived as we ate our last mouthful of the first course making it impossible to enjoy or eat all of the second course. It was a cold windy night and there was no heating available.
We had a great evening there. Lovely live music and great setting. It is well priced and the food was very good. Will recommend it. Book in advance

Booked this restaurant after the reviews from trip advisor. We were not disappointed. We were seated over looking the fort and sea. The choice of food to decide from was amazing and the meal was simply fantastic. Top marks all round.

We stopped here twice on our visit to the city, which says something in itself. We particularly enjoyed the pizza -- vegetarian for me, and seafood for my better half. Despite a full house, the service was also very good. What's more, the prices were reasonable.

Wonderful meal yet again, our fourth visit over the years and never fails to impress. Wonderful location and so atmospheric. Most of all the food and service are of the highest standard for he tourist

we ate here our first night in Dubrovnik. we had a lovely meal with lovely service. There was live music in the background and the view of the walls and the sea was fabulous. We picked it without first going into the old town to see what was available there but it turned out to be the nicest restaurant we went to in Dubrovnik.

I expected the menu to be more expensive with the look of the restaurant and the location. We were pleasantly surprised to see the food was very affordable. We were here for lunch. The sun was out and the staff were friendly. The food was delicious. I had the garden risotto which was served steaming hot and jam packed with fresh seasonal vegetables.

My husband and I visited Dubrovnik for 6 days. One of my cardinal travel rules is: why go somewhere twice, if there are unvisited places yet to try/see? Dubravka 1836 was so good, we broke that rule. The restaurant has many points to highlight, so I'll just hit the biggest ones: 1. Terrific service - we were warmly greeted, told how many tables were available outside (which was our preference), and on the occasion that more than one table was available, we were allowed to pick which one we desired. 2. The food! I loved the risotto and the local red wine. 3. The view. If you sit on the large terrace, you'll be able to see both the Adriatic and the city walls. Lastly, the bar area is stunningly beautiful. We didn't sit inside (I only saw the bar while passing through to the WC) but it was lovely enough to warrant a picture. If I went back to Dubrovnik and could eat at only one place, it would be this one.

This restaurant is located above the water, just outside the main gate and looks out to the Adriatic Sea. Perfect location, very reasonably priced food. The food was delicious and serving sizes are generous. We were served by Marijo - he is fantastic. Great food, great service, spectacular location.

We had dinner here and booked a table at the front overlooking sea and the city walls. Service was very good and the food was also very good. The unique views make the dining experience very pleasurable. We had a litre caraffe of house white wine which was nice and good value. Starters of caprese salad and octupus salad (which was excellent) and mains of mixed grilled fish and chicken tagliatelle which were fresh and tasty. Good value and the bill should have been around £70 but as it started to pour down with rain and there was thunder and lightning they discounted it down to around £40 (didn't really need to so we left a really good tip).

Island hopping and stayed the last night in Dubrovnik. Our landlord Dino from Apartments Mia recommend Restaurant Dubravka. We now love Dino for his very fine Apartment and his recommendation. Restaurant Dubravka was superb and our waiter Dimko made it very special evening. We had the best food, service and recommend drinks. Thank you Dino, Dinko and Dubravka for finishing our stay in Croatia with a high. XXX EXCELLENT

location: Somerset West, Western Cape, South Africa
review: We stumbled on this place getting off the bus, had a coffee and then just kept coming back over our 2 days in dubrovnik! Lovely cool terrace, great views on the city wall and the Fort, excellent and attentive service (from Branko & Mario), fantastic food, reasonably priced. Felt less crowded than the places inside the walls, we almost used it as a base between 'excursions' into the old town.
Good food for a lunch stopover. Wife's risotto was excellent. Surprisingly reasonably priced even though situated just at the border of old town.

We wanted a quick and quality last meal in Dubrovnik before heading to the airport, so we chose Dubravka 1836 based on our positive experiences at their other properties (Nautika and Panorama). Sadly, Dubravka 1836 offers a very different experience. The service was extremely slow, which was painful on a 92 degree day (it took 20 minutes to just get water!). When my meal came, my sunny side up eggs were not cooked and had been covered in slices of cheese (gross). My wife's pizza was similarly over cheesed and almost soupy. It then took about 20 more minutes to pay our bill, despite having cash. 

It's tempting to visit this restaurant given its location at the picturesque Pile Gate, but I'd recommend that you avoid it - we found it to be a tourist trap with low quality food and service.

We had an early diner. Grilled squid was pretty good and would recommend it. Service was quick and precise. The staff was polite and good at reconfirming the orders. 
We had diner in the terrace outside, which even with a couple of rain showers was sheltered by big umbrellas over the tables.

Would go back again, as the location on the square and on the water were perfect. Unfortunately the food was average. My mother, a less discerning critic, ate my seafood pasta. I couldn't find the seafood and pasta was overcooked.

We had dinner here and took a table overlooking sea and the city. Service was very good and the food was also very good. The unique views make the dining experience very pleasurable otherwise all the restaurants inside the old city have the same type of views. So I would definitely mix it up and have dinner here one night specially if you are here as a couple (unlike us who had a kid), this can be a very nice and romantic setting for dinner.

a beautiful restaurant just outside the city walls via pile gate over looking the sea. the food here is delicious. we had a pizza for lunch one day and we had dinner another day. I would recommend if you like lamb great portions for the price. beer is reasonably price here also. the staff are friendly and funny.
The view from the restaurant was stunning, and decent food. However the food was rather of a smaller portion but delicious. A restaurant to go to for an awesome view with great food.

I visited it for lunch. I took a table on the terrace the tables overlooking the rocks and sea were available. Service was exceptionally helpful and extremely well informed about local foods and wines. Best wine list we'd seen while in Dubrovnik. Extensive and very varied menu. Definitely explore the simplicity and harmony of mediterranean and enjoying the most beautiful view of the sea. Not too cheap, but very good value and I would definitely return.

As with most places we visit, we gauge how good a restaurant is by the number of people eating there and we weren't disappointed with this one. We were seated right over the water with views over the small bay, city walls and fort. On the evening we visited, the skies were alive with Alpine and Common Swifts and they provided great entertainment as they flew by within a few feet. 
To eat, we both opted for steaks trying the grilled beef steak and Dubravka Steak which were both cooked well. We tried a few of the cocktails and all were very nice, particularly the frozen Strawberry Daquiri. 
The prices were pretty average for Old Town but definitely worth the visit!
Food was lovely, service prompt, music choices were interesting to say the least. Very enjoyable meal and better value than most in the old town but still you pay for the view.

Stunning and serene views from this restaurant makes a visit to Dubrovnik unforgettable.
The staff is friendly and the bathrooms are very clean, in the morning when we first arrived and around lunchtime.

Great location and food. As it was our first day and we had not eaten since breakfast and we sat down at our table about 8:00, we both had pizza and shared a starter of Croatian cheese. The pizza's were massive but we could still not finished them. The staff were very friendly and attentive.

Ideally located by the entrance to the Old City.

Warmly greeted & taken to a table on the terrace by the wall. Wonderful all round views.

We went twice to this lovely restaurant but did not have dinner there.

The first time a coffee each which came with a small piece of cake. Very reasonably priced considering the location. The second time we had a bowl of soup & some crusty bread which was ideal. We had a Dubrovnik Card which gave us a 10% discount.

The toilets were very clean & fully functioning.

Staff were really friendly and accommodating and the views you get whilst dining are incredible. The food is average price of the old town which is pretty high, however we found the food to be pretty average. Small portions of bland food and basic menu. We dined in quite a few restaurants over our week holiday in Dubrovnik, and this restaurant was the only one we thought was average. The service makes up for it though, so hats off to them for that.

We ate here 3 times for dinner on a 5 night stay in Dubrovnik. The location is truly stunning - sea, rocks, the light and the very noisy Alpine swifts that are everywhere.
We had a table against the wall looking over the sea and towards the ancient city walls on all 3 visits.

Lots of choice from the menu, plus you get a 10% discount if you buy a Dubrovnik card. A large salmon salad, 2 mains, 2 beers and a litre of house wine cost less than £40. The service was very good - no waiting around.

This is so reasonably priced considering the location, and so much better value than restaurants in or around the Stradun.

We went to this restaurant and enjoyed it very much.

The location itself is already great.

The service was formal and friendly, giving us good recommendations.

We tried 3 dishes and all were good, specially the house speciality of king prawns.

It is not cheap but it is worthwhile.
Everytime we are in Dubrovnik, we eat lunch, always the same plate: Fish carpaccio, and mojito...such a beautiful view..such a smiling and perfect serve.. Always ask for Anita: she is just right!!

After climbing Dubrovnik City Wall, felt tired. Needed a cold drink.

Visited this restaurant. Decided to sit outside to enjoy the beautiful Adriatic Sea. Ordered a cheese cake and coke. 

Restaurant has indoor and outdoor seating. Free Wifi. Waiters and waitresses took order. Food served. Payment after meal.

Good tasty cheese cake, not too milky really tasted good. A glass of coke with lemon made it even more perfect. The lovely sunshine and the bluish Adriatic Sea was just a perfect picture in my eyes.

Enjoyed. Loving it.

Nice spot just next to the main gate with great views over the city walls, beach and fort.

Decent pizza and a good place to spot for lunch or a romantic dinner.

To top off our visit to the OLD CITY in Dubrovnik, a delicious seafood lunch, overlooking the view of the Fort Bokar and the Adriatic Sea. The Dubravka Restaurant, Cafe' has an in door/out door setting that was full of enthusiastic travellers like ourselves. The Staff couldn't do enough to please their cliental, moving outdoor umbrellas to shade those sitting in the warm sun. While we waited for our meal to arrive, we had a good opportunity to enjoy the best views with some more photo's.We weren't disappointed with our choice from the menu either. Will remember this lunch spot for a long, long time. Dubrovnik is one great destination worth a visit…..and my husband and l would gladly recommend the Dubravka Restaurant for a meal.

This restaurant was a recommendation from our host and I must say: the setting is very charming (outside terrace), the service attentive, the food nice. They even had very good live music on Saturday night

After we jumped off the #4 bus from Lapad and pushed through the crowds we needed a drink and Dubravka was just in the right place to stop have a drink and relax before going down into the old town. Service was excellent and the drinks list was extensive. There were plenty of people having dinner which created a great atmosphere as the sun set. A great place to stop for a drink but dinner looked good too.

Sunday lunch here, so the place was buzzing - as were the workmen below with their disc cutters for the first hour. Good location, the huge terrace overlooking the sea. Comfortable seating and not cramped, there were enough competent staff to cope with the Sunday peak.

Food OK, but nothing special, pizza dough on one meal being a undercooked and soggy.

We came here for abit of brunch just after booking our kayaking afternoon from the nearby agents. 

I had the sea bass and my fiance had the king prawns. Fresh ingredients guaranteed. The king prawns were massive. 

Our waiter knew we wanted the terrace table and kindly took our picture. You can see a small "wharf" where the kayaks are.

The setting is pleasant, just outside the City walls. The venue is a little large with a high customer turnover to be able deliver great service, the service is however fast and friendly.

I found the choice of starters very limited. Pizza for main was delicious and well cooked, if far too large! More of a quick bite to eat than a place to spend the evening.

Passing through heading home, stopped for lunch in a beautiful setting, friendly staff and free wifi. 

Seafood risotto was superb.

We ate here as an impromptu stop before walking the Old Town. What a romantic enchanting place to dine! The view of the walls and the sounds of the crashing surf were enough, but the food was great and the prices very reasonable considering the location.
Stopped here for breakfast before going into the Old Town. Stunning view, delicious breakfast and great value for money!

Lovely setting for my sisters birthday meal for 6 of us. Tried booking on line but never received confirmation email or call so I had to call them to confirm table. Pizzas were huge but so tasty and with 3 backpacking nephews/friends nothing went to waste! Thanks to Anita for her great service and making it extra special with cake/candles and a drink on the house.
We had a 10% off voucher from their sister restaurant, definitely worth going to. Food was fresh and hot and you couldn't fault the views.
My wife and me really enjoyed our diner here. Location is great, food is great, service is great. Hope you enjoy your diner as much as we did.
My family went here one evening and the food was good if not fine dining but the prices were fair and the location and staff were fab .Service was fast and the ambiance good.

Dubrovnik has many restaurants and the standards are high. This place has an excellent location, just outside of the walls. The service was good, the food was average. Prices on the high side, as expected. Overall, it was a nice evening.

We had booked a reservation by email in advance of arriving in Dubrovnik and they had a nice table outside waiting for us. We were next to the wall so we had great views to go along with our food. We started with a meat plate and a cheese plate and it was good but the prosciutto was extremely salty so we would probably skip the meat plate next time. For lunch we had pizza, prawn risotto and a seafood platter of the day. All choices were very good! For dessert we tried their ice cream sundae and it was delicious especially on a hot day. The local wine that was recommended was also very good and reasonably priced.

Visited here one evening, drawn in by the lights and the subtle music! The food was excellent and the service was second to non. We had a lovely waiter Jasmin who was attentive and friendly. (We even bumped in to him the next day and went for a drink!) The food was delicious and excellent value. The best meal we had in Dubrovnik!

Ate here twice during my break in Dubrovnik. They offer great food with flavour and a lovely view of the sea. The lamb was really tasty and so was the beef steak. I really reccomend the broccoli side dish, it was fantastic. They also have a great coffee to finish of your meal. 

Even though it's situated in the busy aera right outside the old town the atmosphere is good. In the evenings they offer live music to go with the food.

Came here for a drink during the day and the views were amazing. After walking around in the old town we decided to come back for dinner. Not surprisingly the best view tables were reserved. We sat round the corner and the place still looked good. Food was great and service was very good. Not 'fine dining' but definitely too quality which is more comfortable!

reasonably priced. we ordered a pasta dish each costing approx 700 kuna £6.50) and a bottle of water (approx £3 large). relaxing surroundings and worth a visit...the restaurant is situated just outside the old town and central to the pilla gate (main bus station)....

i returned to Dubrovnik after two years and although i remembered this place as somewhere nice to eat on this occasion it seemed even better than my previous experience and on this trip i ate here twice.
the service was excellent and both my partner and myself had the fresh fish plate which was amazing

This is one of my favourite places I have been. Atmosphere is beautiful, all the staff are friendly and helpful and the food is just the best. The portion sizes are good and it caters to all budgets. Book ahead and make sure you get here!
A really good place to stop at on your way to or from Dubrovnik. Reasonably priced, a nice atmosphere, and a beautiful location. Right next to the Pile Gate.
Food was excellent and resonably priced. The sraff spoke very good English and the service is great, location fantastic.

Was a bit dubious about coming here after reading that it was a tourist trap in the guide book, however there really was nothing to be anxious about. The food was tasty (and a good portion size) for a price similar to other restaurants in the area, nice staff and a good location. Nothing to complain about at all.

this place can be visited for any 3 meals or just for a break while having a drink/snack.
we had our breakfast there and it was such a lovely place to start the day and get your 'motor' warm up before you start your walks. we sat at the side/wall where you had a lovely view over the water and walls of the forts.
there were choices of breakfast and it was enough to get you going. definitely a place worth visiting any time of the day...

Initial impression was - this is a beautiful view in the heart of the tourist section - the food will be ok and we will pay dearly - BIG SURPRISE - EXCELLENT food, great wine, reasonable prices. The service was relaxing, well-paced, one of the most special lunches we had during our 8 port stops during our cruise. We feel lucky that we picked this place for our day in Dubrovnik.

We visited twice during our time in dubrovnik and really enjoyed it both times. The view is phenomenal over the city walls, cocktails are lovely and food was very tasty. We had fantastic service from the waitresses on our first visit, the waitresses were very attentive. On our second visit the service was good, but not outstanding. Still, if you're staying in dubrovnik I highly recommend a visit

Great location with stunning views across the bay. Very friendly staff and lovely food. Book a table or go before 7.30 to get a sea view. The night we visited (Sunday), they had a trio playing Sax, double base and guitar playing lovely mellow music, such a lovely treat. We were a part of 4 and had cocktails, one wine and two beers, bottle of water, 2 starters and four mains and it came to approx. £105. For e location and music alone I would have paid this. Dubrovnic is such a gorgeous city with lovely friendly people and Dubravka restaurant was the icing in the cake 😎😎😎😎

This is a place which gets 5 "stars" due to its location and service. The food is not excellent, but it is fresh and meets the expectations for such busy central location. The service is professional and friendly.
Beautiful spot and unobtrusive service. Food ok, nothing amazing but worth a visit for the atmosphere and views. Seafood risotto was nice and pizza tasty. The king prawns were a little disappointing.

Just outside of the old town with views of the walls and Adriatic. We had breakfast here and were not disappointed. Excellent value for money and great service, we got so much food that we didn't eat lunch until the late afternoon! Would recommend the Italian breakfast.

the ticket seller at the monastery suggested this restaurant. We were dubious as it is in tourist central...However, the hostess at the door was efficient and nice, the wait was short, we got to sit outside and the food was delicious. Would recommend if you are visiting the wall...it is a nice break from the walking etc, and the view from here is beautiful.
Food was very good value and setting was perfect. Nice friendly staff and a free drink at the end of the meal. Highly recommended.

Had two delicious meals here. Overlooking the walls and fort. If you want to be on the terrace it's a good idea to book as it does get bus . First meal was accompanied by a jazz group the second one by a cello and keyboard, both groups were very good.the staff worked very hard to ensure everyone had a nice time. The turkey in mushroom sauce and the pork in Gorgonzola sauce were both delicious. Hubby had chicken and the lamb, again both very good. Wish we had found this place early pier in our stay.
Stopped here initially for a drink. Ended up sharing a delicious octopus salad. Great for people watching. Located just outside the entrance to the old town.

Our guide recommended this restaurant and when our host at our apartment did, we figured we have to go. It is just outside of the Pile Gate and one of the biggest restaurants in Dubrovnik. The service was probably the slowest and least attentive while in Dubrovnik but it could be because of the size. View was fabulous. I ordered the pizza, it was big, and good. My partner in crime had the mussels and liked them very much. You need to visit this restaurant and sit by the walls. They also had a duo playing guitar and trumpet which was very nice.

Great location, friendly and professional staff, beautiful view. Got to the restaurant didnt expect much but on our surprise we got very good table, staff was very polite and professional, food ok, and they gave us discount of 30%! So would recommend this restaurant to anyone. Definitely they will get recommendation to all our friends travelling to Dubrovnik.

Good food, excellent service, good value, great location.
They take reservations, can sit along the edge of terrace looking onto castle and walls.
Liked this restaurant better than many inside the walls.
Recommend

The location is perfect seafood was very tasteful, staff polite and helpful. Don't try to get there with your own car because the parking space is not available. The restaurant during the summer season is usually full so I would advise you to get your reservation in advance.

I went to get a beer with my friends and enjoyed the view and good service. Everyone was so friendly and helpfull! Must visit restaurant while in Dubrovnik. Except the restaurant, they have ice cream and souvenir shop. Only the prices are bit expensive.
Great view and reasonably priced food. The fish platter was amazing with great prawns and seabass. Be sure to get a table outside to view the fort and walls of the city at night.

Unique location with s view to ancient city walls. Food is good and for a Dubrovnik measures at affordable price. I can say value for money. Either service was professional we have waited too long for a bill.
And old establishment but with a modern feel. Amazing food with generous portions and a first row view of the old city and one of 5hr bays
Service was very good here and everyone was very helpful. The food was average nothing excellent but not bad for a quick lunch before entering the city walls.

First meal I had in Dubrovnik was here. Ordered a steak that was well prepared, meal was very good. Location at the entrance to Old Town overlooking the city wall, fort, and sea was very nice. Not very private but scenic. Was probably a little pricey but the mustard sauce accented the steak nicely. Service was good but was busy when I was there. Would have that steak again without question.

Understandably unable to enter the old town, our taxi from the airport dropped us outside this restaurant directly adjacent to the Pila gate. I settled Mum here with a table while we checked in and dropped bags then came back to have lunch with her.

Apart from the great views over the Adriatic, lunch was an alfresco dining pleasure of beautifully prepared and tasty food. At such a tourist hotspot, I'd not expected such high standards.

Between the three of us, we had the pork with gorgonzola sauce, the chicken American style and the salmon salad with each of us impressed with the food and service. I had the pork which was wonderfully paired with the sauce, but I also tried my partner's chicken which was superb. Normally eschewing chicken breast as I find it too dry, this was beautifully moist and very tasty.

I'd happily go back except that I'm finding every restaurant we've tried in Dubrovnik is serving up excellent fare and I want to experience as many as possible in our limited time here!

We sat there more than 10 min, no one came to give us a menu for order. Since we were travelling with children we asked if we could change table which was away from smokers around our table, the waiter said: ok, ok, wait! then he left and never came back again. After waited for another 5 minutes some walk in guests took the table, and we still sat there without a menu. Really bad service!

It was about lunch time when called in, and we weren't sure if we would be welcome as we only wanted coffee and a cake but with a big smile we were invited in and made to feel like VIPs . A waiter was was quickly sent across for our order, two delicious chocolate and walnut cakes with whipped cream and decorated with chocolate sauce and two large cappuccinos duly arrived and were thoroughly enjoyed. On leaving both the waiter and the delightful young lady would who seated us at our choice of table, smiled warmly and thanked us very much for our custom. The bill was only slightly more than a much smaller coffee and cake in the old town ( in a cafe priced in euro's) and for the quality, quantity and service was worth every Kuna!

Great service, great views and great food. For its position it would be easy for management to rest on its laurels and either overcharge or provide bad fare. On the contrary the food and service were really excellent and the bill was reasonable. Grab a coffee (we did) in the morning, or table early evening ( as we did) or early lunch. A must.
Here you can enjoy having a drink or a lovely meal with a stunning view on the old fort and the sea. The service is great and the staff is very friendly. Live music also.
Great spot just outside Pile gate, lovely views and the food was good too. A good spot to watch the sunset....

We had a fantastic dinner ... I had King Prawns Dubrovnik style in a tomato and caper sauce ... the prawns are shell on so you have to work for your dinner ... but they are the best ever. 

We also had a local white wine which was really good. 

Nice location (just outside the walls and main entrance to the old city) and ambience (band playing in the background) with friendly service and reasonable prices. 

If there were not so many restaurants to choose from we would definitely be back.

We went for the view but wow the food and the service was good! I had the rissoto who was perfect. 
My friends had seafood and they loved it.

Good quality - value for the view of the Walls

We ate there on our holiday 6 times. The staff are friendly and efficient and the food is good value for money and very filling. Excellent spot for breakfast. and amazing view of Fort Lawrence and the Old Town Wall.

I was recommended by my B&B host for its location and decent food. Well the view might be good, overlooking the Pile Gate, but the service and the food were simply terrible. After we were directed to our table we had to wait at least 10 minutes to receive the menu, and no water or any other type of refreshments was serviced in the meantime. There was no apology for the delayed service. Even after ordering our calamari and seafood risotto, not only did it take a while but the bread was not served until we were well into our meal. As for the food, seafood risotto was a touristy location quality and the calamari was probably the worst I've had anywhere, and I've been to some bad ones. This was definitely the worst meal we've had during my 10-day stay in Croatia (even considering the fact that most restaurants in Dubrovnik tend to be overpriced compared to the quality of the food).

Overall, a huge disappointment even for a tourist trap. Highly discouraged.

We decided to eat here because the menu offered a lot more options than Pizza and Pasta that seems to dominate most menus in Dubrovnik. 

It's in a great location by Pile Gate just outside the Old Town walls and the views from any table are great. The staff were extremely inviting and efficient. 

We enjoyed our first visit so much we booked a table for our last night and again weren't disappointed.

A must visit restaurant during your stay. 

Tip - Book in advance and ask for a table along the sea wall. Stunning views.

Went here on about 3 occasions,as it was so nice.atmosphere good.food even better .Staff so polite.what more can I say.
Chris Enticott,Guernsey Channel Islands.
Nice lunch time stop. Varied menu and the option to sit inside. We chose outside (who wouldn't), but beware of the pigeons!

We were very impressed with the timely service and usual friendly staff here. You would have to be unfeeling not to be taken with the location. Wide selection of food which was good and not overpriced for what is on offer in our view. When eating out a lot on holiday it is sometimes nice to have somewhere in the mid range to accommodate different budgets.

Good place for breakfast or lunch. We ate one breakfast, and one lunch here. The staff could be less stuffy, but service was reasonable, we had breakfast for four on a rainy day, and there was plenty of space to get out of the rain and wind. lunch smoked ham was excellent. Beer was good and terrace views are good if you manage to get a table at the front.

Dubravka has loads of tables, fantastic, well-trained staff, awesome views & the prices aren't as steep as you'd expect! (Example: Risottos ~ kn 80/90). The waiting staff doesn't nag and I was quite impressed at their training. Definitely worth a visit!

Great location overlooking the city walls and right next to where the cruise ships pick up their passengers. They do group service, one person seats you, one takes the order, someone brings drinks or food. Great idea, when it works. Food was good. Since I know the manager is reading this, why is it so hard to pay? My waitress took my empty plate and I never saw her again. I saw three other tables having the same issue, including the one right next to me and they were locals. Anyway, a common problem in this area. But you could seat a lot more people if you helped them get on their way quicker.

Don't expect the best croatian, local dishes at this restaurant. You pay for The view and location, which is amazing. But the food is just around average. Had a pizza for lunch with chewy bacon, and my girlfriend had some chicken and roasted patatoes. The potatoes came straight from the freezer. This is no doubt a tourist cash cow.

We ate here while we were visiting Dubrovnik.
We were welcomed by one very friendly and kind waitress who had placed us at one of the best tables in the whole restaurant. We waited a while for the waiter, but that was ok because it was a bit crowded. We had a little house wine that was really good. After that we ordered the main course. My girlfriend had roasted salmon with vegetables and I had some beefsteak with cheese and mushrooms. Both of the meals were very tasty. At the end we took some ice cream cup.
The whole impression of the meal was very good, but it became even better after we were given a little discount on the bill due to the fact we are Croatians. 
If you're ever in Dubrovnik I would strongly recommend you to visit this place.

I visited the Dubravka on two separate occassions 10/05/2016 and 13/05/2016.On both visits I found the staff to be very efficient,helpful and friendly. The food was very good and value for money. I would recommend this restaurant to fellow travellers.
Restaurant is situated just outsider the old town. Tasty food for affordable prices. Service oriented waiters, who provide blankets if the temperature drops down.

The service was fantastic. 

The food and drinks were gorgeous. 

The restaurant is situated just outside the main city gate. So the view is spectacular. 

A lovely relaxed way to start the day.

Perfect location for an evening meal overlooking the old town walls of Dubrovnik. Food and drinks are reasonably priced. Blankets can be obtained from staff if the wind/weather makes it cold outside. Enjoyable evening :)
Lovely situated just outside the walls of the old town. Tertific views on the sea and the walls. Good pizza, nice mussels, excellent chocolate cake! Friendly personell, would-be definately go back.

We arrived in afternoon from Dublin to Dubrovnik and we were starving by the time we got to the Old Town. A plus for this restaurant is its location. It is probably the first restaurant you would see as it is only beside Pile Gate. Another plus is its view. There are seats where you can have the view of the Adriatic Sea. It was during the busy lunch hours when we got there so we got to seat a bit far away from the sea view but we quite enjoyed the view of the Walls of Dubrovnik (and I enjoyed being in the shade as I have sensitive skin and burn darn easily haha).

Three of my friends ordered their seafood platter which they truly enjoyed. My sister got their pasta and I ordered their grilled salmon with dill sauce served with veggies. The food is great, it is something we'd rarely have in Dublin. We were served complimentary bread that kept our "hangriness" at bay.

The service of the staff was amazing. They were friendly not to us but to all their customers. They offered us a card that we can use the next time we eat there and/or their sister restaurant "Restaurant Panorama" and get a 10% discount.

This is probably just me but I judge a restaurant's overall cleanliness with how clean their restrooms are. The toilets were clean and were maintained.

This is the sister company with Panorama restaurant. When you go to either one they will give you a 10% discount for the other. A variety of breakfast options for a different country. Good food, very busy but didn't wait long for food and drinks.

I've eaten here a few times on previous visits to Dubrovnik. The food is always good and I go back each time I'm in Dubrovnik. For my first visit on this trip I had the sea bass, which was very good, as usual. For dessert I had chocolate pancakes, which have a LOT of chocolate in them! I went back again 5 nights later and the waitress remembered me. I'm not sure if that's a good thing or not, bearing in mind the amount of customers they serve, but it's nice to know that you're not just a faceless customer. On this second visit I had the beefsteak in sauce. Again, a very good meal. I had the pancakes again but this time asked for less chocolate, which was much better. 

It is a good mid-range restaurant, and excellent value for money, especially compared to eating out in the UK. For beefsteak, pancakes and 2 glasses of house white wine I paid about £23. Not bad!

I would always recommend this restaurant. The service is good, the food is lovely and the location, just outside Pile gate next to the city walls and the bay, is probably one of the best in/near the Old Town.

This restaurant is located just outside the city walls. It has an amazing view of the walls and the bay, if you like GoT its the bay where they filmed loads of scenes but namely the Battle of Blackwater Bay! 

Food was excellent and the prices are very reasonable compared to in the city walls. I would recommend this to anyone coming to Dubrovnik.
The staff was very friendly, the food was quite tasty, and the terrace is really lovely to sit on. Good place to go for lunch or dinner.

Location was pure class. Overlooking the gorgeous bay outside the main entrance to the old city. I had seafood risotto for a starter, which could have been classified as a mains dish!! John Dory for my mains was tasty but the sauce could of had more flavour. My wife had rocket and Parmesan salad to start which was delicious and a grilled king prawn dish for her mains. To sum up the place absolutely worth a visit.
