Best location b y the main gate. Looks very nice. Unfortunately we didn't get to try. Next time definitely.

We ate here on our first night in town and we were wowed by the location and friendliness of the staff, who were attentive and professional throughout the evening.

The location just outside the Pile gate is superb and the view if outside is gorgeous.

We have eaten in some amazing restaurants around the world and this is on our top 5.

The food was excellent and the choice varied with a great selection of wines.

The beefsteak Dubravka was beautiful.
And the rest of the meals to the same taste sensation.

Top marks

Queued at the main entrance, only to watch the staff let tourists walk in via a gap in the tables, or watch them be seated, whilst we continued to queue. Eventually we were noticed and the waitress went to look for a table for us, whilst the afore mentioned continued. We were then seated at the edge of the seating area right next to the 'gap', and had tourists with a combination of ruck sacks and a lack of special awareness but in to the back of our heads as they headed for seats at better tables. We then spent 10 minutes watching these tables having their orders taken and their drinks being served. We then stood up and had two waitresses suddenly realise and start to apologise, I explained why we were leaving and we walked around the corner to a restaurant called Orphan, it didn't serve pizza or dark beer but we were greeted, seated and then served, what more could a couple looking for lunch ask for?

Great location to sit outside and take in the fantastic views of Dubrovnik's City Walls while having brunch. My husband had a very tasty pizza while I just had a hot drink (only because I wasn't hungry) but he said it was one of the best pizzas he's had in a long time!

The food here is good and the service very friendly and attentive (better than you usually find in Croatia). But the real reason to come here is the beautiful location, right along the city walls and looking over the sea. Many of the best seats will be reserved in advance, so think about booking if you want to be along the edge looking over the sea and the walls. It's a bit expensive but not terribly so (not like the place on the other side of the square, which is over-priced).

We ate at this restaurant a couple of times. The view was great and the entertainment of the swifts chasing each other around the castle was great.
The food was delicious and well presented. The staff were so friendly and attentive, they made you feel so welcome. We also ate at their sister hotel at the top of the cable car and again a wonderful experience.
Would definitely go back.

This restaurant is all about the location. It's right outside the Pile gate and right on the water with a great view of the Wall and Fort. The pizza I had was fine, but it was the view that made it very worth my time and money. The service was good. I would go back

I experienced a small communications problem and did not receive confirmation of my booking requests from either this restaurant or its next door sister restaurant, Nautika. Once aware of this, not only did the management ensure that I did indeed get a very nice table with a view of the city walls, but they went out of their way to treat me royally and generously at both restaurants. In fact, their attention and service was well beyond the necessary, and greatly appreciated by me! It turned out to be a really lovely evening, and I highly recommend the excellent food at Dubravka 1836, as well as the "Golden Godfather" cocktail at Nautika! Many thanks to the very attentive and professional management at both venues!

Friendly staff, lovely atmosphere and an amazing view... This is one of the best places we visited in Dubrovnik. Everyone was extremely polite, with a big smile and sense of humor. The service is of very high level, and so is the quality of the food and drinks. Highly recommended!

This is a great positioned restaurant and has an extensive menu, so everyone can find something to eat.
The food was delicious and the cocktails were lovely too :) 
Jasmine was especially friendly and welcoming. Thank you Jasmine!
It is a very traditional local restaurant, very elegant and great to celebrate special moments. We were in a large group party and could choose our own options, but even tough the food was very good
The food was good and tasty. The seafood dishes ere super..Excelent servis ,great lokacion. Highly recommend.

This must be the best positioned restaurant in Dubrovnik with views of the three castles.

We ordered the mixed pizza a mussels with wine. Both were excellent choices. The sauce with mussel was very tasty.

The service was excellent. 

The views are spectacular fit 270deg.

Overall a great experience. You also get a discount card if you dine at their sister restaurants: Nautika and Panorama.

I loved your food and I eated pasta bolognese,wine was great too.I would love to say that one employer named Andela is so nice and friendly that she put smile on my face.Nice restaurant,and I would rate it 5 out of 5 from Dublin!:)

We ate here tonight as we have walked past nearly every night and commented on what a great place it looked to eat but never tried! We sat right at the back next to an amazing view. The restaurant also offers 10% discount with the Dubrovnik card so another added bonus. I had the Mexican pizza and my partner had the tuna pizza. Both pizzas were nice, but not the best we have had whilst in Croatia. The restaurant also has free wifi, but it didn't work. Worth a try, good choice menu.

Must visit- great location overlooking city walls. Tasty food, I had tuna steak with vegetables- delicious!
Great and affordable prices unlike other restaurants in the Old town.

Started out seeking a place where we could have a glass of wine. Ended up staying for multiple glasses and ordering the food. Great view, people watching and the price was decent. The staff were great. I really liked our server, great English and super funny.
they serve excellent fish ,fresh steamed vegatable and good meat!nice atmosphere ,friendly personel,but slow service!

We eat here twice in our 6 day stay and also at their sister restaurant 'Panorama' at the top of the Cable Car. AT the first meal you are given a 10% discount card which they honoured on our 2 additional visits.

Food was Dalmation in theme, and the views from the Restaurant are spectacular...a combination of the city walls and a small harbour (Game of Thrones fans will spot the jetty in the harbour they Littlefinger spoke to Sansa on).

What made us keep coming back was the friendliness of the staff. Its a big, bust restaurant, but they always took the time to chat, make recommendations and surprise us with a treat on our Anniversary.

This is just outside the gate of the walled city, we'd walked past 10 times, thinking it must be super expensive with views out to sea, the fort and the city walls. But not only was the menu really affordable, it was the best meal we'd had in 3 days. Most bars/ restaurants serve tiny 10/15cl glasses of wine for around 40kuna, here we got 1L of house wine for 120kuna. 
Would recommend the mussels and the Sorbeto cocktail.

This is just in the main square just outside the city walls. The terrace at the rear has fantastic views of the city walls. They have patio heaters and each chair has a blanket for evenings when it is a bit chilly. Food is great, very reasonably priced and all the staff are very friendly and efficient. Would definitely recommend.

Great views from this cafe restaurant overlooking the city walls and Lovrijenac Castle. Enjoyed a pizza and a shrimp Risotto Dubravka - great. Service was superb as usual. The same company owns Nautika, Panorama up at the top of the cable car and the classic Gradska Kavana coffee house in the old town. All great, although not sure Nautika is worth it's prices.
Excellent local food and wines, but the main addition is the location with great views of the city walls and the sea.

Excellent restaurant - great food and efficient and friendly staff. We went three times and were delighted with the experience each time. Ask for - or book - a table at the edge so that you get the view of the old walls.

This is a big restaurant by the main bus stop at Pile Gate. Tere are many tables and great seating with pretty views of the wall or the fort. The menue is varied. It's a good place for both lunch, dinner, just a tea/coffy, or glass of wine.
The only disappointment was that the soup I had was served in a very small dish.
Nice panorama view, professional staff, tasty meal, salat, and seafood risoto, tagliatelle, tasty good, good served.

Had breakfast at Drubavka in april. They offer a set of breakfast menus that are quite complete and reasonably priced. But what makes going to Dubravka totally worth the while is its views: it is right next to a balcony from where you can see the sea and forts.

After a long day at work we went there for a bite, just before the kicken was closing. 
I selected grill tuna steak, which was fresh and nicely cooked. The place is very popular with tourist so the menu has quite a long selection of food a bit local and a bit Italian (lot of pasta and pizza)
Service was friendly and quick, there were not many customers left also.
The restaurant offer a very nice outdoor with great view of the city wall.

Had lunch here. Feta salad was divine. We also had the fried calamari. Everything was perfect. Even the 'house white' was better than other wines that I've had at twice the price. Can't beat the atmosphere. I'll definitely go back again. Definitely.

During our vacation in Dubrovnik we visited this restaurant several times.
Sometimes just for coffee, sometimes for dinner.
Always service with a smile.

We sat outside near the wall over looking the sea for lunch. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Didn't have to wait to long for our food and it was very tasty. We had the house white which was lovely. Defiantly would go back. Lots of different choices on the menu

We have just come back from Dubrovnik and visited this restaurant three times over six days. On our first visit, we were a group of nine, and on our arrival we were swiftly seated together, a large group was no problem for them. We had a variety of pizzas all of which were superb and great house wine.
On our second visit, there were four of us, we had pizzas again and had 10% off our bill as it was our second visit. Again superb service and excellent food.
For our final visit, there were seven of us, again we were seated quickly, this is not always the case with a large group, and we ordered cocktails which were fabulous. The waitress was amazing and could remember exactly who had ordered which drink. We had a mix of hot pasta starters, which are a very generous size and quite adequate as a main course, meat specialities and pizza, with potato croquettes and salad as side dishes. Again, we received 10% discount as return customers and we left feeling we had had a fabulous meal in spectacular surroundings, served by attentive and caring staff, we whole heartedly recommend this restaurant to anyone visiting Dubrovnik.
You should also make sure you visit their Panorama restaurant at the top of the cable car, more fabulous staff and great cocktails with an awesome view!

I visited Dubravka 1836 multiple times, first time three years ago, and last time couple of days ago (April 2016). Considering location and overall look of the restaurant I was very positively surprised how nice everyone was. Service was so nice that I probably left biggest tip ever before we left, we had probably the best coffee in Dubrovnik, ice cream was very tasty, and we also were very happy with ordering "rozata" (cake speciality from the area) that we ordered more before we left. 

Price wise - first day we got even 30% off, without asking for it and not knowing yet why. Even next time we were there and when we payed full price prices were still let's say 20% off then what you would pay for in Berlin where we live. 

One of those places I'm sure I will come again when in Dubrovnik.
I got the chicken spaghetti and it was amazing with creamy tomato sauce and it was amazing my partner had the pizza and it was light but tasty great place good view nice people

I was a little sceptical about dining here, the menus are well thumbed and adorned with dreadful photos, somewhere I would usually avoid. They had good knowledge of gluten free items although for such a vast menu there were not many options, but I was still happy with my rib eye steak Dalmatian style. 

Portion was absolutely huge and it was cooked to perfection. My o/h had lamb, he would happily eat lamb for every meal if it was cooked the same way they did it. He says it was the best lamb he has had in Dubrovnik. 

We had an order of crepes to finish, which were awful. Pre cooked earlier in the day. 

Plenty of staff milling around. 

All in all due to portion size it's a good place and the view is pretty lovely too.
Stopped by for an ice cream enticed by the 'homemade ice cream' sign. Very disappointed with our choice - the orange had a very synthetic taste and the chocolate was not very chocolatey.

Without trying to sound brash I have eaten in a lot of restaurants in a lot of places around the world. Michelin starred to greasy spoon to back street houses in the Middle East. You will travel a long, long way to find someone as knowledgable, attentive and professional as Roberto the waiter here. The food was good too. Dalmation ham and a caprasse salad to start followed by a house pizza and beef Tenderloin. A dish literally smothered in cheese. House wine great value. You have to come just to see waiting done at it absolute best. The views are stunning to cap it all off.

Lovely food, polite and attentive waiters, cheap prices and an amazing view of the walls of the old town. How could you not return? Another bonus is that on your first visit a 10% off your next meal card is given to you. Makes the return visit even more appealing!

My Wife and I had lunch at this restaurant last Sunday (beg April) and had a couple of drinks and 2 plates of various pasta for around £20. It is literally just outside the old town walls and where most people enter the old town so you will easily find it. It is popular and over looks a bay just below the old walls. We had beautiful warm weather and had lunch outside, which was really nice and relaxing. Excellent service and good food. Enjoy.

We had eaten in a pretty poor restaurant in the old town, so came here for puddings, well, we wished we had eaten our meal here too! The puddings were amazing, great selection and you get to see them in the display case before making your selection. The cheesecake was the best!

We visited this restaurant after walking the city walls and heading to the fort Lovrijenac next. Their bread is really soft and nice. The mixed pizza which could possibly feed two people costs only 69,00 kuna. The waiter and waitress are friendly. Service is quick. Food is reasonably priced.

Just back from a four day visit to Dubrovnik and ate here on three occasions. It was chilly at night but blankets provided and wall heaters but the weather is not the restaurants fault. We enjoyed the food very much and had something different each time. It was very clean with pleasant staff. I would not hesitate in recommending this restaurant.
We ate at this restaurant twice during our stay in Dubrovnik, the food was excellent and location was amazing right on the side of the sea and city walls. It was also very reasonably priced

We decided on this restaurant not because of its fantastic view, which really is beautiful, but because my travel companion is a very picky eater. I think I enjoyed the restaurant just because of its lovely view overlooking the water, the fort, and part of the city walls. It was off season, so it was a little chilly and windy but they had blankets we put over our legs which helped. They also had heaters but we did not get one, but it was okay. My travel buddy (my mother) ordered the plain grilled chicken and was overall happy, but this was probably the most basic thing on the menu to order but I tried it and liked it. I thought the prices were okay as everything in Dubrovnik and especially the city are more expensive but I think for the overall quality of food and service it was a little higher. Having a glass of wine here or a drink on a hot summer day would be fabulous.

This place has a great location, and wine is also good, but slightly overpriced. Food is okay, but average and not a great value. Recommend for location and for wine/drinks, and even for lunch, but not necessarily for dinner if you're looking for great food.

Based on reviews we decided to try. Sure it's a great restaurant with lots of options. It's only popular because of the location. It certainly doesn't deserve any stars for quality of food. Many other little hideaways in the old city serving better tasting food.

In a town which is famous for ripping off tourists, it was a very pleasant experience to find a place where I felt truly welcome and being served as a real guest. I was there before high season, still there were quite a number of others as well in a rainy evening. The grilled squids were great, served with some steamed veggies just al dente and a nice batch of french fries (home made style and yummy). The portion size is ok, though it tasted so good that could have eaten some more squids :-) Very polite waiters who did not seem to bother about extra wishes and all this for a reasonable price. I would happily choose Dubravka the next as well; especilally during the day when you can sit on the terrace with an amazing view to the sea.

We loved the food, and ended up having 4 meals here in our short two day trip. The breakfast was inexpensive and hearty. We tried Pasta, Sea food Risotto and Lamb Steaks, a wide variety of cuisines, and everything was good. All the servers were very pleasant, which was a stark difference, coming from Germany. :-) :-P I love the people of Croatia.

Set just outside the old city, overlooking the city walls Dubravka has a great terrace with an amazing view, something due to the compact nature inside the old city you don't really get. Add to this a terrace with plenty of heaters and blankets meant you could enjoy the view and outside in the warmth. 

The service was first class; the staff were very attentive without been over bearing and the service was very prompt. Most importantly once we had finished our meal we were left to enjoy our remaining wine in the peace and quiet. The table was ours for the night. 

One the first night I had the seafood risotto which was brilliant and something I would highly recommend. On the second night we had mussels to start which were served in an excellent tomato based sauce (although the mussels themselves were a bit small) and for main I had the grill prawns, which were good but felt expensive for 4 prawns and some rice. Overall the food was good, and very good compared to what I had elsewhere (nothing blew my mind away on the whole trip really). 

What I must recommend is the drinks. We had the house red on both nights and it was thoroughly enjoyable and amazing value! I also had an expresso martini and it was perfection! 

All in in all I would recommend anyone who costs Dubrovnik visits this restaurant.

Located just outside the City Walls, this restaurant has unbeatable views - particularly at sunset. During our stay, this was a favourite place to stop for a coffee or a sneaky cocktail in the afternoon. The staff were friendly and were never in any rush to move us on.

We came by bus to the old town on a rainy evening, and found this restaurant. Reasonably good food, and good cheap house wine. Service almost too attentive - staff prowling slightly.
Food tasty and reasonably priced

We had dinner twice at this restaurant located just outside the city wall. On each occasion the service was impeccable and the food well presented. The sea food medley was particularly memorable. There are two open terraces and a pleasant inside dining area. If cool, there are heaters and blankets provided on the terraces. Well worth a visit!

Located at the Pile gate.. I sat outside facing the waterfront and enjoyed the sun and view on two fortresses. The waiter help us with any kind of information. Maybe little bit busy, but it is on the main gate so that's reasonable especially in season.

Went here on our first day as it was raining and so glad we did. I had the steak and was potentially the best steak I've ever had. I work in restaurants in London and have had some very good quality food and this was exceptional. We ended up going back every day of our visit. Definitely recommend sitting outside if it is nice weather, if it is a little chilly they bring an outside heater.
Only thing better than the food was the staff. Anything and everything we needed they helped us with. Cannot fault anyone who helped us

Simple local food...Nothing special,service is nice,could be better..

Very nice view,they offer also just drinks,lot of local people

Had breakfast here to start the day of exploring. We picked a spot that out looks the cove, with its crystal clear blue water, you will get lost in your thoughts, watching the hive of activity below. 

The service was pleasant and can communicate in English very well, and the food was tasty and the coffee was good which I always find important.

We had breakfast there on March 2 2016 and had an excellent meal. We were lucky with very nice weather and we were seating next to the wall overlooking the water. The view is stunning. Our meal was very good and reasonably priced, but on the high side. If the weather is nice for outside seating and it is not too busy, it is a great place to go. We would go back.

As it just opened again, this was the first time we visited this year. Glad to have them back. Always great views from this cafe restaurant overlooking the city walls and Lovrijenac Castle. Enjoyed a pizza and a shrimp Risotto Dubravka - great. Service was superb as usual. The same company owns Nautika, Panorama up at the top of the cable car and the classic Gradska Kavana coffee house in the old town. All great, although not sure Nautika is worth it's prices.
Beautiful place at Pile gate and wonderful seaside view specially when the sun is in february! Nice service and good food!

I was with a group and we were able to get a table on the wall. It was an incredible view for dinner. I had a steak and red wine and it was delicious. We stuck around for after dinner drinks and the service was great. I think our waiters name was Bojan. We ended up having lunch there the next day and it was another great experience. Two thumbs up
Great views over the walls of Dubrovnik in an open courtyard but quite a touristy restaurant. Service was quite average, food OK, disappointing.

This restaurant has an outdoor courtyard dining area with the most magnificent view. We booked a table on the edge of the balcony looking out over the water with the walls of Dubrovnik to our left and the fort to our right. We experienced a magnificent sunset. Later, the walls were spotlit beautifully. The food was very good, except my vegetables were cold. When I mentioned this the waiter immediately apologised and offered a complimentary desert. So the service was excellent. Prices are quite reasonable.
Sitting high over the Ocean with great views , between the old walled city and fortress on the hill we enjoyed the cool fresh air with a few drinks to relax and prepare for more sightseeing.
We were in Dubrovnik on a cruise stopover. We chose this place mainly due to its location. Food was actually relatively good and atmosphere very pleasant. Met expectations.
It was my daughter's 17th birthday and our meal here was a real treat. The view is gorgeous, the staff very attentive and friendly, and had one of the best Greek Salads we have ever enjoyed.

This restaurant is in a prime location and probably the first building you see on arrival as it is where all the taxis & coaches stop. The location is super overlooking the coast and has a lovely outside dining area.

We stopped off on the first afternoon after a walk around the town and had wine and beer, all tasty with friendly service. They also had some great looking cakes on display.

We always like one 'expensive' dinner during a holiday, and had to book here as it was full on the first night we chose. The food was excellent with good size portions, again with nice house wine, and tasty coffee. We had a choice of sitting inside or out and chose outside, where we were provided with a very effective heater. Our friends also went to the sister restaurant at the top of the cable car which apparently was just as enjoyable.

It's probably one of the more expensive restaurants in Dubrovnik, but not overly so and you certainly get what you pay for.

After hours of walking in the Old Town we decided to take a break and stopped here to rest a little.We had a table at the side of the terrace with a great view towards the sea.
Service was quick and good and the price was fair compared to other restaurants.
It's a great place to 'recharge your batteries' so you can continue exploring Dubrovnik!

This was one of the few restaurants open later in the evening when we visited in the fall. Nice terrace seating close to the outside of the main city walls, with very pretty view of the sea as well as Fort Lawrence. The food is good but nothing spectacular. Reasonably priced.

First night in Dubrovnik, had diner at Dubravka, and the food was great. I took the risotto and the beefsteak Dubravka, and both dishes were fantastic.(too much for dessert ;-)). House wine was really good, but the best of this restaurant, you might think the view...which is really nice, but even better was the service by Jasmin. He made it complete. I don't know who is the boss here, but he needs a pay increase. Thanks Jasmin for a great evening. I will be back !!!

We stopped here for lunch as inside the city walls the sun wasn't anywhere to be seen.
We had a table overlooking the sea, the service and food were excellent......the cocktails weren't bad either! 
Great service and great food .... enjoy

Good very convenient location. A little disappointed with my calamari platter, especially vegetables which seemed tired -- but house white wine made up for that. nice, fresh, excellent value glass of wine.

Stopped here mid afternoon just for cake and coffee. Made very welcome. Great seat overlooking the sea. Walnut and chocolate cake washed down with a Croatian craft beer (Tomislav). And good coffee. As the sun went down staff bought us blankets in case we needed them. Also gave us some good directions which were priceless.

Highly recommended.
You'd think with a location like that they'd be not so good on the food front, but we quite liked it. Not only was the view to die for, but the food was actually quite nice.

Very good food at affordable prices and a great view. The service was very good and if you want to eat something 'simple' like pizza, chicken
. this place should be visited
The food was good, given it's tourist location... a local recommended this restaurant for fresh mussels - they were good and the portions were generous.

My husband and I visited the restaurant on our last evening in Dubrovnik. 
Staff were polite and friendly. Food arrived quickly. Really enjoyed my steak which was cooked perfectly and my husband also enjoyed his meal. Lovely views of the city walls - quiet chilly outside however blankets were handed out and heaters were placed around.
Food and service superb in a wonderful location overlooking the old city walls. Wide menu choice to suit all tastes. Excellent value given the views and wonderful food.
An amazing view of the Old city, romantic atmosphere and great food (especially seafood). We were very satisfied with the service. Good wine!

In my opinion this is one the restaurants that you must visit when in Dubrovnik. The food and drink is very good as are all the staff we came across. One lunch they messed up our order so offered us free deserts. When I came to pay the bill they would not let me pay so it was a free lunch. I even had to argue with our waiter who refused to accept a tip because of their mistake!

Try this place when you are in next in Dubrovnik, you will not be disappointed.

Great service and delicious food, alls we ate here twice during our stay in Dubrovnik old town and both times the food was great. Once we were inside as the weather was not so good but on our last night we chose a table outside with overhead heaters, we had a lovely view of the Old city walls

After reading reviews overall this place seemed a good bet however some reviewers had mentioned how they felt almost ignored with regards to the waiting service. We took a chance and decided to go here anyway, unfortunately we ended up being one of those couples. When we arrived we were greeted with enthusiasm, but as soon as we took our seats we were left to it, for 15 minutes we sat with our menus closed until eventually I asked a waiter as he rushed passed if we could order. Our food arrived so quickly in comparison, it tasted lovely no complaints there. But then again, we sat with empty plates in front of us for 20 minutes, until my partner then grabbed someone and asked them to remove the plates and for the bill. She then took her time coming back with that also, we waited again for the change, overall not happy, the couples around us were checked on regularly and made to feel comfortable whereas we felt almost a burden asking for waiting service. Would recommend going here if you like waiting a long time.

The location of this restaurant is great overlooking the sea and the city walls. I ordered the Dalmation style ribeye steak with vegetables and was a little disappointed. It was not the best steak I have eaten and expected better for the price. The vegetables were great and the fish soup for starter was fantastic however.

Four of us had lunch here today and were very impressed we had pizza, mixed seafood plate and two of us had king prawn Dubrovnik. Everything was cooked perfectly and the seafood is exceptional. To make it extra special the view looking out to sea is beautiful, we will be returning again later in the week!

This looks like a big touristy restaurant situated right at the Pile Gate into the Old Town, and where many tour buses drop-off and pick-up tourists. However, the location on the land edge looking on to the Old Town walls and fortress, and over the water, is obvious and alluring. So, we gave it a try and were pleasantly surprised for the quality of the food, choices, service, wine, and pricing. They also have some good dessert choices (which are not always so good in DBV). The love music was also a nice touch. A good choice. -- Note, this is largely an outdoor restaurant.

On our recent holiday in Dubrovnik I think this was probably our favourite restaurant partly because of the views, partly because of the staff, and partly because of the local wine.
We ate here on two occasions - first time was for lunch. It was very busy but the staff were very helpful in sorting out a table. We couldn't get on the terrace that day. We chose pizza and a greek salad along with a carafe of local wine which was excellent and very reasonably priced when compared to other local wines.
For our second visit we called in on our final night before returning home and, this time, we managed to get onto the terrace. It is a great view with the Old City walls and the Fort illuminated under a clear sky. 
A very good way to end our holiday.

Views are amazing both day and night; located just outside main gate. Staff is friendly and helpful. Salads are huge and very fresh. Meat dishes are especially good; try the pork. Only off-note was the potatoes with my pork dish; got four huge "tater tots". In a country famous for potatoes, one should get the real thing.

I was in Dubrovnik for a week and ate here thrice. It has an amazing vista of two forts and the Adriatic sea. The food is consistently good and reasonably priced. The pizza was very good..crust was thin and seafood was fresh. The staff are very helpful. Even when I was a single diner, they always obliged my request for a sea-side table. Regular guests get 10% discount. So does a Dubrovnik Card holder.

We came here for breakfast yesterday. Fantastic view whilst eating. The waiter kindly gave all the ladies dining a blanket as we were sat right on the coast edge. Great food and service. Nothing to fault

but the assortment of ice creams sold at the shop in front was superb. The taste and quality were outstanding and were by far the best we have ever tasted anywhere on this planet. Cheap too. Miss at your peril

Great service, setting and view

We only had a few drinks, a bit expensive, but I suppose it is because its location

Recommended

If you want to sit in the sun, watch the boats go by, have an excellent glass of the local Posip wine and taste fabulous fresh seafood with casual service this is the place to come. It's a little pricey compared with other seafood restaurants in Dubrovnik that are down by the old Harbour but the atmosphere is worth 20 or 30 extra Kuna. 

We had the local mussel speciality and the local prawn speciality. We didn't use cutlery (although it was provided if we wanted it) which is the way it is done by the locals apparently and I have to say getting saucy, messy and sated was a lot of fun. Our waiter Roberto was fantastic. He not only brought us wet wipes he opened the packets for us as he realized how tricky it would have been otherwise. When he saw the mess we'd made of the table cloth he beamed and said we were doing it right! I was pleased I didn't have to be embarrassed for making a mess and really enjoying my lunch. 

We got to watch the boats sail by and tourists walking the walls. As most buses drop you at the Pile gate in the morning, if you want a table right on the rail by the water, it might be worth reserving it for lunch as you walk in to the old town as this place does get busy. We lucked out and got a fantastic table as a walk in for lunch.

My wife enjoyed a sunny lunch in this restaurant. An excellent location just outside the old town. A good choice of food and wine. We went Italian with seafood pasta and pizza. Both excellent. To accompany we had a bottle of the Zlatan Plavac. An excellent vintage (2011) of this great local wine. The service was quick, pleasant and helpful. An excellent place to eat, drink and watch the world go by.

We weren't sure about this restaurant in the beginning because we feel restaurants with such great view normally don't feel like they need to serve good food. However we were quite hungry and decided to just give it a go. The grilled squids were the best ones we've had on our trip so far. The risotto was also flavourful. We are going back here again tomorrow for more squids!

My wife and I found this restaurant on the first night of our stay in Dubrovnik. We were impressed. The location was superb, the menu was extensive, reasonably priced and the food was excellent. The waiters were very friendly and helpful with the menu and wine list and the service was prompt. We returned on three occasions. Highly recommended.

We visited Dubravka restaurant on the recommendation of friends who had eaten there a couple of years ago. We were not disappointed. The standard of food was very good and so was the warm, friendly service. The fish soup and vegetable soup were both very good and tasty. I took advantage of fresh fish from a choice of five on the menu and had the Gilthead (sea bream) which was served with broccoli (approx (£14.50). My husband chose the pork fillet in Gorgonzola sauce, again served with broccoli (£12.50). Potatoes, chips or side salad were an extra charge (£3). We chose the local house red wine which was very acceptable at about £15. After the meal we were offered a complimentary glass of grappa. Very enjoyable evening and would recommend.

We had been told to go here by friends who also recommended the calamari, but were very disappointed. The waiter was not really interested in taking our order, or bringing the bill. The calamari tasted just like it had come out of a box frozen and had been put in the same oil and fried with the french fries. Don't waste your $.

My husband and I decided to stop here for lunch after our tour of the walled city. We each had a caipirhania to start with (they have a full bar) and split the Dubravka pizza. The waiter was efficient and entertaining. We asked to have the mushrooms omitted from our pizza and add an extra egg. Done. One pizza was enough of a meal to split for two. I definitely recommend dining here when in Dubrovnik.

The view was great, the whole place has a very romantic ambience, however everything else seemed average to us. The service was slow and the servers did not seem keen to serve us. The food was okay, nothing special. It's convenient I guess being just outside the walls.

After an early evening of touring, we had a reservation for this beautifully located restaurant, which was located right next to the gate to the Old Town. Even though really popular and crowded, we had one of the best dinners during our stay and the staff was really helpful and friendly. The tuna was fantastic, really well made and osso-bucco was done to the perfection, too. Lovely live music was a plus. The location was fantastic, overlooking to the sea and the walls. Would recommend!

We stopped here for lunch after it was recommended by one of the locals. We were lucky enough to get a table for two at the front overlooking the sea and the fortresses.The staff were attentive and friendly and the food very good. My husband had the seafood risotto and I had a pizza. It was good to get away from some of the hustle and bustle of the old town and relax before going back!
My husband and I stopped off here after spending 4 hours in the city. We proceeded to then spend 4 hours here enjoying the company of the staff and enjoying the ambience of the location and sunshine.

My wife and I were lucky enough to eat here this evening beside the ocean and beautiful old town walls. 

We are outside thanks to warm blankets being provided and heat lamps under the parasols.

The food was excellent quality and incredible value for money. I ate a pizza and my wife had the American style grilled chicken.

We were both very impressed with the staff who were attentive, friendly and couldn't do more to make sure we enjoyed our stay.

We highly recommend it - thank you for making a honeymoon evening so special.

Breakfast for those who consider it the biggest and most important meal of the day are hard to come by in Croatia, but Dubravka delivers the real deal: not just one, but nearly half a dozen alternatives ranging from the standard continental breakfast to a full-on American meat-and-eggs feast. You can't do better than the seaside terrace overlooking the city walls and the St. Lawrence fortress for a good morning pick-me-up.

Dropped in for pizza and salad and beer - what else for lunch! This restaurant is at the main gate to the old town in Pile and gets very busy with the cruise ships drop off point there! What can I say, it made us feel young. Food and service were fine.

Most of the restaurants within the Wall is quite expensive, but this place had a great food with decent pricing to it. View is nice and the service is very good as well.

Baby buggies can be easily carried in to the restaurant and plenty of space to park them near you.

At first I assumed this place was the obvious tourist trap in what is a beautiful but heavily tourist-focussed town. After having tried a few restaurants in Dubrovnik this became our solid backup/easy choice for lunch or dinner as they do plenty of familiar food, cooked and presented nicely, a good vegetarian selection and it's a really nice place to sit. It's well kept and the staff are friendly too so overall would recommend dining here at least once during a stay in Dubrovnik. It won't be a life-changing gastronomical experience but will be worth it for the view and you may also find it an easy option for when you can't be bothered finding somewhere more adventurous!

Four of us dined in this restaurant four times during our city break, twice for breakfast and twice for dinner. Located just outside the City Walls I'd struggle to fault either the food or the service.

The 4 Cheese ravioli was a great starter and the lamb cutlets an excellent main course.

Our waiter (Jasmin) was attentive and engaging without being intrusive, and very generously provided four complimentary Sorbetto (Tangy Lemon Ice Cream, Vodka and Prosecco) cocktails on each of our dinner visits. If I had to describe the cocktail I'd say liquid sherbet with a kick.
We had two very nice pizza meals here. The staff were very helpful and concerned we would not get wet should it rain and gave us a nice table inside still with great views. I'd go back.

We visited this restaurant twice due to its location to our hotel and its fabulous views, just outside the City walls. Excellent for romantics, with live music. good variety to choose from and the shellfish dishes tried were of good quality.
Good value - Great views of sea and Old Town. John Dory fish to die for and very tasty grilled squid. Extremely tasty chips too!

We went there 3 times as it is ideally situated overlooking the sea just outside the Pile gate. Excellent value for money and a wide choice on the menu. I particularly enjoy the opportunity to sample Dalmatian cheeses and the speciality pizza was one of the best I had for years. They cope remarkably well with being busy and they deserve their popularity.

In the past month we have been in Europe, this was my only bad meal. The view was beautiful but the Dubrovnik Prawns were, sad to say, terrible. The rice served with it was not even fully cooked! This was not a cheap meal and I was very disappointed. There are many other places with good food and great views in Dubrovnik. Skip this place for sure!!
Perfect view across the water, of the walls of old town Dubrovnik to the left and the fort to the right. Tasty food and friendly servers

The service at this restaurant is impeccable very attentive and knowledgeable waiting staff but I'm afraid lets it down. I found my pasta dish to be very ordinary and my partner felt the same about his dish... The attention to detail is very good just need a bit more adventure in the kitchen!!!

Four of us had a light salad lunch here, the food was fresh, well prepared, good service. Sometimes when you see restaurants in such a central location (by the Pile Gate) you might wonder if compromises are in the air but that is not the case here. A delightful meal.

We had breakfast here before going to the city walls and check for The Lannisters. It was very windy and chilly but the view was so beautiful that we had breakfast outside. We had dubrovnik breakfast and it was so big that it had to be served by four waiters. The price was OK for the dubrovnik standards. We can definetely recommend it.

Stop in for a late meal and it really wasn't that bad. Yes, it's a little touristy but it has great views of the walls that are up-lit at night.

5 stars for the view and 3 stars for average food.

it would take local knowledge to find a non tourist spot in this area. There are much better looking menus but this is where we landed. There is a sae breeze which is a nice thing after the stuffy air inside the walls. The mussels were not good and the bread very stale. My truffle ravioli was rich but tasty. Risotto bad. Lasagna also good.

We stopped here to have breakfast before going into the old town and the food and service was as good as the view, which is saying something as the view is breathtaking. The food was prompt and fresh and would definitely recommend it to anyone.

We decided on this restaurant at the last minute as it had started to rain. We were nicely greeted & asked if we would prefer to sit in as the rain was going to get heavy. We chose pizza & had a portion of chips to go with it. The pizza was a good size & plenty for two as a light lunch. The storm came, thunder & lightning, we ended up sitting in the restaurant for 3 hours. The waiters were very attentive & brought out blankets to keep us warm. Would definitely return.

The restaurant location is amazing, especially if you have a table on the terrace overlooking the city walls and a cove in front, close to the town centre and still far enough from the loud streets. The food was very good from the starters to a desert. However, the service wasn't that great, they were or rushing around the resto or were chatting in a corner. It was a bit annoying to call them 5 times just to ask for an extra glass, ashtray, etc, but we don't mind it as someone do. at the end of the day, it was a nice experience.

The restaurant is very conveniently located, next to the old town west gate. It has a beautiful view. Like most of the restaurants, it has mostly Italian food. The portions are small. I had spaghetti with Adriatic prawns, and it didn't have much taste to it. My wife had spaghetti with chicken, and she thought it was decent. Our waiter, his name was Hvavoce (or similar), was probably one of the worst waiters I have ever encountered. When he came to take our order, my wife asked his recommendation between two items. He said "I don't know", and rolled his eyes and sighed. I can understand this to a point. I also had a question to him, and asked how big the Turkey steak was, since it was not mentioned in the menu. He said "I don't know". Now, I don't think that should be the answer. I chose the spaghetti. I do not recommend this restaurant at all, there are plenty of options in the area.

We had two meals here. The first consisted of the American and Italian and chocolate crossiants. All very good. Waiters attentive and it seemed clean. The next day we had lunch which on both counts was a let down. We had the mixed fish and tuna salad. All of which was fishy (in a not so fresh kind of way), dry and overlooked. Certainly nothing to write home about and probably to be avoided.

Myself and my girlfriend decided to eat in here after being recommended by friends. We arrived and shown to our seat and were then left to wait 15 minutes before being shown a menu, another 15 minutes passed before we were able to place our order. Once orders were placed drinks arrived promptly, and food shortly after, mine a pizza and the Girlfriends a pasta & fish dish, hers was lovely, mine not so, soggy and cold in the middle. Frankly had better pizzas from Take-Away restaurants. We then had to wait for over 20 minutes go get the attention of a member of staff ( who seem to pay more attention to serving larger groups ) to ask for the bill. All in all a disappointing experience.
Lovely location, great staff, nice food. Also breakfast a great deal and what a way to start the morning with a view like that!

We always come back here to dine everytime we're in Dubrovnik. It's overlooking the city wall, and the Adriatic sea. Great location. Good food and staff service was excellent. We tried the lamb - it was delicious and will recommend it.

Our booking was handled very professionally, and we got our request for a nice table with a view. Staff very friendly and the food was great. Even though the restaurant was very busy, as it was a Saturday night, we did not have to wait long for the food or drinks. We enjoyed it so much, we decided to eat at their sister restaurant the night after, The Panaroma.
Had 40th anniversary dinner, stunning location, excellent service and fabulous food! Live unobtrusive music, great ambiance and lovely people - highly recommended.

Very busy , attentive staff , great coffee and fantastic pizza .

Child friendly where we sat outside . I recall thinking now maybe bit pricey but you get what you pay for .

5/5 .

Had a meal in Dubravka over looking the city walls, fort and beach. Staff ere friendly and helpful and the feta cheese salad and pizza we ordered were perfection. House red was cheap and tasted of a high quality Merlot although we were informed it was a local wine. The Resturant is just outside the Pile gate and has a wonderful view, yet prices are very reasonable.

We spent a very pleasant evening there. The waiting staff looked a little bit confused but after we got the manager's attention the thinks improved immediately. The food was adequate, nothing exceedingly memorable but good quality without any blunders. The pleasant atmosphere makes up for any shortcomings.

Fantastic location just outside Pile Gate overlooking the Adriatic and the city walls. Big area of seating outside which is lovely both daytime and beautiful warm evenings. Very good menu with varied choice and food very good. Great desserts! Staff extremely friendly and attentive. Ate here 3 times during our week long visit to Dubrovnik. Enjoy!

Went here twice during our stay in dubrovnik. The first time was absolutely flawless and the food was delicious. Thoroughly enjoyed everything and the views from where we sat were great. Decided to eat there again on our last day and was a bit disappointed. My friend's order wasn't what she'd expected (she'd misread the menu) but she ate half of it anyway as she didn't want to wait. Caught the staff making fun of her for this and those same staff then didn't collect our plates or bring us our ordered water or our bill at the end. We had to ask for things multiple times. I'd have scored a lot lower if this had been the only day we'd gone but the first day was so flawless I can't bring myself to mark lower!

Lunch for 2 on a very hot day in Dubrovnik in a charming restaurant. We were surprised to be the only guests but would imagine this is more of an evening venue. Food wine and service all excellent. The waiter was charming and spent time making it a memorable lunch in an enchanting city

Locacion beside famous restaurant Nautica and great wiev over muralles and forests of old town Dubrovnik near old city port Pile and seawiev to Adrianico is this restaurants best part. But food isnt anything speciall; avagare i would say. Waitresses are busy and serving a bit slow. Winelist isnt so wide but its ok.

This restaurant gets a lot of points for the nice location, just outside the old city walls, with a really nice view.
The food was ok as well, I had a tuna steak which was cooked just right. My partner had seafood risotto - not the best ever, but still ok. Service was ok as well, nothing to complain.

This restaurant is just outside the city gate, Pile Gate, and has views over the sea. It appears up market but the prices are not, although my 4 prawns did work out at about £3.50 each but they were huge and good! My partner had the pork dish and said it was very good under the load of cheese.

We picked this restaraunt based on it's great view. However, the food was over priced for what it was, as was the wine. Service was ok, however we did sit for a while with dirty plates. The real sting in the tail however was when we checked through the receipt, we had been charged for 3 drinks that we never had! Sadly we only noticed after we'd left. Wouldnt recommend.

Great views & fabulous food.
We went back twice for dinner. Good service - 2nd time service a bit iffy but deoends on the waiter but certainly worth the effort!

We came at this restaurant based on the comments we saw on TA. All is about the terrasse but the food is good but not fantastic and quite expensive even if you're in Dubrovnik. And it is very close to the Pile Gate which means a lot of traffic noise. Might be a good stop for a quick lunch but not the best place for a dinner in Dubrvnik.

After a long walk around the City walls, we stopped in for a late lunch. We are able to be seated at a table with good views of the walls and the sea. We found the food to be more than acceptable -- the octopus salad was deemed of particular high quality. The tiger prawns Dubrovnik were also very good.

Our waiter, Marijo, was a good deal of fun and helpful for us to better understand the city.

We were looking for a cool place to have a long, leisurely lunch, and Dubravka fit the bill perfectly. It was our last day in Dubrovnik, but it was too hot to do a lot of sightseeing. We were attracted to Dubravka because it had large fans with misters, plus the bonus of a view of the wall. But it turned out that the food and service were quite good, and we enjoyed a nice long lunch there. Our large group had a variety of dishes, including salads and pizza, and all were good, particularly the pizza. The highlight, however, was the dessert. Large (huge) bowls of ice cream with the works. My daughter had a banana split that was served in a bowl shaped like a gondola. All the other patrons looked on with envy. Considering its location near the Pile Gate, which could mean tourist trap, it was quite good. I'd go back again.
Go there for an evening drink or dinner and try and get the table with the view of old town. It's beautifully lit at night so it's a very romantic spot.

Initially just had a coffee and (lots) of water after "walking the walls" and thought a nice place for dinner. Returned a couple of days later and the, while we couldn't get a table by the wall we were seated a few tables away which was fine. We ordered starters, some pasta dishes and a local red wine. Servers were friendly and efficient with the courses arriving without having to wait too long, or being rushed. When we ordered coffee the waiter asked if we would like to move to a table by the wall so we could enjoy the views - a nice touch.
Definitely one of the better experiences and meals we enjoyed during our time in Dubrovnik.

Lovely restaurant just outside the walls of the Old City. Food was great - my wife had John Dory and I had whole trout. Delicious. View was amazing as we lucked into a table right on the water despite a same day booking. Service wasn't great hence the four stars - we felt a bit abandoned at our table which was out of keeping with the food and ambience.
